“I… I can just shower,” I say weakly. At least I could hide myself somewhat.
He crosses the room and yanks the blanket off me.
His eyes lock onto mine as he lifts me effortlessly.
He carries me to the tub and lowers me into the hot water.

His gaze never wavers from my eyes.
It doesn’t roam my face or body like his brothers’ did.
It feels like he’s making a point.
“You bathe. I need to change the bedding.”
He returns to the bed and strips the sheets—a task my brother would call mine.

I stay silent and motionless, just watching him.
He moves around the bed and fetches fresh sheets from the closet.
He pays me no mind.
He doesn’t ask questions. His eyes don’t even flicker my way.

Once done, he goes back to the closet.
He rummages through the clothes ordered for me.
“I assume you feel the cold.”
“Sometimes,” I murmur.

He pulls out jeans and another sweatshirt.
He places them on the bed.
“I’ll be in the office when you’re ready.”
He doesn’t wait for a reply, slamming the door as he leaves.
His sudden anger makes me nervous. I dread meeting him in the office.

I don’t linger. I wash quickly, dress, and hurry downstairs.
Julian blocks the hallway.
“Someone’s feeling better,” he grins.
I nod, trying to stay respectful.

“How’s the wound?”
“Better. I have to meet Alpha Alexander,” I murmur, attempting to slip past him.
“Alexander won’t mind us talking. If you’re marrying my brother, we should know each other. You’ll be family.”
What can I say? Alexander didn’t want me alone with him. But escape seems impossible.

“Hey, no need to panic,” he says, draping an arm over my shoulder.
My whole body tenses at his touch.
“Seriously, Julian!” Isabella shrieks from down the hall. “What is it with you and our brother’s brides?!”
She strides over and pulls me from his grip.

“I’m just being friendly,” he mutters, annoyed.
“A little too friendly. You’re always like this!” She glares, growling as she guides me away.
“Where are you going?” she asks once we’re away from her twin.
“Alpha Alexander wants me in the office.”
“Funny, he asked for me too,” she says with a small smile as we stop at the office door.

Beta Sebastian is with Alpha Alexander.
They halt their conversation when Isabella opens the door.
Alpha Alexander’s eyes go to my wet, tied-up hair, but he says nothing.
His look almost makes me want to let it down.

“How are you feeling?” Beta Sebastian asks softly.
He always uses a kind tone, never invasive like Julian.
I nod.
“Isabella, check her wound,” Alpha Alexander orders.

I turn to her before she can speak and lift my top just enough.
Her fingers press gently around the forming scar.
She smiles. “It looks really good. I’d say the blood tie is definitely broken.”
“Good,” Alpha Alexander says, still sounding annoyed.
What did I do? Did I say something while I was out?
###Chapter 0018

“Athena, we’re heading back to Silver Creek tonight.”

My stomach plummeted.

He was sending me back.

He finally realized I wasn’t worth keeping.

My eyes squeezed shut. My breath hitched.

I should’ve acted like the others Isabella told me about.

I should’ve thrown myself at him.

I should’ve tried harder.

I never should’ve accused him.

Rough fingers lifted my chin. “Athena, look at me.”

I kept my eyes closed tight.

“Athena, I’m not returning you.”

I didn’t believe him. I knew it was inevitable.

“I’ll do better,” I pleaded. I still didn’t know my future here, but anything was better than going back to my brother.

“You’re not listening. I am not sending you back.”

I peeked through my lashes.

“We,” Alpha Alexander pointed to Beta Sebastian and himself, “are going back tonight.”

“Is that wise?” Isabella muttered. She glanced my way and sighed. “What if it’s a trap?”

“Raven, I can handle myself. That pack barely has a hundred members. I could take them in my sleep.”

“Are you taking Julian?” Isabella asked.

“Hadn’t planned on it.” Alpha Alexander’s gaze returned to me. “But now I think I will.”

“And if they’re not there? Like last time?”

“Then we burn it to the ground.” He shrugged. “Might do that anyway.”

He watched me, waiting for a reaction.

“If you see Marcus, rip his guts out through his throat.”

Isabella’s jaw dropped. Beta Sebastian stared too.

But Alpha Alexander, a slow smile spread across his lips.

“Gladly,” he murmured.

He turned to Beta Sebastian. “We leave at nightfall.”

Beta Sebastian gave a sharp nod and left. He pulled a protesting Isabella with him.

Now it was just Alpha Alexander and me.

“You’ve thought about his death?” he asked, curious.

“Marcus—”

“Don’t call him Beta. Twat. Prick. Spunk bubble. Call him anything but Beta. He lost that title.”

“Okay.”

“I have more questions. But first, why do I smell my brother on you? Is that why Isabella asked if I was taking him?”

“He said he wanted to get to know me.” I didn’t want to cause trouble.

“Let me guess. Because you’ll be family someday.”

I nodded. He frowned.

I wanted to curl into a ball and disappear. I didn’t need more problems.

His head snapped toward the window. “Athena, stay here. Lock the door behind me.”

He rushed out before I could ask why.

I saw Julian, Sebastian, and other men catapult out the door. Some were already shifting.

I quickly closed the door and slid the lock.

I had no idea what was happening.

They sensed something I couldn’t.

Panicked, I shoved chairs in front of the doors.

I sat under the window, hugging my knees.

Silver Creek had never been attacked. Our pack never attacked anyone. I was lost.

Peering over the window frame, I saw a huge beast being dragged from the trees by the wolves.

It was tall and muscular with strange tufts of dark fur. A human-like body, but its head was a giant wolf’s.

I’d never seen anything like it.

It dug its back feet into the ground as the wolves tried to pull it into the clearing.

Large claws swung at the wolves as it fought to break free.

Then someone grabbed its neck.

They ripped its head from its shoulders.
###Chapter 0019
Athena

I dropped to the floor instantly.
What in the world was that thing?

My body refused to look again.
A sudden knock on the door made me jump.

“Athena. It’s me. You can open up.” Alpha Alexander’s voice came from the hallway.

I stayed silent, staring at the door as the handle jiggled.
I didn't want to move.
I didn't want to leave my corner.
Thank goddess for the bolt lock.

“Athena, I know you saw. The creature has been handled. It's dead. There's no reason to be afraid.”

Pushing up from the floor, I glanced out the window.
All the Wolves were gone.
So was the monster.
I began moving chairs out of the way.
Slowly, I slid the lock back.

Alexander pushed through the gap.
He forced the remaining chairs aside effortlessly.
His crimson eyes scanned the office.
He didn’t mention the barricade.
I was starting to understand—those chairs were like pillows to him.

He’d pulled on a pair of grey shorts after shifting back.
They hung low on his hips, accentuating every muscle.
I looked away, heat rushing to my cheeks.

“What… what was that?” I muttered, desperate to change the subject.

“We don’t know.”

“Y—you don’t?” It shocked me that Alpha Alexander didn’t have an answer.

He shook his head. “I’ve seen many things. Nothing like that.”

“You killed it?”

“It attacked pack members. We had no choice.”

“It had a head… like a Wolf,” I mumbled.

“I know.”

“But the body… it looked almost human. Except for the hair. The size.”

“I know. But it’s over. You don’t need to worry.”

Not worry? That thing would haunt my thoughts until it had a name.
But I could tell he was done discussing it.

“Moonshine will have to wait,” he said, repositioning the chairs.
“Did you really think these would stop someone?”

I shrugged. At that moment, yes, I really did.

“It might be time to enroll you in training.”

“Training?”

“Most kids learn combat in school. You didn’t. I’d feel better if you could defend yourself.”

“You want me to train with the pack?”

He turned to face me. “Not with the pack. Not yet. Their senses are sharper. They’re faster. It wouldn’t be fair. You’ll train with me.”

“With you?” I stammered. He was a powerful Alpha. I stood no chance.

“I have better control than anyone here. If you land a hit, I won’t retaliate.”

My stomach twisted.
I’d spent years flinching at raised hands.
How did he expect to train me?

“Now?” I asked.

“In a few days. I want that scar fully healed first. I won’t send you back to the hospital.”

My hand drifted to my stomach, feeling the raised line beneath the fabric.

“Does it hurt?” He was watching me closely.
###Chapter 0020

“No.”

“Don’t lie to me. The last time you held it like that, you collapsed.”

“It doesn’t hurt, I swear.”

“Then why are you holding it?”

“It’s… It’s nothing.” I didn’t want to tell him the scar reminded me of my own weakness. It would be permanent. Bruises fade. Small wounds heal. But this mark would remain forever. A constant reminder that even with the blood tie broken, I was still mated to Beta Marcus. Even after his death, it would linger. A testament to the horrible life I endured.

His crimson eyes narrow. His brow creases into a deep frown. He leans back in his chair, studying me intently. I offer no explanation.

“Scars fade with time. It won’t always look so prominent.”

How did he know my thoughts? Was I that transparent?

“You should see it as a survivor’s wound,” he continues.

“A survivor’s wound?” That concept had never crossed my mind.

He gives a slow nod. “It caused you immense pain and suffering. But look at you now. Standing before me. Probably the healthiest you’ve been in years. You survived, Athena. You might not believe it, but deep down, you’re a fighter.”

He had such faith. Time would reveal how mistaken he was. The only person I ever truly wanted dead was Beta Marcus. Beyond that, I was no fighter.

When reports confirmed no more beasts in the forest, Alpha Alexander dismissed me from his office. He said I was free to explore.

I stood at the open front door, watching the snow begin to fall. Delicate white flakes swirled in the air. Children were already outside, running and trying to catch them on their tongues.

I took one step outside. Then immediately stepped back across the threshold. I had never been outside alone.

“Are you going to do that all night?” I turned to see Isabella sitting on the bottom stair. Her elbows rested on her knees, chin propped on her hands. She watched me with an amused smile. I hated that I couldn’t scent them.

“It’s snow. You’ve seen snow, right? I mean, Silver Creek isn’t that far.”

“I’ve seen snow,” I muttered, looking out at the falling flakes. The snow was getting heavier now. Starting to settle on the grass.

“Then what’s the problem? I’ve been watching you for twenty minutes. I can’t figure it out. Is it because of that beast? We have the all-clear. It’s dead.”

I hadn’t realized I’d been standing there so long.

I heard her footsteps as she approached. She stopped beside me and linked her arm with mine. “You’re not alone here. There’s always someone to help. Or talk to.” She froze suddenly and ripped her arm away. “You’re not thinking of running, are you?”

“No. I’ve just… I’ve never been outside on my own.”

She grabbed my arm again, beaming at me. “Like I said, Athena, we are never alone here.” She pulled me out into the snow. She seemed completely unphased by the cold, spinning around in just jeans and a vest.

She stopped and smiled at me. “Everyone thinks we’re some horrible, raging pack that just wants to kill. But what we believe in is loyalty. Here, everyone protects each other. If you’re outside and someone attacks, everyone will come to your side.”

“Because I am Alpha Alexander’s bride?” I asked quietly.

“Partly. But mostly because that’s who we are. We protect our own.”

But technically, I still wasn’t part of this pack.
###Chapter 0021
Alexander

Centuries of documented research provided no answers about the creature that attacked my pack. I slammed the laptop shut just as Julian entered the office.

"Have you seen your mate?" He asked with an amused expression, dropping into a chair and propping his feet on my desk.

"Yes." Isabella had already informed me about Athena's breakdown at the front door, but I chose to keep my distance. Some things she needed to figure out alone. "Why?"

"Just surprised you're leaving her unsupervised."

"She's not unsupervised." I shoved his feet off my desk. "What do you want, Julian?"

"I thought we were going to Silver Creek tonight."

"Plans changed."

"Thanks for the update!" He rolled his eyes dramatically.

'Does everything always have to be about him?' Titan grumbled in my mind.

"I've been preoccupied. As you should be." I snapped at my brother.

"The forest is clear. No signs of anything else. What now?" He shrugged, completely unbothered. "We're trained professionals. We've handled other threats before. If more of those things show up, we'll deal with them."

His optimism was typical. That was just how he operated. Even when I'd caught him with my first contracted bride, he'd remained utterly unfazed. Strangely, that made him the perfect Gamma. He maintained clarity where others saw chaos.

"If it makes you feel better, I'll increase patrol numbers." He offered when I remained silent.

"Do you think it came for her?" The suspicion had been growing since the blood tie broke. Madame Zora's warnings, now this attack—it couldn't be coincidence. Nothing in my life ever was.

"Athena? No offense, but she's not exactly special, is she? Just another contract bride like the others."

"She is not just another contract!" Titan snarled in my head. "She's our mate. Tell him if he touches her again, I'll bite his hand off." I smiled at Titan's threat.

"Is he saying something?" Julian asked. "Is Titan talking about me?"

"He reminds you to keep your hands to yourself."

A flicker of grey appeared in my brother's dark eyes—Aspen was close to the surface.

Aspen had been desperate to challenge Titan for years, knowing he stood no chance. Yet he never stopped trying. The grey faded as Julian stared at me. "If we're not going tonight, what should I do?"

Tell him to shove his head up his own ass? Titan suggested.

"Try to locate Madame Zora."

"Seriously? That's like finding a needle in a haystack."

I rolled my eyes. "You saw her reaction. She knows something. Dig up whatever you can."

"Fine."

He left as I stood at the window, watching Isabella and Athena throwing snowballs. Their laughter echoed across the grounds as they chased each other. My heart skipped seeing my mate so happy.

Suddenly, Athena collapsed, clutching her chest.

I was through the window and sprinting toward them before conscious thought.

"Athena! What happened?!"

"You need to chill." Isabella snorted. "She's just winded. Without her wolf back, she can't keep up with us. Talk about overreacting!"

"She's right." Athena gasped breathlessly. "I'm fine."

"Enough for today." I helped her up. "You need to change. You're soaked."

Athena nodded and headed inside.

"I was trying to let her have fun." Isabella crossed her arms.

"I see that now."

"You're worried about her." My sister observed. "She won't always be injured. If she wasn't allowed activity at Silver Creek, she won't have our fitness level. It takes time."

Her dark eyes studied me. "But something else is bothering you."

She was my only sister, and the only pack member who could read me so well. "This isn't about her being winded, is it?"

"No."

"Want to talk about it?" She offered a small smile.

"Not until I know more." I returned her smile, hoping to reassure her. "Nothing to worry about."

"I may be younger, and you raised Julian and me after our parents died. But I'm not a child anymore. Maybe I can help."

"Just watch over Athena when I'm not here."

She nodded before turning toward the medical wing.

'Now you!' I snapped at Titan. 'Don't ever do that again!'

'I panicked. You'd be furious if we did nothing.' He moaned. 'I had to know she was okay.'

My control over him usually held firm, but seeing her collapse shattered my restraint.

I found Athena in the bedroom wrapped in a blanket, changed into gray joggers. The blanket concealed her top, though I assumed she'd changed that too.

"I'm okay. Really." She murmured when she saw me.

"Good."

"Are you angry?"

"No. Yes, but not at you." Her big blue eyes held mine steadily. She was growing more comfortable with direct eye contact, and I welcomed it.

She sat on the bed, the blanket slipping to reveal one of my t-shirts. "I was trying to go outside alone. I... wasn't trying to run." She stammered.

"I know. Isabella told me."

She pressed her lips together and nodded. Taking the chair, I watched her adjust the blanket. She shifted further onto the bed, crossing her legs.

I wanted to tear the clothes and blanket away and lose myself in her. These thoughts grew harder to ignore, undoubtedly influenced by Titan. Only the fear of harming her held me back.

'The sooner we kill Marcus, the better.' Titan's voice rumbled through my mind.
###Chapter 0022
Alexander

Athena lowered her gaze, her fingers nervously twisting the edge of the blanket as she waited for me to speak.

She's like a forbidden fruit. Titan murmured. So close, yet completely untouchable. Are you certain it would harm her?

I could hear the raw desperation in his voice. I understood exactly how he felt because I battled my own urges every time her blue eyes met mine. It wasn't just Titan who wanted her. I craved the deep satisfaction of claiming her as ours.

Until her matebond with Marcus is truly severed, we must wait. I told Titan firmly.

This wasn't what Titan wanted to hear, and it certainly wasn't what I wanted to acknowledge.

Do you truly believe she is our destined mate? Meant for us and no one else? I questioned.

I feel it in my very soul. Titan responded with absolute certainty.

"You... haven't said anything?" Athena whispered, her eyes still downcast.

Even her slight stutter sent heat rushing through me.

"I have some matters to attend to," I stated as I stood up.

She nodded silently, offering no questions as usual. Yet I distinctly felt her gaze following me as I exited the room.

Moving through the house, I could hear my brother arguing with Sebastian.

"You can't be serious, Sebastian!" Julian shouted.

"I am completely serious," Sebastian snapped back. "You think being Alexander's brother gives you special privileges? Not this time. It doesn't matter who you are - I outrank you!"

"Come on, Sebastian, I'll make it up to you."

I felt my frown deepen.

What has he done now? Titan groaned.

You know Julian - he probably seduced Sebastian's partner.

I pushed the door open and fixed my brother with a hard glare. "What the hell have you done now?"

"Go ahead," Sebastian snarled. "Tell him!"

"It happened months ago," Julian pleaded. "We had too much to drink, okay? Just one night. It never happened again." His dark eyes shifted toward me, and I immediately knew I had guessed correctly.

"Seriously? You slept with Natalie? What the fuck is wrong with you?" I snapped.

Sebastian and Natalie had been together since they were thirteen, with two children between them. Maybe it wasn't just his hands that needed severing.

Titan laughed darkly at the thought.

Sebastian was furious, though he masked it well. His eyes flashed toward me. "Tell me you're not letting him get away with this?!"

I loved my brother, but he was completely out of control.

"Julian." My voice turned icy cold.

"I know, I'm temporarily grounded. I won't leave the house without you or Sebastian."

"No, not this time. You've had warning after warning, and you never change. To you, it's all just fun and games." I kept all emotion from my tone. "So I'm giving you a choice."

He stared at me with wide, dark eyes.

"Banishment or..."

My eyes shifted to Sebastian's. He knew what was coming next, and even he looked surprised.

"Or what?" Julian asked nervously.

"Death." I stated clearly.

His jaw dropped open. "Are you actually serious? I'm your brother! You raised me and Isabella! I'll change, I won't do it again!"

"Clearly, I didn't raise you well enough!"

"All because I slept with his mate?" Julian scowled.

"But it's not just Natalie, is it? What about all the brides you've seduced? What about all the women you've taken who belonged to others? It's like a challenge for you - to claim women who are already taken. Enough is enough, Julian. As I said, you've had warning after warning, and you still tried to pursue my bride."

"Bullshit!" He jumped to his feet, his eyes turning stormy gray. If he wanted a fight, Titan was right here and ready for him.

"Really? What about that comment you made about Athena being family? Implying she was to be shared! Isabella tells me everything, Julian. If you want to chase women who don't belong to you, go elsewhere and do it. Mess with the humans for all I care."

"Better yet, leave and take Natalie with you." Sebastian snapped.

"You want me to take your boys?" Julian asked with a raised eyebrow.

"No, just her." Sebastian growled.

"Bro, you can't do this!" Julian pleaded with me.

"Sebastian isn't the first to bring this to me. I have a list as long as my arm. Your time is up. What do you choose?"
###Chapter 0023

Julian shook his head, his dark eyes wide with disbelief. “I’ll go.” He muttered the words, voice barely audible. “Just… I need a few hours to pack my things.” He sounded dazed, almost disoriented.

“Supervise him.” I instructed Sebastian.

“No problem.”

Sebastian followed Julian out of the office as I reached out to Isabella through the mind-link.

‘Are you free right now?’ This news needed to come from me.

‘Sure, where do you want to meet?’

‘My office.’

‘On my way.’ She responded cheerfully.

‘She won’t take this well.’ Titan stated the obvious.

‘Which is exactly why we’re telling her ourselves.’

Isabella arrived quickly. She was in her usual bright mood, which meant Julian hadn’t contacted her yet.

“Is this about Athena?”

“No. It’s about your brother. He’s been up to his old games again.”

“You said it wasn’t about Athena.”

“It’s not. We just found out Julian slept with Natalie.”

“Are you serious?” Her dark eyes went wide with shock. “Why would he do something like that?”

“It happened a while back, but it just came to light. Isabella, he chose banishment.”

“You’re exiling our brother? My twin?”

“It’s gone on long enough. He’s had warning after warning and still refuses to change. Do you have any idea how many complaints cross my desk because of his behavior? I can’t deny he’s a skilled Gamma, but his talents no longer excuse his actions.”

She crossed her arms tightly. “Crap. Where is he going to go?”

“I don’t know.”

“You mean you don’t care!”

“Of course I care about my brother, Isabella. But there’s a limit to how many chances I can give him. If this were anyone else, they’d have been gone long ago. You know he’s been exploiting his status as my brother.”

She nodded slowly, releasing a heavy sigh. “I understand.”

‘She’s handling this much better than I expected.’ Titan mumbled. I had to agree, though it wasn’t entirely surprising—despite being twins, they were never particularly close.

“You can keep in touch if you feel you need to. You’re his twin; I won’t hold that against you. But from today onward, he is no longer a member of this pack. That means no sharing information, no revealing my location or anyone else’s. No updates on attacks. You tell him nothing. Understood?”

She nodded.

“Isabella, I need to hear you say it.”

“I understand. Under no circumstances will I give him any information.”

“Good. I believe he’s in his room packing if you want to say goodbye.”

She left without another word.

‘She’ll get over it.’ Titan muttered. ‘We did what was right for the pack.’

I wasn’t completely heartless. I gave him keys to a car and enough money to last a few months while he figured things out. But essentially, he was on his own—no other pack would take him in.

“You made the right call.” Sebastian told me as we watched the black car vanish from sight.

“I know. It was a long time coming.”

“Would you have killed him if he’d chosen death?”

“I don’t know.” If it were anyone else, the answer would’ve been yes. But could I have actually ended my own brother’s life? Who knows. “What about Natalie? She didn’t leave with him.”

“She’s trying to use our sons as leverage to keep us together. Fifteen years together, and she throws it all away for a fling with Julian.”

He looked up at the house where we could both see Athena sitting in the chair by the bedroom window. “Good thing you got him out before he got to her.” In that moment, I knew without a doubt that would’ve been enough to make me kill Julian—discovering he’d laid a hand on my mate.

“Have you told her yet?” Sebastian asked.

“Told her what?”

“That she’s your mate, obviously.”

“It’s complicated.” I sighed.

“It’s a little unfair not to tell her, especially since you made her part of the contract.”

“She’s still mated to someone else.”

“You do want her, right? I mean, you wouldn’t have brought her here if you didn’t.”

“I want her. But I need her to want me too—not just because of some damn mate bond.”
###Chapter 0024
Athena

I found Isabella in the kitchen.
She was shoveling food into her mouth.
Her dark eyes were watery.
Her face was blotchy from holding back tears.

"Aren't you supposed to be in your room?" she snapped at me.

I flinched at her tone.
Isabella had never been short-tempered with me before.
"I was... I'm hungry," I stammered. "Alpha Alexander said I could help myself if I ever needed to."

"Are you okay?" I asked quietly.

"Julian has been banished," she spluttered.
Tears finally broke free and streamed down her face.

"Oh," I breathed out, puffing my cheeks.
I tried to think of something reassuring to say.
All I could manage was an apology.

Her dark eyes studied my face.
"It's not because of you. It's because he's an idiot. I warned him so many times that Alexander would only tolerate it for so long. I'm trying not to cry, but Midnight is grieving for her twin. I can't control it."

"Your wolf?" I asked.
I couldn't remember if she or Alpha Alexander had told me her wolf's name.

"Yes," she confirmed. "Not only are Julian and I twins, but the wolves gifted to us by the Moon Goddess are twins too. Midnight knows it was his own fault, but she still sobs."

I slipped into the seat opposite her, frowning.
I didn't understand the separate wolf concept.
None of the Silver Creek members had them, at least not that I knew of.
Then again, they never told me anything.

"Can I ask you something?" I ventured.

"As long as it's not about Julian."

"Is it normal to have another voice, your wolf, living inside your head?"

She tilted her head, staring at me intently.
"We all have one. Well, not you, but we all do. When we shift, they take over, and we become a voice to them. It's a spiritual thing. Surely you know that."

I had mentioned it briefly to Alexander.
But so much was happening that I never brought it up again.

"It's just... all of you here talk about them. My brother never did. In fact, I never heard anyone at Silver Creek refer to their wolf. Is that weird?"

"Super fucking weird," Isabella stated bluntly. "If they had a wolf like Midnight, who never stops talking, you'd know about it. Have you told Alexander?"

"Sort of. I haven't discussed it because..." I glanced down at my stomach. "Then there was an attack, and now he seems to be avoiding me."

"I'm telling you, Athena. That is really weird. Midnight wants to know if you've ever seen their wolves."

I shook my head.

"You saw us shift and take down that beast. Are you really saying you've never seen anything like that at Silver Creek?"

"My brother had a rule. Shifting was to be kept in the woods."

"You need to tell Alexander." She shoved more food into her mouth.

Isabella saw my hesitation and offered to come with me.
"It's better that he knows everything you know. And I'm sorry I snapped at you." She gave me a small smile.

She linked Alpha Alexander for me.
She asked him to meet us in his office.

We waited almost thirty minutes before he appeared.
The waiting made me panic more.
It reminded me of some of the abuse I received from Silver Creek.
Sometimes, when I knew it was coming, they would make me wait, tormenting me further.

"Even I can smell your panic. And I'm not an Alpha," Isabella muttered.

"I thought my scent was weird."

"It is, which means your panic levels are stupidly high. You need to relax."

The door swung open.
Alpha Alexander strode in.
"You wanted to talk." His voice was still cold.
Normally he would be watching me, but instead his eyes were fixed on Isabella.
###Chapter 0025

Isabella smirks at him. "Athena has something to tell you."

He gives a dismissive look. "Then why are you here?"

"Support."

He scoffs at the word.

I inhale deeply. "I told you my brother never mentioned his Wolf."

"You lied to me?" he cuts in.

"No. Not like that. I didn't know every Wolf has another person inside."

His gaze sharpens on me, one brow lifting.

"When you spoke about Titan, I thought it was an Alpha thing." I glance at Isabella, who motions for me to continue. "I didn't realize it applied to everyone."

"And now you do?!"

"I never witnessed it at Silver Creek."

"Never?" He sounds genuinely curious.

I shake my head, repeating what I told Isabella.

"Nobody discussed their Wolf? Nobody ever shifted near you?"

Another head shake. I knew how absurd it sounded. Raised in a Wolf pack yet never saw a shift until the attack here.

"Strange, right?" Isabella comments.

"Never?" he presses.

"It never crossed my mind. I had other concerns. My role was to clean and endure beatings." The last part slipped out unintentionally.

Anger flashes across his face. "Enduring beatings is not a role."

Silence fills the room. I can hear my own heartbeat pounding.

"My brother enforced a rule. Shifting was permitted only beyond the trees." I shrug. "I never entered the trees."

Alpha Alexander closes his crimson eyes. "They never shifted, even when they... harmed you?"

"No."

His eyes snap open. "Then it seems we're heading to Silver Creek after all. Isabella, locate Sebastian. Tell him to gather our best."

"We're attacking?" she murmurs.

"Possibly." His eyes lock on me. "You're coming too, Athena."

Alpha Alexander instructs me to change out of joggers and a tee. I pull on black jeans and combat boots. He enters the bedroom as I tug a sweatshirt over my head.

He doesn't comment on my outfit, grabbing his jacket from the closet. The same one he wore when we first met.

"Ready?"

"...I think so."

"Good. The cars are waiting."

"What about the snow?"

He pauses to look at me. "The snow isn't deep. But that's not your real concern, is it?"

I shake my head.

"I'm not returning you. I'm taking you to provoke them." He offers a cold smile.

I open my mouth to speak, then close it. I take a deep breath and return a faint smile.

"Do you believe you'll find the answers you seek?"

"I'm not leaving until I do!"

I follow him out of the house. Several large vehicles are lined up, with people boarding. The front vehicle is the limo I rode in before. The driver stands beside it, holding the door open.

"They'll follow us to a point, then hang back. Close enough to attack if your brother isn't cooperative." Alpha Alexander mutters. "We don't want to appear hostile."

I watch Beta Sebastian enter the limo first.

"And you won't be left alone with anyone," Alpha Alexander adds.

I sit in silence while the men discuss plans openly. I feel occasional glances but no questions are directed at me.

"Well, it's not abandoned," Beta Sebastian remarks, gazing out the window.

I look through my window and see the people who took pleasure in beating me.
###Chapter 0026

The vehicle halts right before the pack house. It appears significantly smaller compared to Alpha Alexander's estate.

The door swings open. Alpha Alexander steps out and extends his hand toward me. I take it without hesitation this time. He had already emphasized the need to irritate Marcus.

His touch radiates warmth. It feels unexpectedly comforting.

Luna Victoria stands on the steps, draped in a long white gown. Her blonde hair is styled in tight ringlets that frame her face.

"Alpha Alexander." Her piercing voice makes me flinch. My grip on Alpha Alexander's hand instinctively tightens. "We did not anticipate your arrival so soon. The contract specified your return after thirty days."

So they had indeed read it.

"It also states I may return within fourteen days if unsatisfied." Alpha Alexander mutters, giving my hand a reassuring squeeze.

"You got exactly what you requested!" Luna Victoria directs a sharp glare at me. "We have committed no wrongdoing."

"Certain questions remain unresolved." A dark edge laces Alpha Alexander's tone, filling me with immediate dread. I would not want to be in Luna Victoria's position facing that.

"You are most welcome to enter. My husband and our Beta are currently out hunting. I can attempt to address your inquiries while we await their return." She shows no reaction to his ominous tone.

Entering the house makes my heart race. Alpha Alexander had repeatedly assured me of my safety. Yet, the flood of traumatic memories is relentless.

We follow Luna Victoria into the office. Her green eyes lock onto mine as she shuts the door. "Please, sit." The words are forced through clenched teeth. The effort it must cost her is almost tangible.

"How may I assist you, Alpha Alexander?" Her tone is deceptively calm.

"Who bound Athena?"

The question surprises me. It wasn't what I expected.

"Regrettably, that is information I do not possess, Alpha Alexander."

"But she was bound on two separate occasions, correct?"

Her green eyes flicker briefly toward me. "Correct."

"Because she was mated to your Beta."

She sucks in her cheeks. "Was. He rejected her. Who would desire a worthless creature like that as a mate?!" A derisive chuckle escapes her.

"Have you concluded she is worthless, Alpha Alexander? Are you attempting to return her?"

"No. As I stated, I am merely seeking answers."

"I am uncertain what you wish me to say, Alpha Alexander. The first binding was punitive. The second occurred upon her eighteenth birthday. The initial witch's work was evidently inadequate."

"You employed a witch? I was under the impression you claimed ignorance of the perpetrator."

A faint blush colors her cheeks. "I do not know her identity. We are both aware only a witch could perform such magic."

It was a plausible recovery, yet it sounded rehearsed.

"Then I shall await Dominic to provide the necessary answers."

"Very well. May I offer you refreshments during your wait?"

"Water is sufficient." Alpha Alexander replies flatly.

She exits the office. Minutes later, she returns carrying a jug of water and glasses. She sets them on a small central table.

Alpha Alexander moves with blinding speed. He pins Luna Victoria against the wall, lifting her inches off the ground. His hands coil tightly around her neck.

"Do you take me for a fool?" He snarls. "I detected the scent before you finished pouring."

"You... you shouldn't be able to..." Luna Victoria chokes out, struggling against his grip.

"Wolfsbane Toxin." Beta Sebastian states grimly, dumping the jug's contents onto the floor.
###Chapter 0027
Alexander

My fingers squeezed Victoria's throat tighter.
She choked, gasping for air.
Her hands clawed desperately at my grip.
I loosened my hold just enough.
"Are you growing it?" I demanded.

"No," she rasped, voice strained.
"Then how did you get it? Was it Dominic? Or that fool Marcus?"
"I found it!" she croaked out.
"Lies!"
"It's true!" she insisted, coughing.

"Who were you targeting? Me or her?"
Movement caught my attention.
Athena stepped forward from behind me.
"Was it you?" she whispered softly.

"Don't speak to me, traitor!"
"Answer her!" I ordered.
I slammed Victoria against the wall.
A sickening crack echoed through the room.
She cried out in sharp pain.

"I don't understand her question," she gasped.
"Let me make it clear. Her parents were murdered with Wolfsbane Toxin. The blame was placed on a six-year-old. Your mate claimed she should have known plants. You know this already. So I'll ask again. Did you kill them?"

"GET AWAY FROM MY MATE!"
Dominic charged into the room.
He crashed into me, sending us both stumbling.
I landed heavily on top of Athena.
Our eyes locked instantly.

Her blue gaze held mine.
A soft gasp escaped her lips.
My chest pressed against hers.
In that moment, I knew.
Titan was right all along.
She was my true mate.

'Told you so!' Titan murmured smugly.
But it still didn't make sense.
How could she have two mates?

I rose to my feet quickly.
Dominic was already raging.
He checked the marks on Victoria's neck.
His eyes burned with fury.

"How dare you attack my mate in my own home!"
"Can't you smell the Wolfsbane Toxin?" I snapped.
His jaw tightened visibly.
"She was alone! She was defending herself!"

"I came for answers, not a war. But if you want war, I'll give it to you."
He raised his hands suddenly.
Realization dawned on his face.
He knew I meant every word.

"It was a mistake. She shouldn't have done it. But you must understand, Alpha Alexander. My mate felt threatened."
"The contract states if you harm Athena again, this pack becomes mine."

"But she didn't harm her. You discovered the poison in time. No damage was done." His eyes flicked to Victoria. She still sat on the floor, rubbing her neck. "Technically, she broke no rules."

'He found a loophole,' Titan growled.
Indeed he had. Dominic was the first to ever find a loophole in my contracts.

"Surely we can discuss this misunderstanding," Dominic said. He turned to his mate. "Leave us."
"I'm staying," she insisted.
"Let her remain," I said. "Let her stay and reveal all your secrets."

I sat back down, watching them both.
My eyes moved to Athena.
I raised a finger to my lips.
She nodded in understanding.
She knew to stay silent and listen.
To hear the lies she'd been fed for years.

"Where's the other one?" I asked.
Victoria said Marcus and Dominic were hunting together.
Yet Dominic arrived alone.

"He's coming," Dominic muttered, jaw clenched.
"Good. While we wait, tell me the truth. Who really killed your parents, Dominic?"

His eyes shifted to my mate.
"I already told you."
"But it's not the truth, is it? Your mate tried to poison us with the same substance. It makes me think it was her. Or perhaps both of you?"

"It was Athena! Why does it matter? You took her as your bride. You clearly don't care about her past actions."
"Because it's not true. Deny it all you want. I know it was one of you." I looked directly at Victoria. "Or maybe both of you were involved."

Victoria dropped her gaze immediately.
"Did you plan it together?" I asked bluntly. "Were you so desperate for power that you killed your own parents?"

I saw his jaw tighten.
His cheeks pulsed with tension.
"If you did, that's your burden. But to blame a child? To punish her so cruelly? That's unforgivable. If the pack discovered the truth, they'd see you as a traitor. You'd have no place here."

"What do you want?" he snarled.
"The truth."
"Don't!" Victoria cried out.
"Silence!" I growled at her.

Dominic turned to look at Athena.
"You did kill them. But it wasn't supposed to be them. You were too young to remember. You were supposed to take the poisoned lemonade to Victoria's parents. But you took the jug and served our parents first."

I watched Athena closely.
She blinked back tears.
Her hands balled into fists.
She slid them under her legs.
She sat on them, hiding her turmoil.

"So you punished her for your mistake?"
"I had to. She served them. There were too many witnesses." He sank into a chair. "I couldn't let it go unpunished."

"And yet you allowed everyone to beat her. You beat her yourself. Was binding her not enough?"
"Then the foolish girl should have followed directions!" Victoria snapped.

Everything fell into place.
Athena had told me about Victoria's changing attitude.
She had tried to befriend Athena.
She wanted Athena to do her dirty work.
It was all a calculated plan.

"Let me understand this. If she had killed your parents, you would never have tormented my bride?"
Neither answered.
"I thought so."

I waited for Titan to speak.
But he just paced in my mind.
He was holding back, waiting for more information.
"You may be angry, Alpha Alexander. But it's in the past. We want to move forward. We want a strong alliance with your pack. I know there's bad history with my sister. But we can move past it. Can't we?"

"Bad history?" I snorted. "You made her life a living hell."
I looked at my mate.
She stared down at her lap.
A fierce need for revenge burned within me.
For everything they had done to her.
They would all pay.
Every last wolf of Silver Creek would feel my wrath.
###Chapter 0028
Athena

A fragmented memory surfaced abruptly.

Luna Victoria's cheerful voice echoed in my mind.

"It's so warm today, isn't it, Athena?" Her tone was light and pleasant as she guided me through making lemonade. She had allowed me to stand on a chair at the kitchen counter, assisting her. A second jug waited on the counter, its bottom lined with unfamiliar leaves.

"What's that, Victoria?"

"I thought we could prepare extra. Everyone enjoys lemonade on days like this."

The memory shifted abruptly.

I saw myself offering the jug to my parents. I watched intently as they poured themselves drinks and toasted to something. Then chaos erupted.

Screams filled the air as someone grabbed my arms and dragged me away. Before I lost sight of them, I saw blood pouring from my parents' eyes, noses, and mouths. They clawed desperately at their faces.

"Athena, what did you do?!"

"I don't know." My young voice trembled with fear.

"Victoria, I didn't mean to. I'm sorry, will they be okay?"

Her face hardened, green eyes narrowing to slits. "My name is Cassandra, and you, you foolish girl, just murdered your parents."

I blinked several times, returning to reality. Just as I looked up, Marcus entered through the door.

"Apologies. I had matters to attend to." His dark eyes found me. "Decided to bring her back then? Too much trouble?" He mused.

"Just sit down!" My brother snapped.

This was unlike Dominic. He never spoke sharply to his mate or his Beta.

"We've told them the truth about our parents." Dominic continued. "It was time for the truth to emerge."

"If it even is the truth." Alpha Alexander snapped.

I followed instructions and remained silent. I would tell him about my flashback later, hoping he wouldn't be too angry.

'I'm also here to ensure you reject her properly." Alpha Alexander told Marcus.

Everyone stared at him. Even Luna Victoria showed surprise, but not my brother. Dominic still knew we were connected.

"You told me you rejected her." Luna Victoria shrieked. I covered my ears. Her voice always caused me physical pain.

"I did, and she accepted."

"Lies." Alpha Alexander snapped. "All fucking lies. If you had truly rejected her, how could you force a blood tie on her?"

"You did what?" My brother's chocolate eyes widened in shock.

Either Dominic was an excellent liar, or he genuinely didn't know about the blood tie. It was impossible for me to tell. I could probably sense it if I had my Wolf.

Alpha Alexander's crimson eyes searched my face. "Say it."

What did he want me to say?

"Fucking speak the words and reject her." Alpha Alexander roared. I felt my body tense.

"Marcus, reject her. Reject her right now." Dominic uttered.

"No." Marcus's lips curved into a smirk.

Alpha Alexander turned away from me, squaring up to Marcus. Alpha Alexander was noticeably taller, yet Marcus held his ground, refusing to back down.

I felt frozen. If I were in his position, I would probably be preparing for death.

"Marcus, do as you're told." My brother shouted.

"Fine." He moved around Alpha Alexander and stood directly before me. I dropped my gaze, unwilling to look at him directly.

"Look at me, whore!"

My body trembled. Slowly, I forced myself to meet his eyes. Pure hatred burned in his gaze.

"I, Marcus Souls, Beta of the Silver Creek pack, reject you, Athena Harrison." He paused dramatically. "As my mate, now and forever."

"I accept!" I muttered quickly, wanting this to end. "I accept your rejection, Marcus Souls."

While I felt nothing, his face contorted as if in severe pain.

"And now," Alpha Alexander smiled coldly. "I can kill you!"

He pulled a dagger from his jeans and drove it straight through Marcus's back and into his heart.
###Chapter 0029

Marcus stumbled forward, clutching his chest.

Beta Sebastian quickly pulled me from my seat just before Marcus collapsed.

He made low, guttural sounds before going completely still.

Both Luna Victoria and my brother Dominic shot to their feet.

“You…you killed him!” Luna Victoria cried out.

“He got exactly what he deserved. I just needed to make sure he properly rejected Athena.”

“You murdered my brother!” Victoria shrieked, rushing to Marcus’s side.

I hadn’t known they were siblings.

For a split second, I felt a pang of sympathy for her.

Then I remembered all the hell she had put me through.

“You better watch your back, Alpha Alexander.” She growled at him.

“You don’t scare me.” He mused calmly.

“Maybe I don’t. But when you see what’s coming, you’ll wish I was the least of your problems.”

“What are you talking about?” Alexander demanded. “Is that a threat?”

“You’ll see.” She muttered as Dominic pulled her arm, helping her up from the floor.

They both bolted from the room.

Alpha Alexander sent Beta Sebastian after them.

I stared at Marcus’s dead body, half hunched over the chair I’d been sitting in.

I had wished for his death for so long.

Now that it had happened, I felt… relieved.

“Are you okay? Did it hurt when he rejected you?” Alexander’s voice was soft.

He used his fingers to gently turn my face toward his.

“No. But it hurt him. I saw the pain on his face.” I whispered. “He… he said it differently this time.”

“I thought that might be the case.”

“I…I didn’t know they were brother and sister.”

“Does it matter? You’re Dominic’s sister, and they treated you horrendously.”

“But it was me. I did kill my parents.” I muttered quietly. “I saw myself giving them the jug.”

“What did you remember?”

I told him about the flashback.

He didn’t interrupt me once as I recalled the smaller details.

Only when I finished did he tell me he still believed I was set up.

It was the same thing he had been saying all along.

“Victoria said she wanted you to kill her parents. I think that was an excuse. I believe the plan was always for you to give the poison to your own parents. She wanted to be Luna, and your brother wanted to be Alpha.”

“They’ll never know, though. They died believing their daughter killed them.” I groaned.

He sighed at my words.

Before he could speak, Beta Sebastian returned.

“They’re gone. Everyone has gone. The pack has cleared out.”

“What the hell are you talking about?”

“I followed Dominic and Victoria into the trees and quickly lost their scent. It’s like they vanished into thin air.”

“That’s not possible. Wolves don’t just vanish. Where the fuck did they go?”

“I’m assuming they have some kind of safe space.” Sebastian shrugged.

“Set up a search party and hunt them down. I’m taking Athena home.”

Back in the car, I felt his eyes on me.

I kept my gaze lowered.

I knew he had questions, but I couldn’t answer them.

I knew nothing when it came to my own pack.

It turned out I didn’t actually know much about Wolves at all.

“You don’t have to see them ever again, if you don’t want to.” His voice was low. “As far as I’m concerned, the contract is void. The one thing that was tying you to the pack is dead.”

I lay down on the seat, turning away to face the back.

I could still feel his gaze burning into the back of my head.

He wanted me to talk.

But there was nothing I could say.

I was too busy remembering the last time I saw my parents.

And how they had looked at me.
###Chapter 0030
Alexander

Athena had fallen asleep during the drive back. I watched her shoulders tremble with silent sobs, her back turned to me the entire time. I remained quiet, unsure how to comfort her. Even Titan seemed lost for words.

I carried her inside, cradling her carefully. She didn't stir as I laid her on the bed. Her face was flushed and tear-streaked even in sleep.

'Do you think she's mourning him?' Titan wondered.

I don't know. She claimed to feel nothing. Perhaps it's a delayed reaction from the binding breaking.

'We should tell her she's our mate. We can claim her now that she's free of that bastard.'

No. That's the last thing she needs to hear right now.

I removed her boots gently. She instinctively curled into a fetal position, emitting that soft snuffling sound she always makes in her sleep.

I watched over her for several minutes until Sebastian's link came through. 'We need to talk immediately!'

His urgency suggested the hunting party had found something significant.

'My office,' I linked back.

'Meet me outside. We'll arrive in ten minutes.'

'What's that about?' Titan questioned when Sebastian ended the link.

'We'll find out soon enough,' I snapped back.

After one final check on Athena, I descended the stairs and exited the house. A convoy of vehicles arrived moments later, forming a protective barrier that blocked the view from the rest of the pack.

Sebastian jumped from the lead vehicle that stopped directly before me.

"Did you locate them?" I demanded. He shook his head.

"Not exactly." Sebastian scanned our surroundings. "Where's Athena?"

"Asleep."

He nodded sharply and yanked open the rear door of his SUV. He dragged out a naked man by his ankles, dumping him unceremoniously onto the snow-covered ground. The man's wrists and legs were bound with thick ropes. A heavy metal chain coiled around his neck. He appeared only half-conscious, covered in blood and mud that obscured his features.

"You brought me a naked man?" I remarked dryly. "He's not really my type."

Sebastian shook his head and grabbed the chain's end. He kicked the prone figure. "Show him!"

Other pack members stepped forward, all holding similar chains. Was this naked man some powerful wolf I didn't recognize? That seemed impossible.

The man simply lay there, staring dazedly at the starry sky. After several seconds, we heard his bones cracking. We watched his limbs elongate, snapping the ropes that restrained him. Patches of fur sprouted across his body. But he didn't shift into a wolf. He transformed into the same type of beast that had attacked my men.

Sebastian signaled his men forward. They quickly secured chains around the beast's legs.

"Where did you find it?" I demanded, studying the creature with my crimson gaze. It matched the description of our previous attacker exactly.

"During the hunt for Dominic and Victoria. This one was hiding in a tree."

The beast remained sprawled in the snow, still somewhat disoriented.

"In a tree?" Titan murmured.

I shared his surprise. Wolves don't climb trees.

"Haven't you noticed the other thing?" Sebastian asked.

I examined the beast more closely and realized it had no scent whatsoever. Not even the faintest trace of body odor.

"How is that possible?"

Sebastian delivered another kick to the creature. "This one either fell from the tree, or the branch couldn't support its weight. It landed right in front of us. If it hadn't, we would never have detected its presence, Alexander. When shifted, these things can literally hide in plain sight."
###Chapter 0031

"Did he talk?"

"Nothing useful yet." Sebastian sighs, his gaze shifting to me. "I believe this is the true form of a Silver Creek wolf."

"Lock him in the dungeons. Maximum security. We'll interrogate later. And this stays between us!" I command sharply.

"What about Athena?" Sebastian asks.

"What about her?" I glare at him.

He immediately falls silent, choosing not to press further.

"Take the beast to the dungeons." I repeat.

Sebastian nods and they load the creature back into the vehicle, driving toward the secure facility.

She can't be one of them.' Titan protests in my mind. 'It's impossible.'

Why are you so quiet?' Titan demands as I walk back through the mansion.

Pieces were finally connecting. My lack of knowledge about Silver Creek until recently. Their extreme secrecy. How they kept vanishing without trace. How Athena had never seen their wolf forms. How the beast hid in the trees. Athena's comments about gaining their wolves at thirteen.

What if that was the key? They didn't disappear—they ascended. Hiding high in the canopy where we'd never think to search.

I settle into the chair in our bedroom, watching my mate sleep. Was she one of them without realizing it? If I unbind her, will this become her fate?

She's ours!' Titan insists, as if that explained everything.

I wake to the sound of running water.

The bed lies empty.

Athena's clothes are discarded at the foot of the bed.

I glance toward the bathroom.

She sits on the shower floor, water streaming over her small frame as she leans against the glass.

"Athena?"

She doesn't respond.

I wrench the shower door open.

She hugs her knees to her chest.

"I... I don't really remember my parents." she whispers. "But I see their faces. I... I see blood flowing from their noses and eyes. I see them clawing at their throats while choking on blood. I remember their eyes locking with mine as they took their final breaths."

I had feared she felt the bond break with Marcus.

Instead, she was reliving her parents' dying moments.

No amount of reassurance would erase that haunting final image.

I strip off my shirt and step under the water.

Sliding down the cool tiles, I sit beside her.

In one swift motion, I pull her naked body onto my lap.

I lock my arms around her, holding her tightly against me.

Hoping it would provide some comfort.

Hoping she would understand she isn't alone.

She rests her cheek against my chest, taking deep breaths.

Her racing heart gradually slows to a steady rhythm.

I desperately wanted her.

I could feel myself hardening beneath her.

"Let's get you dressed." I murmur, ignoring Titan's frustration.

My needs could wait.

My self-control continued to surprise me.

Athena remains still as I wrap a towel around her.

She sits on the bed while I find fresh clothes for her.

"The contract is void, right?" She asks quietly. "You're finished with my brother?"

"Yes."

"So I'm free to leave without you killing me?"
###Chapter 0032
Alexander

I turned back to face her.
She was staring at me with those wide blue eyes.
Her bottom lip trembled slightly as she awaited my response.
I didn't want her to leave.
But what if she truly was one of those creatures?
What kind of danger would I be inviting?

"Are you... going to kill me?" she repeated, her voice barely a whisper.

"No." The answer came instantly.
It didn't matter what she might be.

She clutched the towel wrapped around her body.
It was hitched up around her thighs, offering barely any coverage.

"Put these on." I handed her the sweatshirt and joggers from the cupboard.
I would have preferred her wearing less, but keeping her covered made things easier.

'That won't stop you!' Titan mocked.

I turned away to let her dress. "Why do you assume I want you gone?"

"I'm part of the contract." This time she didn't stutter.
She seemed to find it easier to speak when I wasn't looking directly at her.

"You were," I agreed, keeping my back turned. "But I have no intention of killing an innocent woman."

'Don't you dare!' Titan growled.

"If you wish to leave, you may. I'll ensure you're settled and provide everything you need."

'You fucking idiot!' Titan yelled.
He wasn't concerned at all that Athena might not be a true Wolf.

'I have to give her a choice,' I snapped at him. 'Let her make her own decisions.'

"Where would I go?" Athena asked softly.

"Anywhere you want." I sighed.
It sounded like she'd already made up her mind. "There are neutral zones where no packs hold control."

'Stop telling her the good parts!' Titan paced in frustration.
As much as I didn't want her to leave, I felt obligated to present all options. 'Tell her she'll be unprotected! That there are more monsters like Dominic! Tell her to stay!'

I heard her footsteps pad across the carpet.
She settled into the chair.
I turned to look at her.
The soft blue sweatshirt made her eyes appear even more vibrant.

"Can I think about it?" she asked quietly.

"Of course."

She brushed through her hair.
I caught a new scent mixed with her unusual fragrance.
Lavender.
The more I considered it, the more I realized her strange scent wasn't as potent as before.

'Matebond!' Titan chuckled. 'Finally you believe it!'

Sometimes I truly wished Titan and I were separate beings.
Just so I could punch him.

'Hey!' he complained. 'I'm not the one pretending. Just claim her already.'

"I need to go check on something," I muttered, feeling like a foolish schoolboy. "If you need me, someone can link me. Don't worry, I won't leave the pack grounds."

She nodded silently while Titan continued calling me an idiot.

'Whatever, we have a beast to interrogate!' I told him as I hurried from the bedroom and down the stairs.

Before I even descended into the dungeon, I could hear Sebastian demanding answers.
He wasn't getting far.
The creature wasn't responding.

"What the fuck are you?!" Sebastian shouted just as I appeared.

The man was in human form.
Sebastian or someone had given him basic clothing.
He huddled in the corner.
Without the blood and smeared mud, I could see he wasn't much more than a boy.
Perhaps eighteen at most.

"What's your name?" I asked, keeping my tone even.

"He won't answer," Sebastian muttered. "I've been trying all night. He refuses to speak."

I turned to study the young man in the corner.
They had chained his legs down, allowing him almost no movement.

"Are you injured?" I asked.

The boy still refused to look at me.

"Does Dominic know we have you?"

He remained silent.

"Do you know Athena?"

His eyes flashed toward me.
They were blue, exactly like Athena's. "Is she alright?"

"You're locked in a dungeon and your concern is whether Athena is alright?"

"Please tell me you got her away? That you got her out of that house?"

Sebastian raised an eyebrow at me.

"Who are you?" I asked, giving no information about Athena. "And what are you?"

"She doesn't know me, or at least I don't think she does. My name is Caleb. I'm her true brother, and I'm what's called a Lycan, the same as Athena."
###Chapter 0033

“What the hell is a Lycan?” Sebastian demanded sharply.

“Exactly what you witnessed. Half wolf, half human.” His blue eyes locked onto mine. “Did you get her out safely?”

“What do you mean, true brother?” I pressed.

“Athena only has one brother, and Dominic isn’t him.”

“Stop lying to me!”

“I’ll explain everything.” He extended his arms in a placating gesture.

“You’d be the first.” I snapped, my patience thinning.

“I’m not loyal to Silver Creek. I’m a Rogue.” Devon stated calmly.

‘He’s completely insane!’ Sebastian linked me.

“Rogue?” That term wasn’t used among wolves. You either belonged to a pack or you didn’t.

“Rejected by my pack.” Devon muttered, completely unfazed.

“Assuming you’re telling the truth. How does Athena not recognize you?”

“The same way she believes Dominic is her older brother.”

‘I can’t tell if he’s lying.’ Titan murmured.

Devon pointed to his eyes. “Our eyes. They’re identical, inherited from our mother and her lineage.”

“Anyone can have similar eyes.” I countered.

“You’re right, they can. But what color were Dominic’s eyes?” He smirked. “Why would I bother telling you this?”

“To buy yourself time!” I snapped.

‘I’m locked in a dungeon. I’m not going anywhere.’ He said sarcastically.

“Let me get this straight. You’re something called a Lycan. A man who claims to be Athena’s younger brother. Someone she doesn’t know. And Dominic isn’t related to her?”

“Almost correct. I didn’t say he wasn’t related. I said he wasn’t her brother!”

“Then who is he?”

“Our uncle!”

‘So she is an Alpha.’ Titan murmured in shock. ‘Being bound twice wasn’t just because she carries powerful blood. She’s an Alpha by birthright. The firstborn.’

‘If this is even true.’

“He didn’t believe the Alpha role should go to a female.” Devon continued. “He posed as an older brother due to the significant age gap with our father. The pack supported him.”

“How do you know all this?”

“I had an insider.”

“Had?”

“They came here to verify Athena arrived alive. I believe you killed him.”

“He shouldn’t have attacked my wolves.”
