I nodded and sank deeper into the water.
The water rose to my chin.

"It won't always feel like this." He smiled softly.
He leaned over the tub and kissed my forehead.
Then he moved to the large chair by the window.
He turned it to face me and sat down.

"You don't remember much from your childhood, do you?"
I shook my head silently.
He was watching me intently again.
Just like he had in Dominic's office.
That same curious expression.

"Has Caleb... Has he said something?" I asked quietly.
"No." His voice sounded distant. "I haven't spoken to him."
"Did I do it wrong?" He was my first and only.
I wasn't sure if I had performed well.

He laughed and shook his head. "No, you were perfect."
I soaked in silence, waiting for him to continue.
But he remained quiet, just watching me.

I finally got out and began drying myself.
He went to the closet and picked out clothes for me.
I was slowly getting used to him doing that.

"Are we going somewhere?" I asked as he handed me trainers.
I had hoped to stay here and rest.
"We need to speak to your brother. I have questions. I want you there to hear his answers."

He said he hadn't spoken to Caleb.
What happened while I was asleep?

Walking through the snow toward the dungeons made me uneasy.
Something had definitely occurred.
I wasn't sure I wanted to know what it was.

Alexander pulled the heavy door open.
He stepped into the darkness first.
He flicked the lights on as he descended the steps.

"Caleb?" Alexander called out. "Are you awake?"
"You brought me a visitor. How could I sleep through my sister's arrival?"
He yawned as I stepped in front of his cell.
He looked well-rested.
Someone had given him a small bed, water, and fresh clothes.
He had better treatment than I received under Dominic and Marcus.

"You look comfortable." Alexander's voice was quiet.
"Your gorgeous Beta was kind enough to bring me some comforts. He thought it might make me more talkative. He seemed annoyed that I would only speak to you."
Caleb grinned. "Tell me, is he seeing anyone?"

"He isn't into men. I believe he made that very clear." Alexander's tone was low.
"Such a pity. Anyway, how can I help you?" Caleb stood up and stretched.

"Witches." Alexander stated simply.
"Witches? Any particular witch? Not that I've met any."
"You said you had inside information. Was there talk about witches visiting? Specifically concerning Athena."

My head snapped toward Alexander.
But his focus remained entirely on Caleb.
###Chapter 0059

“I don’t know their names. But I believe it was a Witch, or perhaps several, who bound her. No one else possesses that kind of power.”

“That is precisely why I am asking you.”

Caleb shakes his head slowly. “I don’t know what you want me to say, Alpha Alexander. There was no mention of any Witch. Dominic worked tirelessly to keep Silver Creek hidden from other kinds. He didn’t allow outsiders in easily.”

“What exactly do you mean by that?” Alexander demands.

“Whoever bound her as a child… would be the same one who bound her again as an adult.”

“Do… do you know who he’s talking about?” I ask Alpha Alexander quietly. Maybe that’s why he’s been acting so distant.

“Not yet,” he mutters. He turns toward the stairs and holds out his hand. “Come. It’s time for your lesson with Theodore.”

“Lesson? Ooh, what are you practicing? Fighting?” Caleb asks, his fingers curling around the bars. “Is this Theodore handsome too? It gets a bit boring seeing the same faces down here all day.”

“Reading lesson,” I murmur without thinking.

“It’s about time someone taught you to read and write.”

“What… what did you just say?” I’ve kept it a secret for so long. Isabella figured it out. I accidentally told Alpha Alexander. But I never told anyone else.

Caleb says nothing. He retreats back against the wall.

“Answer her,” Alpha Alexander growls.

“It’s nothing.”

“How… how did you know that?”

“My person on the inside told me.”

Alpha Alexander knew I hated talking about it. He knew I would never willingly tell another soul. Even Dominic thought I could read. The truth was, I just learned to recognize things without reading labels.

“Your story is falling apart, Caleb.” Alpha Alexander paces in front of the cell. “I knew there was something off about you.”

“Honestly, that’s what he told me.”

“His name?”

“He never gave me a name.” Caleb looks directly at me. “He was blonde. At least six feet tall. Almost black eyes. Always seemed happy.”

“You trusted someone from the pack who wouldn’t even give you their name.”

“They didn’t want to be caught.”

“Bullshit!” Alpha Alexander snaps. “I’ve heard lies before, but this is ridiculous.”

“He’s… telling… the truth,” I mutter, vaguely remembering someone who matched Caleb’s description.

“This guy wouldn’t know the truth if it bit him,” Alexander says sharply.

“He didn’t come to the house often.” It was like an old memory scratching at the back of my mind. Little pieces flickered through. “He dropped off a list that Marcus had given him. He made a joke about me not reading it… and then read it out loud for me.”

Alpha Alexander is staring at me intently. “Are you sure?”

“My memory is bad. It’s like… most of the good stuff from when I was little is gone. I only remember the worst parts.” The blood-soaked faces of my parents flash before my eyes.

“That’s what Dominic wanted, Athena. If you remembered all the good things, you would’ve been a threat. He had to make you weak,” Caleb mutters.

“Again, you know a lot for someone who was never in the house,” Alpha Alexander growls. He grabs my hand and tugs me back up the stairs and out into the cool air.

“I don’t like him!” he states firmly. “There’s just something about him that rubs me the wrong way.” He grabs my shoulders and turns me around. “Partial truths don’t mean he’s telling the whole truth.”

“You mean like how you’re not telling me why you’re being so weird?”
###Chapter 0060
Alexander

Occasionally, sharp little remarks would slip through, catching both of us off guard.

“I’m not acting strange. There’s just a lot happening right now.”

“You’re being foolish again!” Titan grumbled.

“What should I say? ‘By the way, you were bound more than twice because they were terrified of you.’ Or maybe, ‘Don’t worry about shifting—you’ve already done it!’ Do you think she wants to hear that, Titan? She’s terrified of shifting!”

“Fine,” he sulked. “Handle it your way.”

“You…you still haven’t said anything,” Athena murmured. “Is Titan…is he saying something to you? Is he talking about me?”

“Titan cares about you as much as I do. We just have different opinions on how to handle certain situations.”

Her brow furrowed slightly. “He wants you to…tell me something?” Her frown deepened.

“Not here,” I muttered, glancing around at my pack members moving nearby. I took her hand and led her back toward the house, shutting us inside my office.

She dropped into a chair and immediately pulled her knees to her chest. It took me some time to realize this was her way of protecting herself—a defense against Dominic and his followers targeting her ribs and stomach. Now, it had become a habit whenever she felt vulnerable.

“It’s bad, isn’t it?” she whispered. “Genevieve is back, and now you and Titan have decided…”

“This has nothing to do with Genevieve.”

“I don’t…I don’t understand.”

“Over the past few days, we’ve spent a lot of time in the bedroom. During that time, we had a visitor.”

“Dominic?” she asked, alarmed.

“No. A Witch.”

“Oh.”

“The same Witch who bound your abilities.” I delivered the news slowly, like peeling off a bandage. “When you were a newborn pup.”

Her forehead wrinkled, eyes widening. “No…I was six.”

I held back the rest for now and explained that this was the same Witch I had met to discuss unbinding her. The same Witch who had fled when I mentioned the name of Athena’s pack. Now I understood why.

“She helped Dominic?”

“No, Athena.” I sighed. “She helped your father.”

Her eyes dropped from mine. Her hands gripped the armrests, knuckles turning white as she squeezed the wood. I felt her anger surge.

“My…my father?”

“Yes.”

“My father…he wanted me bound?” She spat out the words.

Her anger faded quickly, replaced by tears welling in her eyes.

“I know this isn’t what you want to hear, Athena, but from what she told me, I don’t think it was only Dominic and Victoria responsible. I believe it goes back further.”

She sat there, staring at me with her blue eyes. My heart ached for her. I had never encountered a pack like this—secrets thicker than blood, all centered around her.

“W…why?”

“They feared you.”

She let out a nervous laugh. “Me?”

I had to tell her the truth.

“You were able to shift at birth, Athena. They had you bound, and then when you were one, you started shifting again. Your Lycan side was fighting it. You, at one year old, understood why the Witch was there. You purposely kept shifting into a Lycan, hoping she wouldn’t be able to bind you. Athena, that’s unheard of.”

“For Wolves,” Titan muttered.

Athena stared at me as if I were insane. Pure disbelief that I would suggest she had already shifted. Her mind refused to accept it.

“You’re…you’re wrong. I would know. I…”

“You wouldn’t remember. No pup would or could remember that.”

“I… That can’t be. You’re wrong.”

“I’m only repeating what the Witch told me.”

“You believe her.”

“Madame Zora can be elusive at times, but she has always eventually told me the truth. Even if it’s like drawing blood from a stone. Sometimes cash makes her more cooperative. But this time, she didn’t even want money.”

“She’s not listening,” Titan muttered.

I glanced back at Athena. Her eyes were closed, nose wrinkled as she frowned.

“Are you okay?”

“I think I’ve heard that name.”

“Madame Zora?” I asked curiously.

Her jaw clenched as she nodded.

“From someone here?”

“No, it’s just…something up here.” She tapped her head. “It feels familiar.”

“Like I said, they feared you, Athena. That’s why the Witch was involved. They fear a female Alpha.”

“I’m not—”

“You are a rare female Alpha of a dying breed.”

She stood and moved around the desk to the window. “I’m not powerful, Alpha Alexander. I’m just me…the girl who was made a slave. I’m not…I’m not anything powerful. And I wish…please stop saying it.”

I felt her sadness. She refused to believe it was possible.

“If they are dying, let them die out,” she muttered, still gazing out the window.

“Let them die out?” Her comment surprised me, and I needed to confirm what I had heard.

She turned to me slowly. A tear traced its way down her cheek, but her expression was filled with anger. “They did horrible things to me. They don’t deserve to live.”
###Chapter 0061

A dark thought flickered in her mind. It was a hidden part of her, buried deep beneath the persona she'd built over the years. Most would find it disturbing. I found it electrifying. It called to me. I needed to draw it out.

A sharp knock interrupted us. Isabella’s familiar scent drifted through the door. The conversation halted. From Athena’s thoughts, I sensed her relief.

“Enter,” I called.

My sister stepped inside. Her eyes darted between Athena and me, assessing. “Can I take Athena shopping?”

“Shopping?”

“A few of us are heading into the city. I thought she might like to come. Unless I’m interrupting something important again?”

“That’s her decision.” I watched my mate, listening to her silent worries.

She shook her head. “I’m not… I’m not ready.” Her gaze shifted to me. “It might not be safe.”

“Nothing will happen,” Isabella insisted. “The city is neutral territory. Fighting is forbidden there. I’ll be with her. We’ll keep her safe.”

“Who is ‘we’?” I asked.

“Me, Theodore…” She listed a few others.

“Theodore is going?” Shopping was hardly his style.

“He wants more books. You know how he is. Won’t have them delivered in case the pages get bent.” She rolled her eyes. “I figured you’d want a chaperone.”

“So you recruited him?”

“Exactly.”

I turned back to Athena. “She’s right. The city is safe. I trust Theodore.”

“What about Dominic?” she whispered.

“I doubt he’d go there.” I locked eyes with Isabella. “If there’s any trouble—”

“We’ll get her out immediately.”

I moved closer to Athena, turning her to face me. “Isabella has gone to the city weekly since childhood. She knows it better than anyone. If you don’t want to go, that’s fine too.”

“You don’t… you don’t want me to go.” She kept her eyes down. “I can feel it.”

“I’d prefer you where I can reach you instantly. But hiding won’t help you conquer your fears. I trust my sister. I trust Theodore. They won’t let anything happen to you. Anyone who tries would be incredibly stupid.”

“Every Wolf knows who my brother is,” Isabella added. “Gabriel made sure of that.”

She claimed she didn’t blame me for Gabriel’s rejection. But her words sometimes suggested otherwise. I ignored the comment, focusing on my mate. “It’s your choice, Athena.”

“What if I…”

“We’ll have to trust that you won’t.”

I felt Isabella’s stare burning into me. I still hadn’t told her about Athena being Lycan.

“Wait, what?” Isabella’s eyes shot to Athena when I finally revealed it. “You’re telling me she looks like that thing you killed?”

“Yes.”

“So she’s not a Wolf?” She glared, demanding answers.

“Technically, from what I understand, they are part Wolf.”

“Technically?” she sputtered.

“Yes.”

‘This is going great,’ Titan groaned.

“Okay, so the guy in the dungeon, claiming to be her brother. He’s one too?” Isabella asked.

“Yes.”

“And you’re letting him live?”

“For now. Are you questioning my decision?” My tone was a clear warning.

She turned to Athena, her expression softening. She likely realized her words applied to my mate too. “Are you okay?”

Athena shook her head.

“Then you definitely need to come. Escape this madness for a few hours. Clear your head. Spend a fortune on my brother’s credit.”

Athena’s blue eyes found mine.

“Your choice,” I repeated.

Reluctantly, she agreed. She spent the next hour seeking reassurance.

She asked me one last time before getting in the car.

“Just try to enjoy yourself,” I told her.

Isabella pulled her into the vehicle. “I’ll watch her. If it’s too much, we’ll return immediately.”

“You don’t usually like the clingy ones,” Sebastian remarked as the car drove away.

“This is different.”

“Because she’s your mate? Because you marked her?” He raised a brow.

“She’s clingy out of fear, not possession. She needs time.”

“How did Isabella take the news?”

“She focused more on me sparing Caleb. It took her a moment to realize wanting him dead would make her a hypocrite regarding Athena.”

“Isabella doesn’t usually make friends easily. She must like Athena. Especially to invite her shopping. She’s never done that with anyone else.”

I nodded. My sister preferred the hospital to social events.

“I need you to do something for me,” I said as the car disappeared.

“You want me to watch her?”

“Just as a precaution.”
###Chapter 0062
Athena

Theodore gives me a warm smile as I slide into the car. Isabella introduces the other two women, but she thankfully doesn’t reveal my secret. I had hoped she would keep it to herself, even if just for a little while.

“You’ll be okay.” Isabella keeps her arm linked with mine when I start to fidget. “We’re all here with you.”

“I’ve never…” I could feel the other women staring.

“I know, that’s exactly why I suggested this. You can’t stay hidden in the pack forever. It’s good to meet new people. To learn there’s more out there than just us.”

“Though Obsidian Howl is definitely the superior pack.” Theodore winks at me.

Isabella pulls a small black card from her pocket and hands it to me. “This is from Alexander. He thought you wouldn’t take it directly from him, so he asked me to give it to you.”

“What is it?”

The other women giggle, amused by my ignorance, and Isabella shoots them a sharp look with her dark eyes.

“It’s a credit card.”

“Right.” I take the black card from her, turning it over in my fingers. I had never held one before. I never had any use for money.

“I’ll show you how to use it when you buy something.”

“I don’t need his money.”

Isabella snorts. “You should enjoy it. It’s not like he’s short on cash.”

For a moment, I wondered how he made his money. It wasn’t like he had a regular job.

"Taxes." Theodore mutters as he opens a book to read.

"Taxes?"

"From contracts." He confirms.

"Plus Alexander owns several businesses in the city." Isabella adds. "He has very deep pockets."

The other women in the car giggle again, and I see Theodore roll his eyes.

By the time we reached the city, the scents were overwhelming. Traffic, Wolves, food, others I couldn't identify. I wrinkled my nose.

"Like I said, it'll take some time to adjust." Theodore climbs out and stands beside me, scanning the area.

People were everywhere. Some moved quickly while others strolled slowly. "Welcome to the city." Isabella mutters, linking her arm with mine.

I could already feel my body trembling. "Get it together." I whisper to myself, hoping no one hears.

Theodore stays a few steps behind as Isabella drags me from store to store. She insists I pick out a few things and tells me I can't return empty-handed.

She was enjoying herself, but I hated every moment. I wanted to return to the safety of the pack. I wanted to escape the noise and the smells. I silently begged to go back to the car.

A hand closes around my wrist as Isabella rummages through a clothing rack. I look up and see Theodore.

He releases me immediately. "I know, personal space, but you're not enjoying this, are you?"

I shake my head.

"Come to the bookstore with me. It's usually quiet there."

I nod, and he tells Isabella, who pouts for a moment but makes Theodore swear not to let me out of his sight.

"I'm not stupid. Isn't that the whole reason I'm here?"

Isabella gives him a location to meet in one hour. "If you're not back..."

"You'll call Alexander." Theodore finishes her sentence. "I wouldn't expect anything less."

Following Theodore out of the store, he leads me through several streets and down a side alley to a small bookshop. Hidden away from the city's hustle.

He quickly moves through the shelves, searching for something as I trail behind, admiring the beautiful book covers. It made me wish I could read. So many stories here, and I could barely pronounce any of the words.
###Chapter 0063

"What sort of book are you searching for?" I ask, hoping he might describe the cover so I could assist.

Silence answers me.

I turn around.

He's gone.

My heart stutters.

"Theodore?"

Still nothing.

I rush between the shelves, calling his name.

No response.

The library feels empty. Abandoned.

"Theodore?" My voice trembles.

Panic sets in. My pulse races. Breath catches.

I turn the final corner.

And freeze.

Victoria stands perfectly still.

A smug smile twists her lips.

Arms crossed beneath her chest. She grins at me.

"The little rat found her voice."

Behind her, a boot lies visible.

Large. Worn. Theodore's boot.

The metallic scent of blood slowly taints the air.

"Did... did you kill him?"

She turns and kicks the motionless form.

No sound.

"The Alpha released you." Her eyes fix on my neck mark.

"I'm not... not alone." I stammer.

"Oh, I know. But they aren't here now, are they? It's just us." She runs fingers through her long blonde hair. "Where is the mighty Alpha Alexander? If you're his contract bride, I'm shocked he let you wander with these fools."

"Where's... where's Dominic?"

"That is Alpha Dominic to you!" She spits. "None of your concern."

"This is neutral ground. They won't tolerate you here." I glance at Theodore's foot. It twitches. "They have rules."

"You think I care? You killed my brother!"

"You killed my parents!" The words burst out, shocking us both.

Victoria's eyes narrow.

Theodore rolls onto his back. Relief floods me. He's alive.

"Why are you here?" I demand, forcing strength into my voice.

"Dominic wants to see you."

"Why?"

She smirks. "He wants to remind you."

Theodore rises silently behind her.

His hands clamp around her throat. "Remind her of what?"

Before she answers, Beta Sebastian charges in.

He grabs me, pulling me behind him.

"Answer!" Theodore demands.

Victoria struggles.

Her manicured nails dig deep into his wrists.

Theodore doesn't flinch.

Blood trickles down his skin.

Dripping onto the floor.

"Release her, Theodore," Sebastian orders.

"She tried to kill me."

Tried. The word echoes. She only ever tries. Others do her dirty work.

Theodore smiles coldly. "Alexander will have a field day when I drag you to our dungeons. What will he remove first? A finger? A toe? Perhaps your tongue."

"As much as you want her dead, Theodore," Sebastian says calmly. "Alexander will handle it. She targeted his mate."

"Bride," Victoria scoffs.

She saw my mark. Does she doubt it?

"Mate," Sebastian corrects. "You've crossed into forbidden territory, Victoria. You didn't just play with fire. You signed your death warrant."

"Dominic will come for you!" Victoria screeches.

I cover my ears.

"I don't doubt it. I look forward to it." Sebastian glances at Theodore. "My van is out back. Take her. Lock her inside."

"Go to hell, you stupid Wolves!" Theodore snarls.

"Go on then. Shift." Sebastian challenges. "I dare you."
###Chapter 0064
Athena

Victoria glares at him. “You don’t want that.”

Marcus looks confused. He was the only one in the room who didn’t know what I was. What Victoria and I both were.

I had no clue what Beta Sebastian was trying to accomplish. She would show everyone my true form. She would reveal the monster I am.

Victoria’s eyes lock on me. It hit me then—she didn’t know. She had no idea that Alpha Alexander’s mark had shattered my binding.

That’s why she hesitated.

Everything Caleb said about keeping it hidden from me started to make sense. They didn’t want me to discover the truth.

“I’ll come willingly,” she mutters.

“Good,” Beta Sebastian and Marcus say at the same time.

“Marcus, I’m taking Athena with me. Clean this mess up. If word gets out, we’ll have even bigger problems.”

He nods, grabbing hold of Victoria. The smell of iron is still heavy in the air, but I can’t locate the source.

“She killed the shop assistant,” Beta Sebastian whispers to me, as if reading my thoughts. “What you smell is a lot of blood.”

Victoria giggles as Beta Sebastian pushes her forward. The van is parked at the end of the alley, away from the busy main street.

She gets in without resistance. Something feels off.

Beta Sebastian slams the doors shut, locking her inside.

“Come on, you can ride up front with me.”

“Something’s… something’s wrong.”

He raises an eyebrow and scans the area. “What do you mean?”

I look up and down the alley, trying to understand the dread coiling in my gut. Beta Sebastian follows my gaze. “There’s no one else here.”

“Are you… sure?” My stomach twists into knots. Victoria didn’t try to hit me—a first for her. “They never leave the pack without each other.”

“What are you talking about? Victoria was alone when she tried to poison us.”

“At the packhouse, yes. But when they left, it was always together.”

Caleb had fallen from a tree. I glance up at the rooftops. Nothing.

The bookshop door swings open. Dominic drags Marcus by his hair along the ground toward us.

“I’ll trade him for my mate,” he growls, his eyes locking on me.

Beta Sebastian’s hand tightens around my wrist, pulling me to his side. “Is he even alive?”

“Barely. But if you take him now, he might recover.”

“Why?” I whisper, staring at the blood trail behind them.

He sneers at my question and turns back to Beta Sebastian. “You have a decision to make. I suggest you make it fast.”

“Get in the van, Athena.” Beta Sebastian doesn’t look at me.

I obey, hearing Dominic mutter about me actually following orders. I want to say something but hesitate before opening the door.

“Van!” Beta Sebastian shouts.

Reluctantly, I climb in and shut the door, wishing I had more courage.

The van rocks slightly. Moments later, Beta Sebastian gets in with a sigh.

“Did you hand her over?” I ask quietly.

“I had to. We don’t abandon our own.”

“And Marcus… is he alive?”

“Yes. Just barely.”

“I’m sorry. This is… my fault.”

“No, you don’t need to apologize. None of us expected Dominic to be here. Alexander thought it would be too public for him, especially in a neutral zone.”

“Why did you come?” I ask as moans echo from the back.

“Why do you think?”

I wasn’t sure whether to feel relieved or irritated. But if he hadn’t shown up when he did, this might have ended differently. I might not be returning to Alpha Alexander.

Beta Sebastian stays silent for the rest of the drive, only confirming that Isabella already knows what happened.

Alpha Alexander is waiting at the packhouse when we arrive. He waits for me to get out, then grabs my face, forcing me to look at him.

“Are you hurt?” he demands.

“No.”

“Don’t lie to me, Athena.”

“She… she didn’t touch me.”

He pulls me against his chest, his arms locking around me. “I should have trusted my instincts not to let you go.”

“You said… it was up to me.”

“It was. I should have known better with both of them still roaming free.”

“I don’t think she knew,” I mumble into his chest.

“What do you mean?”

“Beta Sebastian challenged her to shift. She looked at me. I don’t think she knew your mark broke my binding.”

“She should have scented you. Or maybe she was confused. It’s been a long time since you were first bound. Maybe she mistook your scent for Marcus’s.”

“Make sure Marcus gets medical attention too,” he calls to Beta Sebastian. “Isabella won’t be back for a while, but there will be someone else at the hospital.”
###Chapter 0065

“Come with me.” His voice was low as he released me.

I trailed him into his office.

Something about this room always put me on edge.

It felt like impending doom.

Like everything was about to fall apart.

“Sebastian mentioned you had a strange feeling.”

I nodded. “Right before Dominic showed up. I just... I can’t describe it.”

“You can’t explain it.” He sat behind his desk, leaving me standing.

“No. It just felt wrong.”

“What did she say to you?”

“That Dominic wanted to see me. That...” I frowned, her words still confusing. “He wanted to remind me.”

“Remind you of what?”

“She didn’t get to finish. Theodore interrupted.”

I shook my head. “Beta Sebastian. He was protecting me. Just like Theodore.”

He ignored my mention of Theodore.

“I should have killed Dominic when I had the chance.” He scowled, scribbling on a notepad.

I sank into the chair opposite him.

What was he writing?

“Alpha Alexander, how did they know where I was?”

“A question for Theodore once he’s healed.”

“Theodore?”

“I’m not accusing him. But he saw Victoria first. I need to know what happened right before she attacked him.”

He looked up. “You’re sure you’re not hurt?”

“Just confused.” I mumbled, trying to piece it together.

“I’ll handle it.” He changed the subject. “Did you buy anything nice?”

“A few things. Isabella has them.” I pulled the credit card from my pocket and slid it across the desk.

He picked it up and smiled. “I told you to buy whatever you wanted. You barely spent anything.”

His crimson eyes locked on mine. “The city overwhelmed your senses, didn’t it?”

“The bookstore was the first quiet place. Theodore said it took him almost a year to adjust.”

“It did. Especially his hearing. That’s why he lives on the outskirts. Fewer people. Less noise. Unfortunately, you don’t have that option.”

“Because I can’t protect myself?”

“Because I want you in my bed every night. Not hiding in some remote house.”

Alpha Alexander took me with him when he got word that Theodore was fully healed.

Theodore was sitting on the edge of the same bed I’d thought I was dying in.

His hair was down, loose around his shoulders.

Alexander drummed his fingers quietly on the bed frame.

Theodore’s eyes found me first. He jumped up. “Are you okay?”

I nodded as Alpha Alexander gave my shoulder a reassuring squeeze. “Are you?”

“That bastard came out of nowhere.”

“Which one?” Alpha Alexander asked.

“What do you mean?”

“The blonde, Victoria. She knocked you out first, right?”

“She asked me to reach a book for her. When I stretched up, she hit me from behind with something heavy.”

“Ever met her before?” Alpha Alexander pressed.

“Never.”

“And the other one? When they left, he came from above. Sliced down my spine.” He glanced at me. “Don’t worry. I’m healed. I heal fast.”

“You’ve never spoken to them? Interacted before?”

“Are you asking if I set this up? Alexander, why would I risk my life? You know I’m smarter than that. He nearly missed my heart. I’d be an idiot to cross you. I’ve seen what you do to your enemies. I’d rather be on your side.”

My eyes flicked to Alpha Alexander, but he didn’t notice. I’d only seen him kill Marcus. How dark could he get?

“Right.” Alpha Alexander murmured, turning away.

“Am I free to go?”

“Sure.”

“Are we still having a tutoring session tonight?” Theodore asked me.

“No. Not tonight.” Alpha Alexander answered before I could speak.

He didn’t sound angry. But he didn’t sound happy either. It made me nervous. He was unpredictable.

Theodore left without another word.

Alpha Dane just stood there, expression unreadable.

“Are we going back to the house?” I asked after a long silence.

My question seemed to snap him out of it. He smiled and nodded.

For the rest of the evening, he barely spoke.

But he watched my every move.

It made me nervous.

It was only when I was getting into bed that he finally spoke.

“Were you accidentally linking them?”
###Chapter 0066
Alexander

She glares at me. "Is that... even possible?"

"Right now, everything seems possible."

"Because I'm a monster?"

"Stop calling yourself that."

She rolls onto her back, staring at the ceiling. She sighs and rests her hands on her flat stomach.

"They'll all react that way." She mumbles, puffing her cheeks. "You... you're the only one who doesn't seem..."

"I don't care what you are. All I care about is that you're mine." I pull her against me. "And why are you still wearing clothes to bed?"

My hand slips under her oversized t-shirt and grazes her lower back. She gasps softly.

Unexpectedly, she pushes me away.

"I can't." she whispers, tugging the t-shirt back down over her hips.

She was fighting hard to keep certain thoughts at bay. Trying to maintain a clear mind so I wouldn't discover her inner turmoil.

I pin her to the bed, dropping my weight on top of her. "What's wrong?"

"You're... crushing my... lungs."

I ease my weight slightly but keep her trapped beneath me.

"Are you still tender?"

She closes her eyes.

"Embarrassed?" I drive my leg between hers, forcing her thighs apart.

She shakes her head slightly. "Uncomfortable." she whispers.

I kiss the mark on her neck. I tell her I'll let her be tonight. Only then does she relax. She falls asleep before I do, curled against my side.

'We need to stop Dominic and Victoria.' Titan growls. 'They nearly started a war in the neutral zone.'

'I know.'

'There are others desperate to knock us down.'

'I know.' I mutter, running my fingers through my mate's dark hair.

'You know how angry I've been, Alexander. I wish we had been there. I wish she had never gone. But I can't change what happened. I can only ensure it never happens again.'

I look down at Athena. Her eyelashes flutter against her cheeks as she sleeps peacefully. She seems unaware of the rage building inside me.

'I need to run.' I tell Titan, slipping from Athena's grasp.

'We should speak to Caleb again.' He suggests.

'He didn't know Athena was going into the city.'

'No, but he might understand their current plans. Or at least predict their next move.'

I pull on a pair of shorts and move through the house. I step into the falling snow. The cold beneath my bare feet offers relief from my constant body heat.

I walk through the snow to the dungeon. A guard leans against the door, bored out of his mind.

"Any problems?" I ask.

"No, he keeps to himself." The guard mumbles, stepping aside to let me through.

The guard closes the door behind me as I turn on the lights.

"Really, it's the middle of the night?" Caleb mutters. He apologizes when he sees me. "I'm not great without sleep. What can I do for you Alpha Alexander?"

He stretches his limbs and yawns.

"Athena." I mutter.

"You'll need to give me more than that." He rubs his eyes.

"You keep talking about Athena being an Alpha."

"She is."

"Right. What is she capable of?"

"No one knows for certain. I've researched, but the most I found is that someone in her position possesses great power. They just need to learn how to access it."

"Are you talking magic? Like a Witch?"

"Honestly Alpha Alexander, I don't know. I just know she can restore us to our rightful status in the world."

"And that's why they fear her?"
###Chapter 0067

“I believe their fear isn’t directed at her personally. They fear what she might become.”

“Especially Dominic and Victoria?”

“They’re the only leaders left standing. What do you think?”

“What would Dominic want Athena to remember?”

He stood up, moving close until only the bars separated us. “What are you implying?”

“What does Athena need to be reminded of?”

He raised an eyebrow. “I don’t understand your question, Alpha Alexander. Is she in danger again? You must release me. I need to help her.”

“She is my mate.”

“I’m aware. But she’s surrounded by Wolves. She needs someone of her own kind. Someone who understands what it means to be like us.”

“We’ve discussed this. It’s her decision.”

“She doesn’t know you’re here, does she, Alpha Alexander? All these late-night visits while she remains unaware as you try to unravel her past.”

“Late-night visits? I’ve only been down here a few times since your arrival.”

“Your friend Sebastian visits often. I think he’s having relationship troubles.”

“Why would Sebastian discuss his mate with you?”

“Sometimes an outside perspective helps.” He shrugged.

“Do you talk about Athena?”

“No.”

“What do you discuss?”

“Like I said, his problems. In return for listening, he brings me things.” He gestured toward the cell, now stocked with soda, clothes, and books. I needed to speak with Sebastian. He never mentioned any of this.

Caleb gripped the bars. “I swear to you, Alpha Alexander, I mean her no harm. You have the authority to release me. You don’t need to wait for my sister’s approval.”

I still don’t trust him. Titan growled.

“Why would Dominic and Victoria go into the city?” I ignored both Titan and Caleb’s pleas.

“I’m not following.”

“They’ve always kept to themselves. Hidden from other packs. None of us knew your kind existed. Now they’re venturing into neutral territory. Why would they do that?”

“Probably for the same reason anyone goes there. They’re searching for something. Or someone. Athena encountered them, didn’t she?”

“Sebastian got her out.”

Caleb grinned. “The hero. I knew he was a good man.”

“He’s not interested in men,” I repeated.

“Anyone can be swayed, Alpha Alexander. They just need the right… incentive.” He winked.

“Anyway, for Dominic and that woman to enter the city, there must be a significant reason. Some kind of plan.”

“Could they find her?”

“Not Victoria, but possibly Dominic.”

“Because of their blood connection?”

He nodded. “But they would’ve needed to be nearby already to sense her presence. Same as how I found Silver Creek. I told you I could feel it. The sensation grew stronger as I approached. That’s how I knew I was heading the right way.”

He paced his cell, muttering to himself. Suddenly he stopped, his blue eyes locking onto mine. “Who knew she was going?”

“My sister, her tutor, and a few other females. Obviously, Sebastian and myself.”

“All Wolves, correct? You don’t have any other Lycans hidden here?”

“Besides Athena. Is it possible she could’ve accidentally alerted him? Opened a link between them?”

“Unlikely. The only other explanation is they were already there for another reason and Athena walked right into them. They won’t come here. You have the numbers.”

I studied him, recalling his explanation about Lycan origins. He called it a story, but what if it was true?

“Caleb, can they create more?”
###Chapter 0068
Alexander

‘What’s our next move?’ Titan demands sharply.

I need to speak with my Beta immediately.

This situation is critical. We must regain control now.

My fist pounds against Sebastian’s door.

“Hey, take it easy!” He yanks the door open before even seeing me. “Trying to wake the whole house?” He freezes when he recognizes me. “What’s happened?”

“Caleb!”

“Damn, he told you. Look, I just needed to vent to someone. I know you’ve been dealing with…”

“That’s not why I’m here. Whatever strange dynamic you have with him is your business. I’m not concerned about that. They can make more.”

He rubs sleep from his eyes. “What did you say?”

“They can create more Lycans.”

“Well, that makes sense. Same as us creating more Wolves.”

“Sebastian.” He wasn’t grasping the severity.

“Shit.” He mutters, finally understanding. “Are you certain? This information came from Caleb.”

“He mentioned it was an unspoken rule forbidding them from doing it. Dominic likely enforced it to maintain pack secrecy. A larger pack would have drawn more attention.”

I recount everything Caleb shared, including their inability to track Athena unless nearby.

“Do you believe they were recruiting?” He questions.

‘The city isn’t exclusively Wolves. Many humans work there, completely unaware of our existence. So yes, that’s a distinct possibility.’

“We should have investigated them more thoroughly.”

“How could we have known? They smelled like Wolves. They acted like Wolves. It seemed straightforward. But their proposed contract was never about needing support or Athena. I think they’re seeking a way to dismantle my authority. And it all connects back to the very system I established.”

“They wouldn’t be the first, Alexander. Over the years, many have tried, including your own brides attempting to escape contracts or gather intelligence. If Dominic and his followers start turning humans, we both know we still hold the numerical advantage. Our fighters are the most skilled. Your brother ensured that.”

He frowns. “How is Athena handling this news?”

“She’s unaware. She was sound asleep when I left.”

A noise echoes from upstairs.

We both pause, waiting to see if one of his sons appears.

Several minutes pass in silence.

We decide to continue the conversation outside.

“Is she alright?” Sebastian asks. “She was unusually quiet on the drive back from the city. Different from that first night we brought her here.”

“I believe it’s a form of shock. She seems to genuinely like Theodore. Seeing someone she cares about that close to death has unsettled her.” I couldn’t describe it as panic; that wasn’t the emotion I sensed from her.

“Thank you for getting her out of there.”

He raises an eyebrow. “You never need to thank me. I am your Beta. Protecting your mate is my duty. I will always prioritize her safety.”

“You never showed much interest in protecting the previous brides.”

He shrugs with a slight smirk. “You never claimed them.”

We spend hours in his garden, strategizing.

Eventually, the sun rises.

His boys appear within minutes, loudly complaining of ‘starving stomachs’ and demanding food.

Sebastian looks at me. “She needs to be part of our next move. It won’t succeed without her.”

‘She needs a tremendous amount of confidence.’ Titan mutters internally.

“Then we’ll help her find it.”

‘So much for our run.’ Titan grumbles.

“The pack run is tomorrow night. We’ll have to wait until then.”

Athena is already awake when I return to the packhouse.

She sits in the kitchen, nibbling on a piece of toast.

She has braided her hair away from her face today.

I notice she has removed the ear plugs.

“How are your ears?” I keep my voice soft.

“Trying… trying to get used to it.” She mumbles, grimacing slightly. “You were up early.”

“I didn’t sleep.”

“Oh.”

“Titan wanted more answers from Caleb. After that, I went to see Sebastian.”

She takes another bite of her toast but remains silent.

She often did this.

Keeping her questions to herself.
###Chapter 0069

I discovered something crucial about Lycans last night.

She remains silent, simply watching me while she eats her breakfast.

“It’s believed that Lycans can create more of their kind. By biting humans.”

Her toast slips from her fingers. Blue eyes widen. Her jaw goes slack. “Is that...true?”

“I can’t say for sure. But the possibility is strong. That’s how the first ones were made.”

“Why would...why would Dominic want more?”

“Numbers. Right now, he doesn’t have enough. But if he succeeds,” I pause, watching her closely. I already know how she’ll react. “They’ll need their true Alpha. Not some impostor.”

“I’m not—”

“But you are, Athena. It’s in your blood. Whether you accept it or not. If Dominic creates a new wave, many will despise what he’s done. They’ll hate what they’ve become. They’ll hate being Lycan.”

“Like me,” she whispers, dropping her gaze to the fallen toast.

“Exactly. Imagine their strength if they had a leader who understood that hatred.”

“I’m not... Alpha Alexander, look at me. I’m...the furthest thing from a leader.”

“It’s in your blood.”

“Stop saying that. My father had me bound. He didn’t want this. He raised Dominic as my older brother.”

“Fathers don’t always know what they want.”

I lean back in my chair with a sigh. She watches me carefully.

“I’m a bastard. The son of an Alpha and an Omega. My father grew desperate for an heir. He convinced an Omega to carry me.”

“I thought—”

“Isabella and Julian had a different mother. She took me in. Raised me no differently than her own children. Our fathers make poor choices. But sometimes, those choices put us exactly where we need to be.”

Her blue eyes lift to meet mine.

“Your father set your life on a downward path long before Dominic came along. He rejected you instead of embracing you. Then Victoria entered the picture. Yet you survived, Athena. For twenty-two years, you survived everything thrown at you.”

Her heart is racing wildly.

‘You blew it,’ Titan mutters. ‘Too intense. You scared her.’

She screws her eyes shut and shakes her head. “I’m not...I’m sorry...I have to go.”

I don’t stop her as she flees. Titan was right. I ruined any chance of making her feel powerful.

‘Told you,’ he mumbles, fading into the back of my mind.

Athena keeps her distance most of the day. Every time I catch a glimpse of her, she’s muttering to herself.

Late afternoon, a scream echoes through the house. I race to the kitchen and find her surrounded by broken glass. A deep cut on her hand drips blood onto the floor.

I pull her away and remove the glass shard. The wound heals instantly. It vanishes within seconds, leaving no mark. As if it was never there. Another sign of her Alpha blood.

Her blue eyes flash up to mine. “Sorry,” she whispers.

“It’s fine.” I murmur, turning her hand over in mine. “Before your binding at eighteen, did you always heal this fast?”

She nods. “They hit me,” she frowns. “Over and over. The bruises faded in seconds. Why?”

“I keep saying it, Athena. Healing this quickly...it’s because of Alpha blood.”

She pulls her hand back and shakes her head.

I pick up another piece of glass and slice my own palm. The wound disappears in seconds. “If this were Sebastian, it would take much longer. Theodore’s injury took hours to heal.” I grab her hand again, holding it up between us. “This is who you are.”
###Chapter 0070
Athena

I stared at my hand.
My thumb traced the smooth skin of my palm.
Not a single mark remained.
It had been years since I healed this fast.

Dominic and the pack used to take pleasure in making my bruises last.
They hit harder each time.
Sometimes they broke bones.
Then they’d hit me again as soon as the fractures sealed.

After the final binding, the beatings didn’t stop.
They just changed.
Their satisfaction came from seeing me permanently wounded.

“It’s the Alpha in you,” Alexander murmured. “The bindings were the only reason it ever took so long before.”

I curled my hand into a tight fist.
My own nails bit into my skin.
Tiny beads of blood surfaced.
The moment I released, the small wounds vanished.
Only droplets of red remained, staining my skin.

“This is what Dominic wanted, Athena. To break you. To strip your power. To make you nothing.” He tipped my chin up with one finger. “But you are not nothing. I need you to see that.”

His hands settled on my hips as he held my gaze. “We’re telling the pack today.”

“No.” I shook my head. I wasn’t ready. I didn’t want to see the monster I would become.

“Athena, it’s time. I’ve delayed as long as I can. They need to know.”

“I don’t have a choice, do I?” I whispered, dropping my eyes.

“Not this time.”

Maybe it was better this way.
If they rejected me, better to know now.

“They will want you here.”

I looked back at Alexander.
His crimson eyes watched me steadily.
He didn’t seem worried at all.

I closed my eyes and gave a slow nod.
I still couldn’t believe I was agreeing.

“Good. The meeting starts in thirty minutes.”

“Thirty minutes?” I thought I’d have more time to prepare myself.

“I’ll be right beside you. Sebastian will be on your other side. But there’s something else you need to do.”

“I can’t… I haven’t even shifted yet.”

“I’m not asking you to shift. I’m asking you to decide about Caleb.”

“Oh. Do you… do you think he’s a risk?”

“Titan still doesn’t trust him.”

“What about you?” I asked quietly.

“I’m still undecided. But ultimately, he’s your family.”

I snorted involuntarily. “Technically, so is Dominic.”

“You have a point. Talk to Sebastian. He’s had more conversations with Caleb than I have.”

“What do you mean?”

“It’s a long story.” He picked up the earplugs from the table and handed them to me. “You’ll probably need these.”

I quietly pushed them back into my ears.
My eyes scanned the room for a dustpan to clean up the broken glass.

“Someone will clean it up,” Alexander said, guiding me toward the door. “It’s time to go.”

We walked across the snowy ground.
We passed the training hall.
We moved further south than I had ever been.

We ducked into the trees.
We followed a well-trodden path.
We moved deeper into the forest.
Alexander kept his fingers locked with mine the entire time.

My nerves built with every step.
The knot in my stomach tightened.
We had to stop multiple times so I could vomit.

We were surrounded by pack members.
Some had shifted.
Others remained in human form.
There were so many of them.
More than I had ever seen.
It made everything scarier.
If they attacked, I didn’t stand a chance.
###Chapter 0071

Beta Sebastian appeared suddenly, taking a position on my left side. Alpha Alexander still held my right hand firmly. His fingers remained tightly interlaced with mine. He stood slightly in front of me, shielding me from the crowd.

Alpha Alexander formally introduced me as his mate. He declared to everyone that he had marked me. Cheers and applause erupted throughout the gathering. I knew this celebration would be short-lived. The moment they discovered what I truly was, they would turn against me. They would turn against their Alpha too.

"Relax." Beta Sebastian leaned in close, his voice a low whisper meant only for me. "Their reactions might surprise you."

"As you all know, we've had ongoing issues with the Silver Creek pack." Alpha Alexander's voice boomed across the clearing. I felt grateful he had suggested I keep the earplugs in. "They failed to uphold their side of the treaty. In fact, it was all a deliberate plot to destroy Obsidian Howl."

"Kill them all!" someone shouted from the crowd.

"In due time, yes." Alpha Alexander responded calmly. "Right now, it's crucial for you to learn some information about my mate."

My heart hammered violently against my ribs. Black spots began dancing at the edges of my vision.

'Is it true?'

I recognized Isabella's voice cutting through the mental chatter.

'That Silver Creek isn't like us?'

"Yes, it's true." Alpha Alexander responded, and I noticed the slight curve of his lips. "They are what's known as Lycans. Part wolf, part human. Like the one killed during the attack on our pack. He belonged to Silver Creek."

A collective gasp rippled through the crowd.

"What about our new Luna?" another voice called out. I could feel numerous eyes burning into me.

"She isn't a Luna." Alpha Alexander grinned widely. "She is an Alpha."

Whispers immediately spread through the assembled wolves. They shifted positions, murmuring to each other. After several minutes, Alpha Alexander raised his hand for silence.

"Yes, she is a Lycan. One who was torn from her rightful position within her family. Forced into slavery. Beaten daily until her body barely clung to life. A Lycan who had her abilities bound. Not once, not twice, but four separate times."

Tears welled in my eyes instantly. I desperately wanted him to stop speaking.

Theodore stepped forward from the crowd.

"Four times?" He sounded genuinely shocked. His deep green eyes found mine. I couldn't determine if he felt disappointed that I hadn't confided in him after he'd shared his own past.

"Are you certain, Alpha Alexander?" he asked.

The rest of the pack remained completely silent, awaiting Alpha Alexander's response.

"What do you know, Theodore?"

"Stories." he muttered back, his intense gaze still fixed on me. "There's nothing formally recorded about Lycans. I can't recall specifics immediately, but I have books. Storytellers' accounts based on myths and legends about wolves." He paused briefly. "And other creatures. Particularly those who had been bound."

"Go look now." Beta Sebastian snapped. Theodore quickly disappeared between the dense trees.

Mutterings continued among the pack members. I felt their stares and the unspoken questions hanging heavily in the air.

"Is she a threat?"

"Will she shift and kill us?"

"Will she pass information back to Silver Creek?"

"Will she turn against us?"

The questions seemed endless. Alpha Alexander appeared to be deliberately letting them voice everything before he responded.

"Any more questions?" he finally demanded when the inquiries began spacing further apart.

I shouldn't be standing here. I should be far away, hidden from all these judging eyes.

Complete silence fell as Alpha Alexander waited for someone to speak. No one dared. They remained quiet, waiting. They probably knew better than to challenge him now.

"Do you truly believe I would bring a mate into our pack who would attack us? Others have attempted it. They were all dealt with severely. Athena isn't like the others. If anyone here questions my decision, remember this: I will not be kind. I will not hesitate."
###Chapter 0072

Beta Sebastian winks at me. "He knows exactly what he's doing."

I understood his meaning perfectly. It was a veiled threat. I'd heard plenty of those over the years.

"Everyone meet back here tomorrow at sunset for the pack run!" Alpha Alexander announces.

There are nods and quiet murmurs. They all begin dispersing, fading into the trees.

"We need to go find Theodore." Beta Sebastian mutters, already moving ahead of us.

"Don't do that." I say quietly when it's just me and Alpha Alexander.

"Don't do what?"

"Don't choose me over them. You've worked too hard for this pack. Don't throw it all away because of me."

"You're right. I have worked hard to build this pack. And you, Athena, are part of it now."

He drapes his arm over my shoulders. "Now let's go see what Theodore was talking about."

Alpha Alexander keeps me close as we walk back through the forest. We enter the main pack territory where Genevieve stands waiting with her arms crossed.

"Well, well. What an unpleasant surprise!" She mutters.

"Watch your tone, Genevieve!" Alpha Alexander snarls.

"She doesn't even belong here!" She speaks directly to Alpha Alexander, completely ignoring my presence. Her hands move to her hips. "I don't understand this."

"Then you better figure it out quickly!" He snaps at her and turns me away, guiding me toward Theodore's home.

The door to Theodore's house stands wide open. Beta Sebastian leans against a wall inside while Theodore frantically searches through books, randomly tossing them onto the table.

"Any news?" Alpha Alexander asks.

"Not yet." Beta Sebastian murmurs with a raised eyebrow. He seems to find the whole situation amusing.

Theodore suddenly starts flipping through pages rapidly. He fans books out across the table.

"There's no mention of Lycans." He murmurs, gesturing to the books. "But there are references to a creature matching your description. Half human, half wolf."

"Why do you even have this?" Beta Sebastian asks.

"I was bound, remember? I was trying to figure out how to break the binding. The only information I found about binding involved these creatures."

"Why didn't you say anything?" Alpha Alexander asks.

"Because I'm a Wolf. It never seemed relevant." His deep green eyes focus on me. "I never thought Athena would be anything other than a Wolf." He taps the book pages. "This information is centuries old. All of it is. You couldn't find anything, Alpha Alexander, because they were never called Lycans. They were known as Wolf-human."

"Wolf-human?" I whisper.

"They don't transition into full Wolves. They become something in between." He sighs. "There's very little information about them. It's practically a secret."

"What do we know?" Beta Sebastian questions. "Besides the basics." He glances at me. "Caleb talks quite a bit."

I see Alpha Alexander frown, but as usual, he keeps his thoughts to himself.

"You've been bound multiple times." Theodore continues. "Correct?"

"At least four times that we've pieced together. But what does that matter?" Alpha Alexander asks.

Theodore picks up one book and hands it to Alpha Alexander, already open to the right page. "This here states that the only Wolf-human bound more than once was bound three times."

"Okay."

"The third binding killed them." He looks at me with heavy sorrow in his eyes. "In theory, you should be dead."
###Chapter 0073
Athena

“Dead?” I whisper.

Theodore rubs his chin thoughtfully. “From my understanding, that side of you shouldn’t survive the bindings.” He glances at Alpha Alexander. “We all know bindings are the worst fate for a Wolf. It traps their other half. It’s the most severe punishment—I would know. I’m living proof. But according to these ancient texts, she shouldn’t have lived through it.”

“Well, she’s clearly standing right here,” Beta Sebastian snaps. “And she’s stronger now than the day we brought her home.”

“Maybe the bindings weren’t done correctly?” Theodore suggests with a shrug.

“You really believe the Witches messed it up—four separate times?” Sebastian questions sharply.

“It’s a possibility.”

Alpha Alexander frowns but doesn’t look at me. Maybe he can’t bear to see the panic written all over my face. I want him to say something—to acknowledge what Theodore is implying. Or maybe he’s finally realizing I’m not worthy of being his mate.

“Or maybe marking her saved her,” Sebastian mumbles under his breath.

“Perhaps,” Theodore replies.

I look up at Alpha Alexander. He’s reading the book Theodore handed him, his fingers tracing the words as his eyes move rapidly across the page. Absorbing every detail.

“Alpha Alexander?” I whisper.

He doesn’t respond. Instead, he slams the book shut.

“This isn’t helpful right now.” He shoves it back toward Theodore. “She can’t be the only one. And why didn’t you tell me you had information on Lycans—or whatever they’re called?”

“These books are ancient, Alexander. I thought they were myths—just stories. I never expected to meet a living one. I’ve been here twelve years, and nothing like this has ever crossed our path. How was I supposed to know it would become relevant?”

“You weren’t,” Sebastian cuts in before Alpha Alexander can speak.

“Am I… am I going to die?”

All three of them turn to look at me. Yet no one answers. Tears prick at my eyes, and I force them back.

For years, I believed death would be better than living as a slave. But that was before Alpha Alexander came into my life.

“Preferably not,” Alpha Alexander says, offering a tight-lipped smile that doesn’t reach his eyes. Is he already expecting the worst?

“I need… I need some air.” I turn away from them and hurry outside.

None of them try to stop me. It’s as if all three are already waiting for my impending death.

I lean against the wall, focusing on my racing heart. I will it to slow down, just for a moment.

I hurry across the grounds. People ignore me, and I’m grateful. No one tries to speak to me—not until I reach the back door of the house.

“Finally. Just you and me.”

My eyes lock with strange gray ones.

“I assume you know who I am?” she spits.

“G-Genevieve.”

She laughs mockingly at my stutter. “Do you always do that? You sound like a child.”

I keep my mouth shut. I can’t help the stutter—it happens when I’m nervous. She reminds me so much of Victoria.

“How the hell are you his mate?” She plants her hands on her hips. I decide it’s better not to speak.

“Cat got your tongue?” she taunts. “So tell me, what is a Lycan? The others say you become part Wolf. Is that true?”

“I d-don’t know.”

“You don’t know? What, have you never shifted?”

When I don’t answer, she laughs coldly.

“You won’t last long here. Alexander will see what a mistake you are. He’ll reject you, just like he did with the others. Only I get to survive. Only I deserve to be by his side.”
###Chapter 0074

"You don't know anything about me."

She scoffs. "Why would I want to? Just look at you."

"GENEVIEVE!" Isabella rushes toward us. "Stay the hell away from my brother's mate!"

"Isabella," she sneers, "I was merely introducing myself."

"Weren't you ordered to keep your distance?" Isabella snarls.

"I simply wanted to meet our Alpha's chosen mate."

"You mean you wanted to size her up. Alexander doesn't want you. How many times must you be told?"

Genevieve clenches her jaw and glares at Isabella. "You don't frighten me. You tried that before, remember how that ended? Perhaps Alexander needs reminding how troublesome his little sister can be."

"Ladies?" Beta Sebastian approaches us. "Is there a problem here?"

"No." Isabella snaps. "Genevieve was just leaving!"

"For now." Genevieve smiles sweetly at Beta Sebastian. As she turns, she tells him she's sorry to hear about him and his mate.

"Just go." He dismisses her as I search for Alpha Alexander. He must have felt my panic. Why hadn't he come? Did he send Beta Sebastian instead?

"Genevieve started it." Isabella mutters while glaring at Beta Sebastian.

"I don't doubt that." He shrugs as I scan the area for any sign of Alpha Alexander. "Alexander is with Theodore, doing research."

"Okay." I whisper softly.

"Shall we go inside?"

Isabella grabs my arm before I can answer. She pulls me through the back door, muttering about how Genevieve is a piece of work and that Alpha Alexander should have dealt with her years ago.

"Are you alright?" Beta Sebastian asks as he fills a glass with water and sets it before me.

"That stupid cow needs to learn her place!" Isabella grumbles as she collapses into a chair.

"I agree, but perhaps you should rise above it, Isabella. Alexander has made her position clear. And you know she won't be the last to throw herself at him. Learn to ignore it." He tells Isabella. "You're better than this."

"She was mocking Athena."

"Haven't you noticed she does that when she's jealous? She has to, otherwise she'd sound desperate. As much as I despise her, she's digging her own grave. Let her continue."

"What do you mean?" Isabella asks.

Beta Sebastian's eyes lock on me. "He has made his decision quite clear."

It was supposed to be easier here. Simpler. That's what Alpha Alexander had promised. But everywhere I turned lately, there was another problem.

"Why don't you go," I hear Beta Sebastian tell Isabella. "I can sit with Athena for a while, keep her company."

"Are you sure?"

"The boys are with their grandparents tonight. I have nowhere else to be."

"I can stay if you need me to." Isabella whispers to me.

"I'm okay." I whisper back, offering a small smile.

"If you need me, I'll be at the hospital."

She leaves as Beta Sebastian takes her seat. "You're a terrible liar."

"I know." I mumble quietly.

"Why didn't you tell her you weren't okay?"

"Too many people are already involved in this mess."

"If Alexander had an issue with you being a Lycan, you wouldn't be sitting here talking to me."

"Am I dying?"

"Hopefully not." He winks. "Caleb has mentioned multiple times that there's something different about you. An anomaly."

"You believe him?"

"I believe what I see. When I first met you, I wondered how you were even alive. You were nothing but skin and bones. Your face was gaunt, like someone in their final days. Your arms were like twigs, looking ready to snap at any moment. Even your heartbeat was so slow, barely there, like you were hanging on by the thinnest thread."
###Chapter 0075

He gives me a gentle smile. “But look at you now.”

“I’m still small,” I whisper. Compared to the other women in the pack, I felt tiny.

“What I’m saying, Athena, is that you shouldn’t have survived the journey here. Yet somehow, you did.”

“Because I’m a Lycan?”

“Maybe. Maybe it’s because you were traveling with your true mate. Maybe it’s because you have a stronger will to live than you realize. Maybe you survived because the world still needs you.”

“Caleb got in your head!” I mutter.

“Maybe he just opened my eyes a little.”

“What… what does that mean?”

“It’s no secret there are more than just humans and Wolves in this world. Looking at it that way, we shouldn’t be surprised when something new appears.”

“Me?”

He nods. “We messed up. We entered this agreement blindly. We should’ve done more research. We should’ve questioned Dominic more. Alexander probably would have, if he hadn’t been so drawn to you.”

“You blame me?”

“Not at all. I enjoy a good war, no matter how it starts.”

A war was the last thing I wanted.

“Would you like to speak to Caleb? I can take you to him if you want.”

“Alpha Alexander won’t like that.”

“Then why did he suggest it?”

Beta Sebastian makes me eat a sandwich first. He says he won’t let me pass out from hunger.

Alpha Alexander still hadn’t returned by the time we walked across the snow-covered grass. It made me nervous. After forcing our closeness earlier, he was now keeping his distance.

“You came.” Caleb smiles as I step in front of his cell. “I didn’t think you’d come back after last time.” His blue eyes shift to Beta Sebastian. “Good to see you, too.” He glances toward the steps. “No Alpha Alexander?”

“Not right now,” Beta Sebastian tells him.

I just stare at Caleb. I didn’t know what to say or ask. I didn’t even fully understand why I had agreed to come with Beta Sebastian.

He smiles at me. “I know you’re not just here to stare. You have questions.”

“I was… bound four times.”

“That’s not really a question.”

“Should…” I glance at Beta Sebastian. “Should I be dead?”

I see him swallow. He shifts his gaze to Beta Sebastian and sighs. “In theory, yes.” He sits back on his small bed. “You were last bound when you were eighteen, right?”

I nod.

“Dominic, Victoria, whoever did it probably hoped it would kill you. And yet, you survived.”

“If they wanted her dead, why not just kill her?” Beta Sebastian asks.

“I don’t know. I’ve been trying to figure that out for years. If it were anyone else, they would’ve just killed their problem, right? That’s what Alpha Alexander would do here, right? And other packs, too. So there must have been some benefit to keeping you alive.”

“It can’t be because Athena is an Alpha,” Beta Sebastian murmurs.

Beta Sebastian’s eyes flicker up behind me just as Alpha Alexander’s strong, woody scent washes over me.

“You’re right.” His crimson eyes lock onto mine. “It’s because you are able to carry the next Alpha.”
###Chapter 0076
Athena

"That's absolutely disgusting." Caleb makes a gagging sound. "Our uncle wants to breed her like some animal?"

I feel sick to my stomach. The idea is horrifying. We're family.

"Not necessarily him." Alexander's voice drops low. He moves closer to me. "You mentioned Dominic and Victoria have been together for years."

I nod slowly. "Since I was very young."

"Yet they have no children of their own. Strange, isn't it?"

I never considered that before. I was too focused on surviving each day without getting beaten.

"Athena carries Alpha blood." Sebastian murmurs thoughtfully.

"Our kind is dying out." Caleb adds grimly.

"Exactly." Alexander studies me intently. "It's the only explanation that makes sense. The plan was to have someone impregnate you. Probably multiple times. To produce another Alpha."

"No." I shake my head violently. "Dominic never-"

"He never allowed anyone near you like that, I know." Alexander finishes my sentence, making it sound even worse.

"You think he wanted to raise the children as his own?" Caleb mutters darkly.

Alexander gives a grim nod.

"What about all the bindings?" Caleb asks.

"Theodore is trying to figure that out." Alexander keeps his voice low. "Dominic had to know."

"He bound me because of Marcus." My voice barely comes out as a whisper. "Because I could scent Marcus." My throat tightens.

"That's what confuses me." Sebastian frowns. "He must have believed there was a reason you were breaking through the bindings."

"Maybe he thought the same as us. That her bindings were failing." Alexander suggests.

Caleb lets out a frustrated groan. "Dominic isn't the sharpest tool in the shed. Victoria definitely controls him. This has her fingerprints all over it."

"What do you mean?" Sebastian asks as I try to process their theories.

"I didn't grow up in a pack, but I know how they operate." Caleb's expression darkens. "An Alpha usually has a Luna. The Luna seeks equal power. Normally, she secures her position by providing an heir. Victoria hasn't done that." He runs a hand through his dark hair. "Fucking monsters!"

This is the angriest I've ever seen Caleb. He's usually so calm, especially considering his imprisonment.

"If he turns more people, he'll have a larger pack anyway." Sebastian points out.

"What good is a pack without an heir to continue the bloodline?" Alexander's frown deepens.

"If they had killed you, which they nearly did, the Alpha line would end anyway." Caleb's blue eyes meet mine. "I'm so sorry I didn't get you out sooner."

If the situation weren't so dire, I might have laughed. He sounds like the protective brother Dominic should have been. Maybe it's time to free him.

"The blood tie." Alexander's hands grip my waist firmly. "The blood tie kept you alive. You were weakening. They knew you were fading. Victoria knew they messed up."

Caleb's eyes fill with sorrow. His jaw clenches as he shakes his head. "I should have done more."

"You're right, you should have." Alexander's voice is low and intense. "But we can't change the past. We can only stop what's happening now."

"This...this is too much." I mumble weakly.

"Look at me." Alexander commands.

Hesitantly, I raise my eyes to meet his. His hand cups my cheek gently. His thumb traces my bottom lip. "You are not alone."

"If I'm...if they need an heir. Won't they come for me?"

"I'd love to see them try." Alexander's lips meet mine in a fierce kiss.

"Guys, guys." Caleb groans loudly. "What you do in private is your business. But I don't want to see it."

Alexander winks at me before turning to Caleb. "If you're staying in the packhouse, you better get used to locking your door."
###Chapter 0077

“You’re releasing him.” Beta Sebastian’s voice cut through the tension. I noticed the faint pink flush on his fair skin.

“It’s your decision,” Alpha Alexander murmured to me. “If you choose to, there will be conditions he must follow.”

“Anything!” Caleb beamed, his eyes bright with desperation. “I’ll do absolutely anything. I need to feel the sun on my skin.”

Doubt clawed at me. What if this was a mistake? What if everything he said was a lie? What if the moment he’s free, he leads Dominic straight to us? I’ve never been good with choices.

Stepping into the snow, Alpha Alexander took my hand. Just then, Caleb muttered about how glorious the sunlight felt.

“I am never going back into a cell,” Caleb declared, his hand catching mine. “Thank you. I swear I’ll be the brother you’ve always deserved.” He straightened up and faced Alpha Alexander, clearing his throat to sound more serious.

“Alpha Alexander, don’t mess with my sister.”

I saw the slight twitch at the corner of Alexander’s lips. He wasn’t a man who took orders. He made his own rules.

“Oh come on,” Caleb grinned. “I had to do the brotherly thing.”

“I’ll allow it this once,” Alexander replied coolly. “But remember—although Athena released you, I can easily put you back. And next time, there will be no privileges.”

“Sure, sure,” Caleb puffed out his cheeks and turned. “Someone’s on a mission.”

I followed his gaze and saw Genevieve storming toward us. Could I just have one day without her drama?

“Alexander, I’ve been looking for you,” she said, though her eyes were locked on Caleb.

“Not now, Genevieve.”

“I’ve been talking to some of the others,” she continued, ignoring him.

“Of course you have.”

“They’re worried about her shifting.” She pointed directly at me.

Caleb snorted.

“I’m sorry, I don’t believe we’ve met,” Genevieve said with a fake smile, using her arms to push her chest up. She pretended to trip, bumping into me. Caleb caught her.

“You can call me Caleb.”

As she stood, I thought I saw something glint in her hand. But no one reacted. Maybe I imagined it.

“Are you a guest here?” She twirled her hair like a schoolgirl.

“You could say that.”

She giggled. Could she not see we looked alike? Or was this some twisted revenge because Alexander rejected her? Was she trying to make him jealous?

Her grey eyes flicked to me. A sinister smile touched her lips before she turned back to Caleb.

“How about you and I get something to eat?” She batted her eyelashes.

“I’m sorry, but you can’t give me what I want.”

Her mouth fell open. “You don’t even know me.”

“It’s obvious who you are. The bitter ex, right? You saw a chance to annoy Athena, and it failed.”

“You have no idea what you’re missing!” Genevieve snapped, fists clenched.

“Oh, I do. And it’s not worth it.”

“BASTARD!”

“Genevieve.” Alpha Alexander stepped between them. “You said you spoke to others.”

Her eyes narrowed at me. “We want to know when she’s going to shift. We want to know if you’re putting us all in danger!”

“Who is ‘we’?”

“You mean just you, Genevieve.”

Alexander sighed. He pulled me against him, his arm draped over my shoulders. “Genevieve, you may have saved my life once, but you’re running out of favors.”

“I’m only asking a question!” she spluttered.

His voice dropped to a commanding tone. “You are questioning my authority.”

“No!” She was furious, not getting her way. It made me wonder how much she’d been allowed to get away with all these years.

For a second, I wished she could live the life I had. Maybe then she wouldn’t be such a bitch.
###Chapter 0078

She never gets what she wants.

I insist he gets one far from mine.

We need a plan.
Dominic and Victoria must be hunted down and eliminated.
I won’t let them find my mate or force someone to impregnate her.

Questioning how cruel she can be.

Damn right.

Finally, we agree on something.

###Chapter 0079

ISABELLA! I linked my sister, demanding her immediate presence. She arrived within minutes and rushed to Athena’s side.

I forced her mouth open. I smelled the blood before I saw it. Her mouth began filling with it. If I hadn’t leaned her forward, she would have choked.
“Shit, shit, shit. What did she eat?” Isabella muttered as she continued searching Athena’s arms.

I lifted Athena, keeping her on her side to prevent choking. There were many things we could heal from. Suffocation wasn’t one of them.

Isabella quickly extracted fluid from the bump. Clear liquid mixed with a small amount of blood. “Is that what I think it is?”
“Wolfsbane Toxin.”
###Chapter 0080
Alexander

“Damn it, damn it, damn it!” Isabella panics, desperately rummaging through cabinets, pulling out various small containers, searching frantically.

It had been years since I witnessed Isabella break down like this. The raw fear, the panic, the terrifying unknown. She hadn’t reacted this severely when Gabriel rejected her. In truth, she hadn’t been this distraught since our parents’ tragic deaths.

“Isabella, stop this!”

“No, it’s here somewhere, we still have time!”

Athena’s racing heartbeat had slowed dramatically. It was barely detectable now, her breaths becoming dangerously shallow. She was suffering excruciating pain, blood now seeping from the corners of her eyes.

Her heart stops completely.

I stare at my sister in disbelief. An antidote was unheard of, especially for Wolfsbane Toxin. If such a thing existed, every Wolf pack would keep it stocked.

‘Listen.’ Titan murmurs.

Her heart gradually begins beating again. Faint, but undoubtedly beating. Athena’s lungs start filling properly as she draws in oxygen. She coughs weakly, bringing up less blood than before.

Isabella maintains her distance, too afraid to approach closer. “She needs complete rest now.” She mumbles, avoiding eye contact.

She was absolutely right, I had told her that.

“Sebastian, Theodore. Damn!

“Genevieve, she saw us leaving the dungeons. She deliberately collided with Athena.

“No, well, only you now.” She gently combs Athena’s hair back, carefully wiping away the blood.

“Well that was her intention, wasn’t it? I might as well let her think her plan worked.”

“I assume you’re....”

“Absolutely. She won’t survive another night.”

Placing my hand against Athena’s forehead, I feel her fever subsiding. I desperately want to stay with her, but this cannot wait.

“Don’t allow anyone inside and absolutely do not speak to anyone.” I instruct Isabella.

Exiting the hospital, I mentally link several pack members as I cross the grounds to where Genevieve had conveniently intercepted us. There was nothing on the ground, nothing concealed in the snow, but she already knew dropping evidence would be a fatal mistake.
###Chapter 0081

I mind-link her to meet me.

She hesitates at first, which is unusual for her. But she appears moments later. She seems pleased by the blood stains on my shirt.

“I’ve been thinking about what you said.”

“Oh?” She flutters her eyelashes. “Have you realized she isn’t the one for you?”

“I’ve thought about many things since you returned.”

Her fingers immediately go to her hair, twisting a strand as she focuses on me. “I knew it, Alexander. I knew she wouldn’t be enough. I knew you only pitied her.”

The others growl at her. They dig their paws into the soil, crouching low, ready to attack.

She backs into the forest.

She runs as fast as she can. I hear her gasping as she moves. She doesn’t shift. She stays on two feet. She likely knows there’s no hope of escape.

I shift into my wolf. I pace before the others. They were chosen for this hunt because they’ll be on duty during the pack run, guarding Athena.

I give the signal.

They charge ahead of me, quickly picking up Genevieve’s scent. Their powerful legs cover the uneven ground. They turn swiftly when her scent changes direction.

I can still hear her. I already know she won’t get far.

I’m quickly linked—she’s surrounded.

I hear her begging them as I approach.

Piece by piece. Titan growls.

Genevieve’s face is stained with tears. Mud clings to her blonde hair, suggesting she fell. Her eyes dart between us as she pleads for her life. It changes nothing. Her fate is sealed.

I give the wolves the signal.

They lunge at her like she’s prey. Her screams fill the forest as they tear flesh from bone. Her cries soon fall silent. Her heart stops. Her eyes remain wide open as they continue tearing her apart.

I hope in her final moments, she felt the pain she inflicted on Athena.
###Chapter 0082

Every slight movement of her muscles holds my complete focus.

She was not dead.

###Chapter 0083

Theodore reads to her. I watch for any reaction, any sign she hears him. There’s only the slightest twitch of her fingers now and then. But it seems to calm her. Her mind feels less chaotic.

“He went to check on his men. Today… changed his perspective.”
