"What's wrong with me? I feel so hot... and sick... I want my mom. I promised I'd be home for dinner." Fat tears rolled down her cheeks, which she swiped away angrily.

'She doesn't know.' Nyx realized. 'She has no idea what's been done to her.'

"Can someone take me home?" She continued weeping.

"Not possible right now." Sebastian said gently. "It isn't safe for you."

She whimpered as Alexander gestured for me to follow him outside.

"What do you want to do?" He asked.

"Me?"

He nodded. "The girl has no idea what she is or where she is."

"Why would they do this? Why would Victoria do this?"

"They're targeting your compassion. The men didn't work, so they're trying a different approach."

"I hate them." My hands clenched into fists as I closed my eyes. "They ruined my life, and now they've destroyed this girl's too. She'll never go home again. Never see her family or friends."

"Do you believe her story?"

"I can smell her fear."
###Chapter 0098
Alexander

Fury burned deep within her soul.
Athena had endured so much, yet this level of rage was new.
It was strange, yet captivating, to witness the fire blazing in her eyes, all ignited by this one girl.

She leaned heavily against the wall of Sebastian's house.
Her head tilted back, staring blankly at the clear blue sky.
Her body slid down the rough surface until she landed on the grass.
So much anger consumed her, and she had no outlet for it.
No idea how to direct it.

“Sophia will be fine.” I muttered softly.
I would never throw a child onto the streets.
A child who has no concept of what she will become.
Returning her to her family was not an option.
Her first shift will be pure terror.
It would be a fucking miracle if she didn’t kill them all.

“Right.” Athena murmured, her voice low.
Her eyes were nearly solid black.

“Someone within the pack will take her in. I won’t abandon her.”

“This won’t be the last. Will it?” She looked up at me, her gaze intense.
“He will change more kids. He will send them all our way.”
She shook her head slowly.
“I knew he was evil. But this? This is sick. This is...” Her words faded, thoughts too jumbled to continue.

“What he did to you was monstrous too, Athena.”

She quickly brushed her cheeks, wiping away tears that hadn't even fully formed.

“I want him dead, Alpha Alexander. I want every single one of them dead.”

“I know. And I am working on it.”

‘His death must be slow.’ Titan mused darkly. ‘He must feel every ounce of pain he has inflicted. Athena deserves her vengeance.’

The door swung open suddenly.
“Guys. I really need your help in here.”

I offered my hand to Athena.
She hesitated for a moment before finally taking it and pulling herself up.
I noticed her eyes were shifting back to their usual blue.

Inside, Sophia was sobbing uncontrollably.
Her fingers clawed at her own skin, tracing the fresh mark on her neck.
“What... what did they do to me?”

Athena froze.
Sophia's words were likely an echo of her own past, spoken repeatedly in her mind.
Hearing them from someone else must have triggered painful memories.

“Sophia, come sit down. We need to talk.” I kept my tone gentle and warm.
Her soft blue eyes met mine, and I saw her swallow hard.

“Please, sir, I just want to go home. To my mum and dad. To my little sister. Please? I won’t tell them anything. I won’t...” Her fingers dug harder into her neck.

“We can explain everything to you.” I offered, maintaining my calm to avoid frightening her further.

Her eyes searched my face desperately.
More tears streamed down her cheeks.
Sebastian handed her a tissue, but she just stood there, staring, making no attempt to dry her tears.
“I’m not... I’m not going home, am I?”

“I’m afraid it’s not that simple.”

She wiped sweat from her hairline with a trembling hand.
Sebastian quietly gestured toward an empty chair at the table.
She moved slowly, tucking strands of her red hair behind her ears.
“Please, please don’t hurt me.”

“I’m going to tell you something you probably won’t believe. All I ask is that you try to keep an open mind.”

“Your eyes are so weird.” She wiped her nose, trying to steady her racing heart.

Crimson eyes would indeed be strange to a human.

“The bite on your neck was from a Lycan.” There was no point in avoiding the truth.

She closed her eyes, shaking her head in denial.
“Like... like the stories.”

“Stories?”

She took the glass of water Sebastian offered and drank it slowly, draining it completely.
“Stories in the library,” she murmured, placing the empty glass back down.

How was it possible that a human library held more tales about Lycans than we did?

“Was I hunted? Was I chosen? Why me? I’m nobody. I barely get by at school. They all hate me because... well, just because.”

Fifteen-year-old girls were complicated.
She had completely missed the point I was trying to make.
I definitely did not miss being fifteen.

"I don't have all the answers right now. But I am searching for them."

"So," she sighed heavily. "what you're telling me is that you are a Lycan?”

“I am not a Lycan.”

“OMG you’re a fucking Vampire.” Her chair screeched as she jumped to her feet.
She held her fingers in a cross, as if that would save her.
“The eyes. I should have known.” She screeched in pure panic.
###Chapter 0099

I see Athena trying to hold back a laugh.

“I am not a Vampire,” I mutter, annoyed. “I am a Wolf, and you are a Lycan.”

Her mouth falls open. She shakes her head slowly.

“No… that can’t be right.” Her soft blue eyes dart toward Athena. “Please help me.”

Her voice comes out high and shaky.

“I’m a Lycan too,” Athena whispers, holding Sophia’s gaze.

“Your name is Athena, isn’t it?” Sophia asks, sinking back into her seat. “You’re the one they sent me to.”

“Yes.”

“Did you do this to me?” The girl doesn’t hesitate to ask.

“No. But I can help you.” Athena glances at me, sadness clouding her features. “The people who did this to you… they hurt me too. The only difference is, I was born like this. They forced this life onto you. That’s why you can’t go back to your family, Sophia. You might hurt them in ways you can’t even imagine. And trust me—you can’t control it. It happens when you least expect it.”

She’s talking about Caleb. How she killed him.

“But…”

Athena reaches across the table and takes Sophia’s hands. “This is something I know for sure, Sophia. We can keep you safe here. We’ll figure it out together. And I will personally make them pay for what they did to you.”

Sophia pulls her hands back and runs them through her red hair. “I’ll never see my family again?”

Athena looks at me. Her brow furrows. She sighs before turning back to Sophia. “No.”

Tears stream down faster now. Sobs shake her shoulders. I feel for her. Fifteen years old, thrown into a world she never knew existed. Victoria and Dominic are twisted. Far more than I am, and that’s saying something.

Sophia stays with Sebastian. It’s the first house she was brought to, and we think it makes her feel somewhat safe. Plus, his boys will be home soon. Knowing Sebastian is a father might comfort her even more.

“Is this what’s going to keep happening?” Athena asks as we walk across the grounds. “Young, innocent kids.”

“Probably.”

“I hate them,” she mutters.

“I know. What is Nyx saying about all this?”

Athena bites the inside of her cheek. Her eyes avoid mine.

“Athena?”

“She isn’t talking much.”

“But she’s been close to the surface. I saw it tonight, when anger took over.”

I try not to read her mind, but when she bends down to untie her shoelaces just to buy time, I give in.

“Can you really do that?” I snap, frustrated she kept something this important from me.

She looks up, a pink blush spreading across her skin. “I don’t know. Nyx thinks I can, but…”

“It would mean accepting your Alpha position,” I finish for her.

She frowns. No matter how many times it comes up, she always tries to change the subject.

“Even if I can, do you really think it will change anything? Victoria and Dominic have a whole pack behind them.”

“There’s only one way to find out. You have to accept who you are. Then we’ll see if you can link them all.”

Her eyes widen. She nibbles on her bottom lip. “I don’t want to be an Alpha.” It’s the one thing she’s always been sure of. She’s made that clear.

“What if it’s temporary?”

“I don’t follow.”

“Once they’re all dead, you won’t need to be an Alpha. You can exist just as you are now. As my mate. One day, as the mother of my pups. You can leave that world behind. Let the breed end with you, if that’s what you want.”

“And Sophia? You won’t kill her?” she whispers, warming to the idea.

“You and Sophia,” I confirm. “And any other children.”

She puffs out her cheeks. “What… what do I need to do?”
###Chapter 0100
Athena

His fingers closed around my elbow, pulling me inside the house.
Those crimson eyes searched mine, probing for any sign of hesitation.
I wasn't even sure myself if I was prepared for this.
But action had to be taken.
The situation had escalated beyond control.
Everything was spiraling, and now children were being turned.

"Beta Sebastian needs to warn Sophia." I mumbled as Alpha Alexander guided me toward the office.
"If this works, she'll be able to hear me too. It'll terrify her."
I'm twenty-two years old and still get unnerved hearing Alpha Alexander's voice in my head.
Nyx's presence is even more unsettling.

"I've already informed him. He's speaking with her right now."
I still couldn't see how this would help.
If anything, it seemed like it would only provoke them further.

He directed me to the chair, his voice firm but calm.
I could see the doubt in his eyes now.
He knew there was a strong possibility this might fail.

'Accept the role.' Nyx whispered in my mind.

'Will it actually work?'

'We won't know until you try.'

'Fine! I accept it!' I just wanted this over with.
I wanted their heads on spikes.
I wanted... My thoughts trailed off as I realized how dark they'd become.

'You'll need to do better than that.' Nyx's laughter echoed in my mind.

I looked up at Alpha Alexander.
He was watching me intently.
He once told me he could always tell when I was communicating with Nyx.

"You can do this. I'm right here with you." He gave me an encouraging smile.

"I accept." I muttered aloud.

Alpha Alexander shook his head slightly.
I understood what he meant - I needed to phrase it properly.

"I, Athena Harrison, accept the role of..." My voice faltered.
Could I truly go through with this?

'It's in our blood.' Nyx murmured softly.

I slumped back in the chair.
Caleb had been pushing relentlessly for me to reclaim my Alpha position.
To take control and lead Silver Creek.
He had insisted it was what they all needed.
Yet they all believed a woman shouldn't hold power.

"Continue." Alpha Alexander urged. "You have the strength for this."

"It's a trick." I whispered.

"Athena, you're panicking." His voice remained calm and steady.

"It was Caleb who revealed my identity to you.
He begged me to lead the Lycans.
To take command.
He claimed they needed me.
But he was working for Dominic all along."

I had been so foolish.
I never saw through his deception.

"You think this is what they want you to do?"

I swallowed the lump forming in my throat.
"They never wanted me to lead.
This is a trap.
This is exactly why Caleb was sent here."
Tears threatened to fall, but I blinked them back.
I felt incredibly stupid.

'Damn it!' Nyx snapped. 'That's been their plan all along.'
She was furious for not realizing it sooner.
Her restless pacing in my mind wasn't helping.
She hadn't been present until the very end.
She missed many of our conversations.

"His strategy is more sophisticated than we anticipated." Alpha Alexander muttered.
He circled the desk, scratching thoughtfully at his stubble.
He paused, leaning heavily on the table with his knuckles.
"What if you accept the role anyway?"

"I don't... I don't understand."

"As an Alpha, I can block out my pack's voices.
I choose who to listen to, who to link with.
The plan was for you to connect with all of them.
What if you start isolating them instead?
One at a time.
Getting inside their minds to gather the intelligence we need?"

"And what if it fails?"

'He's right.' Nyx murmured. 'I can assist with the blocking.'

Alpha Alexander stared at me, waiting for my response.

I sighed deeply, knowing neither of them would like my answer.
"We find another solution."

"Athena..." Alpha Alexander began.

"I never wanted this, Alpha Alexander.
Maybe if I'd been raised differently, things would be different.
But this... I don't want to lead them.
I don't want them using this as leverage to drag me back.
And I absolutely refuse to let them plant their damned seed in me!"
I was practically shouting by the end, which is something I rarely do.

"A..."

"Don't!" I snapped, storming out of the office.
Fury coursed through me, and thankfully Nyx remained silent.

I trudged toward the hospital, hoping Isabella would be there.
I needed someone else to talk to, or perhaps just some silence.

"Hey." She muttered without looking up from her work.
"Alexander mentioned you might come this way.
What did he do? He was being very cryptic in the link."

"He wants me to accept my role."

"As Luna?"

I hadn't even considered that possibility.
"No. As Alpha."

Her dark eyes snapped up, locking with mine.

She pressed her lips together and moved around the station she'd been leaning against.
"There must be a reason for this."

I filled her in on the conversation with Alpha Alexander and told her about the girl.

"I heard about the girl.
Sebastian is bringing her by later.
Thought it would be good for me to examine her."
###Chapter 0101

“What now?” I whispered, still accustomed to others having the solutions.

Isabella chuckled softly. “Athena, since your arrival, I’ve watched your confidence grow day by day. You couldn’t even step into the snow back then.”

She reminded me of the man I’d killed recently.

Then she pointed out I’d journeyed alone from the pack house to here.

Her gaze held mine. “You don’t need my answers. You already know what to do.”

My shoulders slumped. “Can we really solve this?”

“My brother has never been stopped by anything.” Her voice was firm. “If your mind is set, he’ll find a way. And Julian… he’s a master of strategy. His advice could be valuable.”

I hesitated. “Alpha Alexander forbade me from being alone with him.”

She smiled, gesturing around the empty hospital. “I’ll accompany you.”

She quickly located his whereabouts and scribbled a note, instructing others to link her if needed, then stuck it to the table.

“Where is he?” I asked, recalling he’d left during our meeting at Beta Sebastian’s home with Sophia.

“On duty.”

Venturing into the forest without Alpha Alexander’s permission was definitely against the rules.

We moved silently into the woods. Isabella ensured we avoided the boundaries, guiding us deep into the darkest parts. I’d asked Nyx to block Alpha Alexander from my thoughts temporarily, just so I could think clearly.

Scents mingled among the trees, making it hard to distinguish individuals. The guards rotated constantly to stay alert and confuse any intruders.

“Does Alexander know you’re this far out?” Julian’s voice came from above as he dropped from a tree, landing before us.

“Why were you up there?” Isabella snapped.

“Taking a page from Caleb’s book, if that was even his real name.” His dark eyes fixed on me, sending a shiver down my spine. I was relieved not to be alone with him. “You wanted to speak to me?” He scanned the area quickly.

“Have you… found a way to handle them?”

“Almost. Do you have information that could help?”

Nyx whispered a warning in my mind.

“I just want this to end.” I noticed Isabella giving me a strange look, but she remained silent.

“You came all this way to ask that?” He raised an eyebrow. “My people are exhausted, working tirelessly to keep everyone safe. They’re starting to make mistakes.”

“Mistakes?” Isabella questioned.

“It’s been dealt with.” His glance at me suggested punishments had been carried out.

“I never asked for any of this.”

He placed his hands on my shoulders, and every muscle in my body tensed. “Are you seeking trouble, Athena?”

He turned me toward the direction we’d come from. “Return to the house.”

“If I accept my Alpha position, will that help?” The words spilled out.

His hands dropped, and he moved in front of me, frowning deeply. “I thought you didn’t want that?”

“I told Alpha Alexander I believe it’s what they expect.” I sighed, glancing at Isabella, who nodded encouragement. “I think it’s a trap. Caleb was supposed to persuade me to accept. I think…” I groaned. “Alpha Alexander believes I should link them one by one.”

“No.”

His immediate, firm response startled me.

“No, that’s not what they expect? Or no, Alexander is wrong?” Isabella asked.

“Both.” He winked at me.

“I don’t understand.”

“Caleb got inside your head, Athena. He was testing how far you’d go to ignore your Alpha blood. It was a game. I’ve seen it before. You’re unique. They know it, and we know it too.”

“You think she should accept her role?” Isabella pressed.

“That’s not my decision. But if she does, it could work to our advantage.”

“You want me to link them?”

“No. That would enrage Victoria. It’ll draw her and the others out. Like it or not, they’ll recognize who the true Alpha is. That’s what counts. No linking necessary.”

“Plan B,” Isabella murmured.

“Plan B,” Julian confirmed.

He’d been hoping for this all along. “What… what is Plan B?”

Julian smiled at me. “You.”

###Chapter 0103
Athena

My gaze darted between Julian and Isabella.

They had been anticipating this moment.

Waiting specifically for me.

Was Alpha Alexander part of this scheme?

“This… this was your strategy from the beginning?”

“A contingency plan. Alexander made it clear you were resistant, so it became our secondary option.” Julian remarked casually. “And don’t jump to conclusions. We aren’t literally using you as live bait.”

“It’s about the perception of your control.” Isabella added quietly. “We understand you don’t desire it. We know you want no connection to them. But they remain unaware. From their perspective, you embracing your position implies you welcome it.”

“Right!” It irritated me that Julian and Isabella had already debated this as a viable tactic.

Isabella seized my wrists, her dark eyes locking onto mine. “They aren’t solely coming for you. They will eliminate us to reach you. Our pack, as fierce as we are, isn’t prepared to die.”

“Isabella!” Julian snapped sharply.

She released my wrists, turning toward her brother. “I’m merely stating we’ve sacrificed greatly for her. She could at least do this for us.”

“That isn’t your decision to make!” Julian warned his sister, his tone severe. “Alexander will execute whatever is necessary to protect her. We can only present her with choices.”

Isabella frowned, and I suddenly understood her outburst wasn’t born from anger. It was pure panic, a deep fear that the Lycans would devastate the pack she cherished.

A rustle sounded from the trees. All three of us instantly turned toward the noise.

A massive Lycan burst through the bushes, charging directly at us. It was the largest we had encountered, standing well over eight feet tall. Its heavily muscled arms stretched out as it lunged forward.

Its focus was entirely on me. Drool dripped from its razor-sharp teeth. Claws were raised, poised to strike. It showed no concern for the others present. Each footfall hit the ground with such force the earth vibrated beneath me.

White-hot rage surged through my veins.

Julian shoved me backward, shifting instantly into a powerful black wolf. He launched himself at the Lycan.

The Lycan swatted him aside effortlessly, sending Julian crashing into a tree trunk as if he were weightless.

“Shift!” I screamed at Nyx. I was defenseless in this form. I knew shifting was the only way to protect both myself and Isabella.

Nyx reacted without delay. She forced the transformation forward.

The pain was excruciating, but thankfully brief. My bones stretched and my body reconfigured. My clothing tore away, falling to the ground in shreds.

The Lycan skidded to a halt directly in front of me.

At that exact moment, my claws plunged deep into its chest.

It glanced down at the claws embedded in its body. Unlike when I killed Caleb, I could distinctly feel the heart pulsating against my grasp. I felt my claws slide into the organ smoothly, steadily.

The heart raced frantically, fighting to continue beating.

I did not retract my claws.

I watched life fade from the beast’s eyes, like a light slowly dimming to darkness.

A thrill of satisfaction fluttered through me.

One by one, I withdrew my claws from the Lycan’s chest.

It collapsed backward, hitting the forest floor with a heavy, final thud.

No pieces of heart remained on my claws this time. I felt a flicker of disappointment.

“Athena? Athena, are you okay?” Isabella stood staring up at me. The height difference almost made me laugh; she was usually taller.

I nodded, feeling the familiar surge of pain return. My claws retracted. My limbs shortened until I stood completely naked amidst the trees.

“Crap.” Isabella swiftly removed her jacket and wrapped it around me. It covered very little, but at least I wasn’t fully exposed.

She hurried over to Julian, who hadn’t moved since impacting the tree.

“Is he… is he dead?” I whispered, dread filling me.

“No, but his back might be broken. That’s why he’s still unconscious. It takes hours to heal. I need to link Alexander immediately.”

I nodded, my attention returning to the dead Lycan. Aside from the five small red marks on its chest, it appeared to be merely sleeping.

‘He will not wake.’ Nyx murmured. ‘The heart is pierced. Blood is slowly leaking into the cavity.’ She let out a soft, dark laugh. I fought hard not to laugh with her.
###Chapter 0104

I was terrified of shifting.
Scared of becoming that monster who attacked the pack.
But standing here over the dead Lycan, I realized something.
It felt liberating.

Footsteps rushed toward us.
Alpha Alexander appeared with Theodore.
Their eyes instantly landed on the dead Lycan.
Neither spoke as their gazes shifted to me, taking in the fact I wore only a jacket.

“You shifted?” Theodore asked softly. “Completely?”
I remained motionless.

“She did,” Isabella exclaimed. “She shifted and killed him without a second thought.”

“Julian?” Alpha Alexander asked, his eyes briefly leaving mine to check on his unconscious brother.
Isabella repeated everything she had told me.

“Theodore, help Isabella get him to the hospital.”
Once they were gone, he removed his own shirt and replaced the jacket Isabella had given me.
His was longer, reaching mid-thigh.

His finger lifted my chin, tilting my face toward his. “You enjoyed it, didn’t you?”

I didn’t want to admit it.
I didn’t want to tell him how powerful I had felt.
I didn’t want to confess that I’d kill that Lycan a thousand times over if it brought me that same rush.
I didn’t want to speak the truth.

His lips brushed my cheek, his warm minty breath grazing my skin. “You don’t have to say it. I can read your thoughts.”

He stepped back and grabbed the Lycan by its ankles, dragging it across the ground into the trees.

“Where... where are you taking him?”
“I need to dispose of him. I won’t allow them to litter my territory.”

I followed him to a clearing where Alpha Alexander quickly set the body ablaze.
It burned fast.
The smell of burning flesh saturated the air.

Alpha Alexander moved away from the flames and stood behind me.
His arms wrapped around my waist, his lips finding the mark on my neck.

“How many more will come, Alpha Alexander?” I whispered as thick smoke darkened the sky.

“I think it’s time you stopped calling me that, don’t you? You’ve more than earned your place here.”

Dropping the ‘Alpha’ felt wrong.
For years, I was conditioned to respect those in power.
Disrespect meant punishment.
I only stopped using titles for Dominic and Marcus because I was ordered to.

“You are my equal,” he murmured near my ear. “You are an Alpha.”

He turned me to face him, his hand pressing against the small of my back as he held me close.
His crimson eyes searched mine.

“You... you didn’t answer my question,” I said, avoiding his name intentionally. He noticed.

His lips curved. “Because there is no answer.”

“You’re... waiting for me?” I sighed, wrinkling my nose as the stench of burning flesh intensified.

“Yes.”

“Why didn’t you tell me I was part of the plan? That you’re relying on me?”

‘Because he thinks we can’t handle it!’ Nyx snapped.

“I wanted you to be ready,” Alpha Alexander murmured.
He tucked a strand of my hair behind my ear. “As much as I adore this darkness in you, you must be prepared. We don’t know what they’ll throw at us.”

I stared at him, feeling the heat of the fire behind me.
Maybe this was the only way.

‘I will always have your back,’ Nyx whispered.

I pushed Alpha Alexander back as I stepped away. “I, Athena Harrison, accept my position as Alpha of the Lycans of Silver Creek.”

A current shot through my body.
It surged from my toes to my fingertips.
It wasn’t painful like shifting used to be.
It felt electric, coursing through my veins.
It felt powerful.
For one brief moment, I felt unstoppable.
It belongs to me.

My heart beat so loudly it made my body vibrate.
Voices echoed in my head.
Sounds of anger and annoyance, all shouting at me.
Nyx worked hard to shut them down, blocking each one until I heard a familiar voice.

It belongs to me.

“We are coming for you.”
###Chapter 0105
Athena

Dominic's voice hadn't echoed in my mind since we returned to Silver Creek.
Hearing it now sent an icy tremor down my spine.
My body shook involuntarily.
His words had always been instruments of fear.

"You hear them?" Alpha Alexander asked softly.
I nodded.
"Alp—" I stopped when he raised an eyebrow.
"Equals," he murmured. "You can't keep addressing everyone as Alpha or Beta anymore." His lips curved into a slight smile. "You've surpassed that. You're an Alpha now."

"D... Alexander," I stammered.
It felt strange and wrong to say his name without the title.
"Nyx is blocking them out. But Dominic broke through. They're coming."
I turned back toward the body consumed by flames.
The bones were nearly bare.
A dark thought crept into my mind—doing the same to Dominic and Victoria.
I wanted them to feel every ounce of pain I had endured.
Burning them alive seemed fitting.

I wasn’t that timid girl anymore.

Alexander was listening to my thoughts, as he always did when I grew quiet.
His hand caught mine.
His fingers interlaced with mine, locking us together.
He leaned close. "As much as I want to take you right now, we need to go prepare."

He seemed drawn to this new, darker side of me.

Alexander pulled me swiftly through the forest.
His eyes scanned constantly, ensuring we avoided danger.

We broke through the trees into the main pack area.
Theodore was striding toward us.
His arms swung forcefully at his sides.

"Julian broke his back in two places. He'll be down for the rest of the day," he told Alexander as he halted.
His deep green eyes flickered toward me.
Did he know?

"Two places?" Alexander confirmed.
Theodore nodded.
His usual bun was undone, dark hair framing his face, making him look fierce.
"He'll be out for a while."

His gaze dropped to our joined hands.
"What's happening? Did you handle the body?"

Alexander nodded.
"They're coming. We don't know when, but it's imminent. Julian was right."

Theodore's green eyes fixed on me.
"You've accepted, haven't you? That's how you know they're coming."

I nodded slowly.
He didn't sound pleased. It felt almost like an accusation.

"What's wrong, Theodore?" Alexander questioned.

"Nothing. I'm just surprised, that's all."

"Surprised?"

"After everything that's happened, I didn't expect... this." He frowned. "I didn't expect it to happen."

'He's hiding something,' Nyx murmured.

I agreed. His shifting eyes gave him away.

"Just tell us!" Alexander snapped, losing patience.

Theodore sighed.
"The reason I came to find you before we were called to the forest... I managed to uncover more about the one who died during her third binding."

"And?"

"Maybe we should discuss this inside."

"Here is fine," Alexander snapped, annoyed by the delay.

Theodore glanced around, checking if we were alone.
I found myself doing the same.
His nervousness was contagious.

"They tried binding her after she became Alpha. That's what killed her. If they get their hands on you..."

"You think they'll bind me and it'll kill me?" I muttered.

'Nothing is ever simple, is it?' Nyx groaned.

Theodore let out a heavy sigh and nodded.

"That's not going to happen," Alexander stated, staring at Theodore. "Do you really think I'd let her out of my sight long enough for them to take her?"

Did he forget I left the house alone?
Or that Isabella and I went into the forest without him?
I kept my mouth shut. Now wasn't the time for stupid remarks.

"Well, no. It's just... There's talk about how foolish this Dominic is. What if it's an act? Caleb kept saying Dominic was stupid, that Victoria was pulling the strings. If you think about it, it's probably both of them. What if they want us to believe one is weaker than the other?"
###Chapter 0106

Alexander’s expression is dark, a scowl etched into his features. A dull ache begins to pulse behind my eyes.

“It makes you uneasy?” Alexander mutters, his voice low.

“Obviously it does.”

I glance at Theodore. He was tall and broad-shouldered, like most men here. Yet he was different. He preferred solitude, buried in books and research. I couldn’t recall ever seeing him train with the others.

There was a time I questioned Alexander about Theodore truly being a Wolf. He assured me Theodore joined every pack run. He had done so since joining Obsidian Howl.

“You were bullied.” The memory of what I’d been told surfaces. “You never knew when an attack was coming. That’s why this situation makes you nervous.”

His deep green eyes lock onto mine. I knew my words had struck a chord.

“I care about you, Athena. I don’t want to see any harm come to you.”

“I guess so."

“Are you like a millionaire? Like how deep are your pockets?”

I cock an eyebrow at her. She really wasn't afraid of asking questions.

“Right. Too personal, sorry.”

I led her down to the end of the hallway. “This will be your room. I called ahead already, there should be some clothes for you on the bed.”

“Thanks,” she whispers. She gasps as she steps into the bedroom. “This....this is bigger than the ground floor of my home. Thank you.”

“Sure,” I glance back down the hallway, towards my bedroom. Athena was stirring but something wasn’t right. “I just need to go check on Athena, will you be alright?”

Sophia nods her head at me as her eyes dart quickly around the room.

Heading to my bedroom, I find Athena sitting on the edge of the bed.

One hand gripped around one of the posts.

Sweat dripped down her face and I see she is fighting the urge to vomit.

"I don't feel good." she croaks.

"I think I've caught..." she gags and runs to the door where the toilet is.

Pulling her hair back from her face, I gently rub her back, waiting for her to be done.

She sits back against my legs and lets out a tired sigh.

“You are not sick. Besides, we heal from standard illnesses.”

She pauses for a second, taking in my words and slowly tips her head back to look at me. “You're saying...”

‘I am, I scented it this morning when you were still sleeping.”

Her eyebrows raise. “It worked?”

“Are you doubting my abilities?”

“No....my own. Isabella didn't say anything about throwing my guts up!”

Helping her to her feet, I guide her to the large chair by the window. “I’ve moved Sophia into the house.” I hoped it would take her mind off of how bad she was feeling.

“Oh...okay? She didn't leave.”

“No. I went to find Isabella. Her and Theodore had Sophia in one of the rooms at the hospital.”
###Chapter 0114

"Is she all right?"

"No. She shifted." I watch Athena's eyes widen. "Multiple times. She tried to harm herself. This isn't the first incident."

"What are you implying?"

"Her body is covered in scars. Old ones. From before her turning. Her arms and shoulders are marked with thin, silvery lines. She conceals them well, but her past holds more than she reveals. I intend to keep close watch. Perhaps you should spend time with her as well."

"Me?"

"She referred to herself as a monster."

I wait for Athena's response. She only gives a slow, understanding nod.

"She needs guidance. A role model. You could be like an older sister to her. Show her that our existence isn't entirely terrible."

"Not so heartless after all?" she murmurs while I move to fetch her a glass of water.

"Is that your perception?" I raise an eyebrow, handing her the glass.

She doesn't answer. Instead, she presses her lips to the rim. I catch the faint curve at the corners of her mouth, which she struggles to hide as she drinks.

"New arrivals are coming today." I remind her.

"At least I don't have to lie anymore." Her smile is tight, not reaching her eyes.

"No. But you should know—many won't want to be here."

"They're bound by contract?" Athena asks.

"Yes. And they won't hesitate to express their displeasure."

"Right." She sighs. "What exactly do the contracts stipulate?"

"They must protect any heir of mine. At any cost."

"And if they refuse?"

"Do you truly want that answer?"

Wrinkles form on her forehead. She opens her mouth to speak, but the words vanish as she bolts for the toilet. She shoves the glass into my stomach on her way.

I wait until she finishes. When she looks at me, her skin has taken on that same grey pallor from our first meeting. "Nyx suspects something is wrong."

"It's hormonal. I've witnessed it before." The grey tint concerns me, but I won't voice that. "If it eases your mind, we can visit Isabella."

"You're still here?" I mutter to Theodore as we enter the pack hospital.

"Assisting Isabella with the cleanup. Sophia left quite a mess." He flips through a cheap magazine Isabella insisted on buying.

"Where is Isabella?"

"Changing. She'll return shortly. Is everything alright?" His gaze settles on Athena. "You don't look—"

He stops when I shake my head. Before Athena can speak, Isabella bursts into the room.

"Theodore, head to the house. Sophia is in the end room down the hall. Keep an eye on her." I instruct.

"Of course."

"You're pregnant?" Isabella asks the moment Theodore leaves. "You must be. Otherwise, you wouldn't be here. Though I can't detect the changes yet."

"Just examine her."

"I've told you, Alexander. Nothing will appear until she's several weeks along. Even then, it'll be a tiny speck." She turns to Athena with a smile. "All I can advise is to increase your fluid intake if nausea persists."

"This isn't normal for a Wolf." The words slip out, fueled by Titan's urgency. I barely have time to think or push him back.

"She isn't a Wolf." Isabella snaps, crossing her arms. "I can perform a scan, but that's all for now. And I assure you, it will reveal nothing."

She guides Athena to a bed and retrieves a small machine. She moves the wand absently over Athena's abdomen. "Honestly, Alexander, I'm surprised you can detect anything. Most mates don't sense it until at least a month."

She halts abruptly, holding the wand in place. "Huh."

Panic flashes in my mate's eyes. "What does 'huh' mean?" Athena cries out.

Isabella adjusts a setting on the monitor. A heartbeat echoes through the room, followed by a second, distinct beat.

"Athena, you're further along. Approximately six weeks."

"I am?"

"You weren't aware?"

"No."

"What's wrong with the heartbeat?" I demand.

"Nothing. It's exactly what it sounds like when a mother is carrying twins."
###Chapter 0115

Athena

"Twins?"

"Yes." Isabella smiles. "Definitely." She presses the ultrasound wand firmly against my abdomen as I stare at the ceiling.

Alexander's fingers tighten around mine. His happiness radiates through our bond, vibrating against my skin.

Twins? I whisper to Nyx, hoping she understands my terror. I can barely care for myself, let alone two pups.

Look at him! She murmurs.

My gaze shifts to Alexander. He holds the monitor in his free hand while Isabella points out our developing pups. The widest grin spreads across his face, his crimson eyes glowing with pure joy.

He's thrilled. Nyx whispers. We have help.

How? My body has endured too much. I can't be six weeks. I try calculating dates, but everything blurs together since my first cycle.

Nyx remains silent.

Did you know?

No response.

Nyx?

The forest. She finally answers. Our pups develop faster.

Lycans? I'm carrying Lycans? Despite my own nature, I never wanted this connection.

It's too early to confirm. But there's every possibility—

"NO!" I scramble off the bed, yanking my hand from Alexander's grasp. Both Isabella and Alexander stare at me like I've lost my mind.

"Athena?" He reaches for my wrist but I pull away sharply.

"I need space!" My voice comes out harsher than intended as I push past them.

Nyx tries speaking to me.

"Quiet!"

Isabella's dark eyes widen as she glances between me and Alexander.

"Just... give me a moment." I mutter, backing out of the room.

"Athena?" Isabella calls after me. I hear Alexander telling her to let me go. To honor my request.

"Hey, everything alright?" Theodore asks as I burst through the doors onto the grounds.

"I need solitude. And I... thought you were with Sophia?"

"Sebastian's at the house."

"Right." I exhale sharply.

"Is solitude truly what you need?" He offers a gentle smile. "Perhaps you need someone to talk to? Or vent against? Someone who isn't your mate."

I narrow my eyes momentarily. "Have you uncovered more research?"

"About you, specifically?"

I nod.

"I have materials at the house. But I assume you're referring to the pregnancy?"

"You know?"

He shrugs. "It wasn't difficult to deduce. You arrived at the hospital without visible injuries. You merely seemed disoriented and Alexander maintained his composure."

"What do the texts say?"

"Honestly, very little."

I sigh internally, disappointed by the lack of information.

"What does your Lycan say about it?" He probes.

"That the pups develop quicker."

"You're concerned the pup might be Lycan?"

"Worse, that both will be."

He pauses, processing my revelation about twins. His eyes widen with understanding.

"I have Dominic and Victoria hunting me with unknown numbers of Lycans. Alexander will have guests arriving and... and..."

"It's overwhelming?"

I nod, closing my eyes against threatening tears.

"After everything those monsters did to me, they deserve death. But now I might bring more of their kind into this world."

"That frightens you?"

I nod again.

"They'll be raised by you." He offers another small smile. "That means everything."

His words should comfort me, but they only plant more doubt.

Raised by me? It feels like a cruel joke.

I spot Sebastian emerging from the pack house, his hands firmly on Sophia's shoulders. He scans the area briefly before pushing her toward us upon spotting me.

Her eyes remain downcast as they stop before us. I'm too focused on Sophia's butchered hair to hear the men's conversation. She'd taken scissors to it, hacking it unevenly.

Her eyes meet mine. "I couldn't wash the blood out."

I start to offer to fix it—I'd learned to cut my own hair over the years—but Sebastian interrupts to announce Alexander's guests have arrived.

Alexander bursts from the hospital with explosive force. The door slams against the brick wall, making Sophia jump. Her hand grabs mine instantly. I can hear her heart pounding so violently it creates a humming vibration.
###Chapter 0116

“Take her to the house.” Alexander commands.

Every gaze locks onto me, waiting for me to obey and lead Sophia back to the house. But something fierce and defiant flared within me, a raw need to disregard his instructions. I wanted to hear what these visitors truly thought of me. I needed to see the disgust in their eyes. I refused to be hidden away like some shameful secret.

“No.” The word slips from my lips before I can stop it. Alexander simply stares, his expression unreadable. Could he hear my thoughts?

“Sophia, go to the house.”

Her grip on my arm tightens, her nails biting into my skin. She was terrified of being left alone.

“No!” I don’t know where this sudden boldness came from. Surely it wasn't the hormones already?

His crimson eyes darken dangerously. A soft whimper escapes Sophia as she shrinks further behind me.

“If we delay this, they’ll only grow more suspicious. You did.”

“This is different.”

“Is it?”

“It’s too late now anyway.” Theodore murmurs softly.

I look up to see a group of Alexander’s men leading six other Alphas toward us. Julian is at the front, speaking quietly with one of them.

They were all massive, just like the men here. Each radiated a powerful aura. Not as overwhelming as Alexander’s, but potent enough. It makes Sophia tremble. I immediately regret not sending her away. She wasn't ready for this.

“Well Alexander, we’ve arrived!” the first one states. His dark grey eyes find me, and if I weren't fighting the urge to vomit, I’d meet his stare head-on.

“Ethan.” I hear Alexander greet him just as my stomach rebels again.

“Some of us doubted your claim. Especially given how long you’ve been trying for an heir. But now, it’s rather obvious.”

I already despised his tone. There was no friendship here, only a business arrangement. Contracts were the sole reason for their presence.

“Well,” I snap, cutting him off. “Then you’ll be thrilled to hear he’s having twins.”

Definitely the hormones. Nyx muses internally at my bluntness. I catch Julian’s smirk.

“You must be the mate.” Ethan raises an eyebrow at me. I notice the others remain silent. Why was he the only one speaking?

“This is Athena.” Alexander introduces me.

Ethan extends a hand. I don’t take it. He laughs, a deep, grating sound that makes me tense. I feel Sophia flinch. She was probably regretting not leaving the pack with the others when she had the chance.

“Suspicious. A refreshing change.” His tongue flicks over a sharp canine as he studies me.

What did that mean?

“This one hasn’t tried running yet?”

He knew about the others. How long had he known Alexander?

“No. And she won’t.” Alexander replies, his voice firm.

“We shall see.” Ethan smirks directly at me.

“It would be far easier to protect you if you refrain from running off.” He shifts his gaze back to Alexander. “Now, explain the situation. Your message was cryptic. We all have the same question.”

We move into the house, gathering around the large dining table that had gone unused since my arrival. Alexander takes the head seat and mentally directs me to sit at his left. The men settle in. I notice Sophia seize the moment to slip away to her bedroom. Perhaps that was for the best.

Alexander begins to speak. He tells them nearly everything, omitting only the truth of what I am and how they are turning people.

“Why the fuck would you need our help?” Ethan pushes his chair back from the table abruptly. “Your pack is enormous compared to ours.”

Alexander looks at me and gives a slight nod.

‘I’m… I’m not a Wolf.’ The words stumble out.

Every eye in the room instantly focuses on me.

The only blonde-haired man among them, whom Alexander had called Nathan, speaks. “You smell like a Wolf.”

I meet his gaze. “I know.” I whisper.

“What are you?” Ethan demands, his voice sharp.

“The last Lycan Alpha.”
###Chapter 0117
Alexander

Hearing her finally declare her identity was deeply satisfying.
I couldn't tell if her growing confidence came from the pups or if Ethan had simply pushed her too far.
Either way, it no longer mattered.

“A Lycan Alpha?” Nathan questioned, his expression baffled. “What in hell is a Lycan?”
He glanced around at the other men, who looked equally confused.
Except for Ethan.
Ethan’s gaze was locked on my mate.
He watched her with the same predatory hunger Julian once had.
A hunger to consume her entirely.

He can try.’ Titan growled low in my mind.
I remained silent, much to Titan’s irritation.
I wanted to drive Ethan into the ground, but that could wait.

“I am a monster.” A dark smile touched Athena’s lips.
Her eyes had darkened, the blue nearly swallowed by black.
Nyx was hovering close to the surface.

“And you’re running from your pack?” Ethan directed his question at my mate.

“As I’ve already explained, no, she is not.” I cut in sharply.
I had expected more questions about her being a Lycan.

He gave a slow nod. “So you’re the reason humans are turning up with bite marks.”
Ethan rubbed a hand over the stubble on his chin.

“What are you talking about, Ethan?” Nathan asked, frowning.

Before Ethan could answer, my mate snapped. “I am not biting anyone!”

I held a hand up to Athena, turning fully toward Ethan. “You’ve seen this?”

“Yes.”

“You’ve seen them shift?”

“That, I haven’t witnessed. When they started appearing in the city, we handled them before the situation escalated.”

“Your pack is in the city?” Athena asked, sounding confused.

“Next city over. Crestwood City.” Ethan muttered, as if she should have known. “My pack is more urban than you forest dwellers in Obsidian Howl.”

I rolled my eyes. His way wasn't everyone's way.

“When you say you ‘handle’ them, you mean…?” Athena’s voice was quiet.
The black in her eyes receded, blue returning.

“We kill them.”

“You didn’t think to tell me, Ethan?” Nathan snapped at his brother.

“You weren’t anywhere near the situation. You married and took a pack hundreds of miles away. We may be brothers, but we haven’t been close in over a decade.”

My fist slammed onto the table. “Whatever history you two have, set it aside. You all signed a contract with me. I held up my end when you needed me.”
The wood splintered under my hand.
“Now it’s your turn.”

“There’s nothing about Lycans in that contract.” Nathan murmured.

“You’re right, there isn’t. But it does state that you will protect my heirs with your lives if they are threatened.”

“They aren’t even born yet!” Nathan grumbled.

“From the day of conception,” Ethan rolled his eyes at his brother. “We are contractually bound. Or are you prepared to tell your wife you just handed your pack over?” Ethan challenged.

All eyes turned to my mate.
Her head was bowed.
I saw her taking slow, deep breaths, fighting back another wave of nausea.

I don't like how pale she looks.’ Titan warned me.

“Athena, go rest.” I told her firmly.

“I have questions!” Ethan snapped.

“And if all my attention is on my mate, I cannot answer them!”

Athena practically fled the room.
Whether to escape the meeting or to be sick, I wasn’t sure.
But this way, Ethan couldn't keep ogling her.

Every eye in the room was on me.

“Go on, ask!” I challenged, knowing the one question burning on all their tongues.

“What are they?” Nathan asked.

“It’s too early to tell.” I answered casually.

“What if they are like her?” another Alpha asked.

“They are still my heirs.” I knew it was likely.
She was developing faster than any Wolf.
But I also knew the fear of them being Lycans plagued my mate’s thoughts.
She hated the idea.
She wanted the Lycan line to end.

Julian and Sebastian were quiet, listening intently to every word.
Until Julian finally spoke.

“We didn’t call you here to debate the pups' heritage. You are here to uphold your end of the contract. Nothing more.”

“And when this is over, the contract is complete?” Ethan asked. “We are free?”

Their lives won't be worth living if anything happens to our pups!’ Titan snarled.

I was doing this to keep my mate and my heirs safe.

“Yes.” I agreed. “The contract will be completed.”

The Alphas exchanged looks.
Finally, they all nodded in agreement.
They all wanted the same thing—to be free of their debt to me.
###Chapter 0118

“Explain it to me.” Ethan demanded, his gaze fixed on Athena. “You’re the true Alpha of Silver Creek. So why won’t they submit? I can feel your power. It’s immense.”

The allied Alphas had been here two days, and this topic kept resurfacing. Especially with Ethan. He was fascinated by the concept of a female Alpha. He always found a way to linger nearby, asking the same questions, hoping for new answers.

“They don’t believe a female can lead.” Athena replied, her patience thinning.

“Yet they’re desperate to claim you.” He leaned against the wall, studying her. “They’re creating unstable, arrogant pups who can’t control themselves, just to get to you.”

She rested her forehead on the desk, exhausted. “They want me because I can produce more Lycan Alphas for them.”

“The two leading this campaign—the male is her uncle.” I interjected. “The female is his mate. We believe they’re infertile. That’s why they kept Athena alive.”

“So you decided to get her pregnant?” Ethan raised an eyebrow at me.

“I did.”

“That’s reckless. What if they try to keep one of the twins? You must see the flaw in that plan. I know you, Alexander. I know you have one of the best strategists in your pack. Was this his idea or yours?”

“Does it matter? You’re here to protect them.”

“You’re playing a dangerous game. You’re risking all our packs.”

‘Fool.’ Titan growled inwardly. He despised how Athena was being interrogated. He hated that our word wasn’t enough for these Alphas. He was growing desperate to take control.

I straightened, my voice dropping to a warning tone. “It’s the least you can do, Ethan. Especially after what we did for you.”

He caught the threat in my words.

“Are you trying to lure them out? Is that the plan?”

“Yes. Though it’s been quiet since she killed one.”

He glanced at Athena. “She doesn’t look like much. She really killed one?”

“Two.” I said with a faint smile. “She used her claws to rip out the first one’s heart. The second, she pierced its heart.”

I followed his gaze. Athena’s eyes were closed, her cheek resting on my desk. Worry gnawed at me. She hadn’t eaten in days. Even water was hard to keep down. Others had noticed too. I shut down their questions immediately.

I decided to give her a few more hours. If she didn’t improve, I was taking her back to the hospital.

“Insane.” Ethan muttered, for what felt like the hundredth time. “They’d have a better chance if they just accepted their true Alpha.”

“I know. You know. But they think they know better.”

“That’s why they’re dying out.”

Ethan chuckled. “No offense.” He smiled at Athena, then frowned. “Is she asleep? You know that’s not normal, right?”

I checked on her. I moved her from the desk chair to the sofa. She didn’t stir. Completely unconscious.

“You should have her examined.”

“Isabella says it’s normal early pregnancy symptoms.”

“We both know this isn’t normal.” Ethan raised an eyebrow.

“She’s a Lycan. None of us know what’s normal for them. They lied to her her whole life. She doesn’t even know.”

“What about that witch you consult? Maybe she has some insight.”

“Madame Zora? She hasn’t been seen lately. No one has left pack grounds.”

“She’s in my city.”

“What? Why?”

“Long story. I can call her. But we both know she doesn’t come cheap.”

“Call her.”

He pulled a phone from his pocket and held it to his ear. I heard her the moment she answered. “Alpha Ethan?”

“Your presence is requested at Obsidian Howl.”

A pause. A long sigh echoed through the phone before she agreed to come.

“She answers to you?” I asked curiously after he hung up.

“I caught her in a bind.” He smirked. “Let’s just say I learned a thing or two from you over the years.”

He stood and looked at my sleeping mate. His eyes lingered on her a moment too long before turning back to me. “I never thought I’d see the day you found a mate.”

“Neither did I. If anything happens to her…”

He smiled. “Oh, I know. I’ve already made that mistake once. This world will never be the same. It’s better to be on your side than against you.”
###Chapter 0119
Athena

“It’s been nearly four days.” Alexander paces in front of me, his voice low.

“At least the vomiting stopped.” I attempt a smile, but his worried expression doesn’t fade.

“You need to see Isabella. I should’ve taken you last night, after the pack run.”

“I’m fine.” I wasn’t. The constant attention was grating. Everyone watched my every move.

The other Alphas put me on edge. Around them, I either went silent or snapped. No middle ground.

“You might feel fine, but you haven’t eaten.” He pulls me up, hands settling on my hips. His thumbs trace my frame. “You’re losing weight.”

Nyx said the same thing. But I felt okay.

“I’ve gone longer without food. When I was a slave.”

His hands move to my stomach. “You need nourishment. For you and them. You have everything you need here.”

“You should worry about Dominic and Victoria.” I snap. “There’s still no sign of them. The other Alphas are getting restless.”

“Screw them. It’s you I’m worried about.”

“I’m fine.”

“Stop saying that.” His gaze intensifies. “I hear your thoughts, Athena. I smell your distress. But you won’t talk to me. Are you scared they might be Lycans? Or are you starving yourself hoping the pregnancy fails?” He raises a brow.

‘You were supposed to block him!’ I hiss at Nyx.

‘They are my pups too!’ she retorts.

“Well?” Alexander demands.

“It’s… not like that. I…” I bite my lip. “It terrifies me.”

“If they’re Lycans, then that’s their destiny. Madame Zora should arrive today. Maybe she’ll have answers.”

Dread pools in my stomach. The witch who bound me was coming. My stomach growls loudly. Alexander smirks.

“Stop worrying about them. They will be loved. Cared for. No matter what they are.”

He kisses my forehead. “Now go eat. Make my pups happy.”

As I head for the door, he calls out that Theodore will stop by later to check on my reading progress.

Downstairs, I hear Julian in the kitchen explaining mate bonds to someone.

“I’m fifteen!” Sophia shrieks.

I burst into the kitchen. Julian leans against the cabinets, arms crossed, staring at Sophia.

I immediately jump to her defense. I knew Julian’s reputation. No way was I letting him near a fifteen-year-old.

“What’s going on?” I glare at him.

“Want to tell her, or should I?” Julian presses his lips together, annoyed.

“What’s happening?”

Sophia’s eyes are downcast. Her face is bright red.

“Did you try something?” I snap at Julian.

“I like women, but I draw the line at underage ones.” He sighs.

‘They are mated.’ Nyx murmurs as I process his words.

‘And to make it worse, you were human.’ His dark eyes fix on Sophia, not kindly. Sophia runs from the room crying. Julian rolls his eyes.
###Chapter 0120

"How long have you known?"

Silence.

I pressed him again. "How long?"

"Since the day she appeared. She's just a kid. Started following me around a few days ago. I figure her wolf is beginning to settle into her body." His gaze sharpened. "I'm rejecting her. I won't wait until she's eighteen. I could be dead by then."

"That's why you were explaining the bond. Preparing her."

He gave a single nod. "You think I'm an asshole, but I do care about some things. That girl has suffered enough. A rejection might shatter her."

Hearing this side of him was strange. Softer. It proved he wasn't a complete idiot.

"You walked in right as I was about to do it."

"Make sure she has someone with her when you reject her. She'll need the support."

"Fine."

"Alexander!" Ethan's voice echoed through the house. Julian rolled his eyes dramatically. He leaned out the door. "My brother is busy. What do you want?"

"Madame Zora is here."

My spine went rigid. Nyx was already whispering curses inside my mind. She hadn't even met the witch, yet she hated her for binding my powers.

Madame Zora glided in, a small bag in hand. A slow smile spread across her tanned face the moment she saw me.

"How are you feeling, Alpha Athena?"

I hated it. I hated the title from her lips.

Her eyes dropped to my stomach. Her grin widened. "Twins. How wonderful."

"You know?" Ethan frowned at her.

"I see what is necessary." She did a slow turn. "I believe Alpha Alexander wishes to see me."

"He's occupied at the moment," Julian informed her. "You can wait in his office."

"Very well." She turned her attention back to me. "I would enjoy your company."

Julian caught my wrist. "You don't have to if you're uncomfortable."

I stared at the witch. She knew about the twins. Maybe she knew more. "I'm fine," I muttered, pulling my arm free. If she tried anything, I would end her.

The men watched me lead the way to the office. Madame Zora followed too closely. I made a point of sitting in Alexander's chair, behind the desk, facing her and the door. This was my territory now.

"How are you feeling?" she asked, settling herself comfortably.

I ignored her question. "You said you see what's necessary. Where are Dominic and Victoria?"

"Waiting."

"Where?"

"That, I'm afraid, is something I cannot be certain of."

Annoyance flared within me.

"I believe I am here to check on you," she said, studying my face.

"That isn't needed."

"I know. You have it all handled." She smiled faintly. "You know, when I first met you, I knew you were different. A special little pup. Just like the ones growing inside you."

"Are they Lycans?"

She smiled again. "Lycans are a dying breed. Even those who were turned cannot produce Lycan offspring."

"Are they Wolves, like Alexander?"

"Is that what you want, Alpha Athena?"

"I want you to answer my questions."

"As much as I would like to give you the answers you seek, I cannot."

"You mean you won't." I sighed and shook my head. "Why did you even come here?"

"I owe Alpha Ethan. And I wanted one last look at you as the Lycan Alpha."
###Chapter 0121
Alexander

I stepped into a heavy silence.
Athena looked pale and shaken.
She was clutching her stomach tightly.
Tears welled in her eyes.

“What…what does that mean?” she whispered to Madame Zora.

“Exactly as I said.” Madame Zora’s gaze shifted to me. “I cannot provide the answers you seek.”

“Name your price.” I knew her methods well.

She shook her head slowly. “If I accepted payment for this, the answers would be worthless.”

She turned back to Athena. “I regret my role in your upbringing.”

“Twice!” I snapped sharply.

“And I wish I could give you the information you need.” She sighed deeply.

“You said you wanted one last look at me, the Lycan Alpha. Does that mean I’m dying?” Athena demanded.

“Everyone is.” She offered a sad smile.

I shook my head in disbelief. I had known Madame Zora for decades. “Athena, she’s referring to herself.”

“You were always the cleverest Alpha, Alpha Alexander.” Madame Zora winked at me before focusing on my mate. “Yes, he’s correct. Alpha Athena. My time has finally come.”

“Oh.”

“What I can tell you is that your boys will thrive. You simply have a journey ahead.”

“That’s all?” I asked, watching my mate closely.

“That is all I possess.” She rose to her feet. “Now if you’ll excuse me, I wish to enjoy my remaining days.”

She turned to leave, then paused. “One more thing. Your mother experienced the same sickness. For Lycans, it’s common. Likely due to the human essence within. Try ginger biscuits. Your appetite will return soon.”

As she departed, I heard Ethan shouting after her, demanding to know her destination.

“She made it sound like I was dying?” Athena whispered with a frown.

“Madame Zora speaks in riddles. You should have waited for me. I could have interpreted for you.”

“I still don’t understand.” She whispered. “I still don’t know what they are.”

“Perhaps we should take each day as it comes. When you feel them, your perspective will change.”

She nodded, then suddenly looked up. “There’s something I need to tell you.”

“He already did. For once, Julian is actually doing the right thing.”

“It will shatter her.” Athena murmured.

I knew they had spoken, just as I hoped. Sophia had confided in her when Athena fixed her hair.

Athena hadn’t shared details with me.
She said it wasn’t her place to tell.
Sophia had asked for confidentiality.
I respected her choice.

“Just be there for her. Be the person you needed growing up.” I told her.

A sharp knock interrupted us.
Ethan entered without waiting. “What did you say to my witch?”

“First: It’s none of your concern. Second: You don’t own her. Third: You’re in my house. Watch your tone!” I growled.

“I brought her here to help with whatever this is.” He gestured toward my mate. “You wanted answers, and now she’s walked away without looking back. What did you say? Or did she tell you we’re all doomed?”

“She’s dying.” Athena muttered. “She can’t help you anymore.”

“What the hell are you talking about?”

“If you keep speaking to my mate like that, I’ll break your neck!” I snarled. “Madame Zora is dying. She has days left. She doesn’t care about you ‘owning’ her.”
###Chapter 0122

“Once this Lycan mess is over, we’re finished, Alexander. I owe you nothing. I want no part of your pack ever again.”

LYCANS! Sebastian shouts through the mind link.

“They’re here,” I tell Ethan.

He charges out without hesitation, setting aside his issues with me for now.

“Find Sophia,” I tell Athena, guiding her toward the door. “Stay with her. Do not leave the house.” I press my lips to hers and silently beg the Moon Goddess to let me return to my mate alive. None of us truly knew what we were facing.

My pack had formed a defensive wall three rows deep, standing shoulder to shoulder. I could see the Lycans, all shifted, lining the edge of the trees, waiting. It was impossible to tell how many there were.

They didn’t move. They watched us just as we watched them. Everyone listening for the slightest sound.

Was Dominic here? Was Victoria? I had no idea what they looked like in Lycan form.

‘What are they doing?’ Sebastian links me. He stood in the front row, eyes locked on the massive Lycan directly across from him.

‘Scouting. They’re trying to see if this is all we have.’

Faint clapping started somewhere within the trees. One by one, the Lycans joined in, slamming their large clawed hands together. The sound was deafening.

‘Something’s wrong,’ Julian mutters. ‘It’s a distraction.’

We scanned the area. Nothing had changed. My thoughts immediately flew to Sophia. Had I been tricked by a child?

‘Athena? Is Sophia with you?’ I linked her, my heart pounding.

‘She’s hiding in her closet.’

‘Keep her there!’

I scanned the clapping Lycans again. That’s when I noticed them parting, making way for the blonde woman. Victoria was still in human form. As she moved through the crowd, she stepped to the front and raised her hands. The clapping ceased.

“Where is she, Alpha Alexander?” Her voice grated like nails on a chalkboard.

“Not here. Where’s that coward husband of yours?”

“Hiding her in the house, are you?” She smirked. “I suggest you bring her out. This could get very ugly.”

“For who? Not a single one of your creatures made it through. We killed every last one.”

A slow smile spread across her face. “Except one.”

“The one you never should have turned,” I growled.

“Are you certain?” Her eyes closed, and a twisted grin took over. When they reopened, she stared directly at me. “You see, Alpha Alexander, no matter how much little Sophia wants to fight it, she cannot resist the commands of her maker. Athena will have two choices: come willingly, or kill Jessica.”

I already knew what Athena would choose. She would never harm Sophia.

My eyes shut as I heard the packhouse front door open.

“I’m so sorry… I’m so, so sorry.” Sophia couldn’t even look at me. When I refocused on Athena, her eyes were solid black.

‘Don’t shift,’ I linked her. It wouldn’t be safe for her or the pups.

She didn’t respond. She stepped onto the grass, walking calmly beside Sophia. Athena’s expression was cold and detached.

A wall of wolves still stood between Athena and the Lycans. There was no way they were taking her.

The Lycans began cheering as if they’d already won the battle.

“Bring her to me!” Victoria shrieked as Sophia stopped behind Julian.

Sophia’s head snapped up. Her eyes were as black as Athena’s. She held her hand out to my mate. As their fingers intertwined, Sophia growled, “You may be my maker, but you are not my Alpha!”
###Chapter 0123

My heart hammered against my ribs.
Adrenaline surged through my veins, a slow-building inferno.
It ignited something primal deep inside me.
Power thrummed beneath my skin.
And it was all because of Sophia.

I found her trying to hide in a closet.
Her panicked words blurred together as my own fear spiked.
Tears streamed down her face faster than she could wipe them away.

I did what Alexander asked.
I kept her here.
But I couldn't stop myself from glancing out the window.
I had to see.

The Lycans were clapping.
A bizarre, jarring sound.
They slammed their clawed hands together, staring down the Wolves.
This was utterly insane.

'What are they doing?' I asked Nyx.
She just shrugged.

I desperately wanted to link Alexander.
I needed to hear his voice, to understand.
But all I heard was Sophia's muffled sobs from the closet.

I pulled the door open.
I offered her a weak, reassuring smile.
"They aren't here for you, Sophia. They're here for me."

She was curled into a ball, arms wrapped tightly around her knees.
Just like I used to do.
It was strange how we both tried to make ourselves smaller when danger came.

"That woman... Cassandra... the one who brought me here," she stammered. "She wants me to bring you to them."
She refused to meet my gaze.

"Is that why you're hiding?" I asked, fighting to keep my voice calm.
Sophia shook her head.
Then she tapped her temple.
"In here. I hear her. It was a whisper before. Now..." Her soft blue eyes finally lifted to mine. "Now it's a command."

"A command?"
She nodded vigorously. "She keeps saying, 'I am your maker. You will obey me!'"
Control. Of course. That was all Victoria ever wanted.

"Are you going to try and hand me over?" I asked quietly, understanding dawning.
This was why they changed a child.

"I... I don't want to," she whispered.
I sighed. "You can't fight a direct order. Obedience is ingrained in us. We must obey those above us."

Sophia uncurled slightly. "You make me feel like I can fight it. Being near you, I feel safer. If you told me not to, I'd have to listen, right? Because you're the Alpha. My Alpha. You're more powerful than she is."

"Alexander is—"
"No. You are the Lycans' Alpha. If I understand it right, they have to answer to you. Sebastian told me that." She glanced toward the window but squeezed her eyes shut. "Her demands are getting louder. It actually hurts my chest now. That's bad, right?"

"It's because you're resisting her command."
"Can you make it stop?"
Would it work? Alexander mentioned linking them all. But could I do this?
'Only one way to find out,' Nyx murmured.

"I order you not to take me to Victoria."
Sophia threw her arms around me in a sudden, fierce hug. "Thank you."
'I think the kid is onto something,' Nyx mused. 'Let's go take down the whole pack.'
I smiled at Sophia. "I think you might be right. And now, I need your help."

My bare feet touched the cool grass.
Sophia walked slightly behind me, as if presenting me.
She was trying so hard to hold herself together, just like I was.
It wouldn't be for long.
Just long enough to make Victoria believe she had won.

I was desperate to look for Alexander, but I knew I'd break if our eyes met.
I asked Nyx to block him from my mind, just temporarily.
Just until I ended this.

Two words broke through the barrier anyway. "Don't shift."
Shifting was not part of the plan.

Cheers erupted from the Lycans.
If you could call them cheers.
It was a cacophony of roars and howls of satisfaction.
They didn't even have me yet, and they were already celebrating.

As the noise died down, Victoria yelled, "You will bring her to me!"
Sophia stared through the rows of Wolves.
Like me, she was almost too short to see.
Slowly, she reached out and locked her hand with mine.
Her grip was surprisingly strong.

"You may be my maker," she declared, her voice shaking but clear. "But you are not my Alpha."
My heart raced. I could hardly believe her courage.

"You are a stupid little girl!" Victoria shrieked. "You know nothing of our world!"
"I know enough to know who is wrong!" Sophia squeezed my hand tighter, staring straight ahead.
Her eyes darkened, just like Alexander said mine do.
She was close to shifting.

"Bring her to me!" Victoria yelled, stomping her foot in a furious rage.
###Chapter 0124

The Wolves remain still.

But the Lycans inch forward.

They are ready for a fight.

I am ready when you are. Nyx whispers.

I draw a deep breath.

The Lycans creep closer.

If this fails, we are finished.

Drop the block.

My mind floods with whispers.

Lycans' voices blend into a constant hum.

I AM YOUR ALPHA. BRING VICTORIA AND DOMINIC TO ME!

My own tone shocks me. It rings with authority.

The Lycans freeze.

They exchange uncertain glances.

They were fed lies about me.

But if they feel what Sophia felt, they cannot refuse.

NO! Victoria shrieks. You have no power! You are nobody! Dominic, tell them!

Her hands clench into fists.

She is used to getting her way.

Now hundreds of Lycans stare at her. With hostility.

Her eyes show pure shock.

Stupid bitch. Nyx murmurs.

Screams pierce the air.

Victoria's shrill voice makes many cover their ears.

She backs away.

But there is no escape.

Lycans block the trees behind her.

A wall of Wolves stands before her.

DOMINIC! DOMINIC! Help me!

A single black Lycan retreats into the woods.

Large claws seize Victoria.

They ignore her screams.

Bring him to me! I command through the link.

Several Lycans sprint after Dominic.

I glance at Alexander.

He smiles at me.

He waited for this. For me to embrace my destiny.

Lycans turn on each other.

Desperate to deliver the screaming woman to me.

They likely hope for mercy.

They will receive none.

I will not lead traitors.

I reject those who believed Dominic and Victoria so easily.

Sophia's hand remains in mine.

I smile at her.

She is young. That was Victoria's mistake.

She changed a girl like me. A girl content with herself.

The Wolves part.

Two Lycans drag Victoria toward me.

Alexander joins us.

He takes my hand and kisses my cheek.

Then he focuses on Victoria. Well Victoria, how does it feel?

Bastard. You have no idea. Dominic will avenge me if you touch me!

She turns to Sophia. And you! You stupid, foolish girl! I should have let you die!

I pull my hand from Alexander's.

Claws extend from my fingertips.

I drive them into her stomach.

The Lycans release her.

She screams.

Her hands lock around my arm. Trapping my claws.

You destroyed me! I growl.

You made me believe you were special. Then you ruined me. Now I ruin you.

I release Sophia's hand.

My claws lengthen.

I slowly pierce Victoria's skin.

They sink into her kidneys before tearing across her abdomen.

I hate her. She took everything from me.

I look at Alexander.

Evil glints in his eyes.

Kill them all. I whisper.

The two Lycans backing away are attacked by Ethan and others.

Chaos erupts as Alexander orders the attack.

Blood trickles from Victoria's lips.

Her wide, fearful eyes remain fixed on me.

I want to see her bleed. Like she made my parents bleed.

You deserve this. And more. I whisper as my claws retract.

She drops to her knees.

Tears stream down her face.

I have never seen her cry before.

You are a monster! she croaks.

I am what you made me!

My claws plunge into her chest.

They curl around her heart as she chokes.

With one tug, I rip it free.

It beats in my hand for a moment.

Her body sways.

Then collapses to the ground.

I look up.

Ethan stares at me.

His expression is unreadable.
###Chapter 0125
Alexander

Three days passed while the dead burned.
For three days, Dominic remained in my dungeons, still breathing.
For three days, Athena had not spoken a single word about that night.

She sits in her usual chair in my office, quietly nibbling a ginger biscuit.
Madame Zora had been right about them.
They finally settled her stomach enough to eat properly.
Today, instead of curling her legs against her chest, she sits with them crossed beneath her.

Her dark hair curtains her face.
She appears calm, but I have endless questions about the bastard in my cells.

"I can kill him." I mutter without glancing up. "If that's the problem, I'll handle it."

She stays silent.

"Athena, why did you let him live? You killed his mate."

She releases a heavy sigh. "He deserves to suffer. Why couldn't they refuse my command?"

Her question surprises me. I assumed she understood.

"You were their Alpha. That's why they obeyed. It's different with Wolves. As you know, a Blood bond can mean answering to two Alphas. Sometimes Wolves seek refuge in another pack and pledge loyalty to that Alpha. You are the last living Lycan Alpha. They had no other choice. They couldn't disobey."

"Right." she murmurs, reaching for another biscuit.

"The sooner we execute Dominic, the sooner the other Alphas can leave."

She lifts her gaze, frowning.

"They were summoned to protect you and the pups under their contract obligations. Dominic remains alive, meaning the threat persists. They won't depart until it's resolved."

"I'm not ready."

Those were not the words I anticipated.

I study her, unable to read her thoughts. Nyx still blocks me, making it impossible to sense her properly.

"You're not ready?" I ask gently as her frown deepens.

"You'll think I'm insane."

"He's your last connection to Silver Creek. Or more precisely, to your parents." I've been trying to decipher why she keeps him alive, especially since she hasn't even visited him. This was the only logical explanation.

"See? Stupid." she mutters.

"They destroyed you. They beat you, starved you, let the pack abuse you."

"I know!" She snaps sharply.

"You're struggling to release the fantasy of the life you might have had. The life you have here now. Where you are loved. Where you have friends. Where you've gained a sister who adores you."

The corners of her lips lift slightly. "My life is complicated."

"And I wouldn't have met you otherwise. But perhaps it's time to shut the door on your chaotic past and focus on the future. On the pups you're carrying."

She nods slowly. "Will you come with me? I'm still not prepared to face him alone." We descend into the dungeons as Dominic groans, his stomach growling with hunger.

"Look who decided to show up." He sneers, struggling to stand. His hands grip the bars, keeping himself upright. Fading bruises mark his face, and I scent my brother's recent presence.

"Here to throw more punches?" He snarls at me.

Athena remains silent. Her fingers stay tightly interlaced with mine. Her blue eyes are wide as she stares at Dominic. All the confidence she displayed days ago has vanished.

This man instills more fear in her than she ever revealed.

"Cat got your tongue." Dominic mocks her. "You always struggled with words. Stuttering over the simplest things. And now, absolutely nothing."

"Shut your fucking mouth!" I snap. "You hold no power over her."

He smirks. "Her trembling body suggests otherwise."

"You were there!" Athena whispers breathlessly. "You stood in the shadows. You watched me place that lemonade before them. You did nothing as they bled out."

I realize it's not about letting go. She's still searching for answers.

"You're correct." Dominic smirks.

A small crease forms on Athena's forehead as she closes her eyes. "They all knew, didn't they? The chaos, everyone running. They screamed for help, yet no one tried to save them. They all knew, right?"

"Yes."

A single tear escapes her closed eyes. "You planned this for a long time."

"Since the day you were born." Dominic shrugs. "You were meant to produce more Lycans. More carriers of the Alpha blood. They saw something special in you, but I understood what it meant for our kind. There was hope for us."

"So you lied to her." I snap.

"We did what was necessary!"

"Why the contract?" I demand.

"It wasn't a lie. We needed protection. A Wolf pack discovered us and moved to eliminate us. I admit, it was strange seeing him beside you recently. But we never anticipated her being mated to you. A Lycan and a Wolf," He scoffs, "that's unheard of."

"Who? Who already knew about you?"

"I don't know his name. And I don't care either."

"Another trick? Buying more time, Dominic? That only leads to more torture."

"Do what you want. I've accepted my fate."

"Which Alpha are you referring to?" I demand.

"He watches me." Athena interrupts softly. "He wasn't surprised when we told him. The others had questions, but he already knew." Her eyes meet mine. "Ethan."
###Chapter 0126
Athena

It never seemed to end.

One secret after another, spilling out like some twisted game.

The dungeon echoes with choked gasps. I look up to see Alexander, his arms thrust through the bars. His hands are locked around Dominic’s throat. Squeezing until Dominic’s lips start turning blue.

His body convulses. His hands slip from the bars. His mouth opens and closes like a fish out of water. No sound escapes.

His eyes bulge from their sockets as Alexander crushes his windpipe.

‘Now.’ Nyx whispers. ‘Finish him. For good.’

I step forward. My hand stretches through the bars. Long, sharp claws sprout from my fingertips.

My palm presses against his chest. Slowly, my claws pierce his flesh. They slide through skin and muscle with ease. Until they brush against his beating heart.

I pause. Staring into the eyes of the man who caused me so much pain.

He never apologized. Not once. Even now, seconds from death, he stares back. Ignoring the Wolf crushing his throat.

His voice echoes in my mind. ‘Do it. I’ve been waiting. I knew this day would arrive.’

‘What do you mean?’ I murmur through the link.

‘I knew I would die once you found yourself. Once you realized your true power.’

He gurgles as my claws sink deeper. Piercing the edges of his heart.

“Goodbye, Dominic.” I whisper.

My claws plunge into his heart.

I keep them there. Watching the light fade from his eyes. Feeling his heart struggle around my claws. Blood leaks out.

Alexander releases him. Dominic takes a hollow, rasping breath. It sounds like an ancient door creaking open.

I don’t expect him to grab my wrist. Forcing my claws deeper.

His eyes close. More empty gasps escape his throat. Then silence.

His heart stops fighting. His lungs stop demanding air. The only thing holding him up are my claws.

I pull my hand free. His body hits the cement floor with a sickening crack. Blood pools around him instantly.

A single tear escapes my eye. I’ve finally closed the door on my past.

Alexander carries Dominic’s body outside. He dumps it on the grass. Theodore appears with a box of matches and a small can of fuel.

I watch silently as Theodore douses the body. He lights a match. He glances at me for confirmation. I nod.

The flame ignites Dominic the second the match touches him. Huge orange flames race along his body. Drowning out the scent of blood.

Now the air fills with the nauseating smell of burning flesh.

Alexander slips his arms around my waist. He presses his chest against my back as we watch the body burn. “They’re all gone.” he whispers.

I nod. Words escape me.

“You won, Athena.”

“Is… Is Sophia okay?” I ask softly. I want to ask about Ethan, but I’m not ready for that yet.

“She’s inside with Sebastian and Isabella.” Theodore informs me.

I can feel their eyes on me. They expect me to talk about what happened. But there’s nothing to say. I killed them. End of story.

“Has Julian rejected her yet? Is that why they’re with her?”
