“It’s more complicated than that.” Theodore shakes his head. “She’s refusing to accept the rejection.”

“Why?” My voice comes out higher than usual.

“What do you mean, she’s refusing?” Alexander demands.

“She flat-out told him she refuses it. She didn’t say no. She said she refuses.”

“Can she do that?” I frown. “I mean, I was still mated to Marcus after he tried to reject me.”

“That’s because you didn’t accept the rejection properly.” Alexander mutters. “I’ve never heard of someone refusing a rejection outright.”

“She could die!” Panic flutters in my chest. We all know what Julian is like. If he sleeps with another female, it will kill her.

“Where’s my brother?” Alexander questions.

“He left.” Theodore avoids his gaze.

“He left? Where the hell did he go?”

Theodore shrugs. “We tried to stop him. He was too angry.”

“At Sophia?”

Theodore shakes his head. “At the Moon Goddess. She’s the one who paired him with Sophia. He’s furious.”

“I need to find Sophia.” I murmur.

They let me go alone. With all the Lycans gone, Alexander isn’t worried about me going anywhere by myself.
###Chapter 0127

Ethan startles me as I enter the packhouse.
He's seated right outside the office door.
He stands immediately when our eyes meet.
His dark grey gaze drops to my blood-stained hand.

“You finished him?” His voice is flat, devoid of emotion.
Yet he watches me with that same intense stare from our first meeting.
This man irritates me just by breathing the same air.

“Yes. He's dead.” My tone is sharp.
I don't understand why he gets under my skin so easily.

“That leaves you as the last one. Well, you and Sophia.”
His eyes linger on my stomach in a way that makes me uncomfortable.
“Do we understand what they are?”

“Alexander's heirs.” I mutter the words.

“You know that's not my question.”

“And yet that's what they are!” My voice rises.
“Unborn members of this pack. Let me ask you something.”

“Go ahead.”

“The bitten ones. The changed. However you label them. How did they reach your city?”

“Same way they reached every other city nearby.”

“How long have you known about Lycans existing?”

He stares silently, pressing his lips together.

“You knew. You knew before they appeared in your streets. When you were informed, you showed no surprise. How long?”

He merely shrugs.

He's a complete asshole! Nyx growls internally.

“You didn't come just for the contract, did you?”

“Partly, yes. I honor my commitments. Though I was intrigued to hear the great Alpha Alexander had finally settled down. My curiosity peaked when I learned your name. Athena Harrison. It's not a name one forgets.” He rises from the chair.

I step back, frowning. “We've never met.”

“But we have. Long ago. You were just an infant, mere months old. I was ten, perhaps eleven. Your parents visited my family's city. They abandoned you there.”

“No. That's a lie.” A growl rumbles deep within me.

“It's truth. I watched them leave you in a basket down some alley. Wrapped tightly in a blanket. Fools made the mistake of stitching your name onto it.” He rolls his eyes and turns away with a sigh.

“I brought you home to my parents. By then, you'd already shifted. Multiple times.” He smirks, checking his reflection. “A strange little monster, but I couldn't leave you there.”

I shake my head. It can't be true. I was bound. I couldn't shift.

“My parents spent a week tracking your family down.”

“You're inventing this.”

His dark grey eyes lock onto mine.

“Silver Creek sits in the middle of nowhere. Isolated from any other civilization. So remote other packs struggle to find it. The house is large, but not like most packhouses. Gardens spread out back.” He describes my childhood home in perfect detail.

My heart hammers against my ribs.

“Your parents claimed you were kidnapped, but you carried no foreign scents. Only theirs. Honestly, they didn't even seem pleased to have you returned. I begged my parents to keep you. They refused. Said you were a powerful being.”

“My parents loved me!”

“Are you certain? Wasn't Dominic raised as your older brother to become the next Alpha? Weren't they the ones who bound you twice before he did it again?” He rubs his jaw. “The impression I got was that no matter what they did, you kept surviving. As if you were meant to. Perhaps to lead you to this exact moment.” He points at my stomach.

“You intended to kill Dominic and Victoria?” I whisper.

“Not until recent years, when the bitten started appearing in my city. Initially we suspected Vampires, but then they began shifting. I recognized what they were. I'd seen it before. And it had to connect to that pack you came from.”

“Two years?”

“Perhaps longer. Their plan was long in motion, Athena. It intensified after you met Alexander. They likely planned to breed you until you died.”

“All the bitten are dead now, aren't they!” I snap.

“Not entirely!”

I notice the unusual quietness of the house. My heart plummets. “Where's Sophia?”

He smiles coldly.

“What the hell have you done to her?”

“She's safe. For now.”
###Chapter 0128
Athena

“Where is she?” My blood runs hot. She can’t be far. Theodore said she was with Sebastian and Isabella. Where are they? He couldn’t have taken them all.

But if he was wounded, he’d be healed by now.

I turn from him. I rush through every room on the ground floor. Ethan follows close behind me. He laughs each time I find an empty room.

“The contract ended the moment Dominic died.” His voice is low behind me.

Just kill him! Nyx urges.

We can’t. We don’t know where Sophia is. He knows that.

“Don’t listen to that beast inside you.” He smirks.

“Sophia is just a child.” I snarl.

“I know. That’s why she’s safe. For now.”

“She is part of this pack!” I snap. “You’re breaking your deal with Alexander.”

“The deal ended when you killed Dominic. Alexander said it himself. The threat is gone. The contract is over. I’m not threatening your pups.”

“So this is revenge? You asked for his help. Is this how you repay him?”

“I did repay him. I helped kill the Lycans for both of you. She’s not in his pack. She’s in yours. Tell your beast to stand down.”

My eyes betray me, turning black as Nyx pushes forward. Shifting now won’t help. Where is Alexander? He must feel my panic.

I close my eyes. What does he want with Sophia?

“It’s about me, isn’t it.” I mutter. “You said you were fascinated by my shift. You can’t have me because of Alexander. So you’re trying with Sophia. It’s disgusting. You’re twenty years older. She’s fifteen. A child.”

He doesn’t know. Nyx whispers. He doesn’t know she has a mate. If he tries anything, it will kill her.

Ethan shrugs. “Do you think age matters to me?”

“What do you want? Pups? Lycan heirs?”

He smiles. I feel sick.

“She can’t give you pups.”

I see Alexander in the window behind Ethan. He puts a finger to his lips. Keep him talking. His voice echoes in my mind.

“The witch told you that?” Ethan asks.

“Yes. We’re a dying breed. I’m the last true Lycan. That’s why only one pack remained. They’re dying out.”

“Yet you carry twins.” He mocks.

“There’s a good chance they’re Wolves.” I snap back. Part of me hopes they are. The thought of bringing more Lycans into this world terrifies me. Everything I learned about myself happened here. In this pack. I can’t raise Lycans without knowing how.

“Maybe. Only time will tell. I need to prepare.”

“By making your own? What’s your plan, Ethan? Attack Alexander for revenge?”

“What’s happening here?” Theodore enters from the back. I get no answers.

“Nothing.” Ethan mutters. “I was just telling Athena I’m leaving.”

I frown. Him leaving now is bad. I need to find Sophia.

“So soon? Don’t you want to stay for Athena’s birthday celebration?”

I hide my surprise. No one mentioned a party. This must be Alexander’s doing.

What is Theodore up to? Nyx murmurs.

“It’s tomorrow.” Theodore continues, avoiding my eyes. “After everything, we need a celebration. Alexander wants a party. A joint event. Athena’s birthday and victory in the war.”

“A party?” Ethan raises a brow.

Theodore nods. “Interested? You helped take down many Lycans.”

Ethan’s eyes narrow at me. “Sure. It’s been a while since I celebrated.”

“Great.” Theodore smiles. “Where’s your brother? I need to ask him too. Making a list.”

“He left earlier. Heading home to his wife.”

“I see.” Theodore mutters. “That’s a shame. More drinks for us.” He laughs. It sounds forced.

His brother has her. Nyx tells me.

They live hundreds of miles away. I panic.

“I thought you traveled together. Since you live that way.” Theodore presses. He thinks the same as me.

“I had things to settle. I wanted a written letter from Alexander. Confirming the contract is over. I don’t need him finding loopholes.”

“He said it’s over. Multiple times.” I mutter.

“Still. Best to have it in writing.”

Ethan smirks at me. He’s too dumb to see Theodore digging for info. “I’ll stay for the party. It could be fun.”

He turns and leaves.

“Aren’t you going after him?” I whisper to Theodore.

“No. Alexander is already on it.”

I look at the window. He’s gone.
###Chapter 0129

“What about Isabella and Sebastian?”

“We located them. They were unconscious in the pantry. They’re both okay, just heavily sedated.”

“But Sophia…”

“We’ll find her. Everyone knows how much she means to you.” He offered a smile, but it didn’t reach his deep green eyes. He was worried, too. He just wouldn’t say it out loud.

‘Someone should inform Julian.’ Nyx murmured.

‘He doesn’t want her. That’s probably for the best.’ I replied.

‘He is still her mate.’

‘Do you think he’ll go after her?’

‘If we tell him, we might finally learn how he truly feels about being mated to her.’

‘She’s just a kid,’ I muttered.

‘I know. So why do you think he really left?’

‘Because she refused his rejection.’

She shook her head. ‘Guess again,’ Nyx said, a hint of amusement in her tone.

‘To wait until she turns eighteen?’

She nodded. ‘She blocked his rejection. He can’t force it without risking her life. Creating distance was the simplest solution. He’s waiting for her to come of age.’

“Talking to Nyx?” Theodore asked.

I nodded.

“Alexander will find Sophia,” he said, trying to reassure me.

“I hope so. Can you do something for me?”

“Of course.”

“Mind-link Julian. Tell him what happened.”

“But he wanted to reject her—” He stopped when he saw my expression. “You have a theory?”

“Please, just link him.”

He gave a curt nod. His eyes glazed over, signaling he was deep in conversation. I watched his face shift through a spectrum of emotions before he refocused on me. “He’s on his way to meet Alexander. It seems Alexander had the same idea. He already told him.”

“We need to alert the pack to keep watch on Ethan,” I said to Sebastian, pacing relentlessly in front of the office window.

Since regaining consciousness, he had remained with me in the office along with Isabella and Theodore. My restlessness was growing.

Sebastian shook his head. “I understand your concern, but Alexander doesn’t want to draw attention to him. It might push him to flee. As far as the pack is aware, Ethan is here for the party. Nothing more.”

“But Sophia—”

“I know. But you must stay calm,” Sebastian said firmly. “If he suspects anything, it could ruin the entire plan.”

Isabella took my hands in hers. “Sophia is like a little sister to you. If I were missing, my brother would be acting just like you are. He’d want to organize a search party immediately.”

“He actually had to do that once,” Sebastian muttered. Isabella shot him a sharp look.

“So I get it,” Isabella continued. “Ethan told you himself she’s safe for now. Alexander and Julian know what they’re doing. They’ll bring her back soon. Right now, you need to stay calm. Protect those nephews of mine.”

“Boys?” Theodore asked, curiosity piqued.

“We’re not certain, but Madame Zora suggested they’re boys,” I told him.

“Like I said,” Isabella smiled gently. “Try to stay calm. Stress isn’t good for you or for them.”

“We also need to maintain normalcy,” Sebastian advised. “Hiding in this office will only attract suspicion. You should stay with one of us. We can keep you updated on Sophia, and it gives you a valid reason to be with each of us.”

“I’m fine on my own.”

He locked eyes with me. “Alexander’s orders.”

“He’s right,” Theodore added. “You can continue your tutoring sessions with me. Spend time with Isabella because of the pregnancy. Sebastian is your designated guard when Alexander isn’t around.”

I nodded silently.

Hours dragged by with no news. Sitting in the hospital with Isabella made me restless. I needed to be doing something, not just waiting.

“Here,” Isabella said, sliding a pack of ginger biscuits toward me. “Alexander had these placed all over the pack grounds for you. Just in case.”

“I’m not hungry.”

“No, but you look like you’re about to be sick.”

I’d felt off for a while. Something was wrong, but I couldn’t pinpoint it.

Rubbing my eyes, I sighed and took the biscuits. “Any news?”

She shook her head. “He’s fine. You’d know if something was wrong. We all would.”

“I thought it was over,” I mumbled. “When I killed Victoria and Dominic, and the other Lycans were eliminated… I thought it was finished. But there’s always something.”

“Unfortunately, that’s part of being a Wolf. Or in your case, a Lycan. Trouble finds us no matter where we are. It’s why Alexander has worked so hard to build our pack the way he has. To minimize the chaos.”

“And I’ve brought more of it,” I groaned.

“Alexander knew what he was getting into. Out of all the women he tried to bond with, none came close to what he shares with you. He could have killed you the moment he discovered the truth about you. But he didn’t. He isn’t concerned about what the pups might be. He’s just happy to be a father.” She smiled warmly. “You make him happy.”

I returned her smile, but a sharp, sudden pain pierced my heart. At the same moment, the color drained from Isabella’s face.

Alexander was in trouble.
###Chapter 0130
Alexander

“Damn it! Alexander, can you hear me? Wake the hell up!” My brother’s voice cuts through the fog in my mind. He sounds panicked, distant.

“ALEXANDER!”

“Shut the fuck up!” My eyes snap open. I’m hanging upside down. Blood trickles down my arms and face. I struggle to process the scene.

‘What the hell happened?’ Titan’s voice echoes in my head, groggy.

I ignore him, focusing on my surroundings.

The car is overturned, roof crushed against the ground. The windshield is completely shattered. Shards of glass lie beneath my head. A searing pain shoots through my chest, making each breath a struggle. The sharp scent of gasoline fills the air. This car could explode any second.

“Shit!” Julian mutters. He’s fighting against the dashboard pinning him down. He pushes it back slowly, inch by inch, using all his strength. If we were human, we’d be dead already.

I reach for the seatbelt release. Then I feel it. A large piece of glass lodged deep in my chest, dangerously close to my heart. It might have already pierced the organ keeping me alive. I never imagined I’d die like this.

“Julian, look at me.”

“Hold on, I’m almost free.”

“Julian.”

He stops fighting the dashboard and turns to me. The cuts on his face from the glass are already healing. His eyes widen in horror when he sees the glass protruding from my chest. The same terrifying thought flashes through his mind.

“No… no, no, no, this isn’t happening. You’re going to be a father! You can’t leave Athena. She needs you. We all need you.”

“Julian, you know the pack already senses something’s wrong. That’s why you didn’t want to look at me—you felt my distress. Athena will feel it too.”

‘Alexander!’ Isabella’s voice screams through the mind link. ‘What happened?’

‘Car accident,’ I reply, half-chuckling despite the pain. ‘Some idiot came out of nowhere.’

‘But you’re okay, right? Please tell me you’re okay!’

I glance at the glass in my chest. Julian uses one foot to kick the dashboard off his other leg.

‘Promise me you’ll protect Athena,’ I murmur through the link. ‘If I die, promise me you won’t abandon her.’

‘No.’ She begins to cry. ‘She’s carrying your children.’

‘Until they’re old enough, I need you and Sebastian to help her lead the pack.’

Julian presses his hands against my chest. The fear in his eyes is unmistakable.

He carefully unbuckles the seatbelt holding me upside down. He catches me before my body shifts too much and dislodges the glass. Slowly, he drags me out of the wreckage, pulling me across the road just as the car erupts into a massive fireball.

“Go!” I gasp. “The human cops will be here soon.”

“I’m not leaving you.” Julian rips my shirt open, applying pressure around the wound with all his strength. “It might not have hit your heart.”

‘If it did and you remove it, I die.’

‘If I don’t, you’ll die anyway from blood loss and failed healing. What about Athena? What about the twins? You know Ethan will take her if you’re gone! You know she’ll never be the same if she loses you.’

I turn my head and spit out the blood filling my throat. I try to link Athena, but Nyx has blocked her off.

“Are you trying to piss off a dying man?”

“You’re not dying.” He wraps something around the glass and yanks it out, tossing it aside. He presses his hands firmly against the wound. His eyes glaze over.

“Who are you linking?” I cough up more blood.

“My sister. If anyone can help, it’s her!”

Sirens wail in the distance. No one had passed us or stopped, meaning someone else alerted them. The other car that hit us is long gone.

“You have to go!” I snap.

“Not a chance. I made the mistake of following your orders before.” He prods at my wound and smiles. “It missed your heart.”

“Are you sure?”

“Isabella said you’d be dead by now if it had. And you’re healing. The cuts on your face are already gone.”

I look down. The wound is knitting itself together. A thick pink line forms, gradually thinning until it looks like I was never injured.
###Chapter 0131

“You’re not going to like what I have to say.” He muttered, avoiding my gaze.

“Athena ran?”

“Sebastian and a few others are searching for her. They’re trying to find her before Ethan does.”

I sat up coughing, the sound of sirens growing louder.

“We need to leave.” I said as he helped me stand.

“You want to go home? What about Sophia?”

I shook my head. “We just need to go. I can’t deal with humans right now. I need somewhere to think.”

We moved quickly. When I glanced down, the wound had vanished completely, as if it never existed. Relief washed over me. Death had never frightened me before. But now it wasn’t just about me. I had a mate. And twins on the way.

We found an abandoned house and collapsed on the dusty floor.

“I hate humans.” I muttered.

“That guy who hit us?” Julian asked quietly.

“Who else?”

“It wasn’t a human.” Julian murmured. “You were knocked out. The driver stopped, got out, and looked in at us. Then he laughed and drove off.”

“You’re saying it was a Wolf?”

He nodded. “Whose territory are we in?”

“It’s neutral ground.” I closed my eyes and tried linking Athena again.

“Are you sure?”

“I know every pack from here to Nathan’s territory. This is neutral.”

“I think you might be wrong.”

When I looked at him, he was staring past me.

I turned. A large black shadow crouched at the top of the stairs. Beady eyes fixed on us. It slowly rose to its full height, moving into the light. A Lycan.

It growled, drool dripping from bared teeth.

“Another fucking one!” Julian snapped. I glared at him.

‘I thought we killed them all.’ Titan muttered. ‘How did one escape?’

I focused on the Lycan. “We’re looking for someone. A girl with red hair. She’s like you. Taken from her home. From her family.”

It growled again.

“My mate is a female Lycan Alpha.” I tried, hoping for some reaction.

It moved away from the stairs, disappearing around the corner. Minutes later, a blonde female took its place.

“A young girl?” The blonde asked.

“She’s fifteen.”

“Why are you looking for her? You’re Wolves.”

“Like I said, my mate is a Lycan Alpha. The girl is like a little sister to her.”

“I had one of those once.” Her brown eyes remained fixed on me.

“I’m sorry.”

She snorted, folding her arms.

“Did you kill her?” Julian asked.

Her face hardened. She pulled her collar aside, revealing a bite mark on her collarbone, just like Sophia’s. “What do you think?!”

“How long ago were you bitten?” I asked.

“Why does it matter, Wolf?!”

Titan laughed. Normally I would have too. But maybe we could use her help.

“We were attacked back in my pack. The ones leading it had bitten humans. Changed them forever.”

She leaped the entire staircase, landing inches from me. “Was her name Victoria?”

“Yes.”

She smiled. “I can’t wait to kill her.”

“You’re too late. His mate killed her.” Julian muttered.

The blonde frowned, then smiled. It made her look dangerous. As she smiled, I noticed an old scar above her lip.

“Good.” she muttered.

“You got away?” I asked. I wanted to know how she’d survived without a pack.

She rolled her eyes as if it were obvious. Turning away, she headed back toward the stairs. “I haven’t seen the girl you described.”

“Please,” Julian muttered.

The blonde looked back at him. “You care for her?”

He didn’t answer, but I saw it in his eyes.

“The man who had her kidnapped isn’t a good man.”

“Who is?!” she snarled.

“They want her to produce pups.”

Her eyes narrowed to slits. “Didn’t you say she’s fifteen?”

“Yes.”

She sucked in her cheeks, staring at us. “I’ll help you, Wolf. But I want something in return.”

“What?”

“Money.”

“Seriously?” Julian interrupted. “She’s one of you.”

“I named my price. Take it or leave it!”

“Deal.” I muttered, holding out my blood-covered hand.

She shook it. “You can call me Brianna.”
###Chapter 0132

Trigger Warning- Talks of miscarriage

Athena

I ran.

My feet moved on their own.

The pack's voices echoed behind me.

They called out promises.

They said they could help.

They said Alexander would be fine.

He wasn't.

I felt it.

The pain intensified.

It clawed at my heart with every step.

'What's the plan?' Nyx's voice was tense.

I have to find him!

Tears threatened to fall.

'Athena, he left hours ago. We can't find him on foot.'

I have to try.

I burst through the final line of trees.

The boundary lay before me.

I had never crossed it alone.

The old panic returned.

The fear of the snow.

The fear of the unknown.

"ATHENA, STOP!" Sebastian's shout came from behind.

I turned.

He moved carefully through the trees.

His eyes were downcast.

His frown was deep.

The pain shifted.

It moved from my heart.

It sank deep into my abdomen.

"You're lying." A single tear escaped.

It traced a path down my cheek.

"I feel it." My hand pressed against my chest. "He's gone, isn't he?"

'Something's wrong.' Nyx's murmur was laced with fear.

"Alexander is alive." Sebastian's voice was firm. "You were right, he wasn't. There was a car accident. Glass impaled him. It missed his heart. Julian saved him." He took a slow step toward me. "I swear it, Athena. Our Alpha lives. But right now, you need a hospital."

"For Alexander?" My voice was a whisper.

"No. For you."

"I need to see him."

"I know. But he's miles away. You are the priority."

The pain spread.

It shot into my hips.

It burned down my thighs.

That's when I smelled it.

The metallic scent of blood.

My eyes dropped to the ground.

Spots of red stained the grass.

Drops marked the fallen leaves.

A trail led right to me.

"Let me help." Sebastian held out his hand.

He caught me as my knees buckled.

He swept me into his arms.

He ran.

The forest blurred around us.

Pain radiated through my core.

"Am I losing them?"

Sebastian didn't answer.

I felt Nyx pacing in my mind.

Her worry mirrored my own.

'I killed my pups, didn't I?' I whispered to him.

He held me tighter.

He pulled me close to his chest.

Just like Alexander would.

My tears fell freely.

Sebastian crashed through the hospital doors.

"In here!" Isabella's voice was sharp.

He laid me on the bed.

Isabella immediately lifted my top.

She ran a scanner over my stomach.

"Well?" Sebastian demanded.

"Two heartbeats." Isabella's tone was focused. "Two strong heartbeats."

"Then why is she bleeding?" he pressed.

"If I knew, I wouldn't be running tests, would I!"

"Are they really okay?" I asked, too afraid to look at the screen.

She offered a small smile. "They seem perfect."

More tests followed.

No cause for the bleeding was found.

She ordered bed rest for several days.

She promised to recheck me then.

"I can't. Sophia is missing. Alexander is hurt. I still have Ethan to deal with. And that ridiculous party tomorrow?"

"Not a fan of parties?" Isabella tried to lighten the mood.

I glared.

She knew I'd never been to one.

"Just take it easy until then. If the pain worsens, tell me immediately. I'll be at your side during the party. If anything happens, I'm there."

"What's wrong with Sebastian?" I nodded toward the door.

He paced outside.

His arms were crossed tightly.

His eyes were distant.

He was linking someone.

"He's updating Alexander." Isabella gave a weak smile.

"He said he was okay?"

"Oh, he is... Maybe Sebastian should explain. He's my brother's Beta. He'll have more details."

"Tell me."

"Not my place." She turned away.

Sebastian reentered.

His smile was strained.

It didn't reach his eyes.

"Alexander's okay?"

"He's fine. They found a safe place to recover." His gaze flicked to Isabella, who suddenly found the wall fascinating.

"And?"

"They found another Lycan."

"Another?"

"She says she was turned years ago. One of the first."

"Did they kill her?" I already knew the answer.

"No. She's going to help them."

"Help?"

"It seems this Brianna was also bitten by Victoria."

"Brianna?" A cold dread washed over me.

My body began to tremble.

It couldn't be her.

"No. No, no. You heard the name wrong."

"Athena, what is it?" Isabella asked.

"I know her."

"How? That's not possible. They're miles away." Sebastian frowned.

"She was at Silver Creek. Not for long. A few months."

"A slave?" Isabella questioned.

I shook my head. "She was their pet."

"Brianna?" Sebastian sank into the chair by my bed.

"She appeared one day. Victoria brought her to the house. She was all smiles and laughter. Then, after a few days, something changed. A darkness took over her." I paused. It reminded me of myself. The girl who became happy to rip out hearts.

"What do you mean?" Isabella's voice was soft.

"She joined them."

"You mean she hurt you?" Sebastian leaned forward.

I nodded.

The memory was brutal.

It was just before my final binding.

"She grabbed my shoulders. She smashed my head into the concrete basement wall. Over and over. Blood sprayed the walls. The floor. I lost consciousness. I never saw her again after that."

Sebastian and Isabella exchanged a long look.

"Surely it's not the same one?" Sebastian muttered to her.

"How long ago?" Isabella asked.

"When I was seventeen. Almost eighteen."

"Five years. It can't be her."

Sebastian sighed. "What did she look like? I can have Alexander confirm."

"Blonde. Brown eyes. A scar." I touched my face. "Right above her lip."

"I'll be right back." Sebastian strode out.

"Alexander can handle himself." Isabella gave a weak smile. "If it is her, people change. Five years is a long time."

"Or she's filled with so much rage she'll kill him the first chance she gets."
###Chapter 0133
Alexander

Are you completely certain she's alright? I mind-link Sebastian.

Isabella has examined her thoroughly. The twins are unharmed. Your sister believes it's stress-induced and has ordered complete bed rest. Athena believed you were dying. She didn't even realize she was bleeding until I located her. I still don't understand what she was thinking when she fled.

She wasn't thinking. Her only thought was reaching me. I respond silently. Keep her protected. We will monitor this Brianna situation.

You're allowing her to live?

Currently, she might be our only lead to finding Sophia.

Will you return tonight?

I'll try. No promises. If I don't, you know the protocol.

Of course. Alexander, be careful around that woman. She sounds completely unhinged. Everyone is tense.

I still couldn't believe we encountered another one of my mate's past tormentors. We were hundreds of miles from home. In a completely different territory.

I glance at my brother dozing nearby. We agreed to alternate watching our Lycan housemate.

Finished communicating with your pack? Brianna asks from the staircase.

Just checking on my mate. I had mentioned my mate was a female Alpha. Did she know I meant Athena? She must.

I think she knows. Titan grumbles.

Is she alright? She sounds genuine. But she might be practiced at faking concern.

Resting. I offer a brief smile. I would share minimal details for now.

A long conversation for someone who is resting. Her brown eyes fix on me.

She's suspicious. Titan mutters.

I would be too in her position. I tell him.

I give Brianna a reassuring look. I also checked in with my Beta. Leading a pack doesn't pause just because I'm absent.

She nods slowly.

Do you live alone? I ask, surveying the dilapidated house.

Brianna raises an eyebrow. She puffs her cheeks, considering her response.

Mostly.

My brother mentioned another during the crash. Are there more of you?

We're playing with fire. Titan warns.

A few. Brianna states.

All bitten?

She nods and stands. Probably Zachary that crashed into you. He dislikes Wolves. Honestly, he dislikes everyone.

This is neutral territory.

Her eyes lock on mine as she descends the final steps. You all say that. Everyone passing through says that. No Alpha here doesn't make it neutral.

Her temper flares as she approaches. Wolves think they know everything.

You're right. My error. Have you claimed it?

We did! We made it safe for our kind.

I only learned of your kind this year. I say, attempting to divert her.

Because of your mate?

I nod.

And she's a female Alpha?

Yes. I couldn't lie after already telling her.

She stares directly into my eyes. The girl in the basement. Her harsh expression softens. She's alive?

I remain silent under her gaze.

I thought I killed her. Is she... truly alive? You must tell me!

Yes.

Brianna steps back. She leans against the wall, a faint smile forming. She's really alive?

Yes. I repeat.

She sighs deeply. You know what I did, don't you?

I've been told.

By the basement girl? Your mate?

Yes.

Then you don't know everything.

She slides down the wall, landing heavily on the floor. She scowls and picks at a hole in her worn jeans. I was told she was a thief. That they were holding her prisoner until deciding her fate.

She snorts bitterly. And I was foolish enough to believe them. I'd seen her a few times before. Always working in the house. I thought she was hired help. I didn't even know her name. Then I was bitten.

She runs hands through her dirty blonde hair, sighing. They put her in the basement the day before I was bitten. Told me she stole family heirlooms. I was stupid enough to believe it. Stupid enough to trust Victoria.

She shakes her head, leaning back against the wall. When that bitch bit me, something took over. I was so angry. I couldn't control it. I couldn't bury it deep like I usually did.

She sent me down into that basement. Told me to have fun. They said the female needed punishment.

A single tear escapes, tracing down her cheek. She wipes it away quickly, pretending it never happened. Her screams still haunt me.
###Chapter 0134

“What did you do to her?” Julian demands.

I hadn’t even realized he was awake. I wondered how much he had heard.

“She begged me. Tried to convince me the people upstairs were deceiving me. Claimed it was her home. That her parents owned the house.” She paused, voice dropping. “Only looking back do I understand—I didn’t see how sick she was. How frail. The shadows under her eyes. All I saw was the ‘liar’ Victoria had warned me about. And I believed every word.”

Brianna lowered her head. “She didn’t fight back. She was too weak.”

Listening to her was horrifying. It also revealed how much Athena had kept from me about her past. Or perhaps it was a memory she had forced herself to forget.

“Even now, I still hear the sound—her skull cracking against the wall.”

“You shifted?” Julian asked.

“No.” She shook her head. “I was just furious. And suddenly, I had the strength of a Lycan.” Her eyes locked on me. “Is she truly alive? You’re not lying to make me talk?”

“She’s alive.”

“But how? She shouldn’t have survived that.”

“The Moon Goddess wills it,” I murmured.

“How did you know she was an Alpha?” Julian pressed.

“I overheard them talking. I didn’t know what ‘Alpha’ meant. Not until I escaped. Not until I met others.”

“Victoria kicked you out after?” Julian continued, skeptical.

“No. I was so disgusted with myself, I ran. I didn’t stop until her voice—Victoria’s demands—faded from my mind.”

“What about the others?” Julian’s tone was doubtful. “If you were the first, how are there more in this area?”

“We found each other. Or rather, they found me.”

That’s bullshit! Titan snapped.

“Were they all bitten by Victoria?” I asked.

She nodded. “For someone who rarely shifted, she loved creating us.” She glanced toward the broken window. “The sun’s rising. We should get ready to move.”

Brianna headed upstairs. She didn’t seem worried about leaving us alone. Maybe there was truth in her story after all.

I don’t buy it. Julian’s voice echoed in my head. She’s playing the victim card. I don’t trust her.

You don’t have to. She said she’d help us find Sophia. All she wants is money. I can provide that.

Julian frowned. I thought you’d want her dead after what she confessed.

I do. But that won’t help us find your mate, will it?

“Don’t call her that!” he snapped.

Brianna reappeared, eyeing us suspiciously. “What are you arguing about?”

“Sophia,” I muttered.

She nodded slowly, but her eyes narrowed. “Right.” Her tone made it clear she didn’t believe us.

She dragged a heavy bag down the stairs. It thumped loudly with each step.

“What’s in there?” Julian asked.

“Weapons.” Her gaze shifted to me. “Where do you think they took this girl?”

“Somewhere called Shadow Peaks.”

She laughed. “Shadow Peaks? You packs need better naming skills. But I know the place.”

“What do you call yourselves? The ones who got away?”

“Rogues. And we are not a pack.”

“Rogues?” Julian repeated.

“We don’t belong. And we don’t want to.” She spat the words out.

“But you’ll help us?”

“As long as you don’t do anything stupid.” She smirked.

She led us almost a mile from the house to a beat-up car. Tossing her bag into the back, she ordered, “Get in!”

Brianna slid into the driver’s seat, gripping the wheel tightly.

“We don’t have all day!” she snapped. “The sun’s up. Don’t you want to find your mate?”

“Get in,” I told Julian.

He took the back. I sat up front beside her.

She hit the gas, driving like the road was hers alone.

“Will you chill? We don’t need cops chasing us!” I warned.

She grinned, eyes on the road. “No police out here.”

“Stop the car!” Julian shouted after thirty minutes.

“But we need to—” Brianna began.

“I can smell her.”

She pulled over. Julian burst out, scanning the area.

“Tire tracks,” he muttered, crouching down.

“That could be anyone’s,” Brianna said.

He inhaled deeply. “She got out. She ran!”

Julian stared at the cornfield ahead. He moved toward the fence, plucking a stem.

“What is it?”

“Dried blood,” he growled.
###Chapter 0135
Alexander

Julian begins scaling the wooden fence.
I seize his shoulder. "Wait. We have no idea what's inside."
"Does it matter? She needs help. I can track her."
"Alexander is right." Brianna whispers. "You don't know what else is in there."
'What is she talking about?' Titan questions.
"Rogue Lycans?" Julian laughs. "I've killed plenty. A few more won't change anything."
Brianna meets my gaze. "I wasn't completely honest earlier. When you asked how many, I said a few."
"Is this about that Zachary guy you keep bringing up?"
"No." Her eyes scan the cornfield nervously.
"They hide here, is that what you're saying?"
"It's worse than that! Look around, Alexander. There aren't many places to hide out here. But you should know some stay in Lycan form permanently. Like they've lost their humanity." She glances around. "How many humans have you seen since coming to this town? And no police anywhere."
"They killed the humans?"
"They feast on them."
'Disgusting!' Titan gags.
"That's why Zachary tried to eliminate us?"
She nods, her dirty blonde hair framing her face. "Zachary contains the Rogues here. He brings them bad people. Criminals. Child abusers. That sort."
"How many are there?" Julian asks, still staring into the corn.
"A dozen."
"Zachary's the only one like you?" I ask. "The only one who can still shift forms?"
She confirms with a nod.
"Screw this!" Julian charges into the cornfield.
"Don't!" Brianna grabs my arm. "You have a mate to return to. I can't be responsible for her getting hurt again."
"Julian is my brother!" I pull my arm free. "And Sophia is her family."
Rushing into the corn, I realize I'm practically blind. The tall stalks block everything. Wherever Julian went, the corn has already sprung back. I'll have to rely entirely on my nose. And that's the problem. Lycans don't have a scent when they shift.
Brianna appears beside me. "I'll help."
We move forward slowly, following Julian's scent.
After minutes, Brianna stops me. A new scent hits me. One I've never encountered before.
"Zachary, I know you're watching! Show yourself." Brianna demands.
The corn moves nearby. Dark eyes appear, though the stalks hide most of his face. He was taller than me.
"You shouldn't be here, Brianna." His deep voice rumbles.
Brianna crosses her arms, rolling her eyes. "Have you seen a red-haired girl? She's being chased by a Wolf."
"You know I see everything."
"She's one of us, Zachary. Victoria turned her."
He steps through the corn toward us. I understand why he was chosen to be turned. He's enormous.
'Enormous is putting it mildly.' Titan observes.
"Then why are Wolves after her?" Zachary demands.
"It's complicated." I mutter.
His dark eyes lock on mine, his lip twitching. "Interesting eye color for a Wolf."
I ignore his comment. "One Wolf kidnapped her as a favor. The other is her mate trying to save her."
"Right. A Wolf mated to a turned Lycan. Now I've heard everything." He shakes his head dismissively.
"It's true." Brianna says. She frowns. "Remember why I ended up here?"
Zachary nods but keeps eye contact with me. "What does that have to do with anything?"
"She's alive and sees the redhead as a sister."
"You told me you killed her, Brianna."
"I thought I did, but she... survived. Helping her sister is the least I can do to make amends."
I glance at Brianna and see more emotion than ever. The guilt. The sadness over her actions. The years of living with what she'd done.
"Why isn't she here herself?" Zachary asks.
"She's on bed rest." I stop myself from saying more.
Zachary narrows his eyes but doesn't press further. "You're lucky. The Rogues are sleeping a few fields over."
He leads us through the corn to where Nathan and Julian lie bound, gagged, and unconscious.
"Where's Sophia?" I ask.
"Sophia, you can come out." Zachary calls, standing over the unconscious men.
Seconds later, she bursts through the corn and locks her arms around my waist. "I thought I'd never see you again!"
"Which one is the kidnapper?" Zachary asks me.
###Chapter 0136

I gesture toward Nathan.

Zachary moves swiftly, yanking him upright from the ground. His teeth sink deep into Nathan’s throat, tearing it out effortlessly. He tosses the body aside like trash, spitting out the flesh. “The Rogues will collect him later.”

Zachary’s gaze lands on Sophia, who’s clinging to me. “Victoria turned someone this young?”

I nod. “Old enough to shift, though.”

“She deserved a bullet.”

“She’s already dead,” I reply.

“You killed her?”

“No. My mate. She ripped her heart out.”

He lets out a dark chuckle. “Smart woman.”

“She’s the Alpha,” Sophia whispers against my chest.

Zachary’s head snaps up, eyes scanning the cornfield. “You need to go. They’ve caught the scent of blood.” His attention shifts to Brianna. “Take them to the house. I’ll meet you.” He presses a kiss to her forehead before vanishing into the stalks.

“Sophia, go with Brianna. I’ve got Julian.”

I haul my brother over my shoulder. Zachary must have hit him hard to keep him unconscious this long.

By the time we reach the car, he’s starting to stir. “Sophia,” he slurs.

“She’s safe. You’ll see her soon,” I mutter just as he passes out again.

“Hurry!” Brianna shouts. “If they pick up your scent, I can’t hold them back.”

The car peels away the second I shut the door. Instead of turning back, Brianna drives farther north.

“He said take us to the house!” I snap.

“I heard him. He didn’t mean that dump you were hiding in.”

Sophia twists in her seat to look at me. Her blue eyes are wide with fear. “He kidnapped me! Alpha Nathan took me!”

“I know. I’m sorry. We were so focused on protecting Athena… I never thought you’d be targeted.”

“Why me? I didn’t do anything.”

“He took you for his brother.”

“Alpha Ethan?”

I nod.

Her gaze falls on Julian. “He really came for me?”

“Yes.”

“I’m still not accepting his rejection.”

“Then don’t. Maybe it’s time he learns he can’t always have his way. But these past two days showed me something—he does care. And he’ll wait.”

A small smile touches her lips. She turns back around, settling into her seat.

Brianna pulls up to a neat, well-kept house—nothing like the last place. Flower boxes line the windowsills. A white picket fence borders the garden.

“This is where you actually live?”

“The other spot was a base. This is home. Just because I’m a beast doesn’t mean I can’t appreciate nice things. Make yourselves comfortable. I need a shower.”

Sophia beelines for the fridge, muttering about starvation. I dump Julian on the sofa. His bruises have healed, but he’s still out.

The front door swings open. Zachary strides inside. He laughs when he sees Julian. “He needs to learn to take a hit. Where’s Brianna?”

“Shower,” Sophia mumbles through a mouthful of food.

“Right.” He shrugs off his jacket, revealing intricate tattoos crawling up his neck. “The Rogues know you’re here.” He sits across from me. “Once he wakes, you’re leaving.”

His eyes dart toward the stairs. He lowers his voice. “Take Brianna with you.”

“She doesn’t want that. She doesn’t want pack life.”

“He’s right!” Brianna descends the stairs, fresh clothes on, blonde hair tied back. “This is my home. And I’m not leaving without you, Zachary.”

“I have to stay. Keep the other Rogues in line. You don’t belong here anymore.”

“This is my home!” Rage flashes in her eyes, but it softens under his steady gaze. “They’re getting restless, aren’t they?”

He nods grimly. “Food is scarce. That one wolf won’t feed them all. They’re turning on each other. Three died last week.”

“Really?” Brianna whispers, sinking onto the couch. “Why didn’t you tell me?”

“Didn’t want to worry you. They’re close to turning on us.”

“You’re going to kill them?” I ask.

Zachary nods. “It has to be done.”

“This was supposed to be their safe haven. After what she did to us,” Brianna says bitterly.

“It was, once.” He moves to her side. “Go with the Wolf. See the female Lycan. Apologize. If I survive, I’ll find you. If not, you’ll need help stopping the Rogues.”
###Chapter 0137
Athena

“Are you absolutely certain I can’t assist with anything?” I ask Isabella, my voice tight with frustration. “Sitting here idle is driving me insane.”

“No. You need to remain exactly where you are. Sebastian has everything under control.” She hands me a glass of orange juice and settles onto the bed beside me. “Any word from Alexander?”

I shake my head slowly. This was the longest stretch of time we had gone without speaking. It felt profoundly strange. I knew he was safe now. I could sense it through our bond, but that knowledge did nothing to quiet my restless thoughts.

‘I’m positive everything is fine. Who knows? He might even make it back for the celebration.” Isabella offers the words with a hopeful tone.

“Sebastian already said that’s highly improbable. And we still have no strategy for dealing with Ethan.”

“Stop worrying about that. Sebastian and Theodore will handle it.”

I groan softly, taking a sip of the juice just as a sharp knock echoes from the door.

“Enter!” Isabella calls out.

Sebastian steps into the room, his gaze lowered. “Alexander is on his way back.”

“He found Sophia?” I blurt out, thrusting the glass toward Isabella.

“Yes. She is unharmed. She is secure.”

“Why does it feel like you’re withholding information, Sebastian?” Isabella fixes him with an intense stare. “I’ve known you my whole life. I can always tell when there’s more you aren’t saying. Julian is fine, Alexander is fine, and you just confirmed Sophia is safe. So what is it?”

His eyes shift to me. “You must remain calm.”

Isabella scrambles off the bed and shoves him hard in the arm. “Are you serious? You should know by now that telling a woman to stay calm has the exact opposite effect!”

He releases a heavy sigh. “Alexander is bringing Brianna here.”

My heart seemed to freeze solid in my chest. “Why… Why would he do that? You told him. You told him what she did to me. You said he verified it was the same woman. That she bore the same scar.”

“Athena, breathe!” Isabella urges as I slide from the bed and begin to pace the room.

“He’s bringing her here?!” My voice cracks, threatening tears.

Let me think! Nyx snaps, her agitation mirroring my own. ‘Perhaps… perhaps he is bringing her here so we can end her.’

“Athena, talk to me.” Isabella pleads.

Maybe he wants you to have closure.’ Nyx suggests.

A wave of nausea washed over me. Since hearing that name, the memory of what she had done had unlocked completely. Now, just like the bloody images of my parents, it replayed on a relentless loop in my mind. The searing pain, the sickening crack of my skull, my desperate pleas fading into nothingness before the darkness consumed me.

“Athena!” Isabella calls my name again, more forcefully.

“She cannot come here.” I whisper, my voice trembling.

“Okay. But please, get back into bed.” She turns her furious glare back to Sebastian. “Why in the goddess’s name would he bring her here?”

“He said he would explain everything upon his arrival.”

“I don’t understand.” I mutter, moving numbly as Isabella guides me. “He always swore he would kill anyone who ever hurt me. And now… he’s bringing her here. To my home. I’m pregnant!”

“And that is precisely why you need to rest. We will handle this.” She grinds her teeth, her eyes burning into Sebastian. “Won’t we!”

“Without question, you and the heirs are our top priority.” Sebastian states firmly.

I feel my stomach lurch violently. I knew what was coming and barely managed to stumble into the adjoining bathroom.

“Just go and keep watch on Ethan.” Isabella snaps at Sebastian as she follows to rub my back.

“This is a joke, right?” I gasp out when she helps me back to the bed.

“Alexander always has his reasons. I’m certain he wouldn’t do anything that would intentionally endanger you. Focus on the positives. Sophia is safe. Alexander and Julian are bringing her home. No matter what has been thrown at you, you have always found a way to rise above it. If you have to kill her, then kill her.”

“You’re right. I need to keep my pups safe.”

She nods and turns on the television. “Now, can we please watch this film I’ve been telling you about?”

“Why are we still proceeding with this?” I mutter as Isabella carefully walks with me toward the training grounds.

Music had been blaring for most of the afternoon. The entire pack already seemed to be in a festive mood, even though the celebration wasn't scheduled to start until sunset.

“As I’ve said, the pack needs this. It was Alexander’s idea. It kept Ethan here a little longer and it gave my brothers the chance to locate Sophia.”

And bring that bitch here.’ Nyx growls low in my mind.

“Ladies!” Ethan’s voice comes from behind us. Did he hear Isabella? “How are you feeling, Athena?”

“Exhausted.” I reply flatly. He was still playing the charming guest.

“It must be difficult carrying twin Lycans.”

“We don’t yet know if they are Lycans!” Isabella tells him sharply.

“Right. Yes, Athena did mention that. Out of curiosity, when will you find out?”

“Not for several months.” Isabella declares.

His dark grey eyes linger on me. “Several months is a considerable amount of time.”

“There is nothing I can do to change that!” I snap at him. Knowing what he had planned for Sophia made my blood boil. But his excessive interest was solely focused on the twins. More specifically, my unborn children.

“Hey, there you are!” Theodore jogs toward us. “Happy Birthday.”

“I was under the impression this was a celebration for winning the war.” Ethan states.

“It is, but we also celebrate our pack leader’s birthday. It’s a joint celebration.” Theodore informs him.

“No one mentioned it was your birthday.” Ethan grins at me. “Happy birthday, Athena.”

“It’s not an occasion I typically celebrate.” I mutter.

He watches me intently as Isabella and Theodore converse. He doesn’t utter another word, and a cold shiver traces its way down my spine. Sophia was a distraction. It was the twins he truly wanted. I could feel it deep in my bones. That was the real reason he was still here.

“Come on, Ethan.” Theodore calls out. “Come tell me about Crestwood city. I’ve always been curious what it was like for your kind. Do you still conduct pack runs?”

I release a breath I didn’t realize I was holding as Ethan follows Theodore, answering his rapid-fire questions.

“His brother is dead, correct?” I ask Isabella quietly.

“That’s what Alexander told Sebastian.”

“He hasn’t said a word about it. Not a single word. He would feel it, right? He would know his brother was killed.”

“Possibly. The bond is different when they belong to separate packs. There’s a chance he felt something. But there’s an equally strong chance he felt nothing at all. Why?”

“I believe it was a setup.” My eyes dart around to ensure we are alone. “He hasn’t mentioned his brother once. And his questions… He is utterly desperate to know if the twins are Lycans.”
###Chapter 0138
Athena

Isabella persuades me to remain at the party.
She somehow gets me to sit still and do nothing.
To let Alexander and Theodore watch Ethan while I relaxed.

I couldn’t relax.
Not even a little.
Staying calm was the last thing on my mind.

“I should just end him now!” I whisper for what feels like the hundredth time. “Just get it over with.”

‘I agree!’ Nyx murmurs inside me.

“Shifting won’t help your situation. You said it yourself—you feel pain right before shifting. And if you were a Wolf, you wouldn’t be able to shift anyway! Think of the babies.”

“I am thinking of them!” I snap back.

“I know you want him gone. Honestly, I do too. But just do this for me, okay? Let the men handle it.”

“If something happens—”

“Nothing will happen! There are too many people here. It would be suicide.”

‘I don’t think Ethan cares about that.’

My instincts screamed at me, and so did Nyx.
She hated sitting here, doing nothing.
She hated waiting when she knew we could end him in seconds and be done with it.

“Besides, what do you think his pack will do when they find out you killed him?” Isabella whisper-shouts.

“I…I don’t know.”

“Exactly. We don’t need another war. At least not yet.”

I glance toward the bar.
Ethan is seated there.
Alexander and Theodore flank him as he downs drink after drink.

“He’s going to be too drunk to do anything anyway!” Isabella says with a smile.

After a few more rounds, Ethan leaves his seat.
The other two stay at the bar, avoiding suspicion as Ethan stumbles toward the dance floor.

He lasts about three seconds there.
The moment he sees me, he wobbles in my direction.
A wide, sloppy grin spreads across his face.

“Athena.” His words slur as he stops before me. “Care to dance?”

“Resting!” I mutter.

“Ah,” he smiles, placing his hands on my stomach.
I want to vomit.
Who does that?
“The pups. One little spin won’t hurt them!”

“She’s on rest. Doctor’s orders,” Isabella says, standing.

“Pfft!” He grabs me and yanks me into the air.
He holds me against him, just high enough that my feet can’t touch the ground.

“Let her go!” Isabella snaps.

He glares at her and spins me away. “We need to talk.”

Each twirl makes me nauseous.
With my feet off the floor, I can’t break free from his iron grip.

He presses my stomach against his.
His arms coil around me.
His face comes dangerously close to mine.

“I think you’re lying to me about your precious Alpha.” The slurring vanishes completely.
It’s as if I hadn’t watched him drink nonstop.
He spins us again, moving me toward a dark corner.
I see Alexander and Theodore heading my way.
If Ethan tries anything, they’ll be too far to save me.
They need to move faster.

“Please put me down,” I say, digging my nails into his arms.

“Not until you tell me where your mate is.” His dark grey eyes narrow as he waits.

He leans in close.
His foul breath fans my face.
“You see, I know, Athena. I know my brother didn’t make it home. I know Sophia didn’t either. So I’ll ask one more time—where is your mate?”

“I already told you, he’s working in the city,” I whisper.

He spins faster, impossibly so.
His hands slide to my lower back and dig into my skin.

“Don’t lie to me, Athena. I know he killed my brother. I know it’s your birthday—he wouldn’t miss that unless something serious happened.”

“I’m not lying.”

“Spoken like a true liar,” he murmurs, smiling coldly. “Takes one to know one.”

“Let her go, Ethan.” Sebastian appears beside us, halting Ethan’s spinning.
###Chapter 0139

“Tell me where he is!” Ethan demanded sharply.

Alexander’s distinct woody scent filled the air just as he spoke. “I’m right here. And I suggest you release my mate.”

Hearing his voice sent overwhelming relief through me. He was home.

Ethan dropped me instantly, whirling to face Alexander. Julian stood tall beside him, along with Sophia. And then there was Brianna—the girl who had nearly beaten me to death.

“You murdered my brother!” Ethan shrieked.

“No, I didn’t,” Alexander replied calmly, shrugging.

“I felt him die! Don’t lie to me.”

“Yet it wasn’t me. It was a Lycan.” Alexander’s tone remained steady, though I sensed his irritation.

“Don’t bullshit me!” Ethan yelled, grabbing me and yanking me back against him. His hand closed around my throat, squeezing tightly.

I stared at Alexander, struggling for air.

The music cut off abruptly. All eyes were on us.

“It wasn’t Alexander,” Brianna said, stepping forward with her hands raised. “There are Lycans who crave flesh. It was them.”

“Bullshit!” Ethan tightened his grip. “They’re all dead.”

“Do you really believe that? I understand Dark Ridge was your brother’s pack, correct? Just before that territory, there’s a town claimed by Rogue Lycans. Your brother passed through with one of our kind as his prisoner.” She gestured toward Sophia. “He was never leaving that town alive.”

Her brown eyes locked on mine as Ethan’s hold restricted my breathing. My vision began to darken. She was the last person I wanted to see.

“So you killed him?” Ethan growled.

“No.”

‘Nyx,’ I whispered inwardly, gasping for air.

‘What about the pups?’ she whispered back.

‘There will be no pups if I’m dead. Just the claws.’

Excruciating pain tore through my body. I felt my claws extending from my fingertips as Brianna continued speaking.

Reaching behind me, I drove my claws deep into Ethan’s stomach.

He cried out in pain, releasing my throat immediately.

My feet hit the ground. I tried to run but stumbled, falling face-first into the dirt.

‘GET UP!’ Nyx screamed inside my head.

I couldn’t move.

‘ATHENA, GET THE FUCK UP NOW!’ she yelled again.

Shouts erupted around me. Warm hands slipped under my shoulders, helping me to my feet.

Brianna’s face came back into view.

“I know,” she muttered. “I’m the last person you expected to see.”

I was speechless. I had rehearsed this conversation countless times since learning she was coming. So much anger. So many words. Yet now, staring at her, nothing came out.

All my confidence vanished.

“You need to move,” Brianna urged.

“I’ll take it from here.” Isabella appeared at my side, looping her arm through mine and glaring at Brianna.

“I was only trying to help!” Brianna frowned.

“Let’s go,” Isabella said, steering me away from the crowd and the woman who had almost killed me once.

“Ethan,” I muttered once we were away from the party.

“Alexander is handling it,” Isabella snapped. She seemed annoyed, but not about the attack. Something else was bothering her.

She began inspecting my neck, though we both knew it had already healed.

“Are you okay?” I asked softly.

“Yes!” she snapped again, avoiding my gaze. “You shouldn’t have shifted.”

“It was just my claws,” I grumbled. Studying her face, I knew something was wrong. “What’s going on?”

She sighed, turning her back to me. “This is going to sound insane.”

“Insane like a pack man targeting my twins?”

“The woman with Alexander…”

“Brianna?” I spat the name.

She nodded. “She carries someone else’s scent.”

“Okay.”

“My mate’s.”

“Gabriel?” I asked, confused.

She shook her head, frowning deeply. “My new mate.”
###Chapter 0140
Athena

“What do you mean, Isabella?” I mumble as she pulls me inside.

She shakes her head, avoiding my eyes. “It’s not her scent. It’s on her. Someone she’s been close to.”

“Another Lycan?”

“I can’t tell. There’s no way to know for sure. When you first arrived, you smelled like a wolf too. But you had that strange scent from the binding. She mentioned Rogues? What if it’s one of them?”

I just shrug. I have no idea what a Rogue even is.

“I never thought… not after Gabriel.” Her eyes hold a trace of sadness.

“You loved him.”

“Part of me still does.” She lets out a soft sigh. “He was everything to me. And he threw it all away because of my brother. Because of my pack.”

“Are you worried this new mate won’t measure up?” I’m grateful for the change of subject, even if it’s brief.

“I don’t know. All I know is he’ll have to be pretty incredible for me to even think about accepting him.”

“I’d trade problems with you.” I offer a weak smile.

“Your problems are mine.” She nudges my shoulder gently. “And one of them is coming right now.”

Through the open door, we see Brianna walking toward us. Her hands are stuffed in her jeans pockets. A deep frown marks her face.

Who does she think she is, being angry? She’s lucky we let her live.

She stops just outside. Her eyes lock on me. “Can we talk?”

The nerve! Nyx snarls inwardly.

“I have nothing to say to you.” My tone leaves no room for discussion.

She nods, a faint smile touching her lips. “You don’t stutter anymore.”

I narrow my eyes. “Why are you here? Why did my brother bring you?”

“He was asked to.”

“By who?” Isabella demands.

“My best friend. Look, I didn’t want to come. I wanted to stay in my town. But the Rogues are getting out of hand. Zachary says they’re turning feral. Impossible to control.”

Isabella’s dark gaze flicks to me before returning to Brianna. “And where is this Zachary?”

“He stayed behind. He’s trying to eliminate the Rogues. He said if he succeeds, he’ll meet me here.”

“This mate of yours… is he Lycan too?”

“He’s not my mate. But yes, he was bitten like the rest of us.” She shows us the mark on her skin. “Well, almost like all of us.” Her brown eyes settle on me, and she takes a step closer. “I think you might be the only purebred left.”

“That’s close enough.” Isabella holds up a hand, stepping between us.

“I still can’t believe you’re alive.” Brianna shakes her blonde hair loose. “You should be dead. I thought I killed you.”

“Is that why you came? To finish what you started?” Isabella snaps.

“No. Of course not.”

“Then why didn’t you lead with an apology?” Isabella’s voice is sharp.

“Can anyone even apologize for something like that?” Brianna frowns. “It’s unforgivable. Words wouldn’t mean anything. I know if our roles were reversed, Athena wouldn’t be apologizing to me.”

No, Nyx murmurs. We would’ve made sure the job was done.

“You need to leave!” Isabella orders.

“I haven’t killed anyone since that day.” Brianna mumbles, ignoring Isabella. “I couldn’t. I only shift to scare people. To make them back off. I make threats, but I rarely follow through. That day changed me.”

“And that’s supposed to make me feel sorry for you?” I snap.

“No, that’s not what I’m saying. They used me too. Victoria did. She fed me lies about you. Lies I believed because I thought she was amazing. I wanted to make her happy. I wanted her to think I was worthy.”

“By hurting someone defenseless? What the hell is wrong with you?” Isabella growls.

She shrugs. “Everything.”

Brianna’s eyes shift between us. “I helped him find Sophia.”

“I can’t listen to this.” I whisper to Isabella.

She nods and tells me to go rest.

I leave them talking and head upstairs. Dominic and Victoria are dead. I thought I was done with people from my past.

I was drifting in and out of sleep when Alexander appeared. He carried the stench of blood.

“Is Ethan dead?” I murmur drowsily.

“Not yet.” He leans over and presses his lips to mine. “We’re having some fun first.”

He pulls away, and moments later the shower starts. I wait until he’s inside before sitting up. “Why did you bring her here?”

He pauses, looking at me through the glass door. “I was asked to bring her.”
###Chapter 0141

“By this Zachary guy?”

“Yes.”

“After what she did to me?”

“What she did was horrendous, I am not disputing that. And I am thankful that she didn’t kill you. But just like you are haunted by your parents death, she is haunted by what she did to you.”

“Good!” I lie back and glare at the ceiling. “She deserves to be haunted.”

He stays silent and finishes his shower while I simmer in the quiet. Soon, he slips into bed and pulls me close. “I am not asking you to forgive her. I am not asking you to become friends with her.”

“I don’t understand why she is here.” I whisper, holding back tears.

“She didn't have to help me find Sophia, but she did anyway. Without her, Sophia might not be here.”

“That doesn't answer my question.”

His hands settle on my stomach as he sighs. "I don’t have an answer right now. Or at least nothing that will make you feel better.”

I sit up and stare at him. “You always have an answer.”

He says nothing. In the dim light, I watch his chest rise and fall. This wasn't like him. He always had answers. His silence unnerved me as much as Brianna's presence.

At the breakfast table, I bury my face in my hands. I felt awful.

“Come on.” Theodore speaks gently. “You’re almost done.” He points to the book before me.

“Sorry,” I mumble.

“Alexander mentioned you weren't feeling well this morning.” He offers a kind smile.

“No one warned me about this part of pregnancy. And I'm so sick of ginger biscuits!”

He chuckles and taps the book again. “Try to focus.”

I read a few lines and look up. “Has he said anything to you?”

“About Brianna? No.”

“But he's with her right now.” I glance toward the window.

“He said he’s giving her a tour.”

“Why?”

“I didn’t get to ask. But I assume it’s so she knows her way around.”

“Do you think he’s mated to her? Is that why he’s so welcoming?”

“What?!” Theodore chokes on his drink, spilling it across the table and my book.

“It's just... I was mated to Marcus and Alexander at the same time. He could have another mate.”

“That explains why you look exhausted. Were you up all night worrying about that?”

I avoid his gaze.

“Athena, I don’t know if it’s your hormones or you’re genuinely overthinking, but there’s no way. Alexander is honest. You know how long he searched for you.” He shuts the book. “Let’s go for a walk.”

‘I’m supposed to be resting.”

“What good is rest if you’re just lying there stressing?”

Stepping into the warm morning sun, I spot Alexander standing alone. His arms are crossed as he watches the pack.

“You should be in bed if you’re not studying!” He grumbles as we approach.

“Where's Brianna?” I demand, and he raises a brow.

“Getting settled in her temporary quarters.” His crimson eyes shift to Theodore. "Give us a moment?”

Theodore says he’ll catch up later and winks as he leaves.

I take a deep breath and ask the question that haunted me all night. “Is there something between you two?”

‘I've been waiting for you to ask since I read your thoughts last night.” He smiles, trying to ease the tension.

“And?”

“No.” He pulls me into his arms. “You are my only mate. You are the one I love. You are the one carrying my children.”

“Then help me understand because I feel like I’m going crazy!” I fight back tears.

“I think she can help you.”

I open my mouth to respond, but only shake my head in confusion.

“Athena, if you’re carrying Lycans, we need someone with more experience. It’s new to you, new to most of us here. She’s not the person she was. But she’s lived as one much longer than you have.”

Images flash in my mind. Her hands gripping my face, her thumbs inches from my eyes as she slammed my head back repeatedly. Pain shoots through my skull as if it’s happening now.

“The others who hurt you kept hurting you. She left because she couldn’t live with what she did, and she’s carried that guilt ever since.”

“She told me the same thing.” I mutter.

“You don’t believe her, or you choose not to?”
###Chapter 0142

Shit, shit, shit, shit.

My feet pace relentlessly along the sterile hospital corridor. The usual silence amplifies my frantic thoughts.

‘Would you just calm down?’ My Wolf, Midnight, rolls her eyes internally.

I’m mated to a Lycan! How am I supposed to stay calm about that?’

Athena is a Lycan.’

She’s different. I actually like her. This guy… he’s friends with Brianna. That’s a major red flag. And look at the others in his group—they’re all complete jerks! We’re stuck right in the middle of some twisted Moon Goddess scheme!”

Midnight laughs at my panic. I rarely let my inner turmoil show. Thankfully, Midnight’s composure always masks my anxiety.

‘We could talk to her?’ Midnight suggests.

Brianna? We can’t do that. It would seem like we’re betraying Athena. I made it very clear to Brianna that she isn’t welcome here.’

It might be the only way to meet our second chance mate.’

What if he’s nothing like Gabriel? What if he’s horrible? What if he despises us?”

We’ll face that when it happens. The hospital is quiet as always. Go find her!’

Stepping outside, I spot Athena and my brother engaged in a heated argument. Alexander should know better. Athena is supposed to be resting.

She’s definitely grown more confident since the pregnancy.’ Midnight observes.

Hormones and past trauma.’ I mutter in response. ‘I just hope Alexander is ready for it to get worse.”

Hey?”

Sebastian startles me. I really need to stop zoning out during internal conversations with Midnight.

“Hey Sebastian, what’s up?”

“Have you seen Theodore?”

“No. He was tutoring Athena, so…” I gesture toward the arguing couple, “I assume he went home.”

“Sure.”

“Have you seen Brianna?”

He raises an eyebrow. “She was near her house earlier.”

“Her house?”

He nods. “Alexander arranged it for her.”

That surprises me. Bringing her here after what she did to Athena was unlike him.

Sebastian walks with me to show me the house. He leaves me standing a few meters away as he goes to find Theodore.

Three times I approach the door to knock.

Three times I turn around and nearly walk away.

Just as I prepare for a fourth attempt, she yanks the door open forcefully and glares at me.

“What?” She scowls. “I’ve been watching you through the window since you arrived. You made it perfectly clear you don’t want me here. So what do you want? Did you come to insult me? Call me every name imaginable?”

I could no longer smell his scent on her. She had clearly showered, washing his scent away.

“The guy. The scent that was on you. Have you heard from him?”

“Now it makes sense.” She smirks. “The questions about him. You’re mated to him. You smelled him on me, and that’s why you’re here.”

“Apparently!” I huff.
