A dry laugh escaped me. I shook my head, trying to ignore the pull of his aroma. "I'm not going there." Not yet, anyway. I needed a better strategy if she was gathering every Lycan she could find.

"Aren't you curious about the female Alpha?" His sage green eyes, speckled with blue, studied me intently.

I snorted. "I've already met her. She's not impressive."

He ran a hand over the stubble on his chin. "Why not?"

"Why do you care?"

He slid into my booth, trapping me. His scent of leather and tobacco hit me with overwhelming force. It stole the breath from my lungs. This was inevitable with so many Lycans gathering. But I was already claimed. Any move from him could destroy me.

"My whole life, I've heard stories. Stories about an Alpha like no other. We never knew when she would appear. Not until we felt that call." His husky voice sent a shiver straight down my spine. I fought to maintain my composure. It didn't matter that he was my fated mate. I was mated to Julian. I had given myself to Julian completely. I would get him back.

"You believe that nonsense."

He nodded slowly. "Don't you?"

I let out another derisive snort. He slid the glass of wine he'd sent over across the table until it stopped right in front of me.

"Not a fan of the Alpha concept?"

"No. Not her, at any rate."

He raised an eyebrow at me, then nodded. "I still want to meet her."

"You'd be wasting your time." I took a large gulp of the wine. I didn't want it to confirm my desire for him. I just needed the throbbing in my head to stop.

He smirked. The blue flecks in his eyes seemed to glow brighter. "Does she not like you?"

"It's more complicated than that."

"Right." He suddenly grabbed my chin, forcing my face toward his.

"Don't." I shoved his hand away.

"Too public?" He mused.

I yanked my jacket aside, revealing the claim mark on my collarbone. His eyes darkened instantly. "You let another man claim you!" He growled, the sound low and dangerous.
###Chapter 0305

"Don't you dare speak to me like that." My gaze locks fiercely with his. "I've eliminated men like you before breakfast."

"Then I'll have no choice but to eliminate him."

"Good luck with that. He's the Alpha's mate's brother."

"What kind of trouble have you dragged yourself into?" he demands.

"Nothing beyond my capabilities." I slide out from the booth, feeling slightly dizzy. My back cracks audibly as I stretch. He asks how long it's been since my last shift.

"None of your concern." I scrutinize him as he stands to follow me. I didn't know his name. I wasn't sure I cared. I wanted Julian back—the man I truly knew.

He seizes the front of my jacket, yanking me against him. His eyes close as he inhales my scent. Foolishly, I allow it. "I don't even know your name," he whispers, and all thoughts of Julian vanish.

"Seraphina," I mutter, surprised by my own response. I couldn't use Harrison—he'd see through it. "Seraphina Blackwood."

I hadn't used that name in years. It felt foreign on my tongue.

"Pleasure to meet you, Seraphina Blackwood." He flashes a dazzling smile, revealing perfectly straight white teeth. "I'm Levi. Levi Bennett. Most call me Lev."

"You can't interfere," I murmur, my heart racing.

"Doesn't mean I can't keep an eye on you."

"I can't do this." I push his hands away from my jacket. He was here for Athena.

He frowns, stepping back. "She wants you dead, doesn't she? What did you do, Seraphina?"

"None of your damn business!"

"I'm making it my business." His intense gaze feels like it's pulling the truth from me. I can't allow that.

"Back off!" I snap, turning toward the door. The cool night air hits me as I step outside. His hand closes around my wrist, spinning me back to face him.

"Not until you tell me what mess you're in. Did you do something to the Alpha?"

I remain silent.

"His mate?"

I press my lips tighter, willing him to leave.

"You attacked her?"

I shut my eyes, blocking out his questions.

He falls silent. When I open my eyes, Levi is shaking his head. "I, Levi Bennett, reject you, Seraphina Blackwood, as my mate."

My mouth opens, but no sound emerges. Shock, perhaps? Rejection was the last thing I expected.

"Accept my rejection!" he commands.

"But—"

"Like you said, Seraphina. You have a mate." His words drip with venom.

"I, Seraphina Blackwood, accept your rejection." The scent of tobacco and leather fades the moment the words leave my lips. He smells like any other Lycan now. Shaking his head, he walks away.

A sharp spasm tears through my chest as the bond shatters. I should be relieved. I have Julian. I will get him back. I didn't need Levi. I didn't need the man fate chose for me.

Levi disappears around the corner. My chest tightens. He's heading to Obsidian Howl. He'll tell them about me. I have to kill him. I can't let him reveal anything.

I pull a small knife from inside my jacket and sprint after him. Levi's strides are long. He ignores me when I call out.

He stops abruptly. I swing the knife at him. He's prepared, catching my wrist and squeezing until I drop the blade. "That was a stupid move."

"You can't tell them about me!"

"Or what? You'll stab me in the back? How about I beat you to it!"

Something cold plunges into my back. It drags downward from near my heart to a more central spot. The pain doesn't hit immediately. Not until I feel the warmth of blood trickling down my skin, soaking my shirt.

It wasn't him. One hand still grips my wrist, the other my hip. He had an accomplice.

He releases me. I collapse to the ground in agony. The Wolf who brought me the glass of wine stands over me. "Pleasant dreams."
###Chapter 0306
Seraphina

"Look who's finally conscious!" A sharp fingertip digs into my chin, forcing my head upright.

My vision remains blurry at the edges, but I recognize that voice instantly. Levi Bennett. "Took you longer to recover than I anticipated."

A deep, radiating pain shoots down my spine. The tightness across my skin confirms the wound has only recently closed. I attempt to straighten my posture to ease the pressure, but I'm completely immobilized. My head lolls backward, hitting a solid wall behind me. The overwhelming urge to slip back into unconsciousness battles with my rising panic.

A hand pats my cheek roughly. "Wake up, you little slut."

"I..." What the hell did they inject me with? My skull throbs violently, making the spinal agony feel insignificant.

"What dosage did you use?" Levi shouts angrily. "She's still completely out of it."

"I doubled it to be safe," another man replies.

I blink repeatedly, trying to clear the blurriness. It only intensifies the pounding in my head.

"You moron. You were instructed to use the standard dose. We need her breathing!"

I try to swallow the lump forming in my dry throat. "Where am I..."

"Don't trouble your pretty little head with details, Seraphina Blackwood. Or should I call you Harrison?"

No matter how hard I strain, my vision refuses to focus. The sterile scent of the room fills my nostrils, but it gives no clues to my location. I can smell Levi and the Wolf from the bar. No one else. If I could just shift, I could tear them apart.

Their voices begin to echo, as if the room is expanding. My heart hammers against my ribs with terrifying force.

I'd been so distracted by my fated mate that I'd ignored everything else. I failed to see the danger approaching. Now I'm paying the price. I've lost my edge.

A hand strikes my cheek again. "Stay awake, Seraphina."

"Why?" I whisper. Why would my mate do this to me?

"Every Lycan and Wolf wants you dead. It would be a pity if you died like this."

He'd already met Athena. He wasn't heading to Obsidian Howl. He'd already been there.

"You... you don't understand..."

"That you crave her position?" He laughs darkly. "We know everything. Stepdaddy can't keep your secrets."

My heartbeat slows dangerously. My body slumps sideways, colliding with a cold wall.

"No, no. You don't get to sleep now."

"I'm not..." My breath comes in ragged gasps. I'm not getting enough oxygen.

"Shit!" He grabs my legs and yanks me down onto a mattress. A hand presses against my chest. "Her heart is failing. We need her alive." "I'm not a damn doctor!" the other man snarls back.

Something sharp pierces my chest. Darkness swallows me before I can utter another word.

I jolt awake with a gasp. My hands fly to my chest, checking my heartbeat. It's racing, but not dangerously. I'm alive. That's what matters.

I'm in a windowless white room. A toilet sits in one corner. The only other furniture is the bed I'm lying on. An IV drip is connected to my inner arm. A camera blinks in the top corner. I've been dressed in a plain white gown. Everything else has been stripped from me.

How long have I been here? Where am I?

The door swings open. Levi stands there, his large frame filling the doorway. "Look who decided to rejoin the living."

"Where am I?"

"That's not your concern."

"How long have I been here?" My back feels surprisingly good. No tightness from recent healing.

"Five weeks."

"Five weeks? Why are you doing this? We were mated before you rejected me."

"Funny what a special mixture can achieve."

I scramble off the bed, ready to attack. The IV tube tugs sharply at my arm, sending a jolt of pain through me.

"Careful. That's keeping you alive."

"Go to hell!" I rip the tube out and charge at him. I'm determined to fight with everything I have, but a sudden dizziness overwhelms me.

He catches me before I hit the floor and carries me back to the bed. He reinserts the IV just as other women's screams echo from somewhere. They're demanding to know where they are. What kind of place is this?
###Chapter 0307

"You appear disoriented." He murmurs while examining the remaining fluid in the IV bag.

"I assumed this was about Athena."

"The Alpha holds no interest for me. Daniel did, but Daniel is deceased."

"The Wolf from the bar?"

"Correct." He adjusts the blanket over my legs, and only now do I notice my weakened sense of smell.

"What have you administered to me?"

"I needed to ensure you couldn't shift. You create significant problems for our kind, don't you Seraphina. I cannot permit that."

"I'm compensated, and they all warrant it."

"Oh, I'm aware. Although I've been cleaning up your mess for quite some time. Ensuring Humans don't discover us."

More screams and shouts echo from the hallway, both male and female. How many were imprisoned here?

"All Lycans?"

"Not exclusively."

As I stare at him, I attempt to summon my Lycan forward. If devouring him means freedom, I would. But nothing happens.

He smirks at me. "I wouldn't bother. It's ineffective."

My gaze shifts to the IV drip; it must contain something.

Levi laughs. "You require it to survive. Your choices are to live here without your Lycan or perish."

He strides toward the door. "Breakfast will be delivered shortly." He begins to close the door. "Remember this. You believe you are formidable, but there is always someone far more dangerous."

He has no conception of who he's confronting.

I lie still, staring at the pristine white ceiling. Not a single speck of dirt marred its surface. No tiles to count for passing time, nothing. This place was designed to drive us insane. But I am accustomed to solitude with my thoughts.

Breakfast is oatmeal in a plastic bowl. Delivered by an older woman with salt-and-pepper hair. Her grey eyes are vacant. She moves almost mechanically. Not a single word escapes her lips. She avoids all eye contact. What leverage does Levi hold over her?

A different woman arrives thirty minutes later to collect the breakfast dish. She's younger than the first, perhaps in her thirties, but again, there is no eye contact. I began questioning if this was a dream, it felt surreal.

Taking my IV bag with me, I sit in the corner directly beneath the camera. I didn't know if this position hid me from view, but it made me feel slightly less observed.

I fiddle with the IV line, disconnecting and reconnecting it, testing how long I could last before feeling near death. I couldn't exceed five seconds. It wasn't enough time to mount an attack, but perhaps the tubing could be used. It was long enough to wrap around someone's neck.

I startle at a knock on the door. The inability to hear approach was unnerving. I remain silent as the door swings open. Levi's eyes find me instantly.

"On your feet."

"Why?"

"Always so inquisitive." A slight smirk plays on his lips. "Get up."

I rise slowly.

"Bring it with you or you won't get far."

I push the IV stand alongside me as I step into a white corridor lined with multiple doors. Some occupants bang on their doors while others remain quiet or sob behind them.

"Move!" Levi snaps, shoving me forward.

My bare feet shuffle slowly, one before the other, as I try estimating how many are here. And what they might have done to end up here. We reach a door and Levi uses a key to unlock it. He locks it behind us as well.

"Where are you taking me?"

He remains silent, pushing me onward. "Is this retaliation for what I did to Athena?"

"I told you, the Alpha doesn't concern me. Though many would consider it treason." He directs me into another room and points to a chair. "You've met her?" I was beginning to suspect he hadn't. He might know her name, but seemed unaware she was mated.

"Why does it matter to you?"

"Because if you had met her, you would know we are siblings."
###Chapter 0308
Zachary

Lycans now outnumbered Wolves within Obsidian Howl.
This shift occurred a week ago.
It marked the first instance I witnessed Alexander appearing slightly unsettled.
He never voiced it outright, but a Lycan majority posed a potential threat.
Theoretically, we could challenge the Wolves' authority.
Yet, every single one of us remained solely for Athena.

Five weeks had passed, and more Lycans continued to arrive.
I always knew our numbers were greater, but never this substantial.

Many had also perished during their journeys.
Lucas took immense pleasure in that fact.
He remained an asshole, and my trust in him was still absent.
However, he was honoring his word.
He also seemed beneficial for Lottie.

Lucas moved through the open space between the packhouse and the first row of homes.
He conducted his bizarre training routines.
A crowd had gathered, particularly teenage girls who enjoyed watching him exercise.
He tolerated their presence as long as they were Wolves.

"Watching him again?" Alexander muttered, stepping through the front door.

"Just as you watch the Lycans."

"You realize Luc is still seeking a method to bind Nyx. He isn't obligated to do this."

"He's been searching for a solution for nearly two months. Shouldn't he have discovered something by now? Especially with another Hunter's assistance."

"Theodore is nothing like Luc. You already understand that." The revelation about Theodore was profoundly shocking. Comparing him to Lucas highlighted their extreme differences. I struggled to comprehend how Theodore could be a Hunter, particularly since he loved Athena.

"Perhaps it's simply impossible." I stated. "Even if it is possible, we both know the process could kill her. You cannot risk that. Athena must learn to control it."

"What if I told you he has already identified a couple of potential options?"

He had my complete, undivided attention. I tore my gaze away from Lucas. "What?"

"He found a few options. Neither guarantees Athena won't be harmed during the process. One idea originated from a Witch. However, upon learning Athena had been bound previously, she informed Lucas it was not a viable option."

"Why haven't you mentioned this before?"

"I don't have to. She is my mate. I am the Alpha here."

"She is also our Alpha, Alexander. Where is she, anyway?"

"With Theodore. And before you comment." Alexander watched me closely. "Athena can handle herself. Theodore would never harm her."

I decided silence was the best response.

'Julian moved!' Isabella's voice echoed sharply in my mind.

'Isabella...'

'He moved!'

'I'm on my way.' I looked at Alexander. "Julian moved?"

"It's probably just..." His words trailed off as his crimson eyes glazed over. "Come on."

We hurried toward the hospital. He shouted for Lucas to join us. I rolled my eyes. "What did Isabella tell you?" I asked as we crossed the grounds.

"His eyes are open."

"That's impossible." Lucas frowned, an expression seemingly permanent these days.

We burst into the hospital.
We headed straight for Julian's room.
The pillows had been removed from under his head.
The bed was laid completely flat.
His eyes were wide open but entirely unresponsive.
The tube in his throat continued its mechanical work, forcing air into his lungs.

"His hand moved." Isabella whispered. Her own dark eyes were as wide as Julian's. "And he opened his eyes." She gestured toward his face.

I examined Julian's hands. They rested in precisely the same position as always.
This wasn't the first time Isabella claimed he had moved.
Her desperate desire for him to live made her see things that weren't real.
But his eyes being open was a new development.

Alexander clenched his jaw, his eyes scanning his brother's lifeless form.
He had confessed to saying goodbye to Julian long ago.
But he believed Isabella needed more time.
His crimson eyes shifted to Lucas.
Lucas shook his head.

"Isabella, it's time to turn off the machines." Alexander told her, his voice firm.

"You said he would heal." She glared accusingly at Lucas.

"He is not healing. He hasn't been for a while." Lucas replied bluntly. “I have stated this repeatedly. He is not recovering. You must let him go. Forcing him to exist in a world that has no place for him is cruel. You are sacrificing your own life hoping for a miracle. That miracle is not coming."

"He's my brother." I felt her agony. Her longing for him was as powerful as her will for him to awaken. Her denial was equally severe.

"We will proceed with this. You can be by his side, or not." Alexander told her, his tone leaving no room for argument.
###Chapter 0309

"You can't do this... I'm the pack physician. I know what's medically best for him."

My hands rest firmly on her shoulders, giving a gentle squeeze. She needed to feel my presence, to understand she wasn't facing this darkness alone.

Alexander moves with grim determination, switching off the ventilator that had been breathing for Julian. The heart monitor goes silent next, its steady beeps replaced by deafening stillness.

Isabella's sobs break the silence as we watch, waiting for any flicker of life. Nothing happens. No movement. No twitch of fingers. No faint heartbeat.

She collapses to her knees, her breathing becoming ragged and panicked. Her chest heaves with desperate, gasping breaths.

"GO!" I command Alexander and Lucas, pulling my mate tightly against me.

Isabella claws at her own chest, and I have to lock my hands over hers to prevent self-injury. She thrashes wildly, pounding her fists against me with frantic energy, trying to escape the unbearable pain. I hold her steady, knowing this was the brutal moment of accepting her twin was truly gone.

Time loses meaning as we remain on the cold floor. Minutes or hours pass before her struggles cease. She stares blankly at Julian's still form. "Alexander turned off the machines," she whispers, her voice broken.

"He was already gone, Isabella."

"He took my brother from me."

"No. This was Seraphina's doing." She had to remember who truly caused this tragedy. Seraphina made Julian try to kill his Wolf. Seraphina weakened him until nothing remained. Alexander merely performed what should have been done weeks earlier.

"Seraphina," she whispers, the name tasting like poison.

"Seraphina twisted him into something unrecognizable. You witnessed the change yourself. Remember who he was before her influence."

"He loved life completely," she says softly. "He was vibrant. He was joyful. An absolute nuisance sometimes, but always happy."

Her tense body gradually relaxes against mine. "Revenge destroyed him, Isabella."

"Why did he stay with her?"

"From what Brianna revealed, I doubt he had any choice. Seraphina forced him into the life she designed. She likely saw him as her opportunity." She pushes herself up from my lap and approaches Julian. With trembling hands, she removes the breathing tube and gently closes his eyes. Cupping his face, she whispers her final goodbye. A single tear traces down her cheek as she draws the sheet over him.

Isabella returns to me, her gaze lowered. "I need to sleep," she murmurs. "Midnight needs to rest."

It had been too long since she willingly sought rest. "Then let's go home."

As we exit the pack medical facility, Alexander waits by the doors. He immediately pulls his sister into an embrace, though she remains unresponsive in his arms.

Part of me wishes he hadn't prolonged this suffering, but I understood his motives. He had been trying to preserve Isabella's hope.

Theodore passes by with a solemn nod and enters the facility. Likely to prepare Julian for cremation. Little remained to be done except placing him in the casket Alexander had prepared over a month ago.

"Let's get you home," Alexander whispers gently to his sister.

An eerie silence blankets the pack territory as we walk toward the house. Wolves pause as we pass, respectfully lowering their heads. The unusual quiet feels unsettling. No chatter, no children playing. Everyone feels the loss deeply. Perhaps they sense Alexander's grief, though he conceals it well.

Whatever the reason, their profound respect for their Alpha is unmistakable.

Isabella ascends the stairs alone, insisting I remain behind. "I just need to crash," she offers a weak smile.

"I'll check on you soon."

She shrugs and continues upward.

"She requires time," Alexander tells me, turning toward his office.

"Time? Says the man who kept his brother on life support indefinitely. Isabella's depression could have been addressed long ago instead of watching her deteriorate before my eyes."

"Everyone grieves differently."

"Including you?"

"I accepted his death long ago."

"Did you? What I witnessed suggests otherwise."

"How I feel is none of your concern!"

A crash from above interrupts our confrontation. I'm out the door before him, taking the stairs two at a time with Alexander close behind. I sprint toward our room while Alexander bursts through his bedroom door.

Isabella lies unconscious on the bed. She didn't even undress before collapsing starfish-style across the blankets. I quietly close the door just as Alexander calls out to me.

In Alexander's bedroom, he stands frozen before Athena with wide eyes. But Athena isn't in human form.
###Chapter 0310
Athena

"OW!"

My back slammed against the floor.

The impact knocked the air from my lungs.

I lay there, stunned.

Pain radiated through my entire body.

My energy was completely drained.

Practice was over for today.

There's only so much bone-breaking one can handle in a single afternoon.

'Better.' Nyx murmured. 'Almost there.'

I'd been secretly training for weeks.

Shifting into my Lycan form without Nyx's assistance.

It was far from easy.

I gained newfound respect for those who could shift unaided.

Weeks ago, I finally gave in.

I spoke to Nyx directly.

I demanded to know why she kept forcing her way forward.

Her answer remained unchanged. 'I'm protecting us.'

My mind and body had fought so hard to keep her out.

But it was becoming impossible.

She was a constant presence.

A part of me I couldn't suppress.

No matter how much I didn't want her in my head.

I resisted her.

Every waking moment, I tried to block her out.

I wished she'd stop sharing her opinions.

I hoped she'd just give up.

But she never stopped.

The more I pushed, the harder she pushed back.

"I want the darkness gone." I muttered one day. "I want you gone."

I never wanted to become a monster.

I never wanted to become something that fed on blood and flesh.

I still don't.

'Know what makes us superior?' She asked during one heated argument. 'Our blood.'

'I don't understand.'

'We're better than the others. Stronger. More powerful. A Lycan leader. You know it!'

I laughed at her words that day.

Then I noticed Alexander watching from a distance.

A dark expression on his face made me retreat into the training hall.

I didn't want his opinion.

Not while he silently tortured his mate, Hannah.

'Does it frighten you?' Nyx asked one night after putting the twins to bed.

I didn't need to ask what she meant.

I knew exactly what she referred to.

'Of course it does. I'm none of those things you claim I am.'

'Because you still doubt your capabilities, Athena. You still don't trust me. That's what holds you back. We are one. Neither can survive without the other. This is who we're meant to be. You treat me as separate instead of accepting me as part of you. Look at Julian, he's dying without his Wolf.'

Her words made me question everything.

Was she right?

Was I responsible for my own struggles?

'You need to practice shifting.' She declared when I said I'd listen.

'I can't... I'll become..'

'No you won't, Athena. Trust me. Trust yourself.'

Now, almost three weeks later, I'm lying on the bedroom floor.

Alexander and Zachary stare down at me.

The secret is officially out.

I inwardly groan.

I wanted to keep it quiet until I was certain.

Certain I could shift without asking Nyx to do it for me.

“Athena?” Alexander's single word drips with doubt and annoyance.

He stands over me.

He hates when I keep secrets.

It wasn't meant to be a secret.

Just a surprise.

Like tada, I figured something out without his help.

I raise my claws to acknowledge the men.

My heart hammers in my chest.

Shifting is getting easier and faster.

But I always crash to the ground.

Unable to maintain balance.

When Nyx pushed forward, she made it feel effortless.

'Because you keep moving. Practice while still.' she mutters, amused.

Slowly, I shift back.

My neck cracks loudly.

My back arches off the floor as bones realign.

Nyx promised it would get easier.

That the pain would lessen.

But right now, my body feels on fire.

Everything slots back into place.

I'm almost grateful I'm naked.
###Chapter 0311

I mastered nudity during practice sessions quickly.
Torn clothing would only invite suspicion and unwanted questions.

Alexander snatches a blanket from the bed.
He swiftly wraps it around my bare form.
His crimson gaze sweeps over me intently.
"Why?" he demands, voice low.

"I've been training," I murmur back.
I stretch my limbs, feeling several bones pop softly.
Lying serves no purpose now.
He’d be monitoring my thoughts closely from this point.

"Too fucking right," he states, eyes still locked on me.

"Training? As in letting the darkness in and pushing it back out?" Zachary questions.

"No." I frown, struggling to articulate it clearly.
"You claimed it was difficult. Told me once darkness enters, it’s nearly impossible to expel. That isn’t true. Brianna managed it. Gabriel did. So did you."

"Through immense effort," Zachary retorts, clearly annoyed.

"Effort for you," I mumble under my breath.
He glances toward Alexander.
"Not for me. Not anymore."

"What are you talking about?"

"Zachary, you explained Rogues carry darkness before turning. Said it’s unique for everyone. Rooted in their past. But me—" I snort, realizing how blind I’d been.
"I was born with this. It defines me. I’m neither dark nor light."

"Athena, that’s Nyx influencing you," Alexander frowns deeply.

'Of course he blames me!' Nyx mutters internally.

"No, it’s not. I fought her relentlessly. Devised plans to break free from her. But I finally paused to listen. And I learned something crucial." I shake my head and rise to my feet.
I adjust the blanket, tying a secure knot to keep it draped over my chest.
"I’m not meant to eradicate her."

"Athena..." Both men exchange glances as if I’ve lost my sanity.

Alexander shakes his head firmly.
"Athena, Luc stated—"

"Lucas Adler said plenty. He told you darkness fills my fractures. He’s correct, but his reasoning about Nyx is flawed. I tried blocking her. She was merely filling the voids to make me complete. To strengthen me. To enhance my functionality. It was never about domination—her controlling me or me controlling her. I needed to accept her. I needed to embrace what I am."

"None of us truly comprehend what Luc perceives," Alexander argues, shaking his head.
"But his experience—"

"He’s never handled a Lycan Alpha before," I interject swiftly.

I step directly in front of my mate, gazing up into his intense crimson eyes.
"There was a purpose behind my parents binding me as a child. Can’t you see? It all aligns. They were terrified. When the bindings failed, they pretended Dominic was the heir, not me. But they engineered me. The last female Lycan Alpha."

Nyx cheers internally as I boldly declare my true identity.

"I’m no longer afraid. I know exactly who I am."

"Prove it," Alexander challenges quietly.

'You’ve got this,' Nyx encourages. 'Clear your mind. Stand tall. And don’t you dare fall.'

My eyes shift toward Zachary.
"Could you turn around?" I don’t mind Alexander seeing me naked—he’s my mate and has seen me countless times—but Zachary is different.

My body begins its transformation.
Bones crack and stretch.
Fur sprouts across my skin.
The pain is sharp yet manageable.
I continue until I stand fully shifted over him.
He looks up at me, a proud smile gracing his lips.
"There you are."
###Chapter 0312
Brianna

"There you are." I smile brightly as Zachary descends the packhouse stairs. He looks distracted, his expression clouded. "Everything alright?"

"She did it."

"What?"

"Full control. She shifted."

"Seriously?" A wide grin spreads across my face. "That's incredible news. We've waited so long for this moment. How did it happen?" I watch him eagerly, anticipating the details.

"Athena's different." He murmurs quietly. "She's bonded with her Lycan spirit." His gaze meets mine directly. "That's good, right?"

"Of course it is. What's wrong with you? Why wouldn't it be positive?"

Zachary gives me a small smile. "Nothing. I suppose part of me never believed it would happen. She's fought her inner darkness for so long. I started to think it might eventually consume her. Darkness has always prevailed before."

"You're mistaken. We're both living proof that darkness doesn't always win."

He nods slowly. "You're right. I'm overthinking things." He glances back toward the staircase. "She seems genuinely happy. Both parts of her do." His attention returns to me. "You were looking for me?"

"I need your help."

He follows me to my house without question. I gesture toward the kitchen table. He exhales deeply and steps closer. His eyes scan the array of items scattered across the surface.

"Are these..."

"Yes!"

"And they..."

"Yes!" I interrupt sharply.

"And I'm the first person you're telling."

"Obviously. You're my best friend. Who else would I tell first?!"

He raises an eyebrow at me, picking up one of the numerous pregnancy tests. "What about the father?"

I puff out my cheeks in frustration. "Haven't told him yet. He asked me about having children before and I said no. Told him it was too soon after what Gabriel did to his sons. Now I'm pregnant anyway."

"You don't have a choice here, Brianna. You can't keep this from him..." His eyebrows furrow with concern. "Please don't tell me you want my help to get rid of it?!"

"No, never. Of course not. I was hoping for some wise advice. You're usually full of it!"

"You'll make a wonderful mother."

"That's your wise words?" I tease lightly. "Anyone could have told me that."

"But you wouldn't have believed them." I roll my eyes because he's absolutely right. Sebastian is my mate, but he doesn't know me like Zachary does. Nobody does. "Congratulations Brianna. I'm truly happy for you."

"What about you and Isabella?" I ask carefully. I know she suggested trying, but he hasn't shared any updates with me.

He presses his lips into a thin line and sighs heavily. "We would actually have to be intimate to make that happen." I watch his shoulders slump. "Since Julian ended up in a coma, she hasn't been in the right headspace. Now that he's gone... I don't even know where we stand."

"Where is she now?"

"Sleeping. Finally."

"Maybe proper rest will help her think more clearly."

"Here's hoping." He mutters, his dark eyes lifting to the clock. "I need to check on the Lycans." He points toward the tests. "You have to tell him, Brianna. You know who will figure it out and blab to everyone. I'm certain Sebastian would prefer to hear it from you."

I watch him leave and release my own heavy sigh. He's right. Lucas is the last person I need spreading this news.

I thought I would grow accustomed to Lucas after all this time. But knowing he's mated to Hannah and doing nothing about it infuriates me. I want to slap him repeatedly across the face.

It makes everything worse that only Athena and I know the truth. Hannah doesn't want us to say anything. She believes the other Lycans would turn against her if they knew. Athena suggested leaving the pack, but Hannah insisted this is the first place she's ever felt safe.

I make a cup of tea and carry it out to the porch. Before I can even sit down, Lucas is approaching me. He stops several meters away. "Have you seen Theodore?"

"Not since earlier." He nods and starts to turn away. "He isn't like you."
###Chapter 0313

Theodore had been completely transparent about his past discoveries. Fortunately, he and Lucas Adler shared no similarities, and I desperately wanted that to remain unchanged. Theodore possessed genuine kindness—unlike the Hunter now confronting me. I refused to let that alter.

“I never claimed he was. And frankly, your attitude doesn’t sit well with me.”

“My attitude?” I scoffed, then inhaled a mouthful of tea too quickly. It shot from my nostrils like lava, leaving me sputtering and coughing.

He smirked, and my grip tightened around the cup. I was ready to hurl it straight at him. His hazel eyes flicked to my hand, and his smirk widened into a full grin. “That pup’s already got you all riled up, hasn’t he?”

“What the hell did you just say?”

He held my gaze but didn’t repeat himself. There was no way he could already know. I was barely pregnant.

Lucas tilted his head slightly. “You heard me perfectly.” He winked and started to turn away. I launched the cup at him anyway. His hand shot out and caught it effortlessly.

He turned back and closed the distance between us, placing the empty cup carefully on the stone porch beside me. “I’ll let that slide. Just this once.”

His gaze drifted past the open doorway.

“She isn’t here,” I muttered.

“Who?”

“Your Lycan mate.”

“I don’t have a Lycan mate.” He frowned, lines creasing his forehead. Liar. Absolute liar.

“Why are you denying it?” I pressed. “Just reject her and be done with it.”

“Rejecting her would imply we’re mated. Since we’re not, I can’t reject her. I’ve told Athena the exact same thing.”

“That isn’t the truth.” He was denying every possibility. But Hannah had been certain. She knew exactly who her mate was and had no reason to lie.

He grinned at me. “It’s my truth, Brianna. My mate was everything to me. I can’t just move on.”

“How long were you together before Seraphina killed her?” I asked. Lucas had never spoken about his mate, his unborn child, or his parents.

“Twelve years.”

“Was she a Hunter too?”

“Yes. And a damn good one.”

“I’m sorry Seraphina took them from you.”

“Your apology means nothing. You had no part in it.”

“Your child… the one you lost…”

“He died in utero. Was already gone before I made it home. I couldn’t save him.” His voice grew quiet. “My advice to you—don’t act recklessly. Protect that little one. We all know you rush in and deal with consequences later. Change that. Now.” It felt less like a deflection and more like a warning.

Zachary always said everyone carries secrets they’d rather keep buried.

“Why do you care? You don’t even like our kind.”

“I never said I cared.” He turned and walked away without looking back. Almost instantly, a group of young she-wolves appeared, giggling as they trailed after him until they vanished from sight.

I linked Athena, asking if she was free to talk. I needed to tell her about my bizarre encounter with Lucas. She replied that she’d come over as soon as possible.

Getting to my feet, I caught the scent of smoke and burning wood. Peering around my house, I saw Wolves and Lycans sprinting from the forest, scooping up young children and rushing them to safety as flames engulfed the tree trunks.

Many Wolves leaped into action, ensuring everyone moved to a safe distance while others charged into the trees to combat the blaze. But the fire only grew, spreading wildly through the forest.

A hand locked around my wrist, yanking me backward as embers rained on my roof, setting it ablaze within seconds. Everything I had built over the past few years went up in flames right before my eyes.

“You need to move,” the man holding my wrist muttered.

I looked up and recognized Caleb—Seraphina’s stepfather. I hadn’t even seen him approach, but he pulled me back, away from the raging fire. Then I spotted familiar waves of red hair backing toward the flames.

“HANNAH!”
###Chapter 0314

Trigger warning. Suicide. ****
Lucas

Flames sear my skin as I charge forward.
I'm not even near the fire, yet it burns me like I'm standing in the center.
This has never happened before.

Ryken grips Brianna tightly, preventing her from rushing into the inferno.
She screams Hannah's name repeatedly, fighting against his hold.
She struggles wildly, but he doesn't let go.

Act first, think later. That was Brianna's way.
I'm almost thankful someone is stopping her from certain death.
She was one of the few Lycans I actually respected.

Sweat pours down my heated skin.
Smoke billows into the sky as Wolves and Lycans desperately battle the flames.
They pull younger pack members to safety while trying to extinguish the fire.
Every time one section dies down, another erupts in violent orange flames.
Thick, dark smoke chokes the air.

If we aren't careful, the smoke will attract unwanted attention from outsiders.

Athena and Alexander rush past me.
He joins the water chain, dousing the roaring fire.
Athena helps Ryken drag Brianna further from her burning home.

Something is different about Athena.
The black ring around her soul isn't as dark.
It doesn't pulsate like it usually does.
Every crack is filled with black, making her soul appear almost cleared.
She either let her Lycan win or she completely gave up.

I didn't want to put a bullet in her.
But I can't allow another Rogue to roam free.

Brianna's scream pulls my attention. "She's your mate!" she cries at me. "You're just letting her die!"

Ryken frowns, confused by her declaration.

"She isn't my mate," I say for the thousandth time.
My focus shifts to the forest.
I spot Hannah's red hair near the ground.
More fire races up my back.

"Brianna. Brianna, look at me," Athena says firmly, grabbing the Lycan's face. "This isn't your fault."

While Athena distracts her, I slip away.
I enter a section of forest that's already been extinguished.

Hannah's jasmine scent is easy to track.
It's quickly followed by the sound of her crying.
She lets out a piercing scream, and I feel my back flesh burn. "Hannah!"

She doesn't answer.
I'm forced to call again, hoping to stop her from self-harm.

Her chestnut eyes briefly focus on me. "No, not you. I don't need you. Go!" she whimpers from the ground.
She's lying on her stomach.
The back of her shirt is almost completely burnt away.
Her back is covered in black seared flesh and open wounds struggling to heal.

She rolls over, grimacing in pain, and deliberately shoves her arm into the fire.
Hannah releases a gut-wrenching scream that freezes my heart.
I feel fire smolder up my own arm.
It's strange, feeling something that isn't happening to me.
I never felt this with Charlotte's mother.

I grab Hannah's feet and drag her from the flames.
She needs time to heal.
But she kicks at me, shouting and demanding release. "You have to stop!" I snap.

"I can't live like this. It's too hard!"

I pull the small handgun from my hip and thrust it toward her. "Go on then, be my guest, do it." I was calling her bluff.

Her eyes widen, dancing between the gun, my face, and the fire.

"It will be quicker and less painful. Well, if you do it right."

She reaches for the gun.
A move I didn't expect.
I yank it just beyond her reach.
She was willing to kill herself over all this.

"Screw you," she growls at me.

"You've been torturing me for over a month. Do you know how it feels, knowing I'm mated to you of all people? Now let me go!" She tries to kick me again.
###Chapter 315

I block her easily, anticipating her next move as her foot aims for my groin. "Just let me go. Please!"
"You're not going anywhere."

Her chestnut eyes widen, staring at me in confusion. I notice the matches and a small aerosol can nearby.

"You started this fire, didn't you?" I demand as flames leap from one charred tree to another.

"No." The word comes out choked with desperation and sorrow. Like a child being scolded for something trivial.

"Your soul tells me otherwise. The evidence speaks for itself."

She turns away and begins crawling toward the fire, dragging herself across the forest floor despite her injuries.

I pin her to the ground, straddling her hips as she sobs beneath me.

"Why?" My voice is harsh. "Why would you do this to someone who took you in?"

"What are you talking about?" Tears streak through the soot on her face.

"You burned Brianna's house down."

"I didn't..."

"I saw it. You destroyed a pregnant woman's home."

"No." She whimpers. "That wasn't supposed to happen. It was meant for me."

Her heart races wildly. She squeezes her eyes shut, weighed down by grief and pain.

"It wasn't supposed to spread so far." She pushes weakly against me, exhausted. The burns on her arms are already healing. "You should have killed me when you shot Nathan. Please, just do it." She struggles feebly. "Or let me go. It would be easier for you."

"So you can walk into the flames and disappear? I don't think so, Hannah. Not while I feel that fire burning my skin as if I'm the one walking through it."

She grabs my hand with the gun and pulls it under her chin, locking her hands over mine. "I can't live in fear anymore. Please, just kill me?" She tries to force my finger onto the trigger, but she's too weak to move it.

Death is what she wants. An escape from me. But I won't let her go. Not yet.

"I'm not going to kill you. Not yet. But you will keep quiet about what happened and how this fire started. Do you understand?"

I lift her from the ground, cradling her in my arms. She hooks a burned arm over my shoulder. It's been years since I held a woman like this. Her jasmine scent invades my senses. I both hate it and crave it.

I can't admit what she means to me, but I can't let her destroy herself either.

Isabella and Athena rush toward us. Isabella demands I put Hannah down so she can examine her. Athena stares at me with that knowing look.

She pulls me aside. "You saved her?"

"Obviously." I glance back at Hannah.

"I thought you hated Lycans?" Athena blocks my view, arms crossed, eyes narrowed. She won't let this go easily.

"I do."

She rolls her eyes. "Have you accepted her?"

"Why the hell would I do that?" She gives me that same knowing look. I change the subject. "What about you? What happened to you?"

"I don't know what you're talking about."

"Cut the crap, Athena."

"You don't want to discuss Hannah. I don't want to discuss whatever visions you claim to see. But I can order Hannah to tell me what happened in the forest. Actually, that's a good idea. I need to test my abilities further." She smiles, her blue eyes sparkling with excitement.

"Is Nyx in control?"

###Chapter 0317
Seraphina

Each day I hoped for improvement.
Each day proved me wrong.

Levi claims this IV sustains my life.
Yet it feels like it's draining my soul.

A knock interrupts my thoughts.
The daily ritual begins.

A nurse enters to check the drip.
She places a towel on my bed.
A small soap and toothbrush follow.
I must accompany her to the showers.
Dragging my medical equipment behind me.

I attempted to use the tubing twice.
Both times brought severe punishment.
They withheld the medicine intentionally.
Just long enough to cause agony.
Repeatedly.

Levi ordered this for days.
Until I begged for death.
His response never changes.
"Think of those you murdered."
"You deserve this suffering."

I follow the nurse silently.
Most cells remain quiet now.
Inmates learned screaming wastes energy.
No one's coming to rescue us.
But new arrivals always reveal themselves.

They pound against their doors.
They demand freedom until exhaustion.
Weeks later, I still don't understand.
Why make us suffer like this?
Why remove our abilities just to imprison us?

Killing us would be more efficient.
We wouldn't drain resources this way.

The humiliation continues during showers.
I'm constantly watched.

They take my old gown.
Provide a fresh one afterward.
I return to my room.
A meager oatmeal bowl awaits.
The nurse departs immediately.

I have thirty minutes to eat.
Another nurse collects the bowl afterward.

Everything here remains brutally plain.
Bland food, white sheets, white gowns.
A constant reminder we deserve nothing.
They even performed a hysterectomy.

That happened after my first week.
Something about keeping things clean.

Bastards!

This is a prison.
Levi appointed himself warden.

My old life feels galaxies away.
The life I fought so hard for.

Ironically, I'd sacrifice anything now.
Just to contact my mother.
Or hear Athena's voice.
Any voice besides mine or Levi's.
Or someone pleading for freedom.

I place the oatmeal bowl on the floor.
Curling up on the bed seems better.
Starvation beats this existence.

The lock slides open suddenly.
Warm air rushes inside.

"Why aren't you eating?" Levi demands.
I refuse to look at him.
"Third day straight."
"Should we force-feed you?"

"Not hungry."

"Not your decision."

"Feeling unwell."

"Impossible. The drip contains everything."
"You call this survival?"
"Is this some twisted joke?"

"I'd rip this shit out myself."
"But you always stop me first."
My eyes dart toward the camera.
If we all acted simultaneously...
Who would he save first?

"This is your deserved punishment."
"Why let you die, Seraphina Blackwood?"

"Your methods are utterly deranged."
I turn away from him.
"Met many with god complexes."
"But keeping people alive for amusement?"
"That's truly fucked up."

"Minor suffering compared to your destruction."
"Your poor mother, for example."

I sit up glaring fiercely.
"Don't speak about my mother."

"She tried helping you."
"You repaid her with horror."

"Shut the fuck up!"

"You caused her immense problems."
"Made her relive terrible memories."
"Because you couldn't accept reality."
"Clung to your foolish ideas."

"I deserved what was mine!" I snarl.
He laughs deeply from his stomach.

"Life doesn't work that way."
"Perhaps things would differ."
"If your mother raised you properly."
"Maybe you'd have known Athena."

"This conversation's over."
###Chapter 0318

He gives a cold smile. "You call Athena your sibling, yet she isn't even searching for you."

"You know nothing! You have no idea who I am!" She would be looking. Maybe not in person, but she had every reason to want me dead.

He reaches out, tucking a stray strand of my wild hair behind my ear. "I know far more than you realize. But it's time this is gone." His fingers twist into my hair, yanking my head back as he calls out for someone.

The older woman from my first day here enters. She carries a tray with scissors, shaving foam, and a new razor.

"Stay still now, or I might slip and cut something important," Levi warns.

He shaves every strand from my head. The razor scrapes painfully close to my scalp. I watch dark locks fall onto the bed around me. Tears burn behind my eyes, but I refuse to let them fall. I loved my hair. But I won't give him the satisfaction. When I escape this hellhole, I will skin him alive.

Once he finishes, he grabs my face, leaning inches from me. "Next time, make sure you eat."

"You shaved my head because I didn't eat? Are you insane?"

He smirks and walks out with the older woman. The door slams shut. The bolt slides back into place. My hands fly to my head. It's completely smooth. Not a single hair remains. He's done this before.

I hate it. I hate him. I hate what he's turning me into.

I glare up at the camera, wishing I could tear it from the wall. It's too high to reach. The bed is bolted down. I keep staring, hoping he's watching. Hoping he sees the hatred boiling inside me.

He's the first person to truly outsmart me. I hate him more than I hate Athena. But I wonder what she would think if she knew about him. Would she kill him? Or would she thank him for punishing me?

Something tells me she'd want him dead.

My eyes shift from the camera to the door. Something's happening outside. I can't hear clearly. Levi took that from me. Muffled sounds echo. Footsteps. Some are running. Others sound like skipping?

An alarm blares. A red beacon flashes above my door. The noise fills the room. The bolt slides back. The door cracks open. No one enters. More footsteps echo outside. I glance at the drip bag attached to my arm. I have maybe twelve hours left. Unless I find another. Either way, I'm getting out.

Quietly, I push the door open. Bodies litter the hallway. None have drip bags. They didn't learn. Or no one told them. They made it out only to collapse.

I look both ways. Every door is open. Someone broke out. Or someone is overthrowing Levi. I don't care which.

I duck into one room. Quickly, I tie off the remaining fluid in the drip bag. Then I enter the opposite room. I find an almost full bag. That's twenty-four hours. I have roughly forty hours total. But I need to move now.

The building is a maze. I try to map the areas I've been taken to. I pass other escapees. They don't stop. They're doing the same thing I am. Collecting drip bags to survive.

One stops to look at me. His eyes travel to my shaved head, then to the bags in my arms.

"Don't even think about it," I snarl. I need enough to find a witch. That's all.

"FIND HER NOW!" Levi's roar echoes down the hall.

I duck into an empty room. Once he passes, I race in the direction he came from. I push open every door until one leads outside.

The sun is blinding. It burns my eyes. Being kept in a windowless room altered my vision. But I don't have time to adjust. I keep moving.

I run as fast as my legs can carry me. Without a Lycan, I'm painfully slow.
###Chapter 0319
Isabella

"Absolutely nothing?" I whisper, my voice thick with disbelief. A full day had passed since the flames consumed everything.

Alexander shakes his head slowly. "We've combed through every inch. The perpetrator was meticulous. They left no evidence behind."

"Any lingering scents?" I press.

"The smoke overpowered everything else." Zachary adds, his tone grim. "Whoever did this was long gone before the first spark caught. They planned this."

"So Seraphina remains a suspect?"

"We aren't eliminating anyone." My brother tells me, a faint smile touching his lips. "It's good to see you re-engaging with pack affairs."

I offer a weak shrug. "Julian is gone. I need to be useful somehow."

"That's not what I meant." His smile widens. "I've missed your presence around the house. Finding you in random corners with a tub of ice cream. Athena misses you too." He looks at me expectantly, but I can't muster a smile in return.

A heavy sigh escapes me. I'd been completely absent from Athena's life recently. She usually confided in me about everything, but we'd barely spoken since I dedicated myself to my brother's bedside vigil. I'd even missed the twins' first steps. "I'm here now. When is the funeral?"

"Tonight. It's a full moon. I believe it's the perfect night to honor him before the pack run begins."

I hadn't participated in a full moon run for months. "Will the Lycans be joining?"

"Some of us." Zachary confirms. "But many, like the Silverwood group, traditionally abstain."

"Seraphina's family?" I need to be certain I'm following. Their presence still felt strange, though Lucas Adler had personally verified their identities. "Is that a safe decision?"

"Sebastian is staying behind. He will remain at the house with Brianna, Athena, and the twins."

"Oh, Brianna isn't going either?"

Alexander begins to speak, but Zachary answers first. "She chose not to. She and Athena have developed a strong bond recently. She wants to help with the twins tonight."

"Athena allows her near the children?" I struggle to keep the shock from my voice.

"I never thought I'd say this." Alexander smiles genuinely. "They get along remarkably well."

"Oh." I can't deny the pang of jealousy that shoots through me. "So Julian will be laid to rest in the family plot?" I ask, steering the conversation back.

"Yes. Regardless of his choices, he was one of us. He deserves to rest beside our parents."

"Thank you." I mumble softly.

"No thanks are necessary, Isabella. He belonged to Obsidian Howl."

If only he had realized that himself. Zachary clears his throat abruptly, his gaze intense. Damn it. He'd caught my thoughts.

"What time?" I ask quietly.

"Sundown is just after eight. We'll begin then."

I head upstairs, glancing back briefly to see if Zachary follows. I'm alone. A part of me isn't sure that's what I truly wanted. Julian's coma had driven a wedge between us. Zachary couldn't comprehend why I devoted every moment to my dying brother, and I lacked the words to make him understand.

Wolves typically process loss with swift acceptance. There are few exceptions. From my observations, Lycans move on even faster. They grieve for a brief period, then fully accept the person's fate.

I've witnessed countless deaths where the profound sadness dissipates quickly. But this time was different because I clung to the hope that it wasn't real. Zachary simply didn't seem to grasp that.

The sound of childish giggles pulls me from my thoughts. I follow the noise. Athena is lying on her stomach on the floor while Evrin and Logan clamber over her like tiny mountains.

Somehow, I'd failed to notice how much they'd grown. They were proper little people now. Little Lycans.

The twins scramble down and waddle toward me, tiny hands tugging at my leggings, demanding to be lifted.

"They've grown." I murmur, almost to myself.

"Every single day." Athena smiles up at me. "Though they've missed their Auntie Isabella tremendously."

I lift Evrin first, gazing into his brilliant blue eyes. His small hands clumsily pat my dark hair as he giggles. Logan continues his persistent tugging on my leg.

"Does it ever worry you?" I ask in a hushed tone.

"Every single day."

"And that doesn't terrify you?"

"Are you joking?" She laughs softly. "Logan bumped his head the other day, and I went into a full-blown panic. And that was something he did to himself. Now that they're walking, they have no concept of ducking under things they used to crawl under." Her laughter is warm. "The only time I'm not worried is when they're finally asleep. You'll understand that feeling someday." She beams at me. I simply shake my head.
###Chapter 0320

"We discussed it, but then Julian happened. Zachary doesn't understand my grief. I'm beginning to believe our bond is shattered." She grimaces. "The advice I received was to communicate."

"I am communicating."

"To your mate, Isabella. He's the one who needs to understand you. He's the one who can read your thoughts, sense what you're feeling."

"Then why doesn't he comprehend it?"

"Because you were a twin who shared twin wolves. Honestly, I don't fully grasp how it works myself. I don't understand who decides these connections. I'm still learning many things, but perhaps if you talk to Zachary instead of shutting him out."

"I'm not shutting him out."

She exhales deeply. "You've barely spoken to him. He ensured you slept, ate, changed clothes. He gave you the space you needed to handle the situation. He made sure you left the hospital, even if just for a few minutes, to get fresh air. You're mistaken about your bond being broken."

I frown, realizing I hadn't considered that. In my haze of arranging everything for my brother, I overlooked what everyone else was doing. "When did you become so wise?" I muse.

She rises from the floor, takes Evrin from me, and settles into the large chair by the window. "You're not really asking about wisdom, are you? You want to know about my darkness?"

I nod and pick up a whining Logan. "No one discusses it. Are you alright?"

"Zachary and Brianna made me believe I had to fight it. That I needed to restrain it and prevent myself from going insane. Even Lucas Adler suggested something similar, but Nyx never intended to harm me. Not in the way everyone thinks."

"I don't follow."

"She was frustrated. She spent years unable to communicate with me, and when she finally could, I kept trying to suppress her." "So you were never going to turn dark?"

"I could have. If I continued rejecting Nyx, I would have eventually gone Rogue." She frowns and bites her lower lip. "The darkness that drives others Rogue is different; they become their Lycan. But I have a separate entity. Nyx has her own thoughts, opinions, and feelings. We had to unite. It was the only way."

"Alexander mentioned you were practicing?"

Athena nods at me and extends her hand. Claws slowly emerge from her fingertips, just enough for me to see before vanishing.

"It's becoming easier. And I'm not falling on my face anymore."

I smirk, and she returns it. "But you're okay, right?"

"Yes. I finally don't feel that crushing sensation." She pats her chest and smiles. "And Nyx says it's about time. But we don't have to talk about me. We can discuss anything you want."

I didn't want to talk about Julian, not to anyone.

"The new girl, the one Lucas pulled from the fire. She's a Lycan, right?"

"Yes."

"Why did he help her?" She opens her mouth. "I mean, he's a Hunter, right? So he should want to kill her, but he saved her. That's strange, isn't it?"

I look at my red-eyed nephew. He's a miniature version of Alexander, even down to the all-knowing way he looks at me.

"I'm keeping an eye on him." Athena tells me, but it doesn't feel entirely truthful.

Is this what it has come to? I mourn my brother, and they exclude me from certain things unless they decide I need to know.

"Do you think Seraphina started the fire?" I had to know something. They couldn't keep everything from me just because they think I might break at any moment.

"Honestly? I don't know. We haven't seen her. She hasn't appeared. No one has detected her scent in the forest. If it was related to her and she used someone else, then it's possible. But they said the fire..."

"Eliminated the scents," I finish.

She presses her lips together and nods. "You're asking about her because you want to make her pay, don't you?"

"She destroyed my brother, Athena. He gave up his life because of what she did to him. And he never woke up to tell me what she did. He was so stubborn, he kept that information to himself."

"You couldn't have saved him."

"I know that now, but I can ensure she pays for what she did to him."
###Chapter 0321
Brianna

"Go find Athena and Alexander for me." Sebastian commands me.

"I can mind-link her instead."

"Better if you go personally." His gaze pierces through the gates at the approaching crowd. A massive group of Lycans heading our way.

"Fine." I roll my eyes. Still no chance to tell him about the pregnancy. Maybe he already suspects. He didn't question me when I refused the pack run tonight.

I move swiftly but avoid running. Don't want to draw attention. At least a hundred Lycans approaching the gate. Abraxas claims he can handle them, but I doubt it.

Zachary and Alexander are in the office. "Where's Athena?"

"Upstairs with the twins. Why?"

"More Lycans." They both start moving. "You'll need backup."

Alexander turns to Zachary. "Gather more Wolves and Lycans. Meet us at the gates."

Finding Athena is easy. I follow her voice. She's having a heated argument with Isabella.

"So you think I should let you kill Seraphina because of Julian?" Her irritation is palpable.

"Look what she did to him!" Isabella snaps back.

"Isabella, you're not the only one who wants her dead." Athena lists names of those wanting Seraphina eliminated.

"Notice you didn't include yourself." Isabella pushes.

"Sorry, didn't realize I had to." Surprisingly good to hear Athena stand her ground.

"You've changed!" Isabella snaps. Logan and Evrin start crying.

"A lot changed while you trapped yourself in a hospital with your traitor brother."

I enter to find Evrin clinging to Athena while she glares at Isabella. Logan tries pushing away from Isabella. The pups sense the tension. I quickly free Logan, earning a growl from Isabella.

"You have no right to take my nephew."

"I do when you act like this. I'll protect them with my life." Logan buries his face in my hair. His tiny hands paw at me. He stops crying, and Evrin follows. They definitely work together.

I face Athena. "More Lycans at the gate."

"Is Seraphina with them?" Isabella demands.

"Don't know, didn't see her. But listen. You blame Seraphina, and you're right—she's a royal pain. But remember, Julian went to her first. Without that, she might not even be on our radar."

Isabella scoffs, stepping back, shaking her head. "You were my friend."

"Trying to be now. But you're stuck. You said it—you missed so much. Everything changed quickly, and you missed it all."

Her head swivels between Athena and me. "You're supposed to be on my side. I helped both of you. I..."

"That's what we're doing." Athena tells her. "You're stuck, forgetting everything that led Julian down this path. He's gone, Isabella. That was his choice."

She claps her hands. "Some friends you are." She storms out. I feel slightly bad, but she needed that reminder.

Athena sighs, squeezing Evrin tighter.

"She'll come around, Athena."

"Not sure she will. That might get her into trouble. Trouble none of us can fix."

Sadly, I think she's right.

I help with the twins. We take them to Sebastian's parents' house—on the way to the gates anyway. Athena gives me a quick hug and a wink. Different from her usual greeting. Do they know? Can't be possible—haven't told Sebastian yet.

At the gates. Abraxas is already vetting Lycans one by one. The crowd grows rowdy.
###Chapter 0322

Athena’s fingers tighten around mine. Her eyes are wide, almost startled. “I can handle this, can’t I?”

So far, the number of Lycans arriving had been manageable. Some came alone. Others in small clusters. Except for Silverwood, but even their group wasn’t large.

“Absolutely. You were born for this, Alpha Athena.”

She offers a faint smile before descending toward the gathered Lycans. She delivers the same speech she gave the others. Well-practiced. Effective. It’s what she needs right now.

Zachary watches the crowd carefully as he approaches me. “I thought Isabella might have come down with you. I hoped she’d want to see how Athena is managing everything.”

“Have you two talked?”

“Of course we have. She’s my mate.”

“You know that’s not what I meant. Have you discussed what she’s feeling?”

“She’s completely closed off.”

“I walked in on her arguing with Athena.” His eyes widen at my words. “Athena told her she’s rewriting what really happened with Julian. Isabella didn’t take it well.”

“Where is she now?” He frowns.

“She stormed off. Zachary, I know she lost her brother. But Alexander did too. She’s so fixated on how Seraphina betrayed him that she’s forgotten Julian sought her out. Does she not remember he went to Seraphina willingly? Or is she still in denial? She shouldn’t be, right?”

“I’ll talk to her.”

“Do you think she started the fire?”

“No. She knows the pack would turn on her if she did.” He sighs. “What did Athena say about my mate?”

“She thinks Isabella is heading down a path where no one can help her.”

I flinch as Lucas fires his gun.

It’s a sound I doubt I’ll ever get used to.

But it silences the arguing Lycans instantly.

They all stare at the woman bleeding out on the ground.

One by one, they drop to their knees in submission.

All except two.

They’re dead before they even realize they’ve been caught.

I’ve been surrounded by death for years.

I’ve killed. I’ve watched others kill.

But when Lucas does it, it’s effortless. Like choosing a drink from the fridge.

It means nothing to him.

Caleb and a few other long-term Lycans move through the crowd.

They collect the bodies.

They’ll take them to the far edge of the territory and burn them.

Just like all the others.

It’s an exhausting process.

My idea, originally.

But I hadn’t expected so many Lycans to lose their lives.

What’s strange is that no other bitten Lycans have shown up.

Every single one here, except me and Zachary, is a pureblood.

“Doesn’t this seem weird to you?”

“Usually I follow your train of thought, but you’ll have to give me more than that.” Zachary smirks.

“We haven’t seen any bitten Lycans. None like us. Not even among the dead.”

“Athena didn’t issue an order. It was just a request. They’re probably staying away because they fear being killed for not being purebloods. If they’re even still alive. We don’t know if he’s taken any out.” He nods toward Lucas. “He doesn’t mention them. I’m sure if Athena makes it an order, they’ll come. Why? Feeling left out?” He muses.

“No. Just curious, I guess.” I sigh inwardly. Something always feels off. “Where are we going to house all of them? We’re out of cabins. What about the pack run tonight?”

“It’s handled.”

The gun fires again.

A sharp, burning pain tears through my stomach.

I see horror flash across Zachary’s face.

Sebastian rushes toward me.

The sky spins above until I’m staring straight up.

The men hover over me.

Sebastian presses his hands hard against my stomach.

Panic is written all over his face.

I hear Athena ordering the Lycans to drop flat.

What about Lucas?

He’s the one who shot me.
###Chapter 0323
**** TRIGGER WARNING: MISCARRIAGE ****
Athena

"Nobody fucking move!" Alexander's roar echoes across the clearing as I glance toward Brianna.

Sebastian desperately presses against her stomach, trying to stop the bleeding. Zachary cups her face, forcing her to maintain eye contact instead of looking down at her wounds. He speaks to her softly, attempting to keep her calm. From where I stand, I can see her body trembling violently, blood already forming a dark pool around her. Alexander grabs my face and turns it toward him. "You need to control them. You can't help Brianna until you do."

'He's right. We have to do this now.' Nyx whispers urgently.

'I don't know if I'm ready for this.' I respond internally.

'You are ready. Just like we practiced.'

I draw a deep breath, filling my lungs completely as I tap into my Alpha abilities. I only needed the rogue Lycans to obey, not the rest of the pack, and certainly not Zachary as he tended to Brianna.

Focusing on the connections to every Lycan before me. "Everyone, face down on the ground, now!"

They all drop simultaneously. Nyx practically vibrates with satisfaction at my growing control.

Only two males remained standing. Lucas and another Lycan were still on their knees, locked in combat. I immediately see what they're fighting over—a gun. It hadn't been Lucas who shot Brianna, but the idiot he was wrestling with. Lucas had already landed several solid punches.

I step forward, moving between the prone Lycans. They lay completely still, including the children, though their hearts hammered wildly in their chests. Not a single soul attempted to defend the bastard who had shot Brianna.

Lucas finally wrestles the gun free and points it directly at the shooter's head. "She's pregnant, you stupid fuck!"

'A pup can't survive that injury.' Nyx murmurs grimly.

Rage floods through me as I watch Lucas's finger twitch on the trigger. I had allowed him to eliminate threats before, but he wouldn't be killing this piece of shit.

"Stop!"

Lucas shifts his hazel eyes toward me, confusion evident. "He's a threat! He shot Brianna!"

"She's a Lycan Alpha, not a Wolf Alpha. And you're a fucking Hunter. A disgrace to your kind." The shooter sneers as if he thought I would take his side.

"You're right. I am the Lycan Alpha. But you disobeyed my direct order. And the person you shot was a Lycan. You won't get another chance to try that." The shooter slowly turns to face me. His piercing green eyes stare into mine with pure disgust. "You're going to..."

"Who do you think let the Hunter in?!" My voice carries a dark edge that feels different this time. It brings a strange comfort. Nyx stood with me, not against me.

"Trai..." He doesn't finish the word as my claws sink deep into his chest.

His lips part in a breathy gasp. Shock and surprise register on his face as his eyes drift down to the gaping wound. "You...you can partially shift."

His words barely escape as my claws drive deeper, puncturing his lungs. A gurgling sound rises from his throat as oxygen fails him. Blood trickles from the corner of his mouth, slowly tracing a path down his chin.

Intense satisfaction floods through me as I watch life drain from his eyes, but it's quickly replaced by overwhelming guilt.

'You're administering justice for a crime.' Nyx murmurs. 'He deserved this. He hurt Brianna. This doesn't define you, and you know it's necessary. Too many would be endangered if you let him live. They need to know you don't tolerate threats!'

His knees buckle, forcing my claws upward through his chest and into his heart. His eyes bulge with the realization that this was his end.

"It should have been you." He whispers with his final breath. I retract my claws from his chest, and he collapses to the ground, dead before impact.

I pause for a moment, staring at my blood-covered claws. Ending someone who deserved it felt right and just, yet guilt still weighed heavily in my chest.

Turning around, I see all the Lycans still pressed face down on the ground. Alexander watches me, a slight smile curving his lips. My eyes search for Brianna, but she's been moved. I need to get to her. That bullet was meant for me, not her, and now she might have lost a pup because of it.

"Dispose of the body." I tell Lucas.

"Planning to kill any others?" He asks with amusement.

"I don't know, do you want to join him?" Nyx bursts into laughter at my sarcastic response.
###Chapter 0324

Lucas stays silent.

I already know he’s holding back laughter without even turning around.

I hear him lift the body onto his shoulder.

His footsteps fade as he trudges away.

I walk back through the crowd of Lycans toward Alexander.

None of them move.

Maybe it’s fear.

Maybe shame for bringing someone like that here.

I don’t really care.

Alexander slips his hand into mine.

His voice echoes in my mind through our link. How did it feel?

It was necessary.

That’s not what I asked.

I meet his crimson gaze.

“It felt… right,” I say softly.

My eyes drift toward where Brianna had fallen.

Her blood still stains the ground.

“I need to check on her.”

Alexander gestures toward the Lycans still kneeling. “What do you want to do with them?”

I shrug.

I hadn’t planned that far ahead.

“Let me handle it,” he says. “Just release your command.”

He presses a kiss to my cheek.

“You’re sure?”

“Of course. I have more experience with this.”

I release my hold on them.

Everyone rises slowly.

I hurry toward the infirmary.

I expect to see Isabella inside.

But it’s Theodore barking orders instead.

Zachary sits on a chair outside the room.

His hands are clasped tightly between his knees.

“Are you praying?” I ask.

His dark eyes lift to mine. “Someone has to listen.”

“The baby?” I whisper.

He shakes his head.

He doesn’t meet my eyes.

“Theodore is fighting for her life,” he murmurs.

“Where’s Isabella?”

“She refused to help.” Anger flashes in his gaze.

“What? Why?”

“Theodore is in there with a few others Isabella trained. We can only wait.”

That doesn’t answer my question.

“Why did Lucas do this, Athena?” Zachary’s voice is strained. “Brianna told me he knew.”

If it had been anyone else, Zachary would already have torn out the Hunter’s throat.

“It wasn’t him.”

“Of course it was. He’s been waiting for this.”

“It wasn’t him,” I repeat firmly. “One of the Lycans took the gun from him—or tried to. I’m not sure. Lucas was trying to disarm him when it went off. That bullet wasn’t meant for Brianna. The Lycan was aiming at me.”

“You don’t have to defend him,” he growls.

“I’m not. Ask Alexander. He saw it happen.”

Zachary’s jaw tightens. “Where is the guy now?”

“Dead.”

“Lucas killed him?”

“No. I did.”

His eyes drop to my bloodstained hand.

Then they return to my face.

“Thank you,” he says quietly.

I nod.

Theodore’s sharp commands continue from inside.

It sounds bad.

If she could heal naturally, she would have by now.

“Where’s Sebastian?” I ask softly.

Zachary points toward the nurse’s station.

A hand is visible from behind the counter.

Sebastian sits on the floor, back against the cabinets.

He is completely still.

No sound.

No tears.

Just the steady beat of his heart.

If he loses Brianna, I know he’ll spiral back into drinking.

His knees are pulled to his chest.

His shirt is soaked in Brianna’s blood.

His eyes lift to meet mine.

They’re hollow.

Empty.

As if he’s already given up.

“Theodore will find a way,” I whisper.

I sit on the floor facing him.

“She was pregnant,” he says hoarsely.

“I know. I’m so sorry.”

He lets out a bitter laugh. “She hadn’t even told me.”

“How did you find out?”

“The fire. I swept her home after we put it out. There was an untouched test on her table. Several others, too. But they were unreadable.”

“Is that why you didn’t question her about the pack run?”

He gives me a sad smile. “I thought tonight would be the night she told me. But now… if she survives this… I’ll have to be the one to tell her there’s no baby. That there might never be one.”

“I don’t understand.”

“The bullet tore through her stomach. Like Isabella’s leg—it can’t heal what isn’t there.”

His shoulders slump even further.

“You can feel her,” I say, fighting back tears.

I always got the sense Brianna wanted a family.

She wanted to raise her children differently than her father had.

Her biggest worry was whether Sebastian was ready.

“Listen to her body. You know her better than anyone because you can feel her.”

He shakes his head. “She’s barely holding on. I don’t need to be in that room to know Theodore has already restarted her heart twice.”
###Chapter 0325
Zachary

I listen to them talk.
Athena tries to stay calm.
Sebastian tells her Theodore has restarted Brianna's heart twice already.

Twice.

That’s not a good sign.
We can heal from many things.
But if the heart gives up completely… it’s rare anyone comes back from that.

Isabella should be helping.
She’s the pack’s head physician.
Not Theodore, not the others she trained.
I’ve seen her work. She’s precise. Never misses a step.
But she refused to come when I linked her.
Now she’s ignoring me completely.

I stand up.
Athena’s blue eyes flick toward me.

“Please. Tell me the moment you hear anything.” The words almost choke me.
Brianna is my best friend.
We’ve been through everything together.
I can’t lose her because some fucking idiot shot her by mistake.

Athena nods.

I stop outside the hospital.
Debating whether to speak to Alexander about his sister.
Or confront my mate directly.
She should be here. I need to make her help.

I cross the grounds.
Pausing outside the packhouse.
Steeling myself for the fight I know is coming.

I pull the door open.
Charlotte comes flying down the stairs toward me.
Terror is written all over her round little face.
She throws herself into my arms.

“Hey. What’s wrong?”

“Something bad is in the house, Daddy.”

“What do you mean?”

“It’s dark upstairs.”

I look up the staircase.
Sunlight streams through the large windows.

“Don’t go up there, Daddy.” Her bright green eyes fill with tears as she glances toward the second floor.

“Who’s upstairs, Lottie?”

Her eyes meet mine, then drop.
She presses against my chest and whispers, “Isabella.”

“Anyone else?”

Charlotte shakes her head and shudders.
“Daddy, can we please leave?”

I back out of the house.
I can’t sense anything but the pain Isabella is radiating.

“Logan and Evrin are with Athena and Sebastian. Do you want to go there?”
I try to keep my voice calm.
But I’m not sure she believes me.

“Yes, please.” She nods frantically.

Part of me hopes she just woke from a nightmare.
But Isabella’s silence… her refusal to help Brianna…
It has me worried.

Sebastian answers the door.
He looks surprised to see us, but he smiles at Charlotte.

“Well, this is a nice surprise.” His comment makes her laugh.
For a moment, her fear vanishes.

“I’m sorry, Sebastian. Can you watch her for a bit?”

He studies my face.
“No problem. She’ll be safe here. The twins are about to wake up anyway. Athena’s making cakes.”

Charlotte runs inside without looking back.

“How bad is it?” Sebastian asks.

“Brianna’s critical. Alexander and Athena are with her.”

“He can’t lose anyone else.” Sebastian sighs.
“But that’s not what I meant.” He glances to make sure Charlotte is out of earshot.
“She said something about Isabella yesterday. She was half-asleep, so it didn’t make much sense.”

“She came running down the stairs… more terrified than when I rescued her from that bar. Isabella was the only one upstairs.”

“She can stay the night if needed.” Sebastian says. “Athena and I love having kids around again.”

I don’t have the heart to tell him there won’t be grandkids.

“I’ll let you know.”

I look around.
Normally, I’d handle this myself.
Isabella is my mate.
But Charlotte called her dark.
That pushed me out of my comfort zone.
Wolves don’t go dark. That’s a Lycan trait.

“Is my daughter okay?”

I turn to see Lucas coming toward me.

“Did you shoot Brianna?” I need to hear it from him.

“I’m sadistic sometimes. I enjoy killing Lycans. But I don’t kill pups. They’re still pure. If you hadn’t noticed, I could have taken any of you out by now. So I’ll ask again—how is my daughter?”

“Scared.”

“I know that, dumbass. What is she scared of?”

“My mate.”

His brows furrow. “She’s helping Brianna, right?”

Was that concern? Does he actually care about Brianna?

“No. Theodore is.”

As much as I hate him, maybe he can help.
He claims to see darkness in people.
I can’t lose my best friend and my mate in one day.

I tell him what happened with Charlotte.
Her fear. Her panic. Her desperate need to escape the house.

“You think Isabella’s lost it?” He asks carefully.

“I don’t know what to think. I know she’s not the woman I fell for. I know she’s shut down. I know she’s in pain she won’t talk about. I can barely get into her head. And when I do…”
###Chapter 0326

"It's chaos." He finishes my thought.

"Lycans can't be corrupted by the darkness."

"Don't be so certain, Zachary." His lips press into a thin line. Hearing my name from him felt strange, yet far better than his previous insults. His hazel eyes drift toward the pack house. "Recall what I explained about twin Lycans? How a fragment of each resides within the other?"

"Yes."
