No answer. One of Alexander’s wolves appears. “Is there a problem?”

“How far south am I?”

“Almost at the border.”

“Has anyone passed through here?”

“I would’ve seen them. Is someone missing?”

“Still determining.”

I crouch, tracing the last set of tracks. My eyes scan the trees above. Nothing. Wolves can’t scent Lycans in Lycan form, but I can. Someone shifted here.

That bastard took Hannah!
###Chapter 0352
Athena

"Three individuals named Ash are present, but none match the name Ash Thomas." Zachary informs me, tossing the clipboard onto the desk. He turns to Luc. "Whoever provided that name deceived you!"

"Alternatively, the name he gave both you and Athena was false." Luc counters. "That might be his actual identity."

I scan the highlighted names on the clipboard, searching for connections, while ignoring Zachary and Luc's argument. They behaved more childishly than actual children.

Identifying links to each name, I summon them and demand their immediate presence in the office. Perhaps one had provided a false surname out of fear.

Three men arrive within minutes. Luc shakes his head. "None of them are him."

The men exchange confused glances, uncertain why they were summoned.

"Do any of you know Ash Thomas?" I ask.

Two shake their heads and deny it. The third nods. "He arrived yesterday. He asks excessive questions."

"Regarding what?" Luc demands.

"Everything. I assumed it was because he's new here."

'Seraphina claimed that Levi would come here. What if she was correct? What if he's already here under an alias?'

'Luc would recognize him.' I murmur. 'That man couldn't possibly slip past us. Could he?'

'It aligns with what that woman said. That this man searches places where he believes his prisoners might hide. All these questions suggest he's tactically searching for someone.'

'If he sought Blair, why take Hannah? What if this is another scheme orchestrated by Seraphina?' I challenge.

She remains silent, aware, as I was, that too many uncertainties clouded the situation.

Charlotte had stopped drawing the instant he entered, spending the entire time staring silently as I questioned him. "Good. I have business to attend to."

"You should remain here." Theodore blocks my path.

"You said she'll be asleep. I need to find the bastard responsible."

"Who?" He challenges me.

"I don't know yet. But I will."

"Let Zachary and Alexander handle the investigation. Someone must have seen something." Theodore speaks with too much optimism. He would never have survived as a Hunter.

"I can't just sit here. That's not who I am."

"What should I tell her when she wakes?"

"Tell her I'm going to kill the one who did this."

I shove past him and throw open the hospital doors. Darkness blankets the pack grounds. An unusual silence hangs heavy in the air. A few Wolves and Lycans wander about, but the usual energy is absent.

I jog toward the gates. I need to question the guards. I also need to see where Zachary found her. Perhaps there are tracks they missed. Perhaps I will see what they could not.

Caleb stands guard at the entrance. His focus is directed outside the pack, while his Wolf faces inward. An improvement over the usual chatter among guards.

"Caleb!" I call out. He doesn't move.

"Hunter!" He growls in response. "Is the girl alright?"

"She'll live. Seen anything unusual?"

"Nothing."

"You didn't notice Hannah either, did you?"

"I thought it was a fallen log." He mutters. "No movement. No sound. No scent."

"You need to be closer to catch human scent." I reply. His Wolf glares at me.

"Dane informed me. I've been around Lycans too long. It won't happen again."

I have no reason to trust him. I doubt I ever will.

"You relieved Finn, correct?" I press him.

"Yes."

The Wolf avoids my gaze now. He actively prevents our eyes from meeting. Even when I step closer, he looks over my shoulder.

"You're being very quiet." I smile coldly. "What's your name?" I consider calling him coward. "Grant!" He spits out.

"Friends with Finn?" I ask.

"I have nothing to say." His green eyes glare daggers.

"No? Your avoidance suggests otherwise."

"I didn't see anything." He grumbles.

"Not a very competent guard, are you?" I muse. He holds his ground but looks ready to flee. "I'll have to inform Alexander. He won't want weakness at the gates."

"I only meant..."

"What this idiot means is he has a problem with me guarding the gate." Caleb remarks. "We were arguing when Alexander and Zachary arrived with the girl. I already told them both."

"Lycans don't belong on gate duty." Grant snarls at me.

"Is that your decision?" I muse. "Or are you deflecting because you know something about what happened to Hannah?"

"I know nothing about that."

The infuriating part was he told the truth about Hannah. But he was hiding something else.

###Chapter 0370
Alexander

Finn passes his newborn son to me. It’s an Obsidian Howl tradition for the Alpha to greet new pups and formally accept them into the pack.

I press my thumb, marked with a drop of my blood, to the infant’s forehead. He is now a recognized member of our pack. Finn’s blue eyes glow with pride as he smiles.

“Apologies for leaving my post at the gate,” he murmurs. “I couldn’t let my mate face this alone. Though the little one had already arrived by the time I got here.” His mate was supposedly still upstairs, being examined by one of the nurses my sister trained. But I couldn’t catch her scent anywhere.

'We need to investigate,' Titan insists.

'We will,' I assure him. 'Timing is crucial.'

“It’s fine,” I tell Finn, returning the child to his arms.

“Caleb’s a decent man,” Finn says. “I’m grateful he was nearby.”

“Grant wasn’t pleased, though, was he?” Zachary asks.

“Grant is never pleased,” Finn mutters, gazing down at the pup. “That man wouldn’t be happy with a fortune and women fawning over him day and night. But things are shifting in this pack. He can’t cling to the past forever.”

“Is that so?” Zachary probes.

“It is. We have a Lycan Luna. You’re mated to a Wolf. Brianna is mated to a Wolf. Rumor says the Hunter is also bound to a Lycan. Everything’s changing. Maybe that’s what the Moon Goddess always intended.”

“The Moon Goddess,” Zachary echoes thoughtfully. Perhaps he was starting to see things from Lucas’s perspective. Lucas often spoke of higher powers. Truth or not, no one could say for sure.

Finn nods, missing Zachary’s sarcasm. “She has a plan for each of us.”

Zachary stays silent and turns toward the window. “Seems you have another visitor.”

Lucas always knocks the same way, like it’s his secret code announcing his arrival. I open the door to his grim expression. “Is Hannah alright?”

“She’s resting. Theodore says she’ll recover, but there will be scars.” His hazel eyes shift to Finn and the baby, then back to me. “We need to talk.”

'Stay here,' I mind-link Zachary. 'Dig carefully. Be subtle.' Having this connection with him is incredibly useful.

He gives a slight nod as I follow Lucas out. “You’re certain about Hannah?”

“What I said stands. Something strange is happening at the gate.”

“I know Grant is furious about Caleb being there. He made that very clear to Zachary and me.”

“It’s more than that. I sensed Grant was hiding something, yet he was truthful about not seeing Hannah.”

“But you believe he’s involved?”

“I need to look deeper.”

He starts to leave but turns back abruptly. “That pup isn’t Finn’s. And he wasn’t born today. Possibly yesterday, or even the day before. Remember, they arrive with faint soul signatures.”

“Not his?”

“And not his mate’s either.” He walks away. “You should question this.”

'Why does he always have to be so vague?' Titan grumbles.

'It’s just how he is.'

I return to Finn’s home as Zachary is asking, “So you just took him?”

Both men look toward me.

“You won’t believe this,” Zachary says, shaking his head.

I sigh. “Where did you find him?”

“In the city. Yesterday.” Finn sits on the edge of the sofa, holding the pup close.

“But you said your mate went into labor?” I ask, glancing toward the staircase. Zachary shakes his head subtly.

Finn reaches into his pocket and pulls out a crumpled note. He hands it to me. “I should’ve brought this to you when I found it two days ago.”

I look down at the message. 'I can’t stay here with these monsters. They’re taking over. Destroying our pack. They’ll kill us all. I won’t raise my child here.' The handwriting isn’t Chloe’s.

“She took our unborn pup and left.” He takes a shaky breath. “When I went to the city, I found this boy, wrapped up and abandoned in an alley. I thought it was meant to be.”
###Chapter 0371

"You claimed the nurse was upstairs." Zachary's voice was sharp. "Attending to your mate."

"Paige is upstairs. She's Chloe's closest friend. She's searching for any hint of where Chloe might have gone. She was here with him while I was at the gate." Finn gestured to the infant in his arms.

"So you lied about her being in labor. Hoping for what, exactly?" I demanded. "That I wouldn't notice your mate never showed up?"

"I don't know. I didn't think it through. I need to find her."

"Track her down? That's a terrible idea with a pup. It's downright reckless." Zachary shook his head.

"Um," Finn's brow furrowed, deep lines forming.

"You didn't consider that either?" Zachary asked.

"I could handle it. I could care for him and search for Chloe."

"No, you couldn't. Bringing him here was the right move. He'll need this place when he's older." Zachary stated.

"Are you implying what I think you are?" I asked, annoyed he hadn't mentioned it sooner.

'Luc could have warned us.' Titan sneered internally.

'So could Zachary!' I shot back.

Zachary nodded. "That pup is a Lycan."

"WHAT?!" Finn recoiled, dropping the infant as if it were a live explosive. Zachary lunged forward, catching the tiny form before its head could hit the floor.

Footsteps sounded above. Paige appeared at the banister, freezing. She knew we were here. Why the act of being caught?

Zachary stood, cradling the newborn against his chest, glaring at Finn. "That was unacceptable."

"GET DOWN HERE!" I growled at Paige.

Her eyes stayed locked on me, fingers twisting in her pink hair as she descended. I pointed to a spot beside Finn. She sidestepped around us, her heart hammering. I threw the crumpled paper at their feet. "Which one of you wrote this?"

They exchanged a glance. "Chloe," they said in unison.

"Lies."

"It's Chloe's!" Finn insisted.

Zachary stepped back as I crouched before Finn, gripping his face. My nails dug crescent moons into his skin. "Chloe has done work for me. I know her handwriting. I'll ask again. Who wrote this?"

"He did." Paige squeaked, eyes downcast.

I watched him elbow her. "Quiet!"

"Check upstairs." I told Zachary, standing. The marks on Finn's face healed instantly, vanishing.

I paced before them as Zachary disappeared. Paige fought tears. Finn stared blankly ahead. "How long did you think this charade would last, Finn?"

"It's not a game."

"Your reaction to the pup says otherwise. You're the one with a Lycan problem. What was your plan?"

His jaw tightened.

"Start simple. Where is Chloe?"

"She really did leave." Paige blurted. "A few days ago."

"Let me guess, Finn. You were on gate duty? Tricked the other guard so Chloe could slip out?"

He turned away, seething.

"Where did she go, Paige?" I pressed.

"With some man. Cooper, maybe? Levi? We were supposed to join her. He promised a better life. Away from the Lycans."

I laughed coldly. "You both despise Lycans, yet you'd run off with one."

They stared, mouths agape.

"He's a Wolf?" Paige protested.

"No. He is not. Your loyalty is truly inspiring."

"She was packing!" Zachary returned, the pup cradled in one arm, two backpacks dangling from his other hand.

"I assumed as much."

"What will you do to us?" Paige pleaded.

"I believe you already know the answer to that."
###Chapter 0372
Brianna

Something feels off.

I frown, restless despite doctor's orders to stay in bed. Lying still only makes me dwell on what I've lost. I need movement, distraction.

From the window, I spot Alexander, Zachary, and Luc shoving a man and woman forward. The man looks familiar, one of the gate guards usually. But it's the bundle in Zachary's arms that confuses me. A doll for Charlotte perhaps?

Athena steps closer to the window, careful to remain half-hidden behind the curtain. "No one can see me here, remember."

"Tell me I'm hallucinating. Maybe I'm sick again and this is some fever dream."

She pinches my arm sharply.

"Ow!"

"Not dreaming." She risks a quick glance outside. "Why is Zachary holding a pup?"

"It's not a toy?"

"Toys don't squirm like that."

I look again just as a tiny arm stretches out. The movement is brief as the group moves farther away.

"Maybe those Wolves had a baby?"

"Mako and Kira are due soon, but that's not Kira." She presses against the wall, closing her eyes. "That's one of Isabella's nurses from the hospital. Paige, I think her name is."

She takes a deep breath. "I know what's happening."

"What?"

"They're being hunted!"

"Luc will execute them?"

"Not just Luc." She sighs heavily. "Some pack members will shift and chase them like prey. Alexander has done this before."

"Before you came, a woman drugged me with Wolfsbane Toxin. Nearly killed me. Alexander took her to the forest and had his Wolves hunt her down. They tore her apart while she still breathed."

"Seriously?"

She nods as more pack members approach. They're already shifting as they move. The woman, Paige, clings to the guard like he might protect her. I can see her lips moving, probably begging for mercy. They must know what's coming if this is Alexander's chosen punishment.

"It's for those he feels deeply betrayed by." Athena whispers. "If Luc hadn't shot those who crashed into us, Alexander would have done the same to them."

"But he never did that to Julian?"

She shrugs. "Julian was his brother. Even after what happened with Seraphina, even after what he did to Isabella. He couldn't do it, though he threatened Julian many times over the years."

I nod slowly. I can't call it cruel. I've seen Rogues do worse. I've done worse myself. Long ago, I almost beat Athena to death.

"But the pup... surely Alexander won't let that be torn apart?" I mutter, disgusted by the thought. I watch Zachary turn away from the Wolves, heading back toward us. The small form is cradled against his chest, and I breathe out in relief.

"No, he won't harm a pup." Athena confirms.

I turn my attention from Zachary just as Mako and Paige bolt toward the forest. Mako shoves her down right before the trees, giving himself a head start as he disappears into the greenery. She scrambles back to her feet desperately.

Alexander keeps his hand raised high. A signal for the Wolves to hold. Even Luc has shifted, ready to join the chase.
###Chapter 0373

Alexander is giving them a head start.
But we all know they won't escape alive.

His hand drops.
The Wolves charge forward with impossible speed.
They are hyped by the hunt.
Alexander shifts next, taking his time.
He moves into the forest like he's savoring every moment.

Those wolves are going to suffer.
I assume they deserve it.
A small part of me wants to watch it happen.

"Brianna?" Zachary's voice cuts through my thoughts.
"Up here." I call back.

He enters the room still cradling a tiny pup.
The baby is somehow fast asleep.
"Why do you have a Lycan pup?" Athena asks.
"It's a long story." His dark eyes find me by the window. "I assume you saw what happened?"

I nod. "Athena explained the rest."
"They were planning to leave and join Levi." He shakes his head in disbelief.
"Why?" Athena asks.
“It sounds like he made them an offer. They were stupid enough to accept."

"And the pup? Where does he fit in?"
"Finn tried telling Alexander the pup was his and Chloe's. It quickly became clear he wasn't. Turns out Chloe already left with Levi while still pregnant. Finn picked this one up from the city. He practically threw him away when he learned the boy is Lycan."

"So they didn't know Levi is Lycan?" I ask.
"No."
"And decided to kidnap him?" I gesture to the wrapped pup in disgust.
"Finn claimed he found him dumped and abandoned. Whether that's true, I don't know."

"What's going to happen to him?" I ask.
Surely Alexander wouldn't just abandon him again.
"I was hoping you would take him. Until we figure out where he came from. And if anyone is looking for him.”

I stare at him, speechless.
"He's maybe a day old. Maybe two according to Luc. He doesn't even have a name. I thought you might like to name him."

I feel frozen.
Still processing why Zachary asked me.
"I still have loads of the twins' baby stuff." Athena declares. "I'll go dig it out."

"You want to give me a pup?" I mutter as Athena leaves with a smile.
"I can't think of anyone better."
"I can't...." He steps toward me and holds the tiny pup out. "He's not mine."

“And Lottie isn't mine." He presses the pup against my chest.
I have no choice but to hold him as he pulls his hands away.
"Zachary, don't." I've never felt panic like this.
My heart thuds heavily.
Blood whooshes between my ears.
My lungs grow tight. "I'm not ready."
But he is already stepping back.

"Then it's a good thing you have a whole pack supporting you."
"And a mate." Sebastian announces as he enters the room.
"Give him to Athena. She's had practice." I move toward Zachary.
He refuses to take him back and folds his arms. "Look at him." He mutters instead.

I glance at Sebastian.
He watches me calmly.
Leaving the decision to me.

The pup starts to move in my arms.
He'll probably start crying any second.
I take a deep breath and shift my gaze to the poet.

Deep brown eyes stare back at me.
My heart explodes in the best way possible.
###Chapter 0374
Seraphina

"We gave her the warning. Now we should go." I sigh, pulling a thick sweatshirt over my head. The cold is absolutely brutal. I've never experienced anything like this before. My body feels foreign, vulnerable. Every gust of wind cuts right through me. Is this what being human always feels like?

Evelyn brings me a heavy blanket, carefully tucking it around my legs. "I don't think we should leave. Not yet."

"We've overstayed our welcome already." I insist, my voice tight. "You only came here to tell Athena about Levi. We did that. Somehow, I'm still breathing. I'd like to keep it that way, even if it means I freeze to death in this miserable place."

She rolls her eyes, calling me dramatic. "What about your mother? She confirmed your mother is in the pack. Just like you thought she would be."

"So?" I snap.

"Don't you want to see her?"

"What I want doesn't matter. They want nothing to do with me. I already explained why."

"I never took you for a quitter."

"I'm not the person I used to be, Evelyn. He stripped all of that away. Too many people in that pack hate me, and that's just the Wolves. Staying here is a death wish. Someone will kill me, and you won't be able to stop them."

"Is that what you truly want?"

"I don't know anymore."

She sighs, sitting beside me and pulling part of the blanket over her own legs. "Are you scared?"

I consider her question. It wasn't sarcastic. It wasn't mockery. She meant it. I guess, on some level, I am scared. It would be stupid not to be. I used to say that to all the targets I hunted.

Lycans have probably taken over most of Obsidian Howl by now. If they have, that means they submitted to Athena. Maybe even to Alpha Alexander. Who knows how many are living there now? Who knows how many of them I've personally pissed off? I'm not ready to find out.

When I saw Lucas, I truly believed he would kill me right then and there. But he just watched me. His expression was unreadable. That made it so much worse. I know what I did to him. He knows what I did. Yet he just stood there, asking his questions.

It's easier when people outright threaten you. At least then, all the cards are on the table. I wouldn't have to feel this constant, gnawing dread sitting heavy in my gut.

Not being able to read people is terrifying.

"Neither of us can fight them off," I mutter. "We're nothing compared to them. They could break us like dry twigs if they wanted to."

She frowns, taking a slow sip of her coffee. She's completely addicted to the stuff. "Maybe she will help us."

I let out a bitter laugh. "Please don't tell me you're talking about Athena?!"

"I just think... she had a clear chance to kill us. She didn't take it. They found us here. They could have forced their way in, slit our throats, and vanished. But they didn't. Maybe there's a chance for us here."

I shake my head. "Or maybe she just wasn't in the mood. Or maybe she was too focused on getting her answers. She wanted information."

Evelyn nods slowly. "Maybe you're right." She leans her head against my shoulder. "I've been thinking about her questions. I think someone is missing."

"That means he's already here." My heart hammers against my ribs. The thought of being his prisoner again makes me sick. What would he do to punish me for escaping? He already shaved my head. My hand instinctively moves to my scalp, touching the short, dark fuzz.

I haven't looked in a mirror since Evelyn made me. It probably looks like I got electrocuted.

"It'll grow back," Evelyn murmurs, noticing my movement. "It won't be this short forever." She wraps an arm around my waist. Her reflection in the dark TV screen shows a small smile. Her constant positivity is something I can't understand. But I guess she's had more time to get used to this life.

As much as I don't want to die, the thought of living like this forever is terrifying. I hated humans when I was a Lycan. That hasn't changed. I like Evelyn, but I think that's only because we share a common enemy.

"Do you think it's true?" I whisper, watching a candle flame sputter and die.

"What?" Evelyn asks softly.

"That Athena was right. That I was let out on purpose?"

She sighs and sits up straight. "I've wondered that myself. For five years, I waited for someone else to escape that place. I always wondered if there were others who took different routes. Maybe they stuck to roads instead of the woods. That's why they never found my farmhouse. But you said your door was unlocked, just like all the others. So yes, I believe she was right."
###Chapter 0375

"What's his game plan?"

"He might be hunting you. Finding me would just be an extra prize. Or he could be after the female Alpha. I doubt Cooper ever has a real strategy. He adapts. He exploits opportunities as they arise."

"Will he strike at Obsidian Howl?"

She exhales slowly. "Absolutely."

More Wolves and Lycans will lose their gifts because of me. If he was already nearby, I’d be the cause of our kind’s downfall.

I tell Evelyn I'm heading to bed. She asks if I'm alright.

"Just exhausted," I lie. The guilt was a physical pressure, threatening to collapse my lungs.

I wait for hours after Evelyn retires, ensuring she's asleep. Silently, I pull on a jacket and slip outside, careful not to make a sound.

Standing at the end of the driveway, I weigh my choices. Turn left toward Obsidian Howl and hope for a swift end. Or turn right and vanish forever, living out my days as a Human. Neither option appealed to me.

I check my pockets, fingers brushing the rectangle of my credit card. I'd found it hidden in my vanity. A contingency plan from when I first moved in. More than enough funds to start over, far from this chaos. Somewhere no one could ever find me. I took it, just in case I chose right.

"Where are you going?" Evelyn steps beside me.

I close my eyes. I hadn't heard her. Not even the door. "You weren't supposed to know," I murmur.

"I knew something was wrong when you went to bed at seven. You never sleep that early. Not even after what that monster did to you."

"It's not safe here," I whisper back. The lone streetlight illuminates her face, giving her grey eyes a ghostly glow. "If Athena found us, Cooper definitely can. He could be watching us right now, and we'd never know. Obsidian Howl is a few miles that way, or..."

She grips my shoulders and turns me to face her. "Who cares if he's watching! He can't hurt us anymore. So I'll ask again. Where are we going?" Evelyn laces her fingers with mine. "I'll follow you anywhere."

"This isn't me," I mutter. "I don't ask for help. I am the help. People paid me to do their dirty work."

"Okay."

"Okay?" I whisper back.

She nods. "I thought I knew how to help you. But this is your choice, Seraphina. If you want to run, we run. If you want to talk to Athena, we go to Obsidian Howl."

"Why the change of heart?"

"Because I see you. I'm not a Lycan anymore, but I see the guilt you carry. The sorrow in your eyes is plain."

I start walking, pulling Evelyn with me.

"Are you sure?" she asks.

"Yes. If they kill me, don't fight back. It's what I deserve. And more."

Her hand tightens around mine.

As we walk, she asks about the layout of Obsidian Howl's territory. I tell her I never got past the gates. Julian gave me some intel, but not much. I was never truly interested.

We find two burnt-out cars. The rear one looks like it rammed the front vehicle. The front car resembles the one Lucas hurried Athena into when they abandoned us.

"Is that...?" Evelyn asks.

"I think so," I mutter, quickening my pace.

Tire marks scar the ground.

A trail of blood leads from the windshield of Athena's car to the grass verge. Another dried crimson pool sits near the passenger door.

"What happened here?" Evelyn whispers, as if we're being watched.

"Not sure. They torched the cars to destroy any DNA evidence," I whisper back. "Standard procedure. I've done it myself."

"Are they dead?"

"No. Alexander would be breaking down my door if they were. I'm certain of that."

I scan our surroundings and grab Evelyn's hand. "Let's go. I don't want to stay here."
###Chapter 0376
Athena

I sifted through boxes of miniature baby clothes, creating a hopeful pile. My fingers brushed against soft fabrics, each tiny garment whispering a silent prayer. I desperately waited for Zachary’s mental link, praying Brianna had accepted the little boy.

'She’ll say yes, right?' Nyx’s voice echoed with hopeful anticipation.

'I truly hope so.' She needed this. Sebastian needed this.

'The boys can have playdates together.' She murmured happily. 'Someday, he could even become Beta.'

I smiled softly. 'He’s just a newborn, Nyx. Not quite ready for that yet. But when the time is right, absolutely.'

'What if the birth parents—'

'We’ll face that if it happens!'

'She hasn’t given an answer yet.' Alexander’s voice rumbled through my mind, and my heart sank. 'But she hasn’t refused either.' He added, 'And she hasn’t taken her eyes off him since she saw him.'

'Fingers crossed.' I whispered back, continuing to sort through the clothes as he severed the link.

'What if she actually says no?' Nyx asked suddenly.

'Then I suppose we’re about to have a third pup.' Though I was definitely not prepared for that reality.

Just as I finished, Alexander appeared with a triumphant smile. “They’ve taken him home.” He took the box of baby supplies from my hands.

"She said yes?"

He nodded. “I never truly believed she would turn him away. Not after she gave him a name.”

"She did?"

He smiled warmly at me. “Luca."

'I adore it!' Nyx declared. I was certain if she had her way, we’d be perpetually pregnant.

"It seems Logan and Evrin will have a new friend." I murmured. "Everything in that box should last them a couple of weeks until they can get their own things."

His gaze locked intensely on me as he nodded. His fingers drummed rhythmically against the side of the box. "I won’t let her lose him.”

I understood his meaning perfectly.

"Alexander, they abandoned him. If they show up here, demanding him back, do you honestly believe I would force her to surrender him?"

"I simply needed confirmation that we share the same perspective." He nodded toward the box. "I’ll deliver this to her myself, considering you’re supposed to be resting indoors. I spotted Caleb returning from the forest. He was conversing with some other pack members. He’ll likely be here shortly."

“Thank you.” He had finished executing those traitors already. I had half-expected a prolonged, torturous process keeping him occupied all night.

I followed Alexander down from the attic. Just as he departed, a blood-drenched, half-naked Caleb entered. He left crimson footprints in his wake as he strode toward me. Alexander didn’t even pause, continuing his exit as if witnessing the Alpha drenched in blood was an ordinary occurrence.

"Are they dead?" I asked, though the answer was already evident.

"Do you believe I would have returned if they weren’t?"

"You’re furious." I could see it in his eyes and feel it radiating from him. "But you’ve handled them."

"They were merely two Wolves, Athena. Who knows how many other disloyal pricks are turning against Obsidian Howl! I’ve sacrificed immensely to build this pack to its current strength. Somewhere along the way, complacency set in. Their loyalty is wavering. They needed a stark reminder of the consequences. A brutal refresher on the punishment for disrespecting you and me."

I nodded in agreement.

"You don’t disagree?" His tone was laced with skepticism.

"No. I’ve taken lives too." I turned away, but he seized my arm, spinning me back forcefully into his blood-soaked chest. He dragged his thumb across my cheek, tracing a path down to my lips. His breath was hot and heavy as he inhaled my scent deeply.

"Where are the twins?" He asked softly.

"Sleeping. It’s late." I murmured in response.

"And the pup?” His anger seemed to be subsiding.

"Brianna agreed to take him. She’s taken him home with Sebastian. Alexander is delivering some of the twins' old baby items for me, to help them get settled."

"Good. Come shower with me." He lifted me effortlessly from the ground, wrapping my legs around his hips, and carried me up the stairs. I was immensely grateful I hadn’t chosen to wear white today.

He was intentionally slow undressing me, peeling my clothes away inch by inch as if unwrapping a precious gift. As he did, he left bloody fingerprints on my garments and my skin.

Stepping under the hot water, diluted blood swirled quickly toward the drain. Caleb held me tightly, pressing my back firmly against his chest. His hardening length pressed into the small of my back as he cupped my stomach possessively.

He pressed his lips against that specific spot just below my ear. A place that never failed to send shivers of pleasure through me. "When do I get to put another pup in you?”
###Chapter 0377

"Not yet." I whisper, fighting the deep ache building within me.

His lips travel to the mark he left earlier. His teeth graze the sensitive skin as a low growl vibrates from his chest. One hand slides down to my thighs. He uses his leg to gently part mine from behind. His finger traces a slow line across my core.

"Is that so?" He murmurs, his finger beginning slow circles around my clit.

I nod, biting back a moan.

He withdraws his finger abruptly. Spinning me around to face him, he pulls me tightly against his body. The water has rinsed away most of the blood, leaving only a few specks on his chin. I wipe them away gently. He lifts me effortlessly, pressing my back against the cool tiles. A gasp escapes me. The cold surface is a relief against my overheated skin.

"Feeling warm?" His crimson eyes hold mine intently.

I nod again. It's more than just warmth. An internal fire is igniting, burning me from the inside. Sweat trickles down my spine. The steaming water makes my skin feel too tight. It's been too long since I last felt this sensation.

"No. No. No." I push Alexander back, quickly turning the shower dial to the coldest setting. I position myself directly under the freezing stream, trying to regain control. He watches my struggle with amusement.

'Yes. Yes. Yes.' Nyx chants happily in my mind.

"This can't be happening now!" I say aloud. Alexander grins widely. Nyx informs me our body is preparing for another pup. "Athena..." His grin remains. "You can't stop this."

"I know. How did you know?"

"I could scent the change." He steps under the icy water with me. His muscles tense from the cold. "You can fight it, but you won't win. You know that. You'll only delay the inevitable." He tucks my wet hair behind my ears.

His crimson eyes seem to see into my soul as he leans in. His hand reaches out, turning the water off. The fire inside me flares instantly. The persistent ache settles heavily within. Resistance is futile.

Two days. At least it was shorter than the first time. My body still aches. My core throbs.

Alexander traces gentle circles around my navel with his fingertips. He pauses, turning my face toward his. "You're quiet."

"Tired." I whisper. "And sore."

"Roll over." He instructs, moving to his knees.

"Why?"

"Just roll over."

I flip onto my stomach. He straddles my thighs, pinning me gently to the bed. His hands glide along my back. His fingers press into my muscles, working out the developed knots. It feels incredibly good. I sink deeper into the mattress as my body relaxes.

"Before you ask, Victoria and Sebastian have the boys. They've had them for the last two days." He informs me.

I nod into the pillow as his magical hands continue their work.

"Has Zachary been monitoring the situation?" My voice is muffled by the pillow.

"Yes. Sebastian too."

"Nothing's happened?"

"Not that I'm aware of. I instructed them to link me for anything critical. Otherwise, they have it handled."

"Something feels off." I murmur.

His hands still on my lower back. I try to shift, but his legs hold me securely. "Can't you just enjoy this moment?!" He teases. "It's... It's a gut feeling."

"I know. You're not the only one who thinks things are too calm after recent events."

"Why didn't you say anything?" I wriggle out from under him. He finds this amusing.

"Because I wasn't letting my mate go out there while in raging heat. You're also supposed to maintain a low profile. For now, you stay here with me. Zachary and Sebastian have everything under control. Whatever is happening can be tomorrow's problem."

I slump back onto the pillows. He wraps his arms around me, pulling me close. I close my eyes. I hear him groan. My eyes snap open. His eyes are glazed over. I glance at the clock. It's past midnight. Guess today's problems are already beginning.
###Chapter 0378
Alexander

"Stay here." I tell Athena, pulling on a shirt.

"Who is it?" She asks, already climbing out of bed and heading to the closet.

"It doesn't matter. You need to stay here."

She continues pulling on underwear as though I hadn't spoken. "I was right." She murmurs. "My gut feeling was right." She shimmies into a pair of jeans. "Is it Levi?"

"No."

"Who? Hannah. Did something happen? Has she said something?"

"It's not Hannah. Please will you just stay here until I know more."

"Our children are not even in the house."

"Athena and Sebastian won't let anything happen to them." I reassure her.

"Do they need to be kept safe? What's happened? You are not answering my question Alexander!" She plants her hands on her hips and stares at me. She was trying to read my mind.

I shake my head because I knew what her reaction would be when she found out who was at the gate.

"It's Seraphina."

She stops what she's doing to stare at me.

'Three, two....' Titan starts counting down, preparing for Athena to snap. Instead, she sinks into the large chair, her soft blue eyes fixed on me. "Why is she here?"

"I don't know, but will you please stay here? Just until I know what she wants. Besides, you are supposed to be staying in the house."

She doesn't answer me.

"Athena?"

She puffs out her cheeks, "I will stay."

I grab my jacket and kiss Athena before leaving. Whether she would actually stay put was another thing.

Down at the gate, Zachary is staring at Seraphina while Caleb is asking her questions. The blonde with her was sitting on the ground, leaning against Seraphina's legs, half asleep, clutching an old backpack.

"I was expecting Athena." Seraphina mutters.

"Well you have me." I snap. "Why are you here?"

Her brown eyes shift between us as she tries to come up with a response. She tugs her sweatshirt tighter as though it was going to protect her.

"Well?"

"I don't know." She looked genuinely unsure. "I could have left. I wanted to leave. I was ready to go. All I had to do was turn right."

I see Caleb roll his eyes. I'm guessing he has heard a similar story before.

"Then I decided to come here or maybe it wasn't my choice."

"Why?"

"Would you believe me if I said I'm still trying to figure that out. I'm probably going to die here. I deserve it." She puffs out her cheeks just like Athena does when she is contemplating something. She screws her face up. "I think Athena was right."

"Are you fucking shitting me?" Caleb scoffs. "Your mother and I told you that for years. You go and lose your Lycan and suddenly you have seen the light. Maybe we should have packed you off to this prick years ago."

"Hey!" I snap. "There is no need to wish this on someone." As much as I despised Seraphina, no one deserved to lose their beast. Death, yes, but this was just pointless.

Seraphina gestures to Evelyn who is snoring. "She helped me understand a lot." She returns her gaze to Caleb. "I made some mistakes."

"Mistakes?"

"Alright. I made some big fucking cock ups. Is that what you want to hear? I learned to survive and thrive from it. I made money. Got myself a home. I lived a life that I thought I loved. And now I am no one, happy?!"

Caleb takes a few steps away. I'm not sure if he was trying the tough love act as a father figure, but I knew he wasn't helping.

"You tried hunting down my mate and also slowly sent my brother over the edge in the process."

"So he is dead?" She asks, rocking on her heels as she keeps her gaze off of mine. "I didn't feel it, but I thought as much."

"Fucker tried to pull off something that hasn't been done before. He didn't survive it." Zachary growls. "But you, you made him into something else."

She raises her brown eyes to me. "I did like him. I fell for him and let him mark me and then...." She shakes her head and her hood falls down, revealing her short hair. She quickly hikes the hood back up and pulls it down around her face. "I'm sorry. I dragged him into my mess, preyed on his need to get revenge. You're right, I screwed him up, because that is what I do. I have always worked alone. That was why I was known as a Lone Wolf. Ironic when I wasn't even a Wolf."

"Why are you telling me this?" I demand. "Do you think I'm going to welcome you with open arms? Let you stay in the pack? I could give you a list as long as my arm for everyone who wants you dead. Me included."

"Right." She bobs her head. "I told you because can't hide it. Because your Hunter will know the moment he sees me if I am lying, that's if he doesn't kill me first, I screwed with his life too." She frowns and takes a deep breath. "My name is Seraphina Blackwood. I was never a Harrison, nor will I ever be one. I am not a Lycan anymore, nor am I or will I ever be a female Alpha."

She focuses on me." But I am scared."

"You're scared?" Zachary asks with a tilted head "You, the one who slaughtered Gabriel. The one who killed a pregnant Lycan and then stole their pup." She nods. "We have all killed people, but I am scared, because I think I'm about to become responsible for the downfall of hundreds."

My eyes flicker over the possible hiding places, maybe she was lying and someone was waiting, or maybe she was telling the truth. "Bind them both."

I tell Zachary and Caleb. "Put her in the dungeon," I point at Evelyn, "And bring Seraphina with us."

Evelyn squeaks as she is hauled to her feet by Caleb. Big dark circles sat under her eyes. She seemed confused and she didn't protest immediately. I don't know how much she had heard, but it would be better to split them up. Make sure their stories are the same.

"No, please, don't." Evelyn begs Caleb. He binds her hands together and throws her over his shoulder like it was nothing and carries her away. "Don't hurt her." Seraphina pleads.

"Then let's hope for her sake that she speaks the truth."

"Where are you taking me?" Seraphina asks as Zachary marches her across the grounds. Thankfully it was quiet but she still got a few stares. It wouldn't be long until everyone knew she was here.

Zachary pushes her onto the chair and reties her wrists to the wooden arms. Her breathing is heavy and she screws her face up while twisting to one side.

"What's wrong with you?"

"It's called a stitch." She mutters. "Evelyn said it's part of being Human."

"You trust her?" Zachary asks

"She helped me." Seraphina frowns

“Funny that, isn't it. She just happens to be just like you and she is the first person you ran into when you escaped.”

Her frown deepens to a scowl. "She has been nothing but kind to me. I never asked for it. I never wanted it."

"Yet she talked you into coming back here."
###Chapter 0379
Seraphina

I stare at the Lycan in disbelief.
“That’s not true. You think you know, but you don’t. You don’t know her at all. You haven’t even tried to understand her!” I defend Evelyn fiercely.

“Should I tell her?” Zachary asks Alexander. His dark eyes gleam with interest.

“We wait for Luc.” Alexander replies with a casual shrug.

My spine goes rigid instantly.
Dread floods my veins.
Of course it would be him—Lucas Adler.
He’s the one who would pull the trigger.
I still don’t get why he didn’t do it when he came to my house.

A sick knot tightens in my stomach.
My human instincts scream at me to run, to escape this uncertainty.
Damn these weak human traits.
“Just talk to her,” I beg.
Evelyn would despise being locked up, especially after five years of freedom.

“I’m not interested in what she has to say. Not now.” Alexander states coldly.

I lower my gaze.
There’s no way I can overpower these men.
Maybe once I stood a chance, but not anymore.
Arguing feels pointless.
But I have to try.
I need them to see I’m not a threat anymore.

I clear my throat.
“Why do you assume she convinced me to come back here?”

“Because she did.” A deep voice sounds behind me.
Then I feel the cold press of metal against my skull.
I shut my eyes and count, waiting.
Will I hear the shot, or will death come silently?

“Luc, lower the weapon.” Alexander commands.

The gun lifts from my head, but I don’t breathe.
He doesn’t have to obey Alexander.
Hunters work for no one unless they choose to.
He could still blow my brains out any second.

“Speak.” Alexander orders.
His crimson eyes unnerve me.
How does Athena stand them?

“About what? I told your people everything at the house.”

“Athena said Evelyn did most of the talking.” He counters.

“Because I had already told her everything. Evelyn has a way of making people listen. Especially when my life was on the line, given my past.”

“But that’s not like you, Seraphina, is it?” Luc sneers. “You always want to be heard. You always have to get the last word.”

I bite my tongue.
“Things change,” I whisper. “You’ve got this all wrong.”

“No, you have.” Luc grabs my chair and spins me to face him.
“You know what I see. I couldn’t figure her out. There’s truth in her words. She phrases things carefully. She’s built a front, a strong one, probably worked on it for years. But she has no scent.”

“Neither do I.” I snap back.

“You do,” he tilts his head, studying me.
I know what he’s doing.
I’ve seen him do it before—trying to see deeper into the soul.

I swallow hard.
Sweat beads on my hairline.
Nervousness is a new feeling for me.
I hate it more than anything.

“You smell human—sweat and all. But she has no scent. That’s why she stays with you. Your scent is weak, but it can still transfer. She needed it to rub off on her.”

“W…what? No, she had her Lycan stripped away, just like me.”

The Hunter shakes his head.
“No.”

“You’re lying.”

He smirks and shakes his head again.
“I don’t lie. You should know that by now, Seraphina.”

“No one is completely scentless.” I scoff.

“That’s where you’re wrong.” He glances past me, as if waiting for confirmation.
“You passed two burnt-out cars on your way here, right?”

I nod.
“The first looked like the one you and Athena left behind.”

“The assholes in the second car had no scent. Nothing. Just like your friend in the dungeon. The problem is, they were Werewolves. It seems they’ve been given something to completely hide their scents. Just like your blonde friend.”
###Chapter 0380

I glance back at Alexander over my shoulder. "He's lying to me, isn't he? This is just some sick psychological game to punish me before you execute me, right?"

"No."

I turn to glare at Lucas. "Then how couldn't you detect she was a Lycan when we first arrived? I call complete bullshit."

"I'm still working that out myself. She masked her scent remarkably well and concealed her true nature somehow. But now, it's fading. And she's currently locked in the dungeons." Luc smirks at me. "Actually, I'm betting she either wants Levi for herself or she's the mastermind behind this entire operation."

I shake my head in disbelief. This had to be a trap, some elaborate deception. A way to lure me back here, though they still hadn't killed me yet. I knew all about tricks—I'd executed plenty myself. After Levi, I'd sworn no one would ever manipulate me again. Someone here was lying, and it definitely wasn't me.

"She took me in." I whisper the words. "She can't be Lycan. She told me her entire story. She showed me proof."

"All part of the act." He shrugs casually. "And you fell for it completely."

"So what if I did? Why do you even care? You could've just told me to get lost."

"Because like you said, you brought her here. Now she's our problem to deal with."

I sit in stunned silence. They had to be wrong. She told me how she escaped. She described everything done to her. She showed me her evidence box—the hospital gown, the empty IV bag. Her detailed escape plan.

"And the villain falls." Lucas laughs as he spins my chair back around to face Alexander.

Alexander watches me with his jaw tight. His crimson eyes lock intensely with mine. I can't read his reaction at all, but the suspense is torturing me.

"Go get Athena." He mutters to Zachary.

I keep my focus on Alexander as Zachary brushes past me. Minutes drag by without anyone speaking. Eventually, two sets of footsteps approach the office behind me.

Athena walks around to the other side of the desk. She sits in the large chair, partially obscured by Alexander's presence.

"I know you don't want to listen to me." I begin.

The single blue eye I can see focuses intently on me. "Everyone leave." Athena commands.

Hands land on my shoulders, making me jump. "Looks like you're getting exactly what you wanted."

I nervously pick at the material on the chair's armrest. My arms remain bound to it, and as my anxiety grows, I desperately need something to occupy my hands. The repetitive picking helps calm my nerves slightly.

The door closes behind the men. Athena says nothing. I'm unsure whether she's waiting for me to speak first or deciding how to handle this situation.

"Could I... could I get some water?" I ask quietly.

"Would you have killed me?" She asks directly.

"Possibly." I whisper the truth. I remind myself to be completely honest now.

"Did you want Alexander too? You wanted to be Alpha—that would mean becoming his mate."

"No. It was never about him. I wanted the Lycans. I wanted our kind to rise, to become superior to the Wolves." I snort derisively. "To be better than Humans."

"Wanted?"

"It was a mistake. I know that now. It just took losing everything for me to finally see it clearly. And I'll keep saying it until you either kill me or believe me."

Claws extend from her fingertips. She flexes her hands and the claws retract. I need to choose my words much more carefully.

"I told Alexander that I had a chance to..."

"I heard. You should have left and taken Evelyn with you."

"You believe Lucas?"

"I was the one who suggested it to him. She reminded me of someone from my past. Always talking, constantly trying to control situations. I'd say you were about three days away from becoming her punching bag. I stopped Luc from killing you so I could get more answers."

"Evelyn isn't... Is she still alive?"

"For now."

"Are you going to kill her?"

"Soon."

I take a deep breath. "Why haven't you killed me yet?"
###Chapter 0381

Athena

Hearing her beg felt strange. There had been a hint of it at her house. Now, desperation saturated her every word. A complete departure from her first arrogant introduction. Perhaps the truth about her friend shocked her. Or maybe she actually meant it.

'We could just kill her.' Nyx suggested with a dark grin. 'She keeps asking. And she was ready to ruin our life. Fair is fair.'

Seraphina dropped her gaze when I remained silent. "I understand. You're torturing me. Withholding the final blow so I live in constant fear, always waiting." She rocked slowly in her chair. "Fear is a bizarre sensation."

"You get used to it." I muttered the lie. You never truly do.

She considered my words. "Julian told me everything that happened to you. Before Alexander—"

"I told you parts of it too. It changed nothing! Knowing my suffering didn't alter your feelings. It didn't change what you thought I deserved. Or what you believed you deserved. Only now, after losing everything, you claim change." She knew it all yet was prepared to destroy me, a half-sister she never cared to know.

Her eyes flicked up to meet mine. "You are the Alpha."

Nyx snorted in disdain. 'She acts oblivious. That was always her goal.'

"I..." She paused for several heartbeats. "It's a bitter truth to accept. But I've learned I'm not that person anymore. Everything hurts. Everything is different. I am changed, though I know you don't believe it."

"You're right. I don't."

She sighed heavily. "Maybe this was always my fate. Payback for the pain I caused. Punishment for Julian. For you. For everything." A hollow laugh escaped her. "There's always someone worse."

They both had said that. Seraphina and Evelyn. "Who told you that?"

"Levi." she muttered. "The night he took me, or after. He was making a point, outsmarting me. Not that it's difficult anymore." Her brows furrowed. "You can link him, right?"

I stared, weighing how much to reveal.

"Because he's a Lycan?" she pressed. "You link all Lycans. I heard your call for everyone to come. So you must link him and Evelyn if she's truly Lycan."

'Don't tell her. She doesn't need to know.' Nyx warned.

"Unless you can't." Seraphina murmured. "But that's impossible. I heard you. Zachary must have. Brianna linked you. My mother and stepfather heard your call."

"I had a connection to Levi. I check everyone who arrives." I revealed, earning a groan from Nyx. "But it's gone. Evelyn's too. Luc thinks they work with a Witch. A powerful one who severed their connection to me."

"Witches don't work with Lycans. They work with Wolves, never Lycans." Seraphina stated. "Look, I'm useless physically now. But I possess knowledge about Lycans. Knowledge you might lack."

"A Witch worked with our father." I countered.

"Don't..." she began, her eyes locking with mine. A small crinkle formed on her forehead. "You were bound as a child."

"Which required a powerful Witch's help because I already had my Lycan. Think, Seraphina. Levi can strip Wolves and Lycans. He gave Wolves something to mask their scent completely. Evelyn concealed her identity."

'Tread carefully.' Nyx cautioned.

'I am.'

"I never saw Witches in the prison. At least, I don't think so. I wouldn't know how to identify one." She shrugged. "But there were women. 'Nurses,' Levi called them. They weren't. They brought food, water, changed IV bags, escorted us to showers. They never spoke. Always looked entranced. Like automatons."
###Chapter 0382

"Wolves and Lycans?"

"I'm not sure. I can't distinguish them anymore. They might be like me, for all I know. People he has punished."

She was cooperating a bit too easily. She could be telling the truth, or she might be stalling. What if Levi had given her something too, allowing her to mask her identity?

'Alexander.' I link him. I knew he was nearby. 'Come take her to the dungeons and bring me Evelyn.'

Alexander appears without a word. He unties Seraphina from the chair but quickly binds her hands again.

"Where are we going? Where are you taking me?" she demands.

"For a walk."

"Are you going to kill me?"

"I suppose you'll find out." He winks at me as he forces her out of the office.

I let out a heavy breath when I'm alone. It never gets easier. The urge to kill her right here is overwhelmingly tempting. The image of cutting her open and watching her intestines spill out is stuck in my head.

'Well?' I mutter to Nyx while we wait.

'I'm as uncertain as you are. She's sharing information, but it could be intentional. We should have kept Luc here.'

'Luc has probably gone to see Hannah.'

"Please don't... please... I've done nothing wrong." Evelyn's voice grates on my ears as Alexander tells her to be quiet.

"Just move." Alexander snaps.

"I've done nothing. Why does no one believe me? I told Athena everything I know. This is cruel."

He pushes the office door open, and her mouth shuts the moment she sees me. Her hands are bound just like Seraphina's, though she looks a bit roughed up, maybe tossed around a little.

He tries to put her in the chair, but she resists. Alexander laughs, pressing both hands on her shoulders and forcing her down. One by one, he ties her wrists to the chair as she snarls at him. Her scent was definitely returning, and still, there's no connection to her.

Her grey eyes lock onto mine. "Why are you doing this? We haven't done anything wrong."

"Haven't you?"

"We came here to warn you about Levi. Why are you treating us like this?"

Was she unaware that we could scent her? She had to be, or she wouldn't keep up this act.

Alexander rolls his eyes at her.

"What did you hope to achieve by telling me about him?"

"That you would take action against him. He can't be allowed to get away with this. We don't deserve this. We don't deserve to lose our Lycans!"

Nyx laughs, 'She really has no idea we can scent her, does she!'

'Maybe not, but if we can scent her, there's a good chance she can shift.' I reply. 'Those ropes won't hold her in that chair.'

"Seraphina showed you where our pack was?"

"Yes. She told me you're her half-sister. I couldn't believe my luck that you're the Alpha. I've been trying to find ways to bring Levi down for years."

"It does sound like you're lucky." The intensity of my desire to kill her grew with each passing second.

"You were hidden for so long." She mutters, avoiding eye contact.

"I wasn't hiding."

"I didn't mean it like that." She shakes her head, trying to get a blonde strand out of her face. "I mean you were kept away for so long, and then this happened to me. I had no way of finding you, not until Seraphina."

"And it just so happened that Seraphina is my half-sister." Hearing myself call Seraphina my half-sister out loud made my skin crawl.

"Right! Pure luck." She smiles.

"Not a setup at all."

I watch the color drain from her face. "I don't know what you're talking about. How could it be a setup? Why would I give up losing my Lycan?"

'She keeps playing the same tune.' Nyx growls.

Alexander watches me from behind Evelyn. Maybe he knew I was seconds away from tearing out her heart. But perhaps we could use her to lure out Levi.
###Chapter 0383
Lucas Adler

Hannah is asleep when I arrive at the hospital.
She’s been drifting in and out for days.
Mostly out.
Theodore insists it’s just her body’s way of healing.
That she needs this.
It still feels wrong.
Waiting this long.
It doesn’t sit right with me.

The others are handling Seraphina and Evelyn.
If they need me, they know where I am.

I take a seat beside Hannah’s head.
Her face is tight.
Like she’s in pain.
Knees pulled to her chest.
Small whimpers escape her lips.
Fingers twitching against the pillow.
But she isn’t in physical pain.
Not now.
Every time she sleeps, she relives it.
All of it.

I’ve gathered pieces.
In the short moments she’s been awake.
Levi took her.
He led her toward the edge of pack territory.
Pinned her down.
She fought.
She wouldn’t have months ago.

He still got the needle in her.
She said her body went heavy.
Control slipped away.
He took her to a building.
Beat her until she was covered in bruises.
They’re still there.
Purple and yellow on her skin.
She doesn’t remember everything.
Says it’s fuzzy.
But he told her it was because he saw her with me.
Said she was broken.
That a Lycan shouldn’t be with a Hunter.
Said he was going to fix her.
That she was being punished.

He chose her.
Not me.
That tells me he’s weaker than he pretends.

He wasn’t wrong about us.
But doing this to her?
It’s disgusting.
I’ve already planned how I’ll skin him alive.
Slowly.
With a very dull blade.

Theodore enters with a new IV bag.
I push the dark thoughts away.
There will be time for that later.

“Still out?” he asks.
He’d never make it as a Hunter.

I gesture toward her.
It’s obvious.

“It’s a good sign,” he says. “Her brain is helping her body heal.”
He switches the fluid bag.
“She just needs time.”

“She’ll never be the same, will she?”
It’s not a question.

“Are you angry with her?”

I shake my head.
I could never be angry with her.
But this never should have happened.

Hannah moans.
She stretches out.

Her hazel eyes open slowly.
Everything comes into focus.
She stares at me.
Sadness and pain fill her gaze.
Her fingers move to her face.
Like they do every time she wakes.
Checking for the stitches.
Making sure it wasn’t a dream.

She winces at the touch.
Eyes grow watery.
“I made it?”

“Yes.”
She asks this every time.
Needing confirmation she’s safe.
It’s her routine now.

She reaches for my hand.
Her fingers curl tightly around mine.
She tugs me toward the bed.
Just like yesterday.

“I’ll leave you to it,” Theodore says.
He takes the empty bag with him.
I settle on the bed beside Hannah.

She buries herself against my chest.
Snuggling as close as she can.
Minutes later, she’s asleep again.
Her chest rises and falls against mine.
A steady rhythm.
Her lips part as her body relaxes.
But her fingers stay locked on me.
Holding me in place.
Keeping me from leaving.

I breathe in her hair.
Hoping for a trace of her jasmine scent.
But there’s nothing.
She smells like any other Human.
###Chapter 0384

I remained by her side for hours.

Simply watching the steady rhythm of her breathing.

Occasionally, her breath would hitch, a soft double intake.

A single tear would escape her right eye.

Always the right.

I gently wiped each one away.

My mind raced, trying to decide my next move.

I had somehow become a Lycan's safe harbor.

If my parents were still alive, they'd be furious.

A quiet knock sounded at the door.

Alexander entered.

Hannah stirred slightly but didn't awaken.

"How is she?" he asked, his voice low.

"Her soul is more fractured than yesterday," I murmured. "She had existing wounds, ones she was already trying to heal."

"You said a bond would shatter her. Is that imminent?"

"If more cracks appear." I ran my fingers through her vibrant red hair. "And I don't know if we can undo the damage that bastard has caused."

He frowned deeply. "I need a favor."

"Another one?" I arched an eyebrow. "I believe I've done plenty for you already."

"Evelyn is being taken to Athena."

"And you're here instead?"

"She requested I not be present."

"What does that have to do with me?" Hannah pressed closer to me in her sleep, and I held her tighter.

"Seraphina is in the dungeons."

"You want me to kill her? I'd be delighted. I've waited a long time for that."

"No." He paused, studying me. "Out of curiosity, why haven't you killed her already?"

"Athena asked me not to."

"I thought you didn't listen to Lycans."

"Normally, I don't. But she has her reasons. Oddly, I respect them. She's different. She sees things others miss. She listens. She doesn't irritate me." I gave him a sharp, sarcastic smile.

"What do you mean, 'she sees things'?"

I shrugged. "It's hard to explain. Maybe it's how she was raised. Maybe finding her true self settled something in her. I don't know. But she's not a monster. I don't feel the urge to put a bullet in her head like I do with the others."

He almost smiled. "Or perhaps you're finally realizing not all Lycans are evil."

I rolled my eyes dramatically.

"Regardless," he continued, "I want you to come to the dungeons with me. I have questions for Seraphina. I need to ensure I don't overlook anything important."

Hannah would likely sleep for a while longer, based on the last few days.

She didn't stir as I carefully slid my arm out from under her.

She was in the deepest sleep I'd ever seen.

I followed Alexander across the pack grounds toward the dungeons.

Seraphina was curled in the corner of a cell, her hands bound.

Her legs were drawn up to her chest.

She looked utterly broken.

A cold satisfaction settled in my chest.

"This is the end, isn't it?" Her brown eyes lifted to meet mine.

The resemblance was still unsettling, though the brown eyes and short black hair set them apart.

"You must be terrified, waiting to die," I muttered.

She squeezed her eyes shut. "I'm ready."

"He's not going to kill you," Alexander stated.

"Yet," I added with a dark smile, though her eyes remained closed.

I watched her throat move as she swallowed.

Her entire body trembled with palpable fear.

She was genuinely afraid for her life.

How interesting.

###Chapter 0386
Seraphina

My heart hammered against my ribs.

Two men loomed over me, their presence dominating the small space. They weren't in the cell with me, yet they filled every inch of it.

Alexander watched me with his unsettling crimson eyes. Lucas spoke, but his words were lost beneath the roaring blood in my ears. I just stared back, trying to decipher the movements of his mouth. Nothing registered.

The harder I tried, the more my head throbbed. My lungs strained for air, working frantically. A panic attack. Evelyn had called it that right before I agreed to have the IV removed from my arm.

Lucas snapped his fingers sharply. "Are you even listening?"

I wanted to say no. I wanted to tell him his words weren't penetrating the fog of fear. But my muscles refused to obey. I was certain I would wet myself if there was anything left in my bladder.

Evelyn said we all have a fight or flight instinct. Only now, without my Lycan, did I truly understand it. But what did it mean when I was frozen, unable to move or speak to the men who put me here?

"Fear." I caught Lucas's final word. Somehow, I had forgotten what he was capable of.

I forced my head down, dragging in ragged breaths. Was this how my victims felt before I killed them? Did everything move in slow motion as they faced death? Or were they just paralyzed by terror?

My eyes burned with unshed tears. I was weak enough already without them seeing me break down. I would have laughed if this was happening to anyone else.

The cell door screeched open. Alexander moved toward me. He grabbed my elbow and yanked me to my feet.

"What... what are you doing?" My voice was a raw croak.

He offered a smile, but it looked strained. Or perhaps it held some hidden meaning. It was pointless to guess. He wouldn't tell me anyway.

A single tear escaped. I wished I could wipe it away unseen, but my hands were still bound. It traced a cold path down my cheek.

Lucas brought a chair into the cell. Alexander forced me onto it. Lucas held a cup to my mouth. Cool liquid teased my lips, but I turned my head away. Poison would mean a slow death without my abilities.

"It's just water," he muttered.

I peered up into his hazel eyes. I couldn't tell if he was lying. I certainly couldn't smell any poison.

My throat was desert-dry. Every swallow felt like shards of glass. I hadn't had a drink in ages. I took a chance.

I sipped. Relief flooded me. The cold water was the best thing I'd tasted in hours. It was far better than that weird juice Evelyn kept forcing on me. She insisted my taste buds needed to adapt. I drank it, but always made a face at the bitter aftertaste.

"I need you to answer some questions," Alexander stated. My eyes flicked to Lucas. "He is merely here to ensure I get the truth from you."

I nodded. I wasn't risking lies. Not now. A strange knot tightened where my stomach should be.

"Let's start with a few trial questions. What is your name?"

"Seraphina Blackwood," I whispered. I saw the look they exchanged. They expected me to say Harrison.

"How many siblings do you have?"

"Thr... Four," I muttered, almost forgetting my new half-sibling. She must be five months old now. "Two half-sisters and two half-brothers," I confirmed.

"How many people have you killed?"

I shrugged.

"An estimate."

I frowned. Keeping count never bothered or interested me. Many did, but I was paid. Counting was pointless. Once the job was done, I moved to the next client. "Maybe a hundred."
###Chapter 0387

“Why did you sell that child to Humans?”

My gaze shifts to Lucas Adler. Back then, I felt no remorse for what I did to his daughter. It was pure retaliation. I had no issue tormenting someone that way. It simply had to be done. Now… Now I see the cruelty. I killed a mother and her unborn pup in the process. She wasn’t the first. I took a child without hesitation and handed her to the vilest beings on Earth. Humans.

“Because I’m a monster.” I whisper. I had become so vicious without ever pausing to reflect until this moment. I nod at both of them. “I deserve death. I just want to know when.”

Alexander glances over his shoulder at Lucas, who gives a slight nod.

“Athena will decide that.” Alexander states. “Though personally, I’d love to let my Wolves hunt you.”

Being torn apart while still alive wasn’t something to anticipate. I started wishing there had been poison in that cup.

Alexander crouches down in front of me. “I want you to extract every bit of information you can from Evelyn.”

I still couldn’t believe she had betrayed me. Everything she said and did seemed genuine. But now, after everything Athena revealed, I see it clearly. Evelyn was nothing but a liar.

“I’ll try.”

“You’ll do more than try. Your life depends on it.” Lucas snarls.

“Right.” I lower my eyes. “And if I don’t?”

“I think you know the answer.” Lucas replies.

“So you’ll kill me if I fail, and you might still kill me even if I succeed.”

“Correct.” Lucas smiles coldly. “Glad we understand each other.”

Alexander unties my hands and pulls a protein bar from his pocket. “Eat. If you’re going to do this, I can’t have you starving.” His tone is empty. I doubt he’d care if I starved. I’m just a pawn in his game. For now, that means I get to live.

He unwraps it and hands it to me. “Move.”

I stand up. He removes the chair from the cell. Lucas swings the door shut and turns the lock. I take a small bite of the bar and stash the rest in my pocket. Who knows when I’ll eat again.

“Wait, what exactly do you want me to find out?”

“Use your brain.” Lucas smirks. “You’ve done this before. It shouldn’t be hard to figure out.”

I’m left in the dark. It’s shocking to realize how blind Humans are without light. Evelyn had let me sleep with a light on for comfort. The night we left, street lamps lit the road. But here, I can barely see my own hand in front of my face.

The dungeon door eventually opens. Rays of sunlight briefly illuminate the space. I see Evelyn before I see Zachary. Her hands are bound, just like mine were. Zachary’s dark eyes find mine and narrow.

He shoves Evelyn into the cell opposite mine. She keeps her head down, but I can see she’s been crying. Fake tears? I’m not sure. I’ve never seen her truly cry.

As he locks her cell, Evelyn slides down the wall to the floor. I still can’t see how she might be a Lycan, but Athena said they can smell her. “Are you okay?” I ask softly once Zachary leaves. He left the light on. Was that for my benefit?

“We have to get out of here, Seraphina! You were right. We never should have come.”

“What did Athena say to you?”

“She asked me about Levi. I told her what I know, but I don’t think she cares. I thought she was supposed to be a great Alpha.”

“I guess she’s just being cautious.” I sigh.

“You weren’t in there as long as I was.” She stares at her lap.

“Maybe she just doesn’t want to listen to me.” I mutter, frowning. “Maybe she thought you might know more. I guess now we just wait.”

“Screw that. I’m finding a way out of here.”
###Chapter 0388
Theodore

I tied my hair back and picked up the clipboard to review the medical inventory. Isabella had always maintained meticulous records, ordering supplies through Alexander whenever stocks ran low. Continuing her system felt like a small way to honor her memory.

Becoming the new pack physician was never my intention. Yet among those Isabella trained, I possessed the most experience. Our growing population of Wolves and Lycans demanded a dedicated doctor.

I checked each item, compiling a list of necessities. Treating Brianna's gunshot wound and now Hannah had depleted our reserves significantly.

The front door creaked open then slammed shut. I peered around the corner but found no one. The air carried no unfamiliar scents. Just the wind, I concluded. Though accustomed to solitude, this place amplified my loneliness.

I collected a fresh IV bag and headed toward Hannah's room. Her bed stood empty.

"Hannah?" I called out, thinking she might have woken and visited the bathroom. "HANNAH?"

Silence answered me. For a moment I wondered if she had stumbled out the front door. Then a faint moan reached my ears.

I yanked the bathroom door open. She startled me badly.

She lay unconscious with her face pressed against the toilet bowl, blood smeared across the porcelain. Rolling her over revealed torn stitches. Luc would murder me if this kept happening. Last time he threatened to remove certain body parts.

I lifted her from the floor and carried her back to bed. After setting up a new IV, I cleaned her wound and restitched her face. Hopefully Luc wouldn't notice.

As I finished, she mumbled Levi's name. The monster who did this to her. Cruelty didn't begin to describe it. I thought forced bonds were horrific. Learning Athena endured four bonds sickened me. But this...no words could describe it. He deserved to rot.

Hannah coughed and rolled onto her side, reaching for the water jug.

"I'll get it." I rushed to prevent her knocking it over.

I filled a cup and inserted a straw. Helping her sit up, she groaned as her deep chestnut eyes met mine. "Where's Luc?" Her voice came out raspy.

"He went to assist Alexander. He'll return soon."

"Am I safe?"

"Yes."

"I made it?"

"Yes."

She nodded and sipped through the straw. She was an unusual person. Or had been. A Lycan who couldn't shift. I hadn't researched her condition yet, but she believed her captors' drugs caused it.

From my recent studies, I suspected otherwise.

Hannah closed her eyes. "I have a message."

"A message?"

"Levi said I am the message."

"You are the message?" I repeated. She gave a faint nod and lazily pushed red hair from her face.

"Where's Luc?" she asked again, her eyes barely open.

"He'll be back soon," I reassured. "Can I get you anything?"

She shook her head weakly. "I ran. I ran as fast as I could." Her fingers twitched. "Why aren't I healing?"

Luc must have told her already. Her memory seemed affected.

"Levi took your Lycan abilities. Remember?"

She frowned, lips parting slightly. She nodded slowly then shook her head.

"You can't heal anymore, Hannah."

"You're wrong." She snapped defensively. "I can heal. I've always healed."

I lifted her arm, showing the purple bruises covering her skin. "You've been here almost four days."

She examined her arm then looked at the other equally bruised limb. "He pinned me down."

She sounded like she was trying to convince herself.
###Chapter 0389

"Zachary discovered you right by the gates." I verify.

Tears escape the corners of her eyes. "You should rest. Alexander and Luc will likely have more questions later."

She lies back, closing her eyes. I exit the room.

I take a seat behind the small nursing station, waiting for Alexander. I had already notified him. When he arrives, Luc is trailing right behind him.

"She spoke to you?" Alexander asks.

"Yes. Though it wasn't much different from her earlier statements. She mentioned having a message, that she is the message. But I suspect her memory is fragmented."

"She is the message?" He questions.

"A warning," Luc mutters darkly. "So he's boasting about how easily he corrupted one Lycan? Showing us he can do it again whenever he wants?" His hazel eyes fix on me. "Is she still awake?"

"No. I should also inform you she left her bed while I was taking inventory. I found her in the bathroom. She had torn her stitches. I've already treated her. She's stable."

"No harm done?" He glares at me. We had a decent rapport until he learned about my past. Now, everything I say or do seems to irritate him.

"She is fine. Theodore has confirmed this," Alexander states, shooting Luc a look. He turns back to me. "How long until we can have a coherent conversation with her?"

"Under normal circumstances, I could estimate. But I've never treated anyone in this condition. It could take days. Or even weeks."

Luc begins pacing, rubbing his temples. "We need more intel on this Levi Bennett character!"

"Do you believe you're the only one considering that?" Alexander retorts sharply.

"Athena can't establish a link to him?" I frown.

"No. Somehow, he has no discernible connection to her," Alexander explains.

"Are we certain he is even a Lycan?" It was a speculative question, but I voice it anyway. I'm piecing things together, and this is one possibility I can formulate.

Both men halt, staring at me.

"Of course he is. I scented him when he was here. Seraphina said she recognized his scent the night he took her," Luc insists.

"But didn't you state that Evelyn completely masked her scent? To the point you believed she was Human?" I counter. He scowls. He dislikes being outmaneuvered; he admitted that himself during our search for answers regarding Athena. I ignore his reaction and continue addressing Alexander. "What if he has perfected a method to deceive the mind entirely? A complete mental trick?"

Alexander nods slowly. "We initially believed Athena was merely a bound Wolf. But she confirmed a pre-existing link to him before these events unfolded. That link is now severed."

"Consider the facts. What do we truly know? We know Levi somehow stripped Hannah's Lycan abilities. And Seraphina's. We know he manipulated Seraphina into believing he was her mate. We know Evelyn concealed her scent so effectively we mistook her for Human. Is she a Lycan or a Wolf?"

"A Lycan."

"Correct. She accomplished something previously thought impossible. Levi likely aided her. So, what prevents him from altering his own scent? Or fabricating a false link for Athena to perceive? I briefly considered Witchcraft. But what if he possesses Witch blood? Or is a potent Witch himself? His fixation on punishing Wolves and Lycans… it aligns disturbingly well."

A grin spreads across Alexander's face. Luc looks like he just swallowed something bitter. Alexander enjoys solving puzzles, seeing beyond the obvious. Perhaps that's the core issue—Luc relies too heavily on his senses instead of his intellect.

Alexander grips my shoulder. "Come with me. I'll summon another nurse to cover here."

"Are you certain? Hannah is still vulnerable."

"I'll remain," Luc grinds out through clenched teeth.

I inform him I recently replaced her IV bag. Only routine monitoring is required now.

He gives a terse nod and vanishes into her room. I have little doubt I've just become his newest object of resentment.
###Chapter 0390
Athena

“That sounds like pure fantasy to me.” I shake my head, struggling to process Theodore’s words.

“There was a time none of us believed in Lycans either.” He gestures toward the window where Lycans are training. Zachary ordered them to intensify their drills—all to protect me. “We’ve learned a great deal since then.”

“He’s right,” Alexander says. “Remember what happened when that first Lycan emerged from the forest, right over there? You hid. We tore it apart because we had no idea what it was.”

'He’s right,' Nyx murmurs.

'How would you know? You weren’t even here!'

'I have access to all your memories,' she huffs.

“So you’re saying he’s a Witch… but he’s not working with one?” I ask. Madame Zora is the only Witch I’ve ever met, and she’s gone now. Nothing like this.

Alexander nods. “Witches vary. They aren’t uniform like Lycans or Wolves—or so I’ve heard. Different strengths. Different abilities. And they’re damn near impossible to find. Some, like Madame Zora, work for Wolves—for a price. Others act like they’re above everyone. No idea why, given how few remain.”

“Seraphina said they don’t work with Lycans, but Evelyn is one.” I’m trying hard to connect the dots, but it feels like a giant piece is still missing. Something none of us can see.

“Did Luc piss off any Witches? Is that why Levi is doing this?” I ask.

“I already asked,” Alexander tells me. “He said he doesn’t deal with Witches. They never interested him… until now.”

“Because of Hannah?”

He nods.

“He’s with her at the hospital right now,” Theodore adds. “She’s slowly becoming more lucid. When she’s ready, we might get more answers.”

I nod, rocking gently. Evrin clings to me like he has all morning. Almost as if he senses something’s wrong. Alexander offers to take him, but Evrin just holds me tighter.

“So he’s a Witch who faked being a Lycan… and he’s strong enough to form a link with me?”

“I know it sounds far-fetched,” Theodore agrees. “But it fits.”

'No,' Nyx mutters. 'No, it fucking doesn’t.'

“What’s our next move?” I ask, keeping my—and Nyx’s—thoughts private.

“We need Evelyn to break,” Alexander says, leaning over the cot to check on a sleeping Logan.

“She didn’t even realize I could scent her,” I reply. “She kept going, spinning her story about what Levi did to her, even as her scent gave her away. I expected her to shift, but she just played the victim—like we were wrong for tying her up.”

“Seraphina will try to get information out of her,” Alexander tells me.

'Why?' Nyx mutters in my head.

“Why would she do that?” I ask.

“I asked her. She feels just as betrayed learning the truth about Evelyn. I don’t think she’s doing it to help us—more to satisfy her own anger at being deceived. She knows she could die either way, and she still agreed.” Alexander’s crimson eyes linger on me.

“I thought you might’ve killed her.”

“I considered it. But with everything happening, I figured we could use her. To do that, we’ll need to feed her. Bring her out once a day so she can report whatever Evelyn is plotting.”

“If we bring her out, we have to bring Evelyn out too. Otherwise, she’ll suspect something,” Theodore adds. “It seems like Levi has some attachment to Evelyn, right?”

“Maybe,” I sigh. “Or it could be the other way around. Luc thinks there’s a good chance Evelyn is running the show.”

I notice how Alexander is looking at me. He’s been wary of Theodore since the car accident, but now, I hope he feels better knowing Theodore shared this intel. He could’ve kept it to himself—just like he could’ve hidden the fact he was born a Hunter. But he didn’t.
###Chapter 0391
