I keep rocking gently until Evrin’s tight grip begins to loosen.
He’s finally drifting off after being restless all night.
“So we just wait?” I whisper softly.

Alexander gives a single nod. “Yes. But I’d still rather you stay indoors. I won’t let Levi get near you again.”

I offer a faint smile. “I’ll kill him if he tries.”

“Not if he drugs you first.”

“Let me take him. You’re exhausted.” Alexander carefully lifts a crying Evrin from my arms.
It’s nearly three in the morning, and he hasn’t settled since sunset.
Nothing calmed him.
He’s clingy but rejects touch. He wouldn’t even stay near his twin.
Thankfully, Logan is still asleep in the nursery. We moved Evrin here so he wouldn’t wake.

“Is he sick?” My voice trembles. It’s agony when you can’t comfort your own child.
Worse, because I feel his pain. I just don’t know where it’s coming from.

Alexander shakes his head. “He ate. Diaper was full. No fever.” He paces slowly, cradling our son like a newborn. “I linked Theodore. He’s coming to check.”

“You do think something’s wrong?” I can’t hide the worry.

“No. But you’re worried, so he’ll reassure you.”

He keeps pacing, but Evrin’s cries don’t stop.
When the knock comes, relief washes over me.

Theodore examines Evrin thoroughly, then shakes his head at Alexander.

“There has to be something,” I insist, pulling Evrin close.

“Physically, he’s perfect,” Theodore sighs. “No fever. No joint issues. No swelling. I’m sorry, Athena. It’s not medical. How long has he been crying?”

“Almost six hours,” Alexander replies.

“And he hasn’t cried himself to sleep?” Theodore asks.

Alexander shakes his head, lips pressed thin. He’s worried too.

“What about Luc?” I ask impatiently. “Maybe he can sense something?”

“Find him,” Alexander orders Theodore.

“No need. I’m here.” Luc strolls in wearing only gray joggers. “I was training late. Heard the kid crying for h—”

He stops. Stares at my sobbing son. A frown forms. “He’s the younger twin, right?”

“Yes.”

“Interesting. How old were you when you first shifted?”

“A few days old. But then I was bound.”

Alexander holds up a hand. “You think he’s trying to shift?”

“Exactly.” Luc steps closer. “His bones are trying to break. The crying masks the sound. You remember how painful shifting was after your binding broke? That’s what he feels. Constant pain as his Lycan fights to emerge.” His hazel eyes meet mine. “He’s scared.”

“Scared?” Theodore asks.

Luc nods. “Trying to hold it back.”

“You have to show him, Athena,” Alexander says as Evrin keeps crying. He turns to the others. “Leave us.”

Evrin squirms as I hand him back. I wait for Luc and Theodore to go and start undressing.

'Are we really doing this?' Nyx murmurs.

'I’ll do anything for our son.'

I close my eyes and let my Lycan rise.
Bones crack. Hair sprouts. Claws extend.
I open my eyes, fully transformed, to find Evrin silent. Staring.
Hours of crying finally ceased.

His blue eyes are wide. He leans against Alexander’s chest, propped by his arm.
I expect a scream. Instead, he reaches out. Beckoning.

I step closer. His bones crack.
A soft whimper. Tiny claws appear at his fingertips.
Minutes later, Alexander holds a small black Lycan pup instead of our little boy.
###Chapter 0392
Seraphina

Evelyn paces her cell relentlessly.
Her fingers trace every inch of the cold stone walls.
She searches for weaknesses I know don't exist.
I remain seated, observing quietly.
Perhaps her ignorance of Alexander's influence over Wolves makes her hopeful.
But I knew better.
He would have sealed every possible escape route after Julian revealed how Gabriel escaped.

"There has to be something." she murmurs, more to herself than to me.
She hasn't glanced my way for hours.
Those same words have left her lips countless times since our confinement began.

"Suppose you find an exit." I challenge quietly.
"Do you truly believe you'd evade capture?"

Her hands drop to her sides abruptly.
She turns slowly, her face leveling with mine in the dim light.
The shadows conceal her eyes completely.

"The forest isn't far." she insists.
"I saw when that man brought me back.
No guards were posted."

I find her observation difficult to believe.
Perhaps she missed them during her confrontation with Zachary.
Or maybe she was too distracted yelling at him.

"Evelyn, stop this." I urge gently.
"You're making things worse for us."

"How much worse could it get?"

"Will you say that when they sentence us to the hunt?"

She freezes at my words.
"What does that mean?" she snaps sharply.

"I've been threatened with the hunt before." I explain with a frown.
"That means you'll receive the same sentence."

"The hunt?" she scoffs, resuming her search.
She tests each bar methodically.

"My mate... former mate, told me about Alexander's methods for severe punishments." I continue quietly.
"His wolves hunt the condemned.
They tear them apart while they still breathe."

"Like Rogues?" she questions, pausing momentarily.

She rarely mentioned Rogues before.
I hadn't shared that part of my history with her.

"Essentially." I confirm.
"I don't know if they consume their victims.
Julian never gave me that answer."

"I don't believe it." she shrugs.
"Probably just scare tactics."

"I'm not so certain." I mutter.
I break off a small piece of my protein bar secretly.
The taste is awful, but my hunger outweighs the flavor.

"Even if it's true," she argues, "he wouldn't do that to us.
We're practically Human.
We wouldn't stand a chance."

"I don't think he cares about that." I watch her press against the bars.
She stops suddenly and looks directly at me.
"Do you have food?"

"No." I lie instantly.
Guilt twists inside me, but she's been equally dishonest with me.
Just not about sustenance.

"You're lying." she snarls.
"Share some with me."

"I'm not lying, Evelyn!" I retreat to the farthest corner of my cell.
She must have scented the protein bar.
A Human shouldn't detect such faint odors.
I don't question her though.
I want her to reveal things accidentally.
It always works better that way.

Evelyn shakes the bars violently, as if expecting them to open.
"They should worry about Levi, not us." she mutters while testing different bars.

"Do you think he'll come for Athena?"

"Probably." she answers without hesitation.
"Taking the female Alpha's powers would be quite an achievement."

An achievement?
Strange choice of words.
If she supported Athena, she should express hope against it, not label it an accomplishment.

"Judging by the situation, he'll face significant resistance." I sigh heavily.
"There are many Wolves and Lycans here."

"There really are." she agrees.
"How many do you think?"

I shrug helplessly.
"Alexander's pack is large even without the Lycans.
Athena called everyone.
I have no idea how many responded."

She nods slowly.
"A few hundred?"

"I don't know."

"How many did you see?"

"I wasn't paying attention." I admit.
"I was just hoping I wouldn't die soon."
###Chapter 0393

"You have to stay focused, Seraphina. We won't make it out of here unless you help me."

I give a slow nod. "I'll check later. I haven't slept."

"Fine!" she huffs in frustration. She drops heavily to the floor as I curl into the corner, turning my back to her. It might be a risky move, but she wasn't getting through to me.

I don't know how long I slept before Alexander yanks me off the cold floor. He binds my wrists tightly with rough rope, staying silent while Evelyn watches.

He pushes me toward the stairs. That familiar knot tightens in my stomach. Alexander glares, and I keep my mouth shut. Evelyn begs him to tell her where I'm being taken.

He gives no answer. The lights click off as we leave the dungeon, plunging her into darkness. But she'll still see. She is a Lycan, after all.

I stay quiet as he leads me toward the packhouse. Maybe that means I'm not dying today.

Inside the office, we're alone. He unties the ropes and points to a chair. "Sit."

I obey. He takes the seat behind the desk.

"Did you learn anything?"

"She believes she can escape."

He scoffs. "And?"

"She called it an achievement for Levi if he could strip Athena of her abilities." I shake my head. "I've met all kinds of people, but calling that an achievement is..." Words fail me.

"Like she wants it to happen."

I bite my lower lip and nod.

"Did you ask anything else?"

"You want intel. I can't get that if she suspects me." I drop my gaze. His crimson eyes are unsettling. "She also asked about the numbers in your pack. She already knows we're near the forest."

"Anything more?"

I shake my head and hold out my wrists, expecting to be tied again. But he walks past me to the door. Someone hands him something. The door closes.

"That's a start," he mutters, circling me. "Now eat."

He sets a plate on the desk—a sandwich and water. It looks like the best meal I've ever seen. My stomach rumbles loudly. But is this a trick?

"Is this a reward?" I ask, eyes locked on the food.

"Yes. If you're weak or starve, you're useless. Consider it a contract. You fulfill your end, you get rewarded."

"And what do you do?"

"For now, I let you live."

A power move. He knows he's in control. "I'm not signing anything."

"I don't expect you to." He sits. When I bite my lip again, he tells me to stop. "Verbal agreement works. Your choice."

"Fine." I take a bite. The flavors explode. So much for Evelyn saying I'd have to adjust to new food.

Alexander stays silent as I savor each bite. Who knows when I'll eat again? I finish the water. "She'll be suspicious."

"We're handling it."

"What does that mean?"

"Not your concern. Finished?"

I nod. He reties my wrists. I keep my head down as we return to the dungeons.

He shoves me into the cell and removes the ropes. It's all for show, but I'll take that over a slit throat.
###Chapter 0394
Athena

'He already has his Lycan.' Nyx murmurs, her voice filled with disbelief.
'Yes.'
'What's our next move?'
'Nothing.' I respond firmly. I refuse to bind him like they did to me. This is his true nature. But why Evrin and not Logan? Logan is the firstborn, yet there are no signs of this happening to him.

After shifting back to human form, Evrin collapsed into a deep sleep. Nothing could wake him now. 'Nothing.' Nyx wasn't questioning me, but confirming we shared the same view.

I run my fingers through Evrin's dark hair. He smiles in his sleep. I glance at Logan playing on the floor with his toys. Will he shift too? When will it happen? At thirteen like others?

I know I shouldn't compare my sons, but the questions keep coming. No one here has answers. Not even Luc.

I wonder how my parents reacted when I first shifted. The memory fades as I recall how quickly they bound me. Their disappointment contrasts sharply with my pride in Evrin.

I pick up Logan. "Let's let your brother rest." He needs sleep after last night. Carrying Logan downstairs, I see Alexander escorting Seraphina from his office.

She doesn't notice us, head bowed as Alexander marches her out. Hopefully she gave him useful information.

Logan and I enter the kitchen. Luc is eating breakfast. He waves as I set Logan down with his toys.

"Just the one today?" Luc asks.
"Evrin is sleeping."
"Rough night for him, wasn't it?" He smirks, looking pleased with himself.
"What does it mean?" I demand. "He's not the oldest. Logan should inherit both packs. When Theodore researched me, he said my early abilities came from being the last female Alpha. So why Evrin?"

Luc chews slowly, studying me with narrowed hazel eyes. "I don't have that answer."
"You must know something."
"You'd think so, but I'm drawing blanks. Like you said, he's not the eldest. It doesn't make sense, but it's happening regardless. Following his mother's path."

I nod just as the back door bursts open. Charlotte runs inside, crying hysterically. She doesn't stop, rushing past us toward the stairs. Moments later, we hear her frantic footsteps above.

Luc stands as Zachary enters, furious. He throws Charlotte's bag on the table.
"Why is my daughter crying?" Luc growls at Zachary.
"Maybe because she pinned down another child at school! She should be there now, but I had to pick her up early!"
"Start talking!" Luc demands.
"Like I was the one speaking to her teacher?" Zachary snaps, sitting next to me. "She pinned Liam down."

Luc smirks but stays silent. He shouldn't be proud when we're trying to build something better. "Isn't Liam Caleb's eldest?" I ask.
"Yes." Zachary replies. "We've already had issues with Caleb about Lottie attending that school."
"The bastard should mind his own business." Luc retorts.
"The school is for everyone." I warn him. "There are more Lycan children than Wolves there now." I turn back to Zachary. "Did Charlotte say why she did it?"
"Not exactly. She just said he made her very angry." He points upward. "This isn't like her."

He's right. She never lashes out unless having nightmares. Normally she's calm and friendly. Anger isn't part of her nature.

"I'll speak to the Lycan." Luc offers.
I shake my head. "You will not. I won't leave those three children fatherless."

He smiles at me, almost proud that I guessed his intentions.
###Chapter 0395
"Go be with your daughter." Zachary mutters. "You're always training, working, or with Hannah."

"Are you saying I'm neglecting my child?!" Luc's nostrils flare as he slams his hands on the table, visibly restraining himself.

Zachary glares back, confirming the accusation.

"Enough!" I snap. "This pack has enough issues without you two constantly fighting! Sort it out now!" They both fall silent. Seems Evrin isn't the only one pushed to his limits.

"I'm going to talk to my daughter and get the full story!" Luc snaps, storming out of the kitchen.

Zachary opens his mouth to speak, but I shoot him a warning look.

"Did she hurt him?" I ask once Luc is out of earshot.

"Not exactly."

"What does that mean?"

"She launched herself across the room at him. Used a chair to pin him down and threatened, 'My dad will kill your dad.' The teacher wants her home for a few days. She's asking Caleb to do the same with Liam."

"My dad will kill your dad? Was she referring to you or Luc?"

"I think we both know the answer. Not sure if Liam provoked her or if she's just having a rough day. No nightmares last night, even with Evrin crying constantly." His eyes shift to Logan. "Where is he, anyway?"

"Asleep." He doesn't know yet. I take a deep breath. "He shifted."

He blinks several times. "Sorry, what?"

"Evrin shifted. He was crying because his body was trying to shift and he was fighting it. I showed him my Lycan form, and he shifted. A beautiful little black Lycan. And Alexander hasn't spoken to me since."

"Trouble never comes alone, does it?"

I shake my head. Problems never arrive one at a time, not in this life.

****noveldrama

"I'm sure it's nothing." Brianna tells me, cradling Luca. "He might just be in shock."

"He encouraged me to show Evrin. Now he's been avoiding me all day. I've linked him, and he keeps saying he has other things to do. It's not like him."

"As a bitten Lycan, remind me, how old are you when you first shift?"

"Around thirteen."

"Maybe that's it. He thought he had at least twelve more years to prepare. Alexander adores you, and I doubt anything scares him. But maybe this part of fatherhood does because it's beyond his control."

"I hope you're right." I mutter. "Maybe this will slow him down on wanting another."

"Another pup?"

"Yes. And before you get any ideas, I'm not pregnant."

She presses her lips together and raises a brow, turning away. "Do you ever wonder if the next one will be a Wolf like Alexander? That would be interesting, wouldn't it? Siblings that are a mix of Wolves and Lycans. Or one that's a blend of both. Is that even possible?"

"Who knows?" I tuck my legs under me. "Has Sebastian told you what's been happening?"

She nods.

"You knew Victoria quite well. Did she use Witches? I mean, she must have—her and Dominic had me bound. What I'm asking is, did you ever meet any?"

"No. She rarely let me meet anyone. After running away, the older I got, the more I realized how wrong everything was. I was too blind to see it. I should have challenged them more when I learned about you. I should have recognized all the red flags instead of just accepting it."

She takes a deep breath. "I never encountered a Witch. Victoria and the others never mentioned one. We didn't even come across any when we lived with the Rogues."

I can see my mention of Victoria bothers her. Sebastian told Alexander she still carries guilt from the past and what she did to me. We never discuss it. It's like a dirty secret between us, though everyone else knows.

I haven't verbally forgiven her, but in my mind, I did long ago. She's become part of this family, my only female friend, and I can't imagine life without her.

She thinks she's being subtle, wiping away a tear as she kisses Luca's head.

"I forgive you."
###Chapter 0396
Brianna

My mind is reeling.

Athena watches me intently. She isn't waiting for a response. She's studying how I absorb her words.

My mouth opens and closes. Words fail me. If I hadn't been holding Luca, I would have dropped anything in my hands.

Forgiveness was something I never anticipated. Never. She made that brutally clear the day she finally let me speak.

I clear my throat, hoping my brain connects to my voice. "You do?"

She nods slowly.

"Why now?" I feel fresh tears welling up.

"You've changed. I've changed. We've both traveled difficult paths." She shrugs like it's nothing. "The person you were back then only cared about herself." A faint smile touches her lips. "I killed the man who shot you because I was furious. I thought I'd lost you too."

I never considered that perspective. She never mentioned it. Luc told me the guy was aiming for Athena. That's why I assumed she killed him. Not because he hurt me.

"I can't express what hearing that means to me." I whisper, grappling with this sudden relief. I hadn't realized how much guilt I was carrying. I grew so accustomed to its weight that its absence feels strange. But good.

"It's ironic." Athena shifts her gaze to the window. "I never imagined seeing you again. I certainly didn't think we'd live in the same pack." "Or that you'd outrank me. Significantly." I add, seeing her lips curve upward.

"Raven was my first friend. Even if she were alive, I doubt we'd be as close as you and I have become."

"She cared about you." I offer.

"For a time. But then... Anyway, do you accept?"

"Absolutely yes!" My outburst startles Luca, making him cry as Athena laughs.

I spend a few more hours with Athena. She contemplates Alexander's reaction to Evrin shifting. I'm sure it was just the shock of the unexpected. In the moment, he was probably excited. Then reality hit. Protecting him just became harder. Some people won't like it.

Leaving the house, I find Charlotte hidden behind a bush. Her back presses against the side wall, concealed from view.

She's doodling on a piece of paper. Discarded food wrappers suggest she's been here awhile.

I slip behind the bushes. She stares at me with wide green eyes, expecting a scolding.

"Charlotte?" I say softly. "Why are you hiding behind the bush?"

"I don't want my Dads to find me."

I lower Luca and sit, my knees touching hers. "You know they can smell you, right?"

"I didn't think of that." Her shoulders slump. Her bottom lip protrudes. "They're mad at me."

"Because of what happened at school?" It's the only logical reason.

She nods. Her bottom lip trembles further.

"Did something make you angry?"

She doesn't answer. She refuses to meet my eyes.

"Everyone gets angry." I tell her. "Lots of things trigger anger. You know what I've learned over the years?"

She shakes her head.

"It's always better to talk about it."

"But they'll be angrier."

"Maybe. But if we don't know why you're upset, we can't help." I hope she finds it easier talking to someone other than her Dads.

"He said I was different. That something is wrong with me."

"Liam?"

She nods. I notice how hard she's pressing the pencil into the paper. "I'm not bad. I help Athena. He called me poison. I don't even know what that means. Then he said... He said someone would kill me in my sleep because I deserve it."
###Chapter 0397

Her small fingers gripped the pencil so tightly it snapped in two.

"But I'm not the bad one."

"You think Liam is bad?"

She nodded vigorously, her braids swinging with the motion.

"Not yet. But he will be."

It seemed impossible to predict a child's future behavior at such a young age. They hadn't even begun to experience life properly.

"Have you talked to either of your fathers about this?"

"Daddy Zachary got angry. Daddy didn't listen. I had to stop Liam, Brianna. Everything he said hurt me deeply. He's mean, but only to me." She smiled softly at Luca sleeping in my arms. "Can't I just stay here with Logan and Evrin? They actually like me."

"Uh huh. She's the one who told me to stand up for myself. So I did."

Her green eyes studied me with uncertainty.

Zachary and Alexander arrived late that evening. I hadn't expected both of them, but perhaps I could reason with them together.

I recounted my entire conversation with Charlotte.

"He called her poison?!" Alexander asked with clear disgust.

"She said she doesn't even know what that means, so she likely didn't make it up. I don't know if it's because she's a Hunter by birthright or if something else is happening, but..."

"I'll handle it," Alexander stated firmly. "She's part of this pack whether they like it or not."

"That won't ease her mind. That girl cried herself to sleep tonight. She's probably back to square one emotionally." Right on cue, she began crying upstairs.

"I'm taking her home. Maybe her own bed will help." Zachary frowned and disappeared up the stairs to find her.

I sighed and looked at Alexander. "You haven't said anything about Evrin."

"Athena told you?"

I nodded, aware I was entering dangerous territory by challenging him. "Is that why you haven't spent time with them today? Why you've been making excuses about going home? Because he can shift?"

I didn't wait for his answer.

"She's sad, and I know you feel her sadness. She thinks you're disgusted that Evrin can shift."

"Not true."

"But you came here with Zachary when you didn't need to. You could have gone home to her. Home to your boys."

Alexander shook his head. "I've been on duty. I don't want news about Evrin getting out."

"That's why you've been avoiding going home?"

"No. I don't want Levi finding out my son can shift. I've been working all day, chasing leads, looking for problems within my pack. Shutting down anyone who thinks they know something."

"You're worried?"

"Wouldn't you be if Luca started shifting? I'm not worried about who Evrin is. I'm worried about the assholes who might try to take advantage of it."

"Then you should tell Athena before she spontaneously combusts from all the thoughts swirling in her head."
###Chapter 0398
Alexander

The pack house stood silent.
No noise came from Athena or the twins.
Zachary must have settled Charlotte because I couldn't hear them either.

I followed Athena's lavender scent upward.
She sat in the attic surrounded by baby items.
Her tired blue eyes lifted to meet mine.
She released a heavy sigh but remained silent, continuing to fold tiny clothes.

"I'm not upset." I stepped further into the light. "I needed to make arrangements to protect him. To protect them both. If Evrin can shift, Logan won't be far behind. I must ensure no one tries to take advantage."

"Okay."

She wasn't speaking her true feelings.
I didn't need to read her mind to know that.

'She's furious.' Titan murmured.

'I can see that.'

I sat on a storage box, feeling it dip under my weight. "I wasn't running from this. That's not who I am."

"Okay."

I hated her one-word responses.
I thought we had moved past this.

"Athena?" My voice dropped lower.
She stopped folding clothes.
Her shoulders slumped as another sigh escaped her lips.

"I can't remember it clearly, but I imagine what Evrin saw when you handed him back... was exactly what I saw during my first shift. A smile that vanished instantly. That urgent need to get away."

"You're comparing me to your father?"

"Not him specifically, but his reaction. They bound me because I shifted early. They tried to abandon me when that failed. When they still couldn't get rid of me, they bound me again. And you... you just handed him to me and walked away. All day you've ignored us. Made excuses not to come home."

'You've triggered her trauma.' Titan whispered, as if Athena could hear him.

I moved toward her as her pain intensified.
She pulled back, tears tracing down her cheeks which she hastily wiped away.

"I didn't expect-"

"Neither did I! But you don't see me running from our sons!" She snapped, her voice sharp.

"I didn't run away."

"You've been gone all day." The tears stopped, replaced by pure anger.

"I was ensuring Theodore hadn't told anyone. Luc knows to keep quiet but we both know Theodore talks too much. He overshares. This would be exciting news to him. He'd think it's wonderful to tell the pack. I only want the pack to know when you're ready. I want to keep the boys safe. I don't want them becoming new targets for Levi. I'm sorry. I shouldn't have left like that without explaining."

I felt terrible, and Titan confirmed I should.

I always insisted Athena never keep secrets from me.
Yet I had done exactly that.
And I was still withholding something.
But she wasn't in the right mindset to hear it. Not yet.

"I assume the twins are asleep."

She nodded, wiping another tear away.
I hated being the cause of her pain, but loved her fierce protectiveness toward our boys. I hoped that part of her never changed.

"Has Logan shifted?" I asked quietly, taking another step toward her.

"No." She sealed the box she had finished organizing. "Evrin hasn't either. He's been sleeping mostly."

"Have you slept?"

She shook her head.
I extended my hand.
Reluctantly, she took it, allowing me to pull her to her feet.
We descended to our bedroom where she collapsed onto the bed without undressing.
She didn't stir as I removed her boots and jeans.

I stripped down and climbed into bed, drawing her against me.
She was deeply asleep, yet her body instinctively pressed against mine, just as it did every night.

'You didn't tell her!' Titan muttered.

'I will. In the morning.'

'It won't go well.'

'I know. But there's no good way to tell her one of our pack members is missing.'
###Chapter 0399

She has to be told.

But not now. She needs rest first. Telling her while she's exhausted won't help.

I look down at my mate's face resting against my chest. She looks so peaceful. That peace is about to shatter.

When I wake, she's still deeply asleep. She's stripped off her remaining clothes and lies on her stomach, the blanket barely covering her. I wish I could stay, but the boys are stirring in the nursery.

I dress quickly and head to the nursery. Both boys are wide awake and standing in their cots. They're happy to see me, but I notice Evrin glancing at the door, searching for his mother.

It was easier to get them ready before they learned to walk and squirm away. Now it feels like wrestling two octopuses every morning.

I take them downstairs. Zachary is already waiting. "Lottie is having breakfast. Did you tell Athena?"

I shake my head. "She was exhausted last night. Telling her wouldn't have helped. She'll have a clear head when she wakes. Though he isn't a Lycan, so she probably can't do anything anyway."

He nods and takes a wriggling Logan from me, making faces at him. "You're sure he didn't just leave?"

"Positive. I can't sense him at all. It's like he vanished from the face of the Earth."

"No." I cut him off. "I know Luc has issues, but I don't believe he'd do this. Besides, he doesn't have the ability to take away someone else's powers. Only one person we know can do that."

"But why Theodore?" Zachary questions. "Theodore never steps out of line. From what we learned from Seraphina and Hannah, Levi punishes those who are 'bad'. Theodore isn't like that."

"I know. That's what makes it so frustrating."

We take the boys to the kitchen for breakfast. Charlotte runs past us quickly.

"You don't think he did something like those Wolves who attacked Athena and Luc, do you?"

"If you asked me a few days ago, that's exactly what I'd think. But Theodore has been part of this pack for a long time. He's helped in many ways. He wouldn't just turn his back."

Luc walks past the window with Hannah following. A deep frown is plastered on his face while she looks like she's about to cry. Unexpectedly, he knocks instead of barging in like usual. Even Zachary raises an eyebrow at me.

I open the back door. Luc's fingers are tightly coiled around Hannah's wrist.

"Tell them!" Luc orders.

I watch her tremble. "Should you be out of the hospital?"

Her eyes move to Luc. "I don't even know if it was real."

"If what was real?" Zachary ushers her to a chair, much to Luc's annoyance.

"I think... I think Levi was in the hospital."

"When?" I demand.

"I'm not sure. I was tired. In and out of sleep." Her fingers run over her neck. "I don't know if I was dreaming or if it was real." Her chestnut eyes move between all of us. "I heard voices. Angry voices but quiet, like a whispered argument."

"Who?"

"Theodore was helping Levi?" Zachary asks, disgusted by the idea after I just said he wouldn't betray us.

Hannah shakes her head at me, keeping her gaze low. "He offered to go with Levi if Levi promised to leave everyone alone."

I glance at the door leading to the bottom of the stairs. "Shit!" I hadn't been paying attention to my mate's movements. As I move to the door and pull it open, I find Athena standing on the other side.

"Theodore is gone?"
###Chapter 0400
Theodore

I stared up at him. "Why are you doing this?"

He paced back and forth across the small room. My head still felt heavy. But it reminded me of my childhood. When my parents would tie me up. I just felt weaker now. It was manageable.

"Do you always talk this much?" His voice was a low growl. He kept glancing out the window of the old cabin. Like he expected someone to follow us. No one knew I had left. But they would figure it out soon.

"Usually. That's my reputation in Obsidian Howl. I crave knowledge. My entire house is stacked with books." I twisted my bound hands. Trying to create some slack. The rope burned my skin with every movement.

"Alright then, Mr. Knowledge. Tell me how to get Seraphina and Evelyn out of the dungeons."

"You can't. They're heavily guarded. They'll spot you from every angle. You'd be a fool to think Alexander only posted one guard. Why do you even want them back? They're useless to you now."

"They didn't see me coming to the hospital, did they?" He smirked, ignoring my question.

"Because it wasn't a priority."

He ran a hand through his short blonde hair. "You're going to help me get them back."

"The deal was that if I came with you, you wouldn't harm anyone inside the pack."

"They aren't part of the pack."

I laughed. "Inside the pack. That was the agreement. I've read enough contracts to know the exact wording!"

He crouched down in front of me. His sage green eyes studied me intently. "You love that pack. Why?"

"It's my family."

He laughed and shook his head. "There are plenty of bad people in Obsidian Howl."

"And you're not bad? You strip people of their abilities. To me, that's evil." My neck still ached where he had injected me. I fought desperately against the drowsiness. But sleep was pulling me under. I needed to get as much information from him as possible. I would find a way to get it to Alexander or the others.

"No Theodore, I'm fixing everything that's wrong." He stated firmly.

"According to who? You? Why do you get to decide what's right and wrong?"

His fingers gripped my cheeks. He squeezed hard enough to cause pain. "Someone has to. Now get some sleep. We have a big day tomorrow."

He left the room. He watched me as he quietly closed the door. Within seconds, my eyelids became too heavy to keep open.

"Wakey wakey, sleeping beauty." He nudged my legs with his boot.

Groaning, I pushed myself up until I was sitting against the wall. "Here, eat."

He placed an apple in my hands. "I don't need you starving."

I took a bite as he watched me. "I assume you didn't tell them. Is that why you came so easily?"

"Tell them what?"

“Oh, you know exactly what I'm talking about." He squatted and wiped some apple juice from my chin.

I took another bite. I refused to say anything.

"Just so you're aware, what I drugged you with isn't permanent like Hannah's or Seraphina's. In a couple of days, you'll be able to scent me again. Though I'm hoping I can convince you not to reject me.”

The blue flecks in his sage green eyes seemed brighter. Full of hope. Like he was completely convinced I would join him. Just because he happened to be my mate. "Maybe I can convince you not to be a jerk!"

He smiled at me. He pulled a bottle of water from inside his jacket. "As much as you think I'm a jerk, I'd rather you didn't die on my watch." “But you'll gladly ruin the lives of others." My eyes moved to the bottle. But I didn't pick it up.
###Chapter 0401

"You don't trust me, do you?" He questions, his voice low.

"Trust isn't something you've earned."

He takes a long drink from the bottle before setting it down in front of me. "There. Now drink. We need to get moving soon."

He moves toward the window, scanning the area outside. I knew we were still in the woods, but not the territory of Obsidian Howl. There were no abandoned cabins here.

"Is Evelyn the Witch?" I ask. It couldn't be her if I was mated to Alexander.

"No. I am. Well, half Witch. Though I must say, I'm particularly proud of how powerful I've become." He turns back to face me. "Evelyn is the only one who knows that about me, and now you. Clearly my Lycan side has connected with yours. Even more amusing considering you're a Wolf." He lets out a low growl. "Did you think your Witch side was stronger than your Lycan side?"

"I did, until I stumbled upon you. You caught my scent when I was hiding in the pack as Owen Carter."

"Only briefly. I thought my mind was playing tricks on me. I picked up your scent and then, within seconds, it vanished completely."

"I had to keep myself hidden while I investigated the pack. I couldn't let you ruin my plans, could I?" He flashes me a wide grin.

"That's how you severed the link to Athena? Because you can conceal your true nature?"

"Exactly."

"She will kill you for this."

"I'm sure she'll try. But will she end up killing you in the process?"

He does one final check outside and pulls me to my feet. He ushers me out into the forest. Even in the darkness, birds were already singing, signaling the approaching dawn. I don't resist Levi. There was no point. He had the upper hand. So I walk, letting him guide me through the trees until I recognize the location where Alexander had asked me to bring clothes for Athena.

"Where are we going?"

"Well, since my little escapee has abandoned her house, I thought we could spend a few hours there. You know, close by but not too far. Get some proper rest instead of that miserable cabin."

"You don't think they'll search here?"

"Why would they? Seraphina and Evelyn are securely locked away. But right now, I'm more interested in you. You haven't complained once about losing your Wolf. Why?"

I simply shrug and continue walking.

"Now you stop talking!" He mutters in annoyance. "And I was just starting to like you."

I remain quiet for a while before asking the question that's been bothering me. "Why Seraphina and not Hannah?"

"Hannah is weak. I have no use for her. She's a waste of resources. Though I must admit, I'm impressed she made it back to the pack." He said nothing about Evelyn.

"So tell me Theodore," his husky voice sends shivers through me. "Why are you so calm? I could slit your throat right now. I could plunge my lovely little blade into your chest and tear your insides out. I could force you to shift, skin you, and make a nice winter coat from your hide."

I glance over my shoulder. "Because you need me. That's why you agreed to leave everyone alone if I came with you. What is Evelyn to you?"

"A pain in my fucking ass." He stops me abruptly. "Don't you see the resemblance?"

"Can't say I've really looked at her. I've been busy trying to help Hannah."

"She's my sister. Same father, different mother."

I laugh, and he glares at me. "What the fuck is so funny about that?"

"One of the guys thought Evelyn had a thing for you."

"Ew, don't be so fucking disgusting." He shakes his head in distaste. "How long did it take for them to figure out Evelyn was working with me?"

I considered lying. Telling him that only I had figured it out. But it wouldn't achieve anything. It might help if he thinks she's about to be slaughtered.

"Since she arrived."

"So why are they keeping her alive?"
###Chapter 0402
Seraphina

A cold shudder races down my spine as Lucas Adler steps into the dungeon. He was the absolute last person I ever wanted to see.

He slowly drags the barrel of his gun along the iron bars of my cell. Each bar produces a harsh, metallic clunk that vibrates right through my bones.

In the cell across from mine, I watch Evelyn shuffle backward into the shadows, darkness swallowing her form. But her quiet, choked sobs betray her location. "Relax, baldy. I'm not here for you." He spins toward Evelyn's cell and repeats the motion, scraping his weapon against the bars while chuckling lowly. "It's your turn, princess."

"No." Evelyn whimpers. "I haven't done anything wrong."

"We just have a few more questions. Answer them correctly, and you can return here to rest that pretty little head of yours."

"I've told you everything I know!" Her voice sharpens with frustration.

"Evelyn, just answer them. You're making this worse for all of us." I mutter under my breath. Lucas glances over his shoulder and winks at me. Wanting the truth and wanting to survive didn't mean we were allies.

Half of Evelyn's face emerges from the shadows, the rest still cloaked in darkness. Tear tracks stained her cheeks. I'd listened to her cry all night long. The sobbing would stop, then start again, a relentless cycle that made me wish for deafness. It felt like a crueler torture than starvation. Until I noticed each sob sounded off. Forced. Exaggerated. I doubt it was for my benefit; she was probably hoping to lure a guard down. Even now, with just one grey eye visible, I saw pure anger, not sorrow. Nothing was going according to her plan.

I might not have caught on if I hadn't been forced to observe her for so long. Time was all I had left.

Being Human came with massive disadvantages, but it did force you to truly learn about those you were trapped with, if you paid close enough attention.

"Does Alexander want to speak with me?" She asks, her voice barely a whisper.

"No, not today. Today is for my entertainment." Lucas flashes her a wide, unnerving grin. He's a complete madman, and I still can't figure out how a Hunter like him ended up embedded here. Hunters are supposed to work alone.

He unlocks her cell door and seizes her by the throat, yanking her resisting body close to his. "Don't try anything stupid. I have zero tolerance for idiocy today. Understood?"

"Yes." She rasps out.

I see it then—real, raw panic floods her features. And she absolutely should be panicked.

Minutes after they leave, heavy footsteps echo on the stone stairs. I retreat to the farthest corner of my cell and wait. Is this it? Has Alexander finally grown tired of waiting and decided to execute us? That would be the only reason both of us are being taken from our cells.

My lungs constrict painfully. I struggle to draw air. Strange black dots swarm my vision. My chest aches fiercely, and I slide down the cold wall, my legs giving out.

"Shit, kid. Breathe."

Caleb's large, familiar hands grip the bars of my cell. His intense blue eyes are wide with alarm as he scans my crumpled form.

"What... what are you doing down here?"

"Your mother is asking questions. I told her if I got permission, I'd come check on you. See how you're holding up."

The black spots gradually recede. I drag a deep, shaky breath into my lungs. I never want to experience that suffocating fear again.

"Just fantastic." I mutter bitterly. "Why didn't she come herself?"

"The pup is being fussy today."

"You didn't need to come."

"Yes, I did. Because I love your mother." He walks away, grabs a lone stool from the dungeon's far end, and sets it directly in front of my cell. "Sometimes, we do things for the people we love, no matter how pointless it seems. How did you end up in this mess, Seraphina?"

"Let's recap. I embarked on a solo mission to reclaim what was rightfully mine. It failed spectacularly. I met someone, let him mark me, and was a complete bitch to him in return. Ended up trapped for months by a man who believes he's a god. My total lack of Lycan abilities made me trust the wrong person, which landed me right back here. Now I'm a prisoner awaiting my execution date."

His forehead creases into a deep frown. "Do you regret any of it?"

I drop my head and let out a bitter snort. "Does it look like I'm enjoying this?"

He rolls his eyes and sits up taller, crossing his muscular arms over his chest. "I was convinced Alpha Athena would have us all eliminated, simply because of who you are and what you did. But she didn't. She gave us a chance. Your mother and your brothers are thriving here. Your little sister will too."

"And what does that have to do with me?"

"You could thrive here too, Seraphina. You could leave the past behind and start over."

"So we can all be one big, happy family, is that it?" I mock.

He stands up abruptly, shaking his head in clear disappointment. "I knew this was a mistake. You're an ungrateful brat. You won't even accept the help being offered to you."

"What help? You mean reminding me that my mother moved on and had more children to replace me?"

"You know that's not what I meant, and you know it's not true. For once in your life, pull your head out of your ass and look at the bigger picture."

"You can leave now." I dig into my pocket, searching for the last remaining piece of my protein bar. My fingers find only crumbs. It must have shattered when I collapsed on the floor.
###Chapter 0403

"We're doing our best, Seraphina. We want to build a life here. The Wolves aren't bad people—well, maybe a few exceptions, but most are content with how things are run. The boys attend school. Your mother helps at the bakery when she isn't caring for Braelyn. Alpha Alexander allows me to work at the gate now."

"Braelyn?"

"Your sister." He smiles faintly.

"Can I meet her?"

He shakes his head. "Not while you're down here. Not until you're no longer considered a threat."

"A threat? I can't smell anything but my own filth. I can't hear anything beyond your voice. I can't heal. I nearly passed out earlier. My stomach feels strange and hollow. Yet you think I'm dangerous."

"Then prove everyone wrong."

He turns to leave, then pauses. He pulls an apple from his jacket and sets it just inside the bars. "Here. It isn't much, but I could hear your stomach growling from the top of the stairs. If you want a chance, Seraphina, do everything they ask."

He didn’t know I already had a task.

"What if it isn't enough?"

"Then I suppose you didn't try hard enough."

I stare at the apple for a long time. Caleb had no reason to be kind. No reason to advise me. If anything, I thought he’d be glad I was facing execution.

I take the apple and retreat into the shadows. I don't eat it. I roll it between my fingers, thinking. How can I get something useful from Evelyn?

Time moves strangely here. It's always dark unless a light is left on. I only know day from night when one of us is taken out. So I have no idea how much time passes before Evelyn returns.

She’s crying—really crying—as Lucas shoves her down the stairs. This time, it sounds genuine. When she comes into view, my jaw drops. He’s shaved her head completely bald. She’s even balder than I am.

Strands of her long blonde hair cling to her dirty sweatshirt. Lucas pushes her into the cell, and she rushes to her dark corner.

"Maybe next time you won't lie," he sneers, turning away without a glance at me.

"Evelyn?" I whisper once the door closes.

Her sobs echo. "He shaved my head. He took everything."

"Why?"

"He said I was lying. Hiding things. He did it to punish me."

"It'll grow back." I repeat what she always told me when I ran my hands over my own fuzz. "He's cruel."

"He's punishing us. He can't shave my hair—it's already gone."

"Do... do you have any food?" she whispers.

I look at the apple. She can smell it, just like the protein bar. If I keep hiding what I have, she might grow suspicious. Stop talking to me. That would sign my death warrant.

"My stepfather visited. He brought an apple. Do you want it?"

"An apple?"

I nod and step into the light to show her. "I can roll it over."

"Thank you. You don't know what this means. My stomach hurts so much."

I take a small bite, then slip it through the bars. I push it hard enough to reach her.

She devours it in seconds. Foolish girl. She should have made it last.

"What did he ask you?" I need to know everything.

"He wanted to know if there was anyone else."

"Anyone else? Like others who were made Human?"

She hesitates. "He thinks I'm working with Levi. They all do. Nothing I say changes their minds. You have to tell them they're wrong!"

"Did you tell them they're wrong?"

"Of course. But that man—he just stared. Then he asked about a girl named Hannah."

"Hannah?"

"I've never met anyone by that name. Levi never—"

"Never what?" My knuckles whiten as I grip the bars.

"He never brought anyone to the prison named Hannah."

"Did you meet the other prisoners?"

"A couple."

That isn't what she told me before. She'd described a story like mine—locked up nearly all day.

"This isn't much different, is it?" I gesture at the walls. "Though I can't believe you killed someone in the library. That couldn't have been easy."

"It wasn't. But I did it." She sounds proud.

Isn't it amazing how easily Evelyn slips up when she thinks someone's on her side? She told me she killed someone in the bathroom to escape. Not the damn library. I don't even know if the prison had a library.

But it's becoming clearer and clearer how much of her story is bullshit.
###Chapter 0404
Lucas

Hannah was utterly useless.
How could anyone be that stupid to play games with us?
If she had just stopped crying for a single moment, I might have gotten something useful.
Still, I enjoyed shaving her head while she screamed.
If she wouldn't talk, I would keep going until she broke.

I pushed the door open and found Hannah sitting up in bed reading.
Alexander had insisted she remain in the house due to her condition.
We argued, but his authority overruled mine.

The room was small and sparsely furnished.
Just a bed, a wardrobe, and a dresser.
She used the bathroom down the hall.

"I assume things didn't go well with that woman from the dungeon?" Hannah asked, setting her book aside.
"I never said who I was meeting."

She pointed toward the window and rolled her eyes.
"The power of sight is remarkable."

She seemed more like herself, though she kept rubbing one spot on her neck.
Her attitude today was starting to irritate me.

"No, it didn't go well. She was a sobbing mess."
"So you shaved her head?" Her chestnut eyes met mine. "I saw her leave."
"She deserved to experience what she'd done to others."

Hannah nodded but kept her lips pressed together.
"You disagree?"

"I didn't say that." She muttered, picking up her book and flipping through pages, clearly ignoring me.
"You didn't need to. Your face says everything."

She slammed the book shut.
"Have you considered that cruelty isn't the best way to get information? Especially from someone in denial."
She kept her eyes on the book.
"I listened from the stairs while you terrorized her."

She exaggeratedly reopened the book and propped it on her knees, reading as if I weren't there.

"Hannah..."
"I know. This is what you do. You're a Hunter created to kill Lycans."
"Only now it bothers you?" I smirked, and she glared.

"Why are you here?" She fired back.
"You made it clear our bond is gone. Alexander wants me here until he figures things out since Theodore isn't at the hospital."
"You don't need to watch me anymore."

"Han..."
"I'm fine." She shrugged.
"I understand. You couldn't ignore the mate bond before, but now you don't feel it. Levi solved your problem. You can forget I ever existed."

I watched as another crack formed in her soul.
Her exterior seemed fine, but her soul told a different story.
Those cracks were multiplying.
One or two in the right place, and she would shatter.

"You're right. I thought it was the bond, but I couldn't get you out of my head. That hasn't changed. That's why I'm here."

Her eyes widened at my unexpected response.

"I spent hours in that hospital trying to understand why I couldn't leave.
I watched you twist from night terrors, wondering how to make them stop.
I thought of all the ways I'd make Levi suffer for what he did to you."

"I've watched your soul crack repeatedly, waiting for those cracks to meet, knowing they'll tear you apart.
I watched because I didn't want that to happen.
I hoped my presence might prevent it."

She slowly set the book down, her eyes lowered.
"You can't, Luc. You can't stop it because I was already broken."

Her tongue slid across her lips as she scowled.
"The fire you pulled me from wasn't my first attempt.
The men who sold me among their friends regularly took me to the hospital."

That was evident from her soul, but I'd never pressed for details.

"You could heal?" I frowned.

"I could, but before fire, I used poison.
It had different effects and was harder to heal from.
At first, I did it for a break from them.
Then it became a way to numb everything.
But my body adapted, grew used to it.
The doses became dangerous, and they watched me more closely."
She smiled.
"It took them too long to figure out what I was doing."
###Chapter 0405

Fire was my only weapon.

Deep burns take a long time to heal, even for fast healers like us. The damage continues to cook beneath the surface long after the initial injury. I burned down several houses during my escape. I don't regret any of it.

But Nathan, the man Luc killed, learned quickly. He never let me out of his sight after that first attempt. Not even for a second. I couldn't shower alone. I couldn't use the bathroom without him standing guard. When he took me shopping for clothes, he came right into the changing room with me. At night, he handcuffed me to the bed so I couldn't sneak out. So I couldn't set another fire. Or strangle him in his sleep.

She nods slowly. So I know I'm broken, Luc. I've heard you talk about the fractures in Athena's soul. I know what happens when those cracks finally meet. It was only a matter of time before it all caught up with me.

Why didn't you tell me any of this before? I knew she was hiding something, but this... this was beyond anything I imagined. Every word from her lips rings with heartbreaking truth.

She releases a soft sigh. Coming here was supposed to be my fresh start. Especially after you shot Nathan. Her hand rubs at her neck again. I never thought I'd lose the rest of my abilities too.

What if you could get them back? And gain your Lycan form as well? It's a long shot, but it might work.

Don't be stupid. This is the hand I've been dealt. This is what I have to live with now.

No. I refuse to believe you came into my life just to wither away in front of me. The higher powers work in messed up ways, but your death isn't part of their plan.

Luc, it's fine. I know what's coming. I've made peace with it.

You can be so fucking frustrating. I snap. She wasn't even willing to hear me out.

Just as frustrating as you watching me for weeks! Making me feel like I was losing my mind before you finally accepted me! Even if it was in secret!

I cross the room and pull her off the bed. She lets out a surprised squeal as I crush her against my chest. My lips find hers in a hard, desperate kiss. She melts into me instantly. Her arms loop around my neck while my hands slide down to her waist.

She pulls back, breathless. I hold her steady, keeping her hips pressed firmly against mine as she leans back to stare at me.

Just because I can't sense our bond anymore doesn't mean I don't want you.

But I'm...

Not if I can convince Athena to bite you.

Bite me? As in mark me? I don't understand. She's already mated.

Not marking you. That's different. You would be like Zachary and Brianna.

Her eyes widen. Her brows shoot up. I still don't understand.

They aren't pure-blooded Lycans. They were created. They were once Human before they were turned.

She frowns, sucking in her cheeks. When her eyes meet mine again, they're filled with a deep sadness that wasn't there before. But you're a Hunter. Why would you make me Lycan again?

You don't want to be?

I don't know anymore. For most of my life, I've just been fighting to exist. More often than not, I've been waiting for Death to find me.

You were in a horrific situation.

I was. But I'm not like other Lycans. I know that deep down. I've never been able to shift. I never had that exciting moment when I turned thirteen. The only thing that changed was that I became a toy for assholes. Having my abilities but not being able to shift did nothing for me. I always thought they were drugging me to keep my Lycan trapped. But since coming here with Cooper, I've known exactly what's being put into my body. And I still can't shift. So what's the point of being bitten if I still can't transform?

###Chapter 0407
Levi

Theodore sat tied up in the corner of the room.
Levi slept on a chair nearby.
His jacket collar was pulled high around his chin.
His arms were crossed tightly over his chest.
His boots rested on the coffee table he'd shoved against the door.

We reached Seraphina's house unseen.
But each step here had made Levi more agitated.
He hated my calm demeanor.
He was angry that I refused to be angry.
He clearly enjoyed driving people mad.
It didn't work on me.

I let out a quiet sigh.
He had cornered me again about his sister.
He grew more frustrated when I stayed silent.
I expected him to hit me.
To punish me.
But he hadn't laid a hand on me.
Other than keeping me bound.

I heard him stir.
My eyes snapped shut.
His boots hit the floor with a heavy thud.
After the forest, his movements now sounded loud.

He stopped right in front of me.
"Can't sleep?"
I didn't answer.
"Theodore, I know you're awake."
He didn't move.
I kept my eyes closed.
"Your breathing changes. You talk in your sleep."

Crap.
What had I said?
My eyes flew open.
"How do you know that?"

He smiled.
"You have a beautiful home in Obsidian Howl."
He dropped onto the floor beside me.
His arm brushed against mine.
"I get it," he muttered.
"You want to protect your pack. But you'll have to talk to me eventually. I always get what I want."

"I'll talk about anything except my pack."
Maybe I could learn his real motives.

"Why do you love them so much?"
I pressed my lips together and looked away.

"You won't even answer that?"
"That involves the pack."
I kept my tone light.
He hadn't hurt me yet.
I wanted to keep it that way.

"You drive a hard bargain." He winked.
"I like that about you, Theodore. Or maybe I like it because we're mates?"

"We are not mates."

"Just because you can't scent me now doesn't mean we aren't. The drugs will wear off."

"Only because you're tricking my mind. We are not mated." I stated firmly.
I wouldn't fall for his games.

"Is that what you truly believe?"
"It's what you did to Seraphina, right? And others. Lure them in. Trick them. Take their abilities."

"Maybe you're right. Maybe you have me all wrong. Time will tell." He patted my leg.
"Get some sleep. You'll need it."

He stood up and paused, looking down at me.
"You're not like the others, Theodore. They don't see you as an equal."

I rolled my eyes.
"You think I'll fall for that? I won't play your game. Keep me prisoner. Starve me. Lock me up. Do what you want. I won't give you the answers."

"You must care for them a great deal?"
I held his gaze.
He wasn't getting anything else.

He moved back to his chair.
His sage green eyes glowed in the dark.
I couldn't see that yesterday.
The drugs were wearing off.
He'd given me nothing else.
Yet I could scent him now.
Faintly, but it was there.
Maybe it wasn't in the drugs.
Maybe he was projecting the scent himself.
He is part Witch, after all.

"Why do I need my sleep?"
"I just want you well-rested. Not everything about me is bad, Theodore. I do care about some things. You just don't see it yet."

"Like Evelyn?"
"I thought you didn't want to talk about the pack?"

"She isn't part of my pack."
A flicker of delight shone in his sage green eyes.
The blue flecks seemed to sparkle.
His sister means everything to him.
Probably more than anyone.

"You don't have any siblings, do you, Theodore?" My name rolled off his tongue.

"No. And I'm grateful. Siblings always cause problems. Especially younger ones."
Except Seraphina. She was a little older than Athena. But still, a sibling causing problems.

He smiled and nodded.
"They do. I used to think that was their purpose. To be a troublemaker for the older one. I couldn't stand Evelyn when we were kids. Her sticky hands were always in my things. She always wanted to be where I was. The ultimate pain in the ass. But I need her where I can watch her."

"Exactly why I'm glad to be alone."
###Chapter 0408

“Do you prefer solitude?”

“Yes.”

A faint line creased his brow. “Never felt the need to find your other half?”

“No.”

“Isn’t that the goal for every male? To find their destined one and build a life.”

“Not for me.” My vision had sharpened enough to catch the subtle irritation my words sparked. “My life was never about searching for a mate. My upbringing was different. What drives me is knowledge.”

“Power?”

“No, knowledge. Understanding how things work. Uncovering secrets hidden in plain sight.”

“That explains the books.” A slight smile touched his lips. “What other interests do you have?”

“Why does it matter to you?”

“Call it curiosity.” He shifted to face me fully. The scent of leather and tobacco was potent, but it felt deceptive. A lure I had no intention of taking.

“I enjoy helping others.”

“But you won’t help me?” His eyebrow arched.

“You found me in a hospital. What kind of help do you imagine I provide?!”

“Fair point. But we could assist each other.”

I rolled my eyes.

“Not ready for that yet. Fine. You will be. You’ll want to help me. That’s what mates do.”

“Is that what you told all the others?”

He chuckled, spinning back in his chair and propping his feet on the table. “I don’t think I’ve ever enjoyed anyone’s company as much as yours, mate.”

“Stop calling me that.”

“I’ll call you mate until you accept the truth.”

Levi surprised me by falling asleep again. He likely sensed I had nearly regained my strength. His only move had been blocking the door. I flexed my wrists and snapped the rope. Quietly, I rose, checking the windows for another way out.

Everything was locked. Shattering the glass would cut my escape time short. I stood frozen in the center of the room, weighing my limited choices. Finally, I raided the fridge and cupboards for something more substantial than fruit.

Fortunately, Seraphina had tinned sausages hidden deep in a cupboard. Not much, but it was protein. Better than fruit.

I moved through the house, peeking into both bedrooms. One was clearly Seraphina’s. Immaculate, except for a facedown photo on the nightstand. I recognized her mother holding a baby I assumed was Seraphina.

The second bedroom was chaos. An open suitcase spilled clothes onto the floor. Garments were strewn across the bed. Dirty plates and glasses sat in odd places. Shattered perfume bottles littered the carpet near the bed. If I didn’t know better, I’d think a teenager lived here, not Evelyn.

I caught Levi’s scent on the stairs. His footsteps were heavy from running.

“I thought you’d escaped!” He stared at me, the broken rope dangling from his hand.

“I considered it. But I was hungry.”

“Why are you in here?” he asked softly.

“Trying to understand a few things.” I turned to face him. Shadows crossed his features, but his intense gaze was unmistakable. “You took Evelyn’s abilities, didn’t you?”

“You don’t know what you’re talking about!”

“She was your first test subject, right? But the dose was too strong. It wasn’t meant to last this long. She was the first you kept in that prison. You held her there because you knew you’d messed up. She had to stay close so you could monitor her.” I threw his own words back at him.

“Is that what you did to Hannah and Seraphina? Gave them the same dose as your sister? So it’s not permanent? It just takes years to fade?”

“Are you seriously accusing me of doing this to my own sister?”

“Yes. I think you grew tired of her interfering. You finally snapped. Now, somehow, she aids you. What was she supposed to be? A guard for Seraphina?”

“You really are clever, Theodore.”

I stayed silent as he began to laugh, muttering to himself. “Of course I’d be mated to someone who reads between the lines.” “We are not mates. This is a trick. I’m just your prisoner.”

He removed his jacket, letting it drop to the floor. His fingers worked quickly on his shirt buttons.

“Witches, and even half-breeds like me, are born with a mark over the heart. Many call it a Witch’s Mark.” He reached the final button and paused. “But the mark is actually the initials of our true mate.”

He tore the shirt open. Above his heart, in deep red, were the clear letters TA. “Now, remind me. What is your name?”

“Theodore Anderson!” I laughed.

“Before you were adopted.”
###Chapter 0409
Alexander

Zachary, Sebastian and I stood at the edge of my territory. We had searched everywhere all day. The hospital. His home. The forest. Every possible location we could think of. We found nothing. No blood. No hair. No footprints. Not even a trace of Theodore's scent.

'There must be something.' Titan growled.

'We've covered the entire pack lands. There's nothing. Wherever he took Theodore, it's farther out.'

"Where would Levi take him?" Sebastian asked. "I doubt he knows this area."

"Then it's probably somewhere close." Zachary answered. "But it depends if Theodore is unconscious or not. Levi could be carrying dead weight or forcing him to walk. And it depends on what Levi actually wants. Is he staying because he has a target? Or has he already left, taking Theodore with him forever?"

"We expand the search." I commanded.

“We need more people for that. And we need trustworthy ones." Sebastian sighed.

"No we don't." Zachary smirked. "We just need answers from one person."

He turned and headed back through the woods. Sebastian raised an eyebrow at me and shrugged.

"Zachary, wait." I called after him.

"It's time for real answers, Alexander. There's only one person we know is definitely lying to us."

"Evelyn."

"We can smell her. We know her scent grows stronger every day. We know from Luc that she's lying. Maybe now it's time to see how close to death she's willing to go."

"She's in denial." Sebastian told him.

"No she's not." I frowned. "Zachary is right. This is a game to her. I don't know if she's gathering information for her brother or what her end goal is, but it's definitely a game. I've seen too many fools play games they think they can win."

We emerged from the trees and headed toward the dungeons when I froze.

'Do you smell that?' Titan murmured.

'Yes.' I could detect Athena's lavender scent. She was supposed to be in the house, not out here.

The dungeon door stood wide open with lights blazing inside. The guard stood to one side. He bowed his head as we approached.

"Is my mate down there?" I demanded.

"Yes. Was I not supposed to let her in?" He asked, confused.

"It doesn't matter now." I snapped.

I hurried down the steps. I found Athena standing in the dim light, staring into Evelyn's cell. Evelyn was sleeping, as was Seraphina, both completely unaware of our presence.

Athena didn't even turn as I approached. "I can hear her." She whispered.

I looked into the cell at a sleeping Evelyn, curled up at the back with drool hanging from her mouth. Who the hell shaved her head?

"She's asleep." I kept my voice low.

"Obviously." Athena murmured. "But her scent has been growing stronger and now there's no doubt - she's a Lycan. I was bathing the boys and I heard whisperings through a mind link. They weren't really saying anything, just making sounds."

She smiled slightly. "Part of me thought it was Evrin trying to speak to me, because he already has his Lycan. But when I spoke back, he didn't respond. So I asked one of the omegas to watch the twins and followed the sound. It grew louder and led me here."

"I don't understand." Sebastian frowned.

"She's linking me without even knowing it."

"Is that even possible?" Zachary asked.

I nodded. Athena had linked me many times while she slept. It was never intentional, but it still happened.

"What is she saying?" I asked.

"Nothing that makes sense. Just mutterings. Now and then she mentions Levi's name but nothing else. Mostly it's just sounds, whimpers. Almost like she's in pain."

"Is she in pain?"

Athena scrunched her face as she stared into the cell. "I don't think so. Could she be dreaming? Is that why she linked me?"

"Possible. Did you shave her head?"

Her blue eyes showed surprise at my question. "No, that was Luc. He took her for questioning earlier. He didn't learn anything. I assume that's why he did it. A punishment that wouldn't really harm her. But he's been busy with Hannah since then. I haven't had a chance to ask."

“She lied about how she escaped prison.” Seraphina whispered from behind us.

Everyone turned to look at her. She sat against the back wall, eyes focused on the ground in submission.

"What do you mean?" Athena asked.

"When I met her, she told me she killed someone in the bathroom. That was how she escaped. When I mentioned it to her after Lucas brought her back, I changed bathroom to library and she didn't correct me. She was hysterical about her hair at the time. Maybe that's how I caught her. She lied to me."

"Payback's a bitch." Zachary winked at her.
###Chapter 0410

Seraphina sat huddled, knees drawn tightly to her chest. She looked utterly broken. Nothing remained of the bold, dramatic woman who had first arrived at our pack. All her confidence had vanished. But that didn't make her trustworthy.

"Has she said anything else?" I pressed.

Seraphina shook her head slowly. "Not really. Mostly she just cursed Lucas for what he did to her. She cried herself to sleep eventually."

"I can command her," Athena stated firmly. "I can order her to answer my questions. She won't be able to lie. Not now that the pack link is restored." I gestured toward Evelyn's cell.

Athena moved to the bars separating us from Evelyn. She took a deep, steadying breath. "Wake up!"

Evelyn jolted upright, automatically brushing her face as if expecting long hair. For a moment, I thought she might scream. Her grey eyes darted wildly around the dim dungeon. She scrambled backward against the wall, fear evident as she registered our presence.

"Get up," Athena's voice echoed commandingly through the dungeon.

Evelyn rose to her feet against her will. Her lips parted in silent shock. Her grey eyes frantically searched for an escape, realizing she had no control over her own body.

I watched, impressed. Athena wielded her power with quiet authority. She didn't flaunt it like others might.

"Evelyn Reed," she whispered through tears. "But you can call me Evie or Eve." It was the same introduction she'd given before. "You are a Lycan?"

"I was. I was drugged and now..."

"Who is Levi?" Athena pressed, cutting her off before she could finish.

Evelyn squeezed her eyes shut, tilting her face downward. Her cheeks flushed red as she fought against answering.

"Answer me!" Athena snapped.

"He is my brother," she blurted out. Her eyes widened in horror at her own admission.

Silence fell. We were all stunned by the revelation. None of us had anticipated this. Luc had believed they were mates, not siblings. 'Seriously?' Titan asked mentally. I gave a slight nod.

"WHAT?!" Seraphina shrieked from behind us. Evelyn's head snapped up, finally noticing Seraphina was awake. "You're his sister? You're his fucking sister!" Seraphina rattled the bars violently. "I'll kill you! I'll get out of here and kill you myself!"

"You are siblings?" Athena asked, ignoring Seraphina's outburst. I saw claws extending from her fingertips. She was ready to execute Evelyn.

Evelyn nodded miserably. "He is my older brother."

"So why did you come here, to Obsidian Howl?" I snarled.

She didn't resist answering this time. "Because he asked me to. I'm sorry, Seraphina. I wasn't... I... You were a good friend."

"You set me up! You brought me back knowing I'd be killed!" Seraphina shouted. "Be grateful these bars are between us!"

"I had to. He's my brother," Evelyn dropped to her knees, defeated.

Seraphina began pacing angrily. She muttered to herself, hands on her hips. At least her focus was off Athena now.

"What does Levi want?" Zachary asked Evelyn.

"I don't know."

"Tell the truth," Athena demanded.

"It is the truth. He asked me to convince Seraphina to show me where Obsidian Howl is. I don't know why." Tears streamed down her cheeks unchecked.

"I was in prison. That wasn't... I was out of control. Levi helped me. He had to do this to me before I became a danger to everyone."

"What does that mean?" Zachary frowned.

She shrugged helplessly. "That's what he always told me. He did it to look after me. To keep me safe. To protect me. He's good like that."

"She's delusional," Sebastian commented.

"So you were just on a farm, waiting for me?" Seraphina asked.

"Levi asked me to wait there. He said you would come my way. He wanted me to reassure you."

"Kill her!" Seraphina snapped. "Just fucking kill her already!"

Zachary gave her a warning glare, and she backed away from the bars. He turned back to Evelyn. "What did he do with Theodore?"

"Who is Theodore?"

"If Levi were to take someone, where would he go?" I questioned.

"You won't find him."

"Where will he go?" Athena snarled.

"I don't know. I don't keep tabs on him. He always contacts me when he needs something. How are you doing this to me?" "She is the Alpha," Zachary told her with a cold smile.

Athena's claws lengthened further. I pulled her back gently. She frowned at me. "I can kill her."

"As much as I like that idea, you can't. Not yet. If you kill her, he might kill Theodore."
###Chapter 0411
Athena

"Sometimes it's infuriating when he's right." Nyx groans. She was just as eager as I was to end Evelyn, but Alexander was correct—we couldn't risk losing Theodore, especially without knowing the full situation.

"So we're letting her live?" I whisper to Alexander as my claws retract. They emerged with almost no pain now, sometimes without me even noticing.

I watch Evelyn staring at us. Her expression mixes fear with hope, believing Alexander is saving her.

Now that she's awake, I no longer hear her whimpers, though our connection remains undeniable. I could command her—I felt that power—but could she sense it too?

"Why is everything so loud?" Evelyn suddenly cries, pressing her hands over her ears. It was strange how sound returned to her last. For me, it had been the first sensation when my binding broke.

"You have your Lycan, you stupid bitch!" Seraphina screeches, making Evelyn flinch.

"You're wrong," she cries back.

"Enough!" Zachary snaps.

"Sebastian, take Seraphina to my office," Alexander orders. "Zachary, ensure she doesn't do anything reckless."

'Is he going to kill her? We have information now. We don't need her anymore. He must be, right?' Nyx asks.

'I don't think so.' I could tell Alexander was contemplating something. If he intended to kill her, he would have done it immediately without hesitation.

He gestures toward the stairs and offers me his hand. He remains silent until we're outside. "We need to relocate Seraphina."

"Why? She's secure in the cell."

"Yes, but she's made it clear she's furious with Evelyn now that some truths are exposed. She'll be useless for gathering more information. You heard her—she wants Evelyn dead. She'll focus solely on that. If Evelyn dies, Theodore likely dies too. I know you don't want that."

I shake my head. "You're right."

"So we handle this carefully. I'll offer the bastard a trade."

"A trade?"

"Theodore for Evelyn and Seraphina. Two for one. We'll see how much he values his sister—it's either both or none."

"Won't that make him think Theodore is more valuable?"

"Deals often involve offering something the other party believes benefits them. They don't have to actually benefit—they just need to believe it will."

I watch as Zachary and Sebastian appear with Seraphina. She stays quiet, keeps her eyes down, and doesn't resist as they lead her away.

"We don't even know how to contact him," I say, scanning the dark grounds. "We don't know where he's taken Theodore."

"Something tells me we won't need to. He'll soon realize the spell or drug has worn off, and he can reconnect with his sister. If he's desperate enough, he'll show up at our doorstep."

"Okay," I mutter. "What will you do with Seraphina?" The slam of the dungeon door makes me jump. "You said she can't stay there. You can't expect me to agree to let her live in the house."

"Of course not. I need someone to watch her, and I know just the person to ask."

He never made people wait for death. If they deserved it, they got it swiftly. So why was he letting her live?

"Do you think Levi will be angry if we kill her too?" I ask.

"Possibly."

"She's too much of a risk," I keep my voice low as Zachary and Sebastian take Seraphina toward the house.

"She is, but I don't think you're her target anymore. She didn't want to come here—Evelyn talked her into it. I don't believe you've been her focus for a while. I'm not saying forgive her; she doesn't deserve that. But maybe we can put her to work, nothing involving security. Just until we figure out our next steps."
###Chapter 0412

‘To work?’ Nyx scoffs.

My gaze snaps to his. “You’re playing your little game again, aren’t you?”

He drapes his arm over my shoulder, pulling me close. He doesn’t answer.

In his office, Seraphina sits slumped in a chair. Her eyes stay fixed on her knees. Her hands are clasped tightly in her lap.

Silence hangs heavy. Minutes pass. Seraphina grows restless. Her entire body trembles. Her leg bounces nervously.

Caleb knocks on the open door. “You called for me, Athena? Is this about Liam? I know we haven’t…” His eyes land on his stepdaughter. A deep scowl forms. “What has she done now?”

“It’s complicated,” Alexander states.

“I assume you thought telling me was better than telling her mother? How long does she have?”

“That depends on you, Caleb,” Alexander replies.

“Me? You want me to decide how she dies?”

I see Seraphina’s eyes go wide. Nyx laughs. ‘She’s practically shitting herself. But why is Alexander lying to Caleb?’

‘You know he has his own methods for testing people.’

“Seraphina is no longer safe in the dungeons. You are her stepfather. I am requesting you take her in. Keep a very close eye on her,” Alexander instructs. I still hated the idea. But I didn’t want her near the house either. Keep your friends close, your enemies closer. Theodore taught me that.

“Take her in? You want me to bring her into our home?” Caleb acts as if we’ve asked him to walk into fire.

“Take her in. Feed her. Watch her. Do not let her out of your sight. She will work under guard supervision. When work ends, she returns directly to you. She does not leave the house unless I or Athena request it,” Alexander orders.

“She is your stepdaughter, Caleb. She is your responsibility. If you refuse, I understand. She will not live to see another day. If you agree, your family’s lives depend on her obedience. If she fails or steps out of line, she will not be the only one to face death. Is that clear?” Alexander asks.

“I have a baby,” he protests, frowning deeply.

‘What if he says no?’ Nyx wonders.

‘We’ll cross that bridge if we come to it.’

“If I do everything you ask… I get to live?” Seraphina whispers.

No one answers. After a tense moment, she nods. “You’re going to kill me anyway.”

“I’ll do it,” Caleb announces.

All eyes shift to him. I expected consent, but also a refusal.

“You will?” I ask. Seraphina stares at me, eyes wide with shock. She’s as surprised as I am.

“I will kill her myself if she disobeys.”

Seraphina looks at me, tears welling in her eyes. “Thank you.”

“Don’t thank me.” I leave the office before anyone else. My heart races. My head pounds.

‘I don’t like this either,’ Nyx grumbles. ‘She was determined to destroy us.’

I wait at the top of the stairs. It takes time for the others to emerge. Caleb has his hands on Seraphina’s shoulders. Her eyes remain downcast as he guides her through the front door. Zachary follows, presumably to ensure no trouble. Sebastian disappears.

Alexander looks up at me from the office doorway, his crimson eyes meeting mine. “I know you’re unhappy. This is only temporary.”
###Chapter 0413
Alexander

'She is furious.' Titan growls inside my mind.
'I know.'
'You could still call this off.'
'No. This has to happen. It must work.'

"Are you going to say anything?" I ask my mate.

Athena remains silent, but she doesn't need to speak. I feel her anger through our bond, see it burning in her blue eyes as she stares down at me from the top of the staircase.

She rises slowly, her hand gripping the banister. Her gaze locks with mine for a brief moment. "I hope you know what you're doing." She turns away just as Luc appears. His eyes track her movement, then shift to me. He frowns as she disappears down the hall. "You've really pissed her off." He observes, walking toward me.

"I'm aware."

He raises an eyebrow. "Aren't you going after her?"

"Normally I would. Right now, my presence will only make it worse. She needs space to process this."

"What exactly is happening? What did I miss?"

I explain the situation. He spends most of the time shaking his head and scoffing.

"Let me get this straight. Seraphina made a threat. Evelyn is in denial. You think the solution is releasing Seraphina from the dungeons. I have to agree with Athena on this one, and that's fucking hard for me to admit."

"You don't lead this pack. Your opinion doesn't matter."

"Fair enough." He mutters. "But consider this. You talk about Evelyn playing games. Seraphina could be part of it. Her reaction might be part of their plan. You know that, right?"

"I don't think so. Not this time. Her defeat is genuine. She asked if she gets to live by following our rules. She thanked Athena. She's broken. Maybe you should observe her more closely."

"You want to fix her?" He gives me a skeptical look.

"It's not about fixing her."

"Could have fooled me." He says sarcastically, studying my face.

"Don't pretend you know everything, Luc."
