"You have to consider Athena might not want family outside this pack. She's been through hell. Until you, she had no one. Not everyone wants siblings. Frankly, I'm surprised you're reacting this way after what Seraphina did to your brother."

"My brother dug his own grave and dragged my sister down with him. He was always selfish. Instead of just dying, he piggybacked my sister's soul. I brought out his true colors. I'm not saying what she did was right. I'm not trying to make Athena trust her."

"Right." He presses his lips together, watching me carefully.

"Your opinion doesn't matter anyway. When the time comes, she'll be offered for trade along with Evelyn."

"If you say so."

"I do."

"In that case, I'll keep an eye on her." He offers. "Not when she's with her stepfather, but during her work duties. She fears me more than she fears you. My presence will be a good reminder."

"You mean you want to keep a closer watch on Caleb?"

He scowls at the mention of Caleb's name.

"Caleb returns tomorrow to meet with Zachary and me. We're discussing what happened with the children. As Charlotte's father, you're welcome to join. But under two conditions. No weapons. Keep your hands to yourself."

He clenches his jaw, staring at me.

"Those are the terms, Luc."

"She's my daughter."

"Then act like a father and have the damn conversation with him. Both children were wrong. You can't blame only Liam. Charlotte pinned him down. She had her reasons, and we need to understand them. I told Zachary the same thing. He's willing to reach an agreement with Caleb."
###Chapter 0414

"Alright, I'll show up. No weapons, and I'll keep my hands in my pockets." He clicks his tongue and rolls his eyes. "But I can't promise I'll agree to anything."

"I can live with that for now. Now that's settled—why the hell did you shave Evelyn's head?"

He chuckles. "I was wondering when you'd ask. You said I couldn't physically harm her. So I made sure there was no physical pain. Only psychological. Still got nothing useful out of her, though."

"Always hunting for a loophole."

He nods and flashes me a smile. "So Evelyn and Levi are siblings?"

"You couldn't tell that from her soul?"

"How many times do I have to remind everyone? I'm not psychic. If they were twins, sure, I might’ve sensed it. But I’m guessing half-siblings?"
"Why do you say that?"

"No real resemblance. Apart from the blonde hair. Different eye colors, different nose, lips, face shape. If I saw them on the street, I wouldn’t guess they’re related. Do you believe it?"

"Athena compelled her to tell the truth. You saw how confused Evelyn was. She panicked when her hearing got louder and louder."

"Almost like she’s never shifted?"

"Exactly. Reminded me of Athena when her bindings broke. She wore earplugs for eight months just to handle the noise."

He nods. "Theodore told me."

"He did?"

"When we were out looking for something to help Athena, he filled me in. I think you're right about Evelyn. She's never had the abilities."

I frown. "She kept saying Levi told her he was protecting her. Keeping her safe so she wouldn’t become a danger. I thought Rogue, but if she’s never shifted, that’s not possible. Which means he did it before she turned thirteen."

"And I’d know if she’d ever gone Rogue. Let me spend more time with her. I might see her soul clearer."
"Wait until morning. And don’t touch her."

He rolls his eyes. "I won’t."

Luc drops into one of the office chairs. "I assume there’s no news on Theodore?"

"Not yet."

"Hannah doesn’t know anything else, either." He sighs.

"She’s talking to you now?" We all heard the yelling earlier. It was obvious how furious she was. One of the few times I’ve heard Luc sound so unsure.

"Yes." His answer is sharp. "I actually wanted to talk to Athena about her."

"About what?"

"Turning Hannah back into a Lycan."

'Seriously?' Titan scoffs. I hold up a hand to Luc, trying to push down my own frustration.

"You what?" I sputter as Titan starts losing it. It’s been a long time since he’s gotten this worked up.
"To restore her Lycan nature," Luc states.

"You want Athena to bite her?"

"Yes. Though Hannah is unsure right now."

"No."

"It’s for her own good."

"Why? So you can feel the bond again? You don’t even like Lycans. You struggled to accept her."

"I know. She’s grown on me."

"Athena won’t do it. Not after... she just... And we don’t even know if the Hannah situation will wear off, like with Evelyn."

He glares at me, gets to his feet, and storms out.

I was grateful for the silence. Over twenty-four hours awake without a moment’s peace.

'Alexander. Alexander. Are you there?'
###Chapter 0415

Theodore

'Damn it, Theodore. Where the hell are you?' Hearing Alexander's voice again was a relief.

'I'm with Levi. I had to go with him. It was the only way to ensure he wouldn't harm anyone else.'

'Are you alright? Are you injured?'

'He hasn't hurt me. He drugged me, but it's worn off now.'

'Where are you?'

'He brought me to Seraphina's house. Don't come here. It's too dangerous.'

'Why not?' He asks. 'I can bring enough people. We'll get in and out quickly.'

'He's expecting that. I don't know what else he's capable of.'

A loud snore comes from the chair in the corner. I watch Levi silently, fully expecting him to wake up any second.

'Theodore?'

'He's half Witch, half Lycan. He's drugging people with something he created. Evelyn was his first test subject. He got the dosage wrong, and she hasn't been the same since.'

'It's worn off. He'll probably figure it out soon.' Alexander tells me.

'He already knows.'

'We can use that to our advantage.' He doesn't elaborate further, and I decide it's better not to know.

'What about Hannah and Seraphina?'

'No change.'

'I need you to do something for me.' I speak faster, knowing Levi will wake up any moment.

'Theodore, we need to get you out of there.'

'Not yet,' I mutter, seeing Levi stir. 'Let me get what I can from him first. But I need you to ask Seraphina what scent Levi was giving off when he tricked her into thinking they were mated.'

There's a pause. 'You think you're mated to him?'

'He has a mark on his chest. Claims that Witches are left with the mark of their mate's initials.'

'And?'

'TD' I mutter.

'Your surname is Anderson.'

'My adopted name.' I reply quietly.

Silence again. I knew this news wouldn't be well received. 'Remind me, what was your birth parents' surname?'

'Daudet.'

'Theodore....'

'I won't accept him.' I say hurriedly as Levi starts making more noises. I can't accept someone who thinks it's okay to strip others of their abilities. Not after what my parents did to me. Not after seeing Athena and Hannah struggle. I just need to know if it's a trick or not before I reject him. I want to break him. I have to go, he's waking up.'

I end the link and focus on the rising sun. Keeping my gaze away from Levi. He stopped asking about my birth name after he realized he could link with Evelyn. Whatever she told him made him angry enough to trash the house.

He's a madman with two personalities. If I want to make it back home, I need to play along to some extent.

Levi yawns. "You're already awake."

"Early riser." I mutter back. "I like watching the sunrise."

"I'm surprised your Alpha isn't here, knocking down the door. I know you can link him. I know you're a full Wolf again. So either you have and told him not to come, or you haven't because you can't resist the bond with me."

"Do you always think so highly of yourself?" I glance at him to find him staring intently.

"Yes. Yes I do."

I roll my eyes and turn back to the sunrise as pink hues fill the sky.

"So is today going to be the day you give me your birth name?"

"You're so smart, maybe you should figure it out yourself."

"I'm going to cook you breakfast this morning." He announces, changing the subject.

"Not hungry." I mumble, though my stomach protests with loud growls.

He places a hand against his chest, pretending to be hurt. "But it's my special pancakes. Everyone loves them."

I highly doubt anything here will be edible. Seraphina and Evelyn have been in the pack for ages. Anything you find is probably spoiled."

"Lucky for you, I went out while you were asleep."
###Chapter 0416

"You left the room?" I hadn't heard a single sound all night. Honestly, I don't even recall drifting off to sleep.

"A simple sleeping charm works wonders. Now get up. Go take a shower. I left some clean clothes for you behind the door."

"What?"

He grips my arms and pulls me upright. "Shower. Now."

"Why?"

"You can't sit at breakfast looking like that."

"No—I mean why are you doing any of this?" I stare straight at him.

"I'm trying to prove I’m not the monster you think I am."

I let out a sharp laugh.

"They really convinced you I’m some kind of beast, didn’t they?" He shakes his head slowly. "I would never harm you."

He reaches toward my face, but I pull back. "Is that what you tell all of them? Sweet words, getting under their skin, making them believe lies? I’m not like the others. I won’t fall for it. You keep pretending this is for me. It’s not. You’re doing this for yourself. It’s that simple."

"What will it take for you to believe this is real?"

"Real? I don’t think you know what that word means."

His eyes narrow. I struck a nerve. He seizes my shoulders, spins me around, and shoves me toward the kitchen. A faint smile touches my lips. Maybe he was finally realizing he couldn’t win me over.

Alexander forces me into a chair. "Sit!" he snarls.

As I sit, he yanks my arms behind my back. I feel something cold and metallic—a chain—wrapping around my wrist. "Let’s try a different approach." He grabs my head, forcing it to the side. His rough fingers push my long hair away from my neck.

"Get off me."

"You won’t be able to resist once I mark you."

"Don’t you dare touch me." I growl, straining against the chains. "I am not your mate. You want to know my birth name? It doesn’t start with a D." I lie through my teeth. "It’s Monroe. Theodore Monroe."

His fingers still in my hair. "You're lying."

"No, I'm not." I had prepared myself to go this far. There was no way I was letting him mark me. That would bind me to him until death.

He drags my chair across the floor.

Crouching down, he locks his sage-green eyes on mine. The blue specks in them darken again—something that happens when he’s about to lose control. "What is your name?"

"Theodore Monroe." I say it clearly, confidently.

"Liar."

"And you’re a fool if you don’t believe me."

"I can smell you. You can’t hide that."

"Maybe your mind is playing tricks. Maybe you’re so obsessed with me you want to believe it’s true. I’ve seen stranger things happen." Clearly, detecting lies wasn’t one of his strengths. Idiot.

He taps my cheek lightly and turns away. "What’s your favorite pancake topping? I’m making you the best damn pancakes you’ve ever tasted."

"You mean you’re going to poison me?"

"No. Why would I do that? I’ve told you, Theodore. I like you. I like you a lot. I want you by my side."

He was delusional.

"What about your true mate?" He was so sure it was me, but I would never accept someone like him.

"We’ll see."

He turns my chair back toward the table and slides it forward until I’m seated properly. He moves away, muttering to himself as he pulls out what sounds like a dozen ingredients.

The window reflection shows his lips moving, but no sound comes out. It was like he was talking to himself—but then I catch his eyes. He was mind-linking someone.

It had to be Evelyn.

###Chapter 0418
Athena

'What if we just end her? It's a viable option, isn't it? No one has to find out until it's done.' Nyx suggests.

'As much as I'd love to, Alexander is right. We need Seraphina for the trade along with Evelyn. I don't want Theodore to die. He doesn't deserve that fate.'

'Fine. Then we wait until the deal is finalized. After that, we eliminate her? Make it appear accidental? She's human now—it should be simple. Let her bleed out? I know you've considered it too, so don't pretend otherwise.'

No thought remained private anymore. Either Nyx was listening in, or Alexander was reading my mind.

'We are!' She clicks her tongue.

'As much as I want to, I'll wait. Let Alexander play his game. If anything goes wrong, I'll happily tear her heart out myself.'

I collapse onto the bed, staring up at the ceiling as my body sinks into the mattress. The omega had taken the twins to Victoria and Sebastian's shortly after I left last night. She was young, and even at their age, the twins knew how to test her patience. Though she hadn't witnessed Evrin shift yet.

Damn it. I forgot to warn Victoria and Sebastian too.

Closing my eyes, I'm instantly hit with a wave of Alexander's woody scent. The door swings open, letting in a cool breeze. "Are you still angry?" He asks softly.

"No. I'm too exhausted to stay mad."

He pauses, and I know he's sifting through my thoughts to verify my honesty.

"Then this might upset you."

I push myself up on my elbows to meet his crimson gaze. "What do you mean?"

"Theodore linked me."

"He linked you? How... he was... where?" Questions swarm my mind.

"He was drugged, as we expected. But it seems to have worn off, just like Evelyn's did."

I try to process how. Evelyn claimed she lost her abilities long ago. And Hannah and Seraphina were still without their Lycan traits. "Levi has him." Alexander continues.

"Where?"

"He doesn't want us to rescue him. He believes it's a trap—exactly what Levi wants and expects."

"We can't just abandon him!" I scowl.

"We won't. For now, he's unharmed and safe. But he wants to gather more intel on Levi and his motives." "Where is he?" I press.

"There's more." He evades my question. He clearly doesn't want me to know. "Theodore asked me to speak with Seraphina about the scent Levi used. The one he manipulated to make her believe he was her mate."

"Wh..." I stop myself as realization dawns. "He thinks Levi is his mate?"

"He explicitly stated he won't accept him, even if he is. He refuses to be with someone like Levi."

"Is that why he left with him? Because of a potential bond?"

"I'm not sure. He severed the link before I could ask."

"He cut the link?"

"Yes." He sighs. "His last words were that he won't accept the bond. That's why he wants to know what Seraphina smelled. If it's the same, he'll know it's a trick. I'm allowing him to link me on his terms, when it's safe."

"What if it's not?" I sigh. "What if that scent is what his mate is supposed to smell like? Levi might not be fabricating the scent but the idea of the bond. That means everyone he desires would smell identical."

'For someone so tired, you're sharp today.' Nyx murmurs, impressed.

I study Alexander, who remains silent. "There's something else, isn't there?"

"Yes. Levi is half-Witch. He wasn't using anyone. It's all been him."

I exhale heavily. The only other Witch I've met was Madame Zora.

"He told Theodore they bear a mark."

"Like a Witch's mark?"

Alexander closes his eyes and nods. "The mark is the initials of their mate."

"And?" I know he's doling out information slowly. Not for dramatic effect, but to let me absorb it all.
###Chapter 0419

"Theodore."

I fall back onto the mattress.

Nyx curses under her breath.

"Where is he?" I demand.

"I'll tell you, but you must promise not to act. Do you understand me?"

"It's Theodore," I argue. "We can't just—"

"We have to."

"You're not doing anything!" I can't comprehend his lack of urgency. Theodore was our friend. He helped with my Lycan history. Tutored me. Supported us at the hospital. Stepped in as Beta when Sebastian was failing. Saved Brianna. The list goes on, but listing his deeds won't change Alexander's mind.

"Trust me, Athena. I am handling it. This isn't something we can rush. We won't be storming in to rescue him."

"Why not? I've watched you eliminate countless threats."

"Those were Wolves and Lycans. Witches operate differently."

"I don't follow."

"Their abilities vary. We don't know what the Bennetts are capable of. He used a drug to suppress powers, but we have no idea if he can brew potions. He might have other skills."

"Like what?"

"There's an old story from my childhood. About a Witch who annihilated an entire Wolf pack without ever setting foot inside their territory."

I frown as Nyx wonders how that's even possible.

"The tale says she could project herself into the pack. Gather intelligence without physically being there."

"They couldn't detect her?" I ask, confused.

"No."

"Then how do you know it's true?"

"I don't. The story has been passed down through generations of Wolves. I remember asking my father about it once. It made him uneasy. My mother told me to never mention it again."

"If I've learned anything, it's not to believe something until I see it with my own eyes." I sit up and swing my legs off the bed.

"That story still haunts the older generations of Wolves."

"Is that why they avoid Witches?"

"Exactly."

"You worked with one," I whisper.

"Madame Zora was different. Though I suspect she would have done anything for the right price."

I stay silent, processing his words. "You don't want me to know where Theodore is, do you?" I ask quietly.

He sits beside me on the bed. "I'm worried you'll go after him alone. And before you argue, I know you're capable of killing Levi. That's not the issue. Theodore said he's waiting. That means he's prepared for our arrival. I won't take any risks."

"But—"

"Theodore assured us he's safe. Levi hasn't harmed him."

"He stripped his abilities," I frown.

"Temporarily. We will get Theodore back. We just need to time it right and let events unfold. We'll make our move when we're ready."

I nod as he wraps an arm around me. But leaving Theodore out there twists my stomach into knots. It feels wrong. Like we're abandoning him.

Alexander kicks off his boots and crawls up the bed, lying down with a groan. He holds out a hand to me. "Come here. You're exhausted."

"I'm fine."

"We have a few hours before Caleb returns. Zoe is keeping the twins until noon."

His hand remains extended, but his crimson eyes narrow. He's ensuring I don't go anywhere.

I roll my eyes and lie back down. He immediately pulls me against his chest, his arms locking around me.

I should be angry that he's restraining me. But his scent, his warmth, his touch—it soothes my restless mind. I have to trust his process. I have to believe in what he's doing.
###Chapter 0420
Zachary

I knock on the office door and get no answer. That’s odd. I expected Alexander to be here already. The meeting with Caleb starts in less than five minutes.

I step inside and move to the far right corner. I position myself behind the desk, near the window. I need a clear view of everyone in the room.

Luc shows up next. He spins in front of me deliberately. He lifts his shirt just enough to prove he isn’t hiding weapons in his belt.

“You actually listened for once.” I mutter.

“It might shock you, but I care about my daughter. I can follow rules when it matters.”

I don’t answer. Alexander walks in yawning. “I need to talk to both of you after this.”

“About my little girl?” Luc asks.

“No…”

He’s cut off as Caleb arrives. Caleb checks his watch. “I’m not late, am I?”

“You’re right on time.” Alexander tells him. “Take a seat.”

“What about my daughter and his kid? Shouldn’t they be here too?” Luc challenges. “Since this is about them.”

“DO NOT call him that.” Caleb growls through clenched teeth.

“I don’t want either of you speaking.” Alexander’s crimson eyes shift between them. “You both need to listen.”

He points at me. He already asked me to explain how I found Charlotte. He believes it will help Caleb understand. “Do you know how Charlotte lived when she was young?” I ask carefully.

“Yes, I know what Seraphina did.”

“I’m not talking about Seraphina. I’m talking about the Humans she sold her to.”

“This has nothing to do with her attacking my son.”

“Maybe not. But you deserve to know. It might help us understand why she pinned Liam down.”

Even Luc doesn’t know the full truth about how I found her. He only heard bits and pieces. As long as she was safe, he was satisfied. But I often wonder if he noticed the cracks in her soul too and just stayed silent.

His eyes flash toward me. I can see his anger rising to the surface. He paces in the background. His hands are balled into fists. He’s like a live grenade, ready to explode.

'Tread carefully.' Alexander links me while watching Luc.

'He’s unarmed.' But that doesn’t mean Luc won’t hit something.

“She was just a child.” Caleb mutters sadly as I finish explaining how she ate from a bowl like a dog the first night I saved her.

“She learned to survive on nothing. She had nightmares for almost a year. They finally eased to maybe once a week.” I glance at Luc. He’s staring into space, probably imagining how he’ll make Seraphina suffer for what she did to his child. “Charlotte has kept everything bottled up for so long. I knew one day she would explode. She didn’t attack him for fun. She attacked Liam because of what he said.”

Caleb looks down.

“He hasn’t told you what he said, has he?” Alexander asks.

“He’s sticking to the same story. He claims he asked for a pencil and she snapped. But I know it’s not the whole truth. She has nightmares; he sleeps soundly, without a care.”

“He called her poison. Told her someone would kill her in her sleep.” I mutter. Hearing Brianna tell me that made my blood boil. “He wouldn’t…”

“He did.”

Caleb narrows his eyes at me. “She told you that.”

“No, she confided in a friend. I believe her.”

“My son wouldn’t say something like that.” Caleb shakes his head dismissively.

“Then bring him in here! I’ll find out if the little liar is telling the truth!” Luc snarls.

Alexander raises his hand to silence everyone. “Caleb, how would Liam know about poison? It’s not something taught to children that young.”

He shakes his head. “He’s never mentioned it before. Not even when fighting with his brother. I don’t think Zoe and I have ever discussed it. Maybe we did without realizing he was listening, but it wasn’t recent. If you haven’t noticed, Alexander, we’re not a family that goes on hunts or to war. We haven’t even joined a pack run because we don’t feel welcome among the Wolves.”
###Chapter 0421

"Is it all the Wolves or just specific ones?" Alexander questions, and it hits me that we overlooked the most obvious source. The Lycans would know exactly which Wolves were causing trouble.

"I can provide a few names." Caleb sighs, his blue eyes locking onto mine. "I am Liam's father. I will speak with him again."

"He's already lying to you. Talking won't accomplish anything." Luc snaps sharply.

"Has Liam ever behaved like this before?" I ask, hoping Luc will just be quiet for a moment.

"Never. He always received excellent reports from his previous school. We've never had problems with him at home, aside from some typical sibling rivalry. But that's normal, isn't it?"

"Oh, absolutely." Alexander mutters. "Just wait until your daughter is old enough to develop an attitude. Younger sisters are experts at creating chaos." He adds. "Why do you ask?" Caleb queries.

"As you know, Lottie has been assisting Athena with any Lycans that have appeared. She does it because she takes after her biological father." I murmur, gesturing toward Luc. "She perceives things others cannot."

"Are you suggesting she saw something in my son?"

"That is precisely what Zachary is implying." Luc scoffs.

"So what is our course of action?" Caleb asks. "They both need to attend school, but if incidents like this will keep occurring with the Hunter's daughter..." He shrugs. "I'm already monitoring my stepdaughter closely. Zoe will be devastated if Liam is barred from school. And separating them isn't really a solution, is it?"

"Actually," Alexander mutters. "Maybe that is exactly what we should do. Some children could have lessons in the morning and finish at lunch. Others start after lunch. That way, they aren't in the same classroom together."

"I agree to that arrangement." Caleb nods.

"I suppose." Luc grumbles.

"Keep Liam home until Monday. My direct orders if anyone questions it. We'll implement the new schedule then."

"Thank you, Alpha Alexander." Caleb rises to his feet and gives a respectful nod to me and Alexander. He then pointedly walks past Luc without any acknowledgment.

"Do you believe it will work?"

"There's only one way to find out. Luc, close the door."

He gives Alexander a strange look but obeys the command.

"Theodore is alive."

"How do you know that?" I ask, surprised.

"He mind-linked me."

"Where is he?" I press.

He takes a deep breath, almost as if he didn't want to tell us. "He's still with Levi."

"You have got to be fucking kidding me!" Luc snaps.

Alexander shakes his head and closes his eyes with a sigh. "Levi is attempting to convince Theodore that they are mates."

"He's completely delirious." Luc scoffs.

Alexander's eyes fix on Luc. "You know a great deal. I'm wondering if you can confirm something for me?"

"If I can, I will."

"What is a Witch's mark?"

"I've never seen one myself. I can only relay what I've heard, and it might not be entirely accurate."

"Continue." Alexander growls.

"It was once said that the mark served to distinguish them from the rest of us. But over time, as the world evolved, it changed."

"Changed?" I mutter.

"The mark began to mutate. In its place, almost like a scar, are the initials..." He stops and stares back at Alexander. It was almost amusing to see him speechless.

"Initials?" I press, eager for the information.

His eyes shift to me. "The initials of his mate. Levi is his mate, isn't he?"

"It is appearing increasingly likely."

"Has he switched sides?" Luc asks as I try to process this revelation.

"No. His intentions are very clear. But he needs to resolve a few matters on his end first."

"We must leave immediately to retrieve him. You can locate him now that you've linked him." Luc suggests.

"He doesn't want us to. Not yet. I am aware of his plan. We simply need to be patient." Alexander states.

"Since when is Theodore gay?"

They both stop to stare at me. Luc is the first to laugh, followed by Alexander.

"You've been here a while, correct?" Luc asks through his laughter.

"Yes."

"Well, it's fairly obvious." He replies.

I look over at Alexander, who is forcing his lips together to suppress his amusement. "You might have just improved my mood."
###Chapter 0422
Seraphina

I stretched out on the narrow single bed that was now my own. The soft mattress felt like heaven after endless nights on cold, hard stone. Someone had left a stack of folded blankets and a fresh set of clothes at the foot of the bed. I assumed it was my mother, since everything was already here when Caleb brought me down.

Upstairs, I could hear my brothers racing around. Their heavy footsteps echoed through the ceiling. My mother’s voice cut through the noise, telling them to quiet down before they woke Braelyn.

It felt strange to find comfort in the sounds of my family. I had always preferred silence until Levi Bennett forced it upon me. Now, every moment of quiet felt threatening. Silence only meant one thing—punishment was coming.

I closed my eyes and let a small smile form. I was still alive. Still breathing. Maybe I could find a way to stay that way. If I just did everything they asked, maybe they would forget about punishing me.

The door handle turned suddenly. My eyes flew open. One of my brothers stood on the stairs, staring down at me. I couldn’t tell which one—they both had the same blonde curls framing their faces.

"You look like a boy," he spat, his voice full of disgust. I guessed it was Liam, the slightly older one. Caleb had mentioned him earlier when he came to the office. He’d said something about a meeting regarding him this morning. Now I understood why there were issues.

My hands instinctively went to my shorn hair. His brown eyes were wide as he watched me. The corners of his mouth turned up in a smug grin. He was proud of himself for thinking he’d upset me.

"It’s what happens when you’re naughty," I told him flatly.

"Then you shouldn’t have gotten caught," he shot back before darting back up the steps and slamming the door shut. I heard his quick footsteps fade, followed by muffled conversation with our mother. I couldn’t make out the words.

A few minutes later, my door opened again. I remained seated on the bed, watching as my mother slowly descended the stairs. Her hair was pulled back into a tight bun, a few strands of white visible against the jet black. A deep green dress hugged her frame. For someone who’d had four children, she didn’t look it. Her body was in better shape than mine. Only the soft wrinkles around her eyes gave away her age.

"What did you say to Liam?" she asked softly.

Of course he’d run to her. "He said I looked like a boy because of this," I said, pointing to my head. "I just told him it’s what happens when you’re naughty."

She placed her hands on her hips. "You can’t say things like that to a seven-year-old."

"Maybe he needs to hear it. I know Caleb went to meet with the Alpha about Kim. There’s only one reason he’d need to do that."

Her lips pressed into a thin line. She knew I was right.

"Please be careful what you say around the boys. I don’t want any more trouble than necessary."

"Mom, you and Caleb are already tasked with watching me. What more trouble could you possibly have?"

She glared at me, and I quickly backtrack.

"I’m not saying I’ll cause trouble. I’m just saying you’re already on the Alpha’s radar."

She nodded slowly, considering my words. "Come upstairs for breakfast. You’re going to work soon, and you can’t do it on an empty stomach."

"I’m okay."

"I’ll tell you what I tell the boys. It’s not negotiable."

I followed her up the wooden stairs and into the dining room. She gestured toward a chair beside my youngest brother. He hadn’t met me yet. He dropped his spoon into his bowl and stared at me with dazzling blue eyes. He was a miniature version of Caleb, but with the same blonde curls as Liam. Caleb must have been blonde before he went bald.
###Chapter 0423

“Calihan.” Mum speaks to him. “This is your sister, Seraphina. She will be staying with us now.”

He flashes a wide grin, showing all his teeth. “Hi. Are you my big sister?”

“Yes, I suppose I am.” I return his smile as mum gestures toward the cereal boxes, inviting me to help myself.

Liam takes a seat across from me. He watches me intently while eating, remaining silent as Noah chats excitedly about school, completely unaware of his brother’s behavior.

“Your father just informed me there’s no school today.” Mum announces as she brings in several jugs of juice. She looked prepared to feed an entire pack rather than just four of us and a baby.

Noah pumps his fist in celebration while Liam demands to know why. Another unusual trait—most children his age would rejoice at an unexpected day off.

“Alpha Alexander is restructuring the classes. He’s splitting them to ensure each child receives more attention. Starting Monday, Liam, you’ll attend in the morning, and Noah, you’ll go in the afternoon.”

“That’s not fair!” Liam slams his fist on the table.

“Those are the rules. What do we do about rules?” Mum glares at him, and Liam immediately shrinks back.

What was that about?

“We follow them.” Noah states proudly.

“Exactly, especially if we want to remain happy here.”

Noah nods enthusiastically and slurps milk from his bowl. The boys were polar opposites, but it went beyond that. Even without my Lycan senses, I could tell something was troubling Liam.

Noah resumes telling me about his school friends while Liam continues his silent observation. He bore no resemblance to the carefree boy I’d seen playing in the front garden days before.

“It’s Liam’s birthday soon.” Noah informs me. “He’s turning eight.” Noah holds up his fingers proudly. “Just two more sleeps.”

“Are you excited?” I ask Liam as mum leaves to retrieve Braelyn.

He rolls his eyes and carries his empty bowl to the sink.

“He’s just being silly.” Noah explains.

“Maybe he’s so excited it’s made him tired.” I tell my little brother, stretching the truth. “It happens sometimes.”

Mum returns with Braelyn. She had grown significantly since I last saw her. Mum settles her into the high chair and places a bottle of milk before her. She was a perfect miniature of mum—deep brown eyes and a shock of jet black hair. Completely focused on her bottle.

“Do you think you could get used to this?” Mum asks me.

I’d never experienced anything like this before. A tear escapes, and Noah wraps his small arms around my waist. “Please don’t cry.”

I nod at mum. “I’m sorry.”

She smiles warmly. “I understand. It just took you a while to find your way home.”

“Dad. It’s not fair.” Liam stomps after Caleb while I finish tying my boots.

“It’s necessary. You won’t be in class with the Hunter’s child anymore. No more trouble.”

“There wasn’t any trouble! I just asked her for a damn pencil!”

I watch Caleb spin around and glare at Liam. Liam immediately shrinks, lowering his head until his face disappears from view.

“Watch your language! Don’t ever speak to me like that again!”

“Yes Dad.” His tone completely changes from moments before. “Now go to your room until I return.”

Liam nods quickly and dashes toward the staircase. His feet pound up the steps, followed by a slamming door. Caleb groans in frustration. He turns to me. “Ready? Your escort is here.”
###Chapter 0424

"My escort?"

"He specifically requested to monitor you. It wasn't my decision to make."

"Who?" I ask softly, already dreading the response.

"Lucas Adler. My advice..."

"I comply with his every instruction and answer all his questions." I cut in swiftly.

He gives a curt nod. "You'll be assigned to the gardens today. Fruit inspection, vegetable maintenance, and weeding."

"I can handle that." Though I wasn't certain how I'd cope with Lucas's constant scrutiny.

"Take this." Mum extends a paper bag toward me. "I packed you a lunch."

"You didn't have to..."

"I know. See you later."

An unfamiliar emotion swelled inside me, threatening to bring tears to my eyes again. Not from anger or sorrow. This feeling was entirely different. "Thank you," I whispered, but she had already turned away.

I opened the door to find Lucas massaging his temples. "You didn't attempt to escape? I was anticipating it."

"To give you another excuse to end me?" I countered.

"Perhaps. You're learning quickly, it seems. Let's move. I hope you're decent with plants."

I followed him to the expansive gardens, where rows upon rows of various plants were being tended by multiple workers. They all paused to glare at me. Lucas gestured to a woman with long, wavy red hair. She approached me slowly, carrying a bucket of small gardening tools.

Removing her glove, she offered her hand. "I'm Hannah."

"You're the woman they mentioned. The one who lost her abilities?"

"Correct. Shall we begin working?"

Surprisingly, Lucas didn't follow me through the crops. He remained at the perimeter, his watchful gaze never leaving me. His silent observation made me increasingly uneasy.

"You don't need to keep looking at him." Hannah murmured beside me. "He's just here to observe, nothing more."

"It's just... I ruined his life. I know he wants me dead. But I'm trying to make amends."

"I know. The fact that you're here at all shows you're trying." She winced as she bent over.

"Are you all right?"

"He believes it's too soon for me to be doing this, but I insisted. I can't remain indoors all day."

"Too soon?"

She lifted her shirt just enough to reveal badly bruised ribs.

"Did he do this to you?" I gasped.

"Absolutely not. I'm still recovering from Levi."

"I hope he gets what he deserves. To do this and strip us of our identity... it's worse than death." I sighed heavily.

"I'm certain they'll find a way to handle him. Athena is remarkably clever, and so is Alexander. They always prevail." She gave me an encouraging smile.

"I truly hope they win this time." I remained filled with doubt.

I worked for hours, letting Hannah guide me through each task. Lucas never once hovered over me, but he always positioned himself within sight.

He walked me to my new residence in complete silence. I wanted to say something, anything, but ultimately chose to keep quiet.

He knocked on the door and waited for Caleb to answer. The moment the door opened, Lucas turned and walked away without uttering a single word. His silence felt more punishing than any words he could have spoken.
###Chapter 0425
Lucas Adler

"I told you she would fear me!"

"You used Hannah?" Alexander raised an eyebrow at me, though his annoyance was clear.

"It was her suggestion. She believed connecting with Seraphina over what Levi did to them both might help her relax."

"And?" He leaned back in his chair.

"Nothing happened. Seraphina didn't lie as I expected. She was surprisingly open with information. She focused on the task, accepting everything Hannah showed her. If we didn't know her history, you'd think she was a model pack member."

"Probably because you were watching her?" He muttered. "She fears you, of course she'll behave. But do you truly believe she's being honest?"

"As much as I despise her and would gladly use her skin as a warning to others, she isn't lying. I never thought I'd say this, but Levi broke her in ways I couldn't imagine. I saw something in her I've never seen before." Did I want to admit it? No. Did I want to tell Alexander? Absolutely not. But it was better coming from me.

"What?"

"Empathy."

"Empathy?"

"Yes." I answered sharply. "The bitch actually showed empathy."

He stared at me in disbelief. "Keep that information to yourself."

"I can do that. Are you worried about Athena?"

He shook his head. "Athena can handle herself."

"Okay, but..."

"It doesn't matter, Luc. Just do this for me."

I scowled at him. "Seems like more things keep getting added to our agreement."

He looked me directly in the eye. "Are you going to tell me you suddenly hate living here? You haven't returned home in months."

I remained silent. I wouldn't admit I was growing accustomed to pack life or that I didn't want to be away from Hannah. I still disliked ninety percent of the Lycans, but the Wolves were tolerable.

"Having regular people to talk to is nice, right?" He paused for my response. When I didn't answer, he continued. "Speaking with others like you every day. Having your mate here in the pack. And don't tell me you dislike my mate, because I know you're fascinated by her soul."

"Alright! Yes, I do like living here."

A smug smile appeared on his face, and I rolled my eyes.

"It's just not how I was raised. I could never accept you as my Alpha, but yes, I do enjoy living here."

"I can accept that for now." His eyes flickered to the clock. "Want to join me to feed the other prisoner?"

"You're feeding her now?"

"We need to keep her alive if we want to trade her."

I followed him to the kitchen where a tray of food was already prepared. Just a sandwich, a carton, and some fruit, but it would be enough to sustain Evelyn. Personally, I would have let her starve for another day or two.

In the dungeons, Evelyn sat at the back of her cell. She held her knees to her chest and rocked slowly. Alexander opened her door and gestured for me to bring in the food. She didn't move as I placed it on the ground and stepped out.

It was only when Alexander turned the key that her head snapped up. "Levi is going to kill you!"

"Are you talking to me or him?" I asked while pointing at Alexander.

"Both of you. You both hurt me. You both punished me. You took away my friend. You ruined everything I had."

"Your friend? You mean the one you lied to? The one you tricked into leading you here?" Alexander challenged. "You're an excellent friend."

I had to stop myself from laughing at his sarcasm because Evelyn didn't understand it.

"Have you killed her?"

"Does it matter?"

She rested her forehead on her knees and began crying. "This is all wrong. This wasn't supposed to happen."

"Being thrown in the dungeons?" I asked out of curiosity.

"Why are you really here, Evelyn?" Alexander pressed.

"It doesn't matter." She sniffled. "He's coming for me."

"I assume you're talking about your brother?"
###Chapter 0426

"He wants me back."

"Your brother is a complete asshole." I mutter under my breath.

She shakes her head fiercely. "No, you don't understand. He protects me. He's always protected me."

"Is that the lie he feeds you?" Alexander questions sharply. "He stripped you of your Lycan nature to protect you? Do you know what we call people who do that?"

Her grey eyes flicker up to us nervously before she shakes her head again.

"Abusers. Cowards. Weaklings. I could list more." Alexander tells her coldly. "But you wouldn't believe a word I say."

"He's my brother. His only job is to protect me."

"Yet here you are in my dungeons while he's nowhere to be found. We know you can mind-link him, Evelyn. And judging by those deep claw marks on the wall, you've shifted recently."

I had been so focused on reading her soul that I missed the savage gouges scarring the stone walls.

"It was agony." She whispers, dropping her head in shame.

"First shifts always are." I shrug. She would've known that if Levi had bothered to teach her anything about being a Lycan.

"When is Levi coming?" Alexander demands as her stomach growls loudly. Her grey eyes keep drifting toward the untouched food.

"He said he's on his way."

"She's lying."

Her head snaps up. "I'm not!"

"You are. I can see it plain as day. Your entire demeanor shifted when you said it."

"So he's not coming?" Alexander asks for confirmation.

She presses her lips together in a tight line. "He said he would and then..."

"And then what?"

"Something more important came up. He wants you to go to him instead."

"Did he tell you to say that?" Alexander demands.

She nods quickly. Alexander looks to me for verification. I confirm she's telling the truth this time.

"And you still can't see how he's using you?" He asks incredulously.

"He isn't!"

"Really? He planted you in that house exactly where he predicted Seraphina would run. He had you befriend her. Convince her to return here even when she knew she might be walking to her death. What else? Did he want you to spy on my pack? Draw him maps of our territory? Connect with his other lackeys?"

"I don't know."

"What did he want you to do, Evelyn?"

"I..."

"What is his plan?" Alexander's voice rises with each word.

"I... I truly don't know."

"He's using you as a pawn and you don't even know the game?"

"No." Tears stream down her face. "I just had to get her here."

Alexander glances at me. I nod. “She's telling the truth now.”

He slams his hands against the steel bars and storms out. My patience wears thin most days, but Alexander was clearly losing his composure over the lack of real answers.

"Eat. Stop that stomach from making those disgusting noises." I snap at Evelyn before following Alexander.

"You believe her?" He demands as we step into the harsh daylight.

"Several things are clear. She genuinely believes Levi is helping her, not punishing her by taking her abilities. She thinks she's Seraphina's real friend despite the lies. And she has zero clue what Levi actually wants."

"So he's manipulating her?"

"We both know that. But he's careful about how he uses her. If he's the only one who knows the full plan, it makes him harder to stop. In some twisted way, the bastard's a genius."

He glares at me. "He's a monster."

"Never said he wasn't. But even you have to admit not sharing his plans is strategically smart!"

His scowl deepens. "Go check with Caleb. He's compiling names of Wolves causing problems for the Lycans. They might be working for Levi."

"I've already vetted them all."

"Luc, just do it."

"What are you planning?" I ask cautiously. His anger radiates off him. My sarcastic comments weren't helping.

"I need to speak with my Betas."

"Well, today's your lucky day." I nod toward Sebastian speaking with a Wolf several hundred yards away.

I watch Alexander stride off, making a mental note to talk to Athena. An enraged Alpha losing control of his pack was a disaster waiting to happen. And if he feels that control slipping, we're all in deep trouble.
###Chapter 0427
Athena

“And she was genuinely kind?” I question Hannah, struggling to accept her account of Seraphina.

‘Seraphina must be deceiving us, right?’ Nyx murmurs internally.

“She was. Luc made her visibly anxious, and she kept glancing around to track his location. But in the end, she didn’t speak negatively about anyone except Levi. I barely know her, which is exactly why I offered to be present. I thought if she was putting on an act, she might reveal her true intentions to a stranger, or someone who’s endured similar trauma. I even showed her the bruises I still carry. And you know what? She advised me to rest. But I insisted on helping.”

“You didn’t need to go that far.”

“I know. I just wanted to contribute. You and the Alpha are both allowing me to stay in the house, even though I’ve lost my Lycan abilities. This felt like something I could actually do.”

“Has Luc discussed your Lycan with you?” I ask.

“He suggested that you bite me to restore my abilities.”

‘He did what?’ Nyx responds, clearly startled by the idea.

“I told him I’m not even certain that’s what I want anymore.”

“That… wasn’t what I meant. There’s a possibility your lack of abilities is only temporary. They might return.”

She frowns and shakes her head firmly. “No.”

“What do you mean, ‘no’?”

“Levi told me. It’s all a bit foggy, you understand.” She taps her temple gently. “But he definitely said it. He called it my punishment for being with Luc. He said I would never experience being a Lycan again. Only those who are worthy deserve it.”

‘But it wore off for Evelyn?’ Nyx whispers.

“He said never?” I press.

Hannah nods. “Something about how he doesn’t make mistakes.”

“He doesn’t make mistakes?”

“Sorry.” She shrugs slightly. “Like I said, it’s still fuzzy. Sometimes the memories don’t feel coherent. Occasionally, a clear memory surfaces, and I know it’s not a dream. I remember him standing over me, saying those exact words.”

‘He doesn’t make mistakes? That feels like a hidden message,’ Nyx mutters.

‘I agree.’

“Do you remember anything else, Hannah?”

She shakes her head. “I’m sorry, Athena. I try, and Luc keeps asking me. But when I attempt to recall, it feels like I’m being pulled into a dream. I can’t always distinguish what’s real. Is it okay if I go lie down? It’s been a long day.”

“Of course.” I offer a warm smile as Nyx repeatedly echoes Hannah’s words.

‘He doesn’t make mistakes.’

‘It’s a strange thing to say, right?’ I mutter to Nyx.

‘Yep!’ She emphasizes the ‘p’. ‘Everyone makes mistakes. Do you think she knows something more?’

I shake my head. ‘I doubt she could keep anything from Luc. Not through words, and not because he’d see it in her soul.’

I sink onto the sofa, tucking my legs beneath me. “Do you think he messed up by saying that to her?” I speak aloud, yawning.

‘Like I said, everyone makes mistakes, so it’s possible. Maybe Levi thought she was unconscious? Maybe he believed she couldn’t hear him?’

“Maybe.” It’s incredibly frustrating.

Nothing about Levi adds up. What was his goal in turning some of Alexander’s Wolves to his side? Why target Seraphina and then Hannah? Why did he have such control over Evelyn? There are no clear connections between any of them.

‘Power?’ Nyx mutters.

“Then why hasn’t he come after me or Alexander? He isn’t accomplishing anything by targeting the people he has. Hannah couldn’t even shift, and he knew that!”

The front door swings open, and moments later, Luc’s scent fills the room. He drops onto the sofa opposite me. His hazel eyes study me intently. “Alexander isn’t happy.”

“I know,” I mutter.

“He feels he’s losing the pack.”

“I know.”

He leans forward, resting his elbows on his knees. “That could mean trouble, Athena. For everyone. I’m aware Alexander has his methods, but I’ve seen what happens to angry Alphas. I’ve watched their packs disintegrate.”

“What do you suggest?” I mutter. “Because some members of this pack seem to be forgetting who’s in charge.”

“We go after Levi. Deal with him permanently. Bring Theodore home. Just you and me. In and out. We leave Levi with a bullet in his brain.”

“I’m not doing that. That’s exactly what Levi wants us to do. As much as Theodore is family, he’s safe as long as we don’t intervene. Levi believes Theodore is his mate.”
###Chapter 0428
He glares at me, struggling to hide his irritation.

“You’re missing the point, Luc. This isn’t something we can shoot our way out of. Do you not get that? He’s been planning this for a long time. Whatever it is. Seraphina wasn’t his first victim, and Hannah won’t be his last. Seraphina mentioned others in that prison. We still don’t know what he’s after.”

“At first, we thought it was me. Then he targeted your mate. And now there’s Evelyn. That bastard has manipulated her, and she can’t even see it. Levi is using her, and she’s just going along with it because he’s convinced her he’s keeping her safe.”

“So you want to help her?”

I scowl. “I’m saying I need time to think. There’s more than one thing going on in this pack, isn’t there?” I snap, thinking of the little Lycan fast asleep in his crib upstairs. Shifting in his sleep—I didn’t think it was possible, but Evrin did it.

“Where’s Alexander?”

“Last I saw him, he was talking to Sebastian. Said he needed to speak with his Betas. He’ll be back soon.”

I nod.

“I know I’m an ass, but if you need to talk, I’m listening.” Luc leans back into the couch. “Maybe I can help.”

“It’s nothing.”

He raises an eyebrow. “You’re a terrible liar. You know that, right?”

“And you can be incredibly annoying! Even worse when you haven’t killed anyone.”

“Think of it as keeping me sane. It’s getting harder to be who I am. I’m a Hunter. I used to go out every night. Being here, around Hannah, you, even Brianna… it’s making it impossible to be the man I was raised to be.”

“See? Not all Lycans are monsters.”

He smirks at that.

“So that’s why you want to go after Levi? You need to kill?”

He nods. “I need bloodshed. Hunters thrive on it.”

“Theodore doesn’t.”

“You sure about that?”

“He’s not a killer.”

“He spends a lot of time at the hospital, doesn’t he? Maybe he thrives differently. He wouldn’t make a great Hunter—too calm. But there’s something in him. Good diversion, by the way.”

“I wasn’t trying to divert you.”

“But you did. You might suck at lying, but you’re good at digging. So, what’s on your mind?” I shake my head.

“Come on. I shared something. It’s only fair you do too.”

“Evelyn?” I let out a breath.

“She linked me in her sleep. No one’s ever done that. It was strange. I felt everything she was feeling. Then when she woke up, it was gone. Like she didn’t know she was doing it, but also like she did.”

“Like her mind connected to you on its own?”

I nod.

“Almost like it wasn’t her, but someone else?”

I nod again.

“You have Nyx because you’re an Alpha. Same as Alexander with Titan. Evrin has his, and no doubt Logan will too when it’s time.” He pauses. “Wait, what? Evrin has who?”

“His Lycan spirit.” He smirks. “I thought that was obvious after he shifted.”

Nyx stays silent. I feel her pulling back, though she has nowhere to hide.

‘You knew, didn’t you?’ I snap at her.

‘I didn’t want to worry you.’

“She doesn’t carry Alpha genes,” Luc continues. “Because you’re the last female Alpha.” He twists the ring on his finger. “You’re an only child, right? Besides Seraphina.”

“Yes. Only child from my mother.”

“If she had siblings, you’d know.” He spins the ring faster. He started doing that after I told him to keep his guns out of sight.

“Did your mother have any siblings?”

“I don’t know. I don’t remember. I just remember Dominic. He was raised as my brother, but he was really my uncle… my father’s brother. I don’t remember anyone from my mother’s side. Pretty sure there was no one. Ironically, the best person to ask would be Theodore. He’s been researching my family for years. Is that what you think? That somehow Evelyn is family? Like a cousin or something?”
###Chapter 0429
Alexander

Her blue eyes lift to meet mine as I enter the room. "Did you hear that?" She scoffs.

I nod slowly. I only caught the tail end of Luc's speech. "I didn't need to hear it all. I'd already considered the possibility. But this isn't about that. This confirms everything." I hand Athena the book I'd been carrying under my arm.

Zachary, Sebastian and I had returned to Theodore's house because I knew he'd been researching Athena's past. I wondered if there was a connection between Athena, Evelyn and Levi, especially after Evelyn linked to Athena in her sleep. But there wasn't.

She opens the book and unfolds the pages. Theodore had been busy. While her father's family line was limited, her mother's side was extensive. Name after name stretched back through generations, all the way to Aldous Harrison and beyond.

How Theodore managed to gather so much information was beyond me, but it was his specialty.

"Wow." Her whisper is soft as her fingers trace the family tree. "This is... It goes all the way back..."

"Centuries. You know how Theodore loves his research." I smile at her.

I let her study the names for several minutes before she frowns. "There's no mention of Evelyn or Levi. That's good, right?"

"Yes and no. It means you're not connected to them, thankfully. But it also means we're not making progress in discovering who they are or what they want. Evelyn seems detached, almost unstable since regaining her abilities. She claims to know nothing beyond Levi sending her here, and even that information is limited."

"At least I don't have another half-sibling appearing out of nowhere!" Athena tuts, and I catch the way Luc looks at me. I glare back, and he quickly makes excuses to leave as I sit beside my mate.

She rests her head against my shoulder, her hand sliding onto my thigh. "Is Theodore okay?"

"Yes. He hasn't gotten anything useful from Levi yet, but he's working on it."

"We can't leave him there."

"It won't be forever. Theodore will come home." I drape my arm around her shoulders, pulling her closer. "I'll make sure of that."

"What if--"

"It's not an option, Athena. He's said it himself. He'll never accept Levi."

She falls silent. "Don't lose control," she whispers.

"You listen to Luc too much."

Her eyes search mine. "What does that mean?"

"It means you don't need to worry. We'll figure this out." I kiss the top of her head, and she buries herself against me.

"Evrin shifted again. Luc says he has his Lycan spirit."

'Crap.' Titan mutters. I ignore him. It wasn't necessarily a problem.

"Was Evrin okay?"

Athena nods. "He did it in his sleep. I left him sleeping as a little Lycan. I didn't want to wake him."

'In his sleep?' Titan mutters. 'How is that possible? Is that even a thing?'

'I don't know, but it is now,' I mutter back.

"Evrin will be fine," I tell Athena, and she sighs.

"We don't know what this means. Does it mean he's more powerful than Logan? Does it mean he's the next true Alpha? Logan is first born—I thought that's how it works."

"You're worrying too much. Right now, he's just a baby who's only started walking." I pull her onto my lap so she's facing me, her legs straddling my thighs. "But it's not just him you're worried about, is it? Me, Theodore, Hannah, Zachary, and probably many others." I tuck a strand of her dark hair behind her ear, her blue eyes locking with mine. "It's probably one of the hardest things about being an Alpha. You feel responsible for everyone else. Just as one issue settles, something else comes up. It's a never-ending cycle. I grew up expecting that—you didn't. Though you've adapted to it remarkably well."
###Chapter 0430
Athena turned her face away from me. I gently guided it back. "You can't keep everything locked inside. Some things, yes. But not everything. Having me read your thoughts isn't the same as you actually telling me what's wrong."

"I am not weak anymore," she scowled.

I never said she was.

"Not knowing what Levi wants makes me feel weak. He's part Lycan. I should be able to command him. Or at least link him. It's like he doesn't even exist."

"That would be his Witch half."

"But his Lycan side is still there, right?" She frowned deeply.

"I suspect it depends on how dominant his Witch genetics are. If he's lived his whole life as a Witch, that side is probably stronger. He may have never even shifted."

Her brows furrowed in frustration. "None of the scenarios I imagine feel right. It wasn't like with Gabriel, who was always one step ahead. It isn't like Seraphina, who taunted us from a distance. This man only hurt Hannah. He took Theodore. He convinced a few Wolves to rebel. That's it. If it were you, you wouldn't waste time like this. He'd already be dead. His pack would be gone too."

"You're right. I wouldn't have waited. But we aren't just dealing with Wolves or Lycans. He is part Witch. That changes everything. They play by different rules. Not all are like Madame Zora. And she wasn't exactly innocent either."

"I suppose," she said, shaking her head. "I'm just done with it."

I raised a brow. "Done with it?"

She nodded firmly. "I want it handled. I want him gone. I want Evelyn gone. I want peace. I want to raise my sons without fearing someone will come for them."

"Alright. I will link Theodore. I'll tell him to inform Levi we are ready to make the trade."

'She didn't mention Seraphina,' Titan noted.

'No, she didn't,' I confirmed. I hadn't planned on bringing her up either.

Athena leaned forward, resting her head on my chest. "Thank you."

I reached for the link to Theodore. 'Is now a good time?' I asked, aware his opportunities to speak were limited.

'Yes,' he replied, though his tone felt strained.

'Are you okay?'

'Tired,' he muttered through the link. 'His watch on me has intensified.'

'Anything new?'

'No. He spent the day trying to convince me I'm his mate.' He sounded utterly disgusted.

'It doesn't matter now. Tell him we want to offer a trade.'

'Alexander, I need more time.'

'I'm sorry. I can't give you more time. This needs to end. Athena is right. This has dragged on far too long. Tell him he needs to be at my gates with you by six tomorrow morning.'

'He will refuse.'

'Then tell him his sister will be killed. There will be no hesitation.'

Theodore was silent for a moment. I looked down at Athena. Her eyes were closed. Her lips were slightly parted. Her breathing had settled into a steady, slow rhythm.

'I will tell him.'

I severed the link and remained still. Letting Athena have her moment of peace. I pressed my nose against her hair, inhaling her calming lavender scent. It soothed my own mind. It was a scent I would never grow tired of.

Her body grew heavy against mine as she slipped deeper into sleep. I closed my own eyes just as Theodore linked me again.

'We will be there.'
###Chapter 0431
Theodore

“That’s all he said?” Levi questioned.

“Yes. He expects us there by six tomorrow morning. Or your sister dies. He’s waiting for confirmation.”

He paced back and forth, restless. “Impressive, Theodore. You woke me just to say that. Could’ve stayed quiet. Let him kill Evelyn.”

“He ordered me to tell you. He is my Alpha. I obeyed.”

“Right. But he wouldn’t have known if you kept it secret. As your mate, I think you’re trying to make me happy. Telling the truth. You know I want Evelyn back.” He winked. “But what does your Alpha really want? You, I assume. You’re valuable to him.” He ran a hand through his short blonde hair. “Never had to choose before. My sister or my mate? Difficult.”

“I am not your mate. I gave you my birth name.”

“Theodore, you lie. Not good.” He checked the chains on my wrists. “Tell your Alpha I’ll be there.”

“He won’t hand over Evelyn if I’m not with you.”

“Yes, he will.” Confidence radiated from him. His eyes glowed. “If he knows what’s good for him.”

“You don’t know Alexander like I do. He’ll see I’m not there and tear her apart. I’ve seen it happen.”

“Then he’ll face my wrath. You might not believe it, but I love my sister. Even though she’s difficult. I’ll do anything to keep her alive.”

“You’ve done nothing while she rots in a dungeon.” I muttered, frustrated. He’d given me nothing but coded answers.

He squatted before me, leaning close. His breath was stale. He needed to brush his teeth. “But she’s safe there. Everyone is safe while she’s locked up. It would be a bloodbath if she got out.” He stood. “Tell your Alpha we’ll be there. I’ll decide when everything is revealed.”

I linked Alexander and confirmed.

“You keep saying she’s safe in the dungeon. What does that mean? Why no hurry to get her out? Why a bloodbath? You think she can kill everyone?”

“No need to hurry when I know where she is.” He didn’t elaborate. Odd. I didn’t buy it. I needed to know why Evelyn was safer inside. And why everyone else was, too.

“She’s a Lycan. You confirmed it. She confirmed it.”

“Yes.”

“Is she a weapon?”

He smiled. “Don’t worry, Theodore. I’ll keep you safe. She won’t hurt you. She won’t be allowed to.”

Allowed? He thought he was powerful enough to stop her.

“Are you afraid of her? Is that why you blocked her abilities? You said it was because she touched your things. I don’t believe that. You’re hiding something.”

“So curious. All will be revealed in time. Get some sleep. Early start tomorrow.”

“I can’t sleep with your riddles. Is my pack in danger?”

“Haven’t decided.”

“You decide? You said Evelyn could cause a bloodbath.”

He smiled. His wide sage green eyes looked unhinged. Why would the Moon Goddess think he was my match?

“Who are you after?” I pushed. No answer. “I could tell Alexander to kill her!”

He grabbed my face roughly, lifting me off the floor. Strength surprised me. “You will do no such thing. Understand!”

He dropped me with a thud and strode out. He returned with a syringe. “Better yet, let’s make sure you can’t!”

Levi stabbed the needle into my neck before I could react. Instantly, weakness washed over me. My senses faded. I tried to link Alexander. Nothing.

“Another reason I’m glad I’m not your mate!” I spat.

A sharp, painful slap hit my face. It burned. A red handprint marked my skin. One that wouldn’t heal for days.
###Chapter 0432

My jaw clicked painfully as I worked it open and closed. Not broken, just throbbing. "Stop lying to me," he snarled.

"You think hitting me will make me talk?" I shot back, my voice sharp. "You know nothing about me. If we were truly mates, you'd be disgusted with yourself right now."

"You're not making it easy to love you at this moment," he growled.

"Love?" I scoffed. "Is this how your Lycan side behaves when you don't get your way?" I yanked against the heavy chains binding my wrists. "You keep claiming your Witch side is stronger, but I'm starting to doubt that. You use your magic to suppress your Lycan nature, but it's failing. You're angry because you can't control me, and now I understand why!"

"Why?"

"Planning to beat the answer out of me?" I sneered.

He didn't respond, just settled back into the chair by the door. He kicked off his boots and propped his feet on the coffee table. His eyes never left me. He wanted to ask, but hesitation held him back. Until now, he had been the one with all the information. I wondered how he'd react when he discovered I was a Hunter. Especially after how he'd punished Hannah for being involved with one.

I met his gaze steadily. Occasionally, the corners of his lips would twitch upward as if he enjoyed the silence, but then they'd flatten when I remained quiet.

Finally, he moved, positioning himself directly in front of me. "You're hiding something."

"Only from you. I suppose it's not a secret, just information you lack."

"Tell me."

"No."

"Tell me now," he demanded. I shook my head. "Is it about you or the pack?"

I shrugged. He clearly hated being kept in the dark. This could work to my advantage.

He laughed roughly, dragging a hand through his hair. "You're incredibly frustrating."

"The feeling is mutual," I muttered. "You're not offering me anything. Why should I give you anything in return?"

"Now I see why you've never found a mate until now," he said with a smug smile.

I stayed silent. I didn't need another slap.

"Tell me your secret, and I'll tell you about Evelyn."

I pressed my lips together and shook my head. The closer he leaned in, the stronger my desire to end him grew. To gut him and watch everything spill out while he still breathed.

Where did that dark thought come from?

He tapped his fingers on his knee, considering. "Fine. You get one question. I'll swear to answer truthfully, and in return, you tell me your secret."

"Three questions," I countered. This could get me killed.

"Two," he replied.

"Three."

"Fine. Three," he finally agreed.

"Who in Obsidian Howl are you after?"

"Evelyn."

I rolled my eyes. "Now who's lying?"

"It's not a lie."

"Why did you want Seraphina to lead you here?"

"I didn't."

I stared. He hadn't let Seraphina lead him to Obsidian Howl. Which meant Evelyn had. When Alexander and I spoke last night, he mentioned that Luc had confirmed Evelyn was telling the truth about not knowing what Levi wanted. But she would be telling the truth if it was her plan—she might not know Levi's full agenda.

"Final question," he mused.

"I'm thinking." How could I warn Alexander before he released Evelyn from the dungeon? "You attacked Hannah." He seemed surprised by my statement. "Because she was with a Hunter."

"That's not a question."

"But it was your doing. Just like you stripped your sister of her abilities. You claimed it was because she kept touching your things, but it was more than that. You love her because she's family, but she's a threat to you." I watched the color drain from his face as he realized I'd figured it out. "None of this was your plan—it was all hers. You followed her here, not Seraphina. Hannah was just an unfortunate bonus for you."

"Stripping Evelyn of her abilities let her hide better. All the questions she's being asked are about you, not her. She's the mastermind behind everything."

I looked up at him, and everything went dark.
###Chapter 0433
Athena

"Wake up, it's happening." Alexander's lips brush my cheek as I stir.

I blink sleep from my eyes. "What's happening?"

"The exchange."

I sit up abruptly. Confusion clouds my mind. I'd fallen asleep on Alexander, yet now I was in our bed. And I'd only asked him to move the trade forward last night.

Nyx's voice echoes in my mind. "It's happening now? You moved it up?"

"While you slept," Alexander says. "You wanted it sooner. But there's a problem."

"He's not bringing Theodore, is he?"

"He claims he is, but Theodore has vanished from my senses. I've been searching for our connection for the past half hour. Nothing."

"Could Levi have blocked him again?" I ask through another yawn. "After learning Theodore could communicate with you? You don't think he's..."

Alexander shakes his head. "More likely Theodore discovered something. Levi is preventing him from warning us."

I frown and slide out of bed, peeling off yesterday's clothes. Strange that Alexander hadn't undressed me. Perhaps he'd been exhausted too. Or preoccupied with planning this.

"So what's our move? This needs to work in our favor. Not his." I mutter.

And we get to kill him, right? Nyx demands.

'Not yet.' I tell her.

She mentally scoffs. Killing Levi was her sole objective, but would he even come close enough? He wasn't stupid.

"Nyx talking?" Alexander asks.

I nod. "She wants to know when we eliminate him."

Alexander grabs my hand and pulls me against him. His warm skin presses into mine. One hand settles at my throat, holding me in place as his mouth claims mine. I feel him hardening against me, and it takes visible effort for him to step back.

"When this is over, I'm keeping you to myself." He growls and disappears into the closet while I head to the bathroom.

He emerges dressed in a simple black tee and jeans. In his hands are clothes for me. His crimson eyes sweep over my naked form. He doesn't speak, but his smile says everything. I think he secretly loves that I do things backwards, because it gives him more time to watch me.

Alexander stays silent as I dress, but he turns the large armchair toward me and watches intently.

As I pull on the sweatshirt, I frown.

"You don't think we should bring Evelyn from the dungeons, do you?" He asks.

"Not until we confirm Levi actually brought Theodore. That this isn't a trap."

"Agreed. Zachary is already waiting at the dungeon for my signal."

'He knows us too well.' Nyx murmurs, almost annoyed at our predictability.

'He can read our minds.' I retort.

She rolls her eyes as I pull on my boots.

"Ready?" Alexander extends his hand.

We check on the twins first. Evrin had shifted back but now wore a diaper. Alexander squeezes my hand. "After I put you to bed, I checked on them. He was human again."

"We can't leave them." I mutter just as footsteps sound on the stairs.

Brianna appears carrying Luca. "That's why I'm here. Now go bring Theodore home."

Alexander and I walk hand in hand across the grounds. No one is visible, but the scents of wolves and Lycans are strong. They're hiding. Waiting for Alexander's command.

We reach the gates where Caleb is already on duty.

"No sign yet." He tells Alexander.

Alexander checks his watch and links me, 'Four minutes.'

I nod silently. My eyes remain fixed on the road leading to our gates. The view is clear. With four minutes remaining, Levi should already be approaching.

At two minutes, rustling comes from the trees. Theodore is shoved forward. Chains bind his wrists. His usually deep green eyes are now a dull grey. He moves uncoordinatedly, feet scuffing the ground, stumbling as if in a trance. It reminds me of how Seraphina described the prison nurses.

Levi steps from the trees, cheeks puffed. "Sorry, we almost didn't make it. Harder to walk with this one than I expected."
###Chapter 0434

"You're joking, right?" I stare at him.

He gives me a twisted smile. "Don't you find it amusing?"

I remain silent.

Levi's eyes dart between me, Alexander, and Caleb. "Where is my sister?"

"What did you do to him?" Alexander demands, pointing at Theodore.

"Nothing permanent. He'll recover fully in a few days. He won't even remember we were here."

"You harmed him?" I ask. He claimed to be Theodore's mate yet hurt him. Some men were truly despicable.

"I couldn't risk him sending you secret messages, could I?" Levi beams. "Now, where's my sister?"

"She's in the dungeon," Alexander replies.

'This is a trap!' Nyx exclaims.

"Well hurry up and bring her to me," Levi commands.

I step closer to the gate, gripping the bars. "Why are you doing this? We don't know each other."

"You're right. We're strangers," Levi mutters.

"Why Hannah?"

"Right place, right time." He smiles coldly. "Don't tell me you've never taken advantage of a situation. I wouldn't believe that. I've heard all about you, Athena. I know how you enjoy tearing out hearts."

"Theodore told you that?"

"No."

Julian told Seraphina. Seraphina probably told him. Alexander links me.

Levi shakes his head. "Theodore refused to give me information no matter how I pressed him. It's annoying how he treats me. I am his mate."

I snort. He was insane.

"You find that funny?" He frowns.

"I think you have a twisted understanding of what mates are." I glance at Theodore, who sways slightly, head bowed. He was both present and absent.

"None of this makes sense," I mutter to Alexander.

"It doesn't need to make sense," Levi smiles. "Now, bring me my sister or I'll kill you all."

"Your sister for Theodore," Alexander spits.

"No."

"It's a trade," Alexander frowns.

"I want both. My sister and my mate. It's cruel to make me choose. I wouldn't expect you to choose between Athena and Julian or Athena and Isabella."

"That's not how this works," Alexander growls. I understood his anger. This man had infiltrated our pack, learning everything about us.

"Wrong. This is how it doesn't work for you. I leave with both."

"He's not your mate!"

Levi points at Alexander. "I've heard that before. Theodore denies it too. But I can smell him. It's the most intoxicating scent. Someone is lying, and I hate lies."

"Says the constant liar," I mutter.

"You're mistaken. I'll let that slide this time." Levi's eyes narrow. "I bend the truth, but I don't lie. I share only what I want."

"You make prisoners believe they're your mates. Isn't that a lie?"

He frowns deeply.

'Does he genuinely not consider that lying?' Nyx wonders.

I watch Theodore. His eyes lift toward me. The grey fades, replaced by his usual deep green. Whatever Levi gave him wasn't as effective as planned.

Theodore's swaying slows. He blinks several times as Levi demands Alexander fetch Evelyn.

"I'll get her if you hand over Theodore," Alexander states. "It's simple."

"You don't understand, Alexander. This isn't your decision. It's mine. I'm leaving with both."

Hook to Alexander. 'We can't let him take both.'

"I can protect him," Levi continues. "He'll have the best life with me. I'll provide everything he needs. Trust me, he'll be safer with me."

"You call this safe? He's bound and drugged. You're delusional. I am your Alpha." I glare. "You might not feel it now, but I will make you feel it. I will make you suffer."

He laughs. "Go get my sister, princess."

"Don't!" Theodore shouts. "She's behind all of this!"
###Chapter 0435
Alexander

My gaze fixed on Theodore.
He was shaking his head at me violently while watching Levi.
"She's dangerous."
He dodged as Levi attempted to grab him.
"Everyone remains safe only if she stays in the dungeons. Do not release her."

'What in hell does that mean?' Titan demanded as we watched Theodore evade Levi again.

I yanked on the gates, forcing them open and squeezing through the narrow gap just as Levi pulled a blade from his jeans and lunged at Theodore once more.

"Theodore." Athena whispered, her voice cracking as his name escaped her lips.

I looked up to see the blade protruding from Theodore's chest.
His shirt rapidly darkened with blood oozing from the wound.
He staggered backward, only for Levi to seize him and keep him upright.

"You bastard!" I roared.
My eyes shifted from him to Theodore.
The color was draining swiftly from his skin.

Levi merely frowned at me.
"Look what you made me do!"
He continued holding Theodore upright.
"You forced me to kill my mate. You left me mateless. You took him from me. You will pay for this."

I simply stared at him.
How could he blame me when he had just stabbed Theodore?

'Theodore is right. This man is completely unhinged.' Titan scoffed.

Athena pushed past me.
I grabbed her hand, preventing her from moving forward.
I couldn't risk him stabbing her too.
Her blue eyes met mine and I shook my head.

'He's killed Theodore' She whispered through the link.
I could see her fighting back tears, and I had to use all my strength to stop her from throwing herself forward.

'Look at the blade's angle. It should have missed Theodore's heart.' I muttered, even though Theodore had stopped moving and his head hung low.
'There's still a chance.' At least I hoped there was.

Levi combed his fingers through Theodore's long dark hair.
He begged him to open his eyes.
"I can fix this Theodore. Just open your eyes."
He tapped Theodore's cheek, pleading desperately.

"You stabbed him, you idiot!"

"Because he shouldn't have done that. He shouldn't have listened to you. He shouldn't have been awake."
Levi's eyes flicked up to me and he growled.
"I will ensure she gets out and tears your pack apart."

"No you won't." Athena growled back at him.
"I am your Alpha and you will obey my commands. You will listen and follow my orders. Look at me!"

"What are you doing to me?!" Levi demanded, his wide eyes shifting to Athena.

"Reminding you of your place." Athena snapped.
"Release Theodore." She ordered.

Levi trembled as he fought the command, but his body was forced to lower Theodore to the ground regardless of his will.
"I am a Witch. You can't do this!"

"No, you are only part Witch!" Athena growled back at him.
"I've been wondering why I couldn't reach your Lycan half and now it's obvious. You need to be at your weakest. You need to be vulnerable. When your Witch half fails, your Lycan thrives, no longer blocked by that foolish spell."
Her eyes darkened as she stared at him.
It had been some time since I'd seen Nyx so close to the surface.

"Release him." Athena demanded.

Levi's fingers withdrew from Theodore, leaving scratches across his arm.
"You bitch!" He growled, but forced himself to straighten up when from the corner of my eye, I saw Theodore rip the blade from his own chest and slash it straight across Levi's abdomen.

Levi frantically clutched at his wound, thick crimson blood spilling freely over his hands as Theodore faced him.
"I will never be your mate even if you were the last man on Earth. But I want to be the last thing you see."
He took the blade and drove it through Levi's left eye, forcing it as deep as possible.

With a smile, Theodore's legs buckled beneath him, dropping him to the ground while Levi's body fell in the opposite direction.
It hit the ground with a dull, heavy thud.
###Chapter 0436

"Is he dead?" Athena whispers.

I gesture for Caleb to check Levi while I move to Theodore.

"Dead." Caleb mutters seconds after pressing his fingers to Levi's throat.

"Double check." I mutter, pulling Theodore's shirt open to find his chest already healing. Relief washes over me. "He's alive."

"Are you sure?" Athena asks.

"One hundred percent." I watch his wounds knit together with unnatural speed. Sometimes I forgot how fast he could heal. It was almost as quick as me.

"And this bastard is definitely gone." Caleb tells me. "What the hell was he playing at?"

Hollow gasps rattle from Theodore's chest before he finally takes a deep breath. "He wasn't playing or plotting, at least not anymore." Theodore croaks. "He was only ever here to watch his sister. He had no plans for any of us. Except me."

"But what about Hannah?" Athena presses.

"She was just collateral damage. He took advantage of the situation." His breathing remains slightly wheezy. My guess is Levi managed to puncture a lung. "Evelyn wanted Seraphina to come here."

"Why?"

"That's what I don't know. I don't think he really knew either."

"That makes no sense. He released her from prison." Athena states.

"I don't think he did. I believe it was her." Theodore coughs and spits blood. "He mentioned her being safer in the dungeon, but also said you'd all be safe with her contained. He warned that if she escaped, it would be a bloodbath now that she has her abilities. I thought he controlled her, but I think it's the opposite. Or perhaps they controlled each other in different ways."

"Luc would have detected the lies. She already deceived him once."

"Not if the questions specifically concerned Levi and his plans. She wouldn't have known because they were never his—they were hers." He rolls onto his side and frowns at Levi's body.

"She's a Lycan. I can control her." Athena mutters.

I raise a hand to Athena. "So he suppressed her abilities to protect her? That's why he never tried to retrieve her. Evelyn is locked away, but he wanted to stay close just in case."

"Not just for her." Theodore coughs and spits more blood.
