"So in some twisted way, he was trying to help?" Caleb scoffs.

"Until he discovered we were mated." Theodore says, his hand moving to his mark. "I feel much better now that he's marked me." He glances at Levi's body. "I'm glad he never got the chance to—"

I look over at Levi. The blade remains lodged in his eye, and the wound on his abdomen continues to bleed. But something feels wrong.

'Zachary, is Evelyn still in the dungeon?'

'Yes. Are you ready for her?'

'No, change of plans. Is she okay? Or is she upset?'

'She's furious. She knows my presence means something.'

She would be upset if she just felt her brother die. I glance back at Levi's lifeless form. Something seems off.

"Can you stand?" I mutter to Theodore.

"I think so. Damn. I don't want to get stabbed in the chest again." He rubs the wound.

I offer him a hand and pull him to his feet as Athena throws her arms around his waist. She tells Theodore how relieved she is to see him.

"Everyone, move to the other side of the gate. Caleb, do you have a lighter or matches?"

"I think so." He searches the small office by the gates and returns with a matchbox. "Am I missing something?"

"Ever dealt with Witches before?" I ask.

"Can't say I have. Always taught to avoid them."

"What's happening?" Athena asks as I strike a match and watch the small orange flame appear. I toss it at Levi, and it lands on his chest. He ignites in a ball of orange fire.

"It's not him." Theodore scowls, suddenly understanding my actions. "No, it certainly is not."
###Chapter 0437
Theodore

"That's impossible. How could it not be him?" Athena demands. "I saw him stab you. I watched you kill him. You stabbed him right through the eye!"

"It's..."

"Are you suggesting this was one of his powers?" Caleb asks.

"Yes." I glance at Alexander, hoping he might explain it better than I can. "Are you telling me it's a twin?" Athena searches my expression, desperate for answers.

I turn back to the fire. Not even the slightest scent of burning flesh. That's what I would have expected if it were truly him.

"Alexander?" Athena asks. "I don't get it."

"Theodore didn't kill him." He tells her.

"I was right there. I saw it happen."

"It's called astral projection." Caleb explains.

"Astral projection? He stabbed Theodore!" Athena mutters.

Alexander cups her face and tilts it up until their eyes meet. "Remember how I told you Witches possess different abilities?"

"Yes, but..."

"He was never physically here, Athena. His projection was powerful enough to wield a weapon. That's why there's no smell of burning flesh. It's why when the fire dies, the body will either remain or vanish completely, leaving only the blade behind."

Right on cue, the blade clatters to the ground. I watch the flames slowly die out. Nothing remains but the blade, exactly as Alexander predicted.

"So he can be in two places at once?" Athena asks as Alexander moves toward the blade.

"Yes, though it could be more locations depending on his strength." I reply.

"If he wasn't actually here, how was I able to make him release you?"

"Because you found his weakness. From what I understand, projecting requires immense energy. When he believed he had killed me, it weakened him significantly. The problem is, now he's aware of that vulnerability and will likely find a way to prevent it from happening again."

"So if he wasn't targeting us before, he definitely is now?" Caleb asks.

"Yes. Possibly just me and Evelyn, maybe all of us." I frown and scan our surroundings. "The most concerning part is, I don't even remember how I returned here."

"You were in some kind of trance." Alexander mutters as he removes his tee and wraps it around his hand. He carefully picks up the blade and brings it back to us. "Your eyes turned grey and you could barely walk. I suspect he drugged you."

"He administered something after I confirmed he would meet with you. It suppressed my Wolf, but there was a moment when I started asking questions and he became furious because I figured things out. Everything went black after that, and then I woke up here."

"Athena, Theodore, return to the house." Alexander instructs. "I need to speak with the sister." He examines the blade, turning it over in his hands. "Caleb, alert us if there's any sign of him or anyone else."

Caleb nods. "At least I know what the bastard looks like now."

Athena quickens her pace to match my long strides. "How do you know so much about Witches?"

"Truthfully, I'm not entirely certain."

"What does that mean?"

"Information about Witches is scarce. There are no books about them, similar to the limited knowledge about Lycans. Yet some knowledge feels instinctive, like it's always been there." I press a finger against my temple.

"But you enjoy research, so perhaps you learned it at some point."

"Is the bastard dead?" Luc asks, rising to his feet as we approach the pack house. He crosses his arms over his chest, staring us down. "I assume he must be since you're standing here."

"No." I groan.

"Why not?"

"He projected himself."

"Interesting." He mutters. "Where's Alexander?"

"Gone to question Evelyn." Athena tells him.

"Oh shit, so the bastard lost you and his sister. He's probably furious right now. I know I would be." He purses his lips. "Now can Athena and I go kill him?"

"You just said it yourself. He's beyond angry. Do you really think you can just walk in there and kill him?"

"Who said anything about walking in? I have guns with longer range than a pistol."

My eyes shift to Athena. Ultimately, it wasn't my decision to make, but I hoped she would recognize how reckless this idea was.

She shakes her head. "Luc, I know you think that's the easy solution. But I disagree. What if the person you shoot is just another projection? What if it's a trap? What if it's exactly what he wants us to do?"
###Chapter 0438

"He expected you to show up." I inform her. "If anything, he was irritated that you didn't. He has enough syringes loaded with drugs to eliminate more than just this pack. He could potentially turn every single one of us Human."

"Did he intend for it to wear off so fast? Was that part of his plan?"

"I doubt it. He appeared genuinely shocked when he noticed the drugs had left my system. That's why he stabbed me."

"It's because he's a Hunter." Luc shrugs casually as if stating an obvious fact.

"What does that change?"

"Seriously, Mister Research." Luc rolls his eyes dramatically. "You've mapped her entire bloodline for centuries, yet you never bothered to investigate your own heritage?"

"I've been slightly occupied."

"You heal quickly, correct?"

"I suppose. I always considered it luck."

Luc gives another exaggerated eye roll. "You're a Hunter. Despite how wrong that title feels for you. Hunters heal fast. We recover like Alphas because we're our own breed. Have you ever seen me injured?"

"That's why the drugs didn't last in his system?" Athena scowls.

"Exactly."

"But there's more you should understand about Hunters." His eyes scan the surrounding area cautiously. "Perhaps we should continue this inside."

He motions toward the door and Athena enters first. She leads us into the office and takes Alexander's chair behind the desk. "Well?"

"This is information I never imagined would be relevant."

"Just say it, Luc." I snap impatiently. I'm exhausted and need rest to clear my thoughts.

"If you haven't researched yourself, I assume you know little about Hunters in general?"

"I never needed to. Usually when I ask, you tell me what I want to know."

He perches on the edge of the desk, much to Athena's visible irritation. "Hunters don't exclusively hunt Rogues."

"What?"

"Actually, that's not entirely accurate. Some Hunters don't hunt Rogues at all."

"What are you implying?" Athena demands. "Because I'm clearly missing something."

"It doesn't help when Luc insists on being theatrical!"

"Look who's growing a backbone after making a successful kill!" He smirks.

"LUC!" Athena warns sharply.

"Fine. You spent days with Levi. What did you learn?"

"He's completely unhinged!"

"Anything else?"

"We're mated!"

"Are you certain about that?" Luc raises an eyebrow skeptically.

"He bears a mark with my initials."

"Does he now?"

"He showed me."

"See, that's where things get interesting. Witches do have marks."

"The mark displays their mate's initials. Yes, I know. I lied and gave him a false name, but I don't think he believed me."

"That's not entirely accurate."

"That's what you told Alexander. You said the mark evolves into their mate's initials over time." Athena frowns.

"I said I believed that, but now I'm not so sure. Otherwise there would be more Witches around, and he'd likely be mated to another Witch to preserve bloodlines."

"Luc, just say it plainly. These cryptic answers make me want to rip out your tongue!" Athena glares darkly. Or perhaps it was Nyx emerging through her darkened eyes. When did that start happening again?

"So I've been wondering why you're unaffected by Lycans. In fact, you're insatiably curious about them, which disgusts me slightly. But regardless, you're a Hunter. There's a reason you withstand Levi's nonsense. That mark he showed you? I don't believe it's a mate mark. He's still half Lycan. Clearly he wasn't raised to understand this. I think I was wrong. I believe the initials belong to his destined killer, not his mate."

"What?" Athena presses urgently. I couldn't tell if her shock came from Luc admitting error or from his revelation about me.

"Theodore isn't just any Hunter. He's a Witch Hunter."
###Chapter 0439

Alexander

Evelyn huddles at the back of her cell when I enter the dungeons. She draws her knees tightly against her chest, hiding her face from view.

“She stopped crying not long ago.” Zachary informs me from his stool at the far end. “But she shifted again. More claw marks up top.” He gestures toward the ceiling of her cell. “Is the bastard dead?”

I shake my head. “It’s complicated.”

I pause outside her cell, examining the deep gouges. They cluster around the ceiling as if she tried to dig her way out. She’ll have a tough time. Concrete encases reinforced bars. No one else escapes.

“My brother’s alive, isn’t he? He was here. Now he’s gone.” Her whisper is muffled by her arms still hiding her face.

“You tell me. You’ve been lying, Evelyn. Do you even know what truth is?”

“I’m not—”

“Enough. I know you’re behind everything. Why manipulate Seraphina into bringing you here? Who’s your target?”

“I came for help. That’s true.”

“Keep lying, and I’ll open this cell. I’ll drag this blade from your neck to your navel. Very, very slowly.” I lift the blade. She finally raises her head. Fresh claw marks mar her face, healing slowly.

Her eyes fix on the blade. “You can’t hurt me with that.”

“Don’t test me.”

She shakes her head. “You literally can’t. The handle has marks. They prevent it from touching my skin.”

I examine the handle. She’s right. Strange symbols are carved into the wood. “Why?”

She shrugs. “Levi made it for me. For protection. But it could never be used against me. He never actually let me use it. Decided I didn’t need protection when I had him.”

“Protection from who?”

She drops her head onto her knees, silent.

“Evelyn!”

She says nothing. I’m tempted to rip the door open and test her theory. Then I remember Theodore’s warning. Her escape would mean a bloodbath. But why?

“Everyone and no one.” she whispers.

“What does that mean?” Zachary moves closer. “How can you need protection from everyone and no one?”

“From yourself? Is that it? Or from Levi and his projection powers?” I demand.

Her grey eyes widen, flicking up to meet mine. “He’s mastered it?”

‘Is this a trick?’ Zachary links.

‘I don’t know.’

Evelyn scowls, burying her face in her legs. Her mouth opens and closes, searching for words. “If he’s mastered it after all this time… I don’t know what happens now.”

“Tell us the real reason you came here.” Zachary presses.

“It was my plan to come. Not for the reasons you think. Levi didn’t know. I never told him. I knew he’d follow. I have to stay close. That’s what he does. I made Seraphina believe he’d follow her. I didn’t want her to know it was really me.”

“Why?”

“I don’t know.”

“You can’t keep saying that. You know what you’re doing. Why withhold information?” Zachary snaps. “You’re speeding up your own death.” He looks at me. “We should bring Luc in. Her answers make no sense. One minute her brother will come for her. The next she’s a mess.”

I agree. Her story is falling apart. What do you think? I ask my Wolf.

‘I’m thinking of Athena.’ Titan replies.

‘Okay.’

Just like when we first met her. She stayed quiet about her suffering. She knew speaking up would make things worse. We saw what her family was like. Maybe Athena is right. Maybe Levi messed with Evelyn’s mind.’ He nods. ‘But that doesn’t make it Evelyn’s truth.’

I take Zachary’s stool and sit directly before Evelyn’s cell.

“I did like Seraphina.” she mutters softly. “I didn’t want to use her. I had no choice.”

“We all have choices. One of you is lying, or you’re both stupid enough to play each other. That never works.”

“I’m telling the truth about this!”

“About this?”

She nods. “I couldn’t even link the Alpha. When she told me Athena was her half-sister. I saw an opportunity.” She buries her face in her hands and screams. Her fingers claw at her skin, digging and scratching until blood surfaces.

“GET OUT GET OUT GET OUT!”

She tears at her clothes, screaming and clawing her skin as she writhes on the floor. It reminds me of Julian fighting his Wolf.

“Evelyn, stop!”

Her grey eyes meet mine, glazing over as she continues to dig into herself.

“What do we do?” Zachary asks.

“We see what happens.”

“GET OUT!” She screeches again as claws sprout from her fingers. Dark fur bursts from her skin. She screams through breaking bones.

I’ve watched Athena shift. I’ve watched my own son. Neither made this much noise. Athena said it was the most painful experience.

The process takes thirty minutes. A massive Lycan lies stretched on the floor. Her breathing is heavy. Her eyes remain closed. Zachary looks from her to me. “What now?”

“We wait.”

Another thirty minutes pass before movement. Her fingers twitch. The twitching spreads to her arms. Her eyes open. She continues lying there.

I watch her nostrils flare. She inhales the scents around her. Slowly, she sits up, staring at us. Neither Zachary nor I speak. I’m not sure if Evelyn can hear us.

My grip tightens on the blade’s handle. I prepare for an attack. But she just watches us, as if we’re the ones in a cage. She runs her tongue over sharp teeth as she stands. She’s definitely larger than the average Lycan.
###Chapter 0440
Zachary

Her gaze remains fixed on me from inside the cell.
Evelyn had been watching both of us for some time.
But once her grey eyes locked onto mine, I became her sole focus.

‘Rogue?’ Alexander links through our mind connection.
‘No. Luc would have detected it instantly, and so would I.’

I study the cell.
The deep claw marks at the top made sense now.
She must have been over eight feet tall in her shifted form.
It was difficult to tell while she remained seated.
The rest of us typically reached around seven feet when fully shifted.

“Can you speak?” Alexander asks her.
Her eyes briefly flicker toward him before returning to me.

“Perhaps we need Athena,” I murmur.

“I’ll ask her to come down,” Alexander says, frowning.

Evelyn gives a sharp nod, as if she knew exactly who we meant.
She doesn’t move while we wait, but her eyes never leave me.
It’s starting to unsettle me.

Athena’s footsteps are soft as she descends the stairs.
“What did you need—” She cuts herself off when she sees Evelyn’s Lycan form. “She shifted again?”

“She doesn’t appear to have control over it,” Alexander explains.

“But she’s aware enough to remove her clothes first?” Athena gestures toward the discarded clothing in the corner.

Alexander sighs. “Yes, it seems so.”

Athena suddenly raises a hand toward Evelyn. “I am speaking to my mate.”

I glance into the cell and see Evelyn bow her head in submission.
This was new.
She had shown anger, frustration, even tears before.
But accepting dominance was different.
Maybe it was the Lycan in her.
Maybe she couldn’t refuse.
Or maybe she was finally realizing she couldn’t win.
It had taken long enough.

“She just shifted?” Athena asks Alexander.

“She screamed and demanded we leave. Then this happened,” Alexander says, gesturing toward Evelyn.

“We all knew she was a Lycan,” I murmur.
Evelyn’s grey eyes flicker toward me.
“But she’s significantly larger than the rest of us. Could she be something more?”

Athena moves closer to the cell.
Evelyn continues watching me until Athena addresses her directly.

“Who are you?”
“What do you want?”

Athena falls silent for a moment.
Then she instructs Alexander and me to turn around.
“No one wants an audience if shifting causes pain.”

We turn and face the opposite cells.
A low growl escalates into a piercing howl.
It’s quickly replaced by a human scream, followed by sobbing.

“Get dressed,” Athena says firmly. “You need to provide clear answers.”

“I can’t,” a whispered reply echoes through the dungeon.

“You mean you won’t,” Athena presses.

“No, I can’t. I didn’t lie. I came here for help. That is the truth.”

“First you said you came for help, then you claimed your brother sent you. Now you’re back to saying it was for help. Which is it?” Athena demands.

“Help. I need help.” Her voice cracks with emotion.

“Then why threaten us with your brother?”

“You were going to kill me. He always promised to protect me. But this… the monster… It hurts so much. Is this what he was shielding me from?”

I turn to see Evelyn sitting on the floor.
One leg is folded awkwardly beneath her while she hugs the other.
Tears well in her grey eyes.

“Levi followed you here?” I ask.

She points to her neck. “I think he implanted something in me. I believe he does it to many people, to monitor them.”

‘A tracker?’ I link Alexander.

‘Possibly,’ he replies, though he seems deep in thought about something else. “The farm? You or Levi?”

“Levi at first, to prevent anyone from escaping. Seraphina wasn’t the first, but she was the first I liked. That’s why I helped her. She reminded me of myself. I thought maybe he wouldn’t notice if I helped just one. The others… they were different. Dangerous, even without Wolves and Lycans. My job was to keep them occupied until Levi came for them. That was my role. And I got to stay on my little farm.”

Her eyes settle on Athena. “Seraphina told me who you were. I thought… I thought this would be my salvation. But I knew I had to lie. To her, to him, to everyone.”

“That’s the problem with too many lies,” I tell her. “You unravel, and you end up in deeper trouble. The kind that gets you killed.”

“What do you want?” Athena demands.

“I just wanted to reach you. It took so long to persuade Seraphina to come here. I truly believed she would walk away after we traveled so far. I knew there was a chance you would kill her. I took that risk because I thought if I could just get her to show me where you were, then maybe I could convince everyone she’s not who she used to be. I didn’t consider my own death a possibility. I thought… it doesn’t matter now. I know you won’t help me.”
###Chapter 0441

"You believed we would simply welcome a total stranger into our home?" Alexander demands.

"You are both Alphas. I hoped... I prayed one of you might understand."

"He used the word bloodbath. Warned us you would break free and slaughter everyone."

She locks her fingers together, twisting them nervously as she searches for a response. Her words are nearly inaudible when she mutters that Levi told her she was dangerous.

"Did you kill someone at the prison?"

She gives a quick nod. "I had to."

"You had to?" Athena presses.

"Yes. I..." She draws a sharp breath and shuts her eyes. "It wasn't what I told Seraphina. It was a nurse, that part was true. He came in at night." Her lip curls and her gaze hardens. "Touched me when he believed I was asleep. I saved a fork. When he sneaked into my room again, I waited for the right moment and drove it into his throat."

Her eyes flick up to meet mine. "I yanked it out and made certain he never left that room as he choked on his own blood."

It was somewhat surprising she wasn't a Rogue.

"I ran. Levi found me. He didn't force me to go back, though. I was too much of a liability." She drops her gaze and blinks several times. "He made me like this, didn't he? Levi twisted my mind until it no longer belongs to me."

"Yes," Athena mutters. "It's what abusers do, especially when they've been at it for years." She turns to glance at Alexander before vanishing up the stairs. He follows her, leaving me alone with Evelyn.

"Why do they keep saying that?" Evelyn asks softly.

"Because it's true, and if anyone can confirm it, Athena can. Levi has used you. He manipulates you into doing his dirty work with empty promises of safety and protection. But he hasn't kept you safe at all."

"He talks to me. I hear him. It's because my abilities have returned. I wouldn't have shifted into that... Lycan otherwise. And the Alpha wouldn't have been able to hear my thoughts."

"What does Levi say when he speaks to you?"

"That he will free me. That he's working on it." She hunches her shoulders. "Something about a mate. Sometimes he sounds furious. He blames me for something."

"For what?"

"I don't know. His voice can be deafening, sometimes it's barely a whisper. Other times it vanishes completely."

"Have you always heard him?"

She shakes her head. "Only when he wanted me to."

I move toward the steps.

"Don't go. I hate being alone down here."

"You were alone on the farm."

"It was different there. I had freedom. You don't have to speak to me. I can just sit quietly."

I take a seat on the wooden stool, crossing my arms over my chest. She lowers her eyes. "How do you expect us to believe anything you say?"

Her forehead creases into a frown. "I don't expect you to. I tried to play games. I attempted to deceive my own brother. If someone here doesn't kill me, he probably will."

Evelyn lets out another whimper. "It's happening again."

Frantically, she tears off her clothes as she screams. She tries to curl into a ball, but the cracking bones prevent it. I watch her roll onto her stomach and push herself up onto her hands and knees. The screams are agonizing to hear, and I've witnessed Rogues tear living beings apart.

The screams blend with roars of pain as her body contorts in ways it didn't last time. I couldn't bear to listen any longer.

"Hey, listen to me!"

As her body continues to jerk violently, her eyes find mine.

"Stop fighting it."

"I can't," she cries out between screams. "It's not me."

"Evelyn, it is you. It is your Lycan, no one else's. You have control. Let it out or shut it down!"

Tufts of black fur begin to sprout along her legs as they lengthen and widen. She hurls herself back against the wall, her claws scraping against the ground. "STOP STOP STOP. You can't do this to me!"

She releases one final whimper and goes still.

The tufts of fur recede and her legs begin to shrink. She slides over until she's lying on her side, drawing her knees to her chest, sobbing and hyperventilating.

"There's a blanket right behind you."

Without looking, she reaches behind her, fumbling for the small piece of fabric, and drags it over her naked body. A few more of her bones snap back into place, but this time, she only cries.

"Were you talking to him? Was that who you were telling to stop making you shift?"

She lowers the blanket just enough for me to see her eyes. "No."

"You were telling yourself?"

"No, I was telling the voice in my head."
###Chapter 0442

Athena

"Wait." Alexander's hand closed around my wrist, halting my angry stride. "Stop."

I turned, frustration burning in my veins. "Why can't she see it? If she's telling the truth, why doesn't she realize how wrong his treatment was?"

His crimson eyes held mine. "If she's being honest—and that's a significant if—it's likely due to brainwashing. He manipulated her with promises she believed."

'She's still an idiot.' Nyx muttered. I echoed her words aloud.

Alexander's grip tightened. "Would you have said that about yourself? I understand why you left that dungeon, Athena. It hits too close to home."

"So many bastards in this world," I whispered.

He pulled me against his chest. "You're right. There are."

"Do you believe her?"

"No. I operate on distrust until proven otherwise. Before you stormed out, I was heading to find Luc, as Zachary suggested."

"He's at the house. Trying to convince Theodore he's a Witch Hunter."

Alexander's gaze snapped toward the pack house. "Did I hear that correctly?" I nodded.

"A Witch Hunter?"

"Apparently. Luc said he was wrong before. About the initial marks meaning mates. He thinks because Theodore isn't bothered by Lycans like he is, that makes him a Hunter. He believes Theodore is meant to kill Levi."

Alexander stared, bewildered. I shrugged. "I don't get it either."

"Theodore scented Levi. Levi keeps calling him his mate. You heard him at the gate—he blamed us for stabbing Theodore." Alexander's frown deepened.

"Luc said something about Theodore tolerating Levi's nonsense. And how there would be more Witches if they were all mated to the name on their mark, not fewer."

Screams erupted from the dungeon below.

"Is she shifting again?" I asked, confused. Why force another shift?

"Sounds like it," he muttered.

"Why is her Lycan so large? It's bigger than Zachary's."

"Unknown. But keeping her contained is safest. We can monitor her condition."

Curiosity burned through me. "You go talk to Luc and Theodore. I'll stay with Zachary."

"Stay out of her cell." His eyes demanded agreement.

"I won't enter the cell."

He tipped my chin up, pressing his lips to mine. "I'll be listening."

'Anyone would think we're planning something reckless,' Nyx murmured.

I crept back down the dungeon steps. Just in time to hear Evelyn mention a voice in her head.

Zachary's dark eyes flicked to me. Evelyn was curled under a blanket in human form. Her shift had failed or she'd stopped it.

"Where's Alexander?" Zachary asked.

"Gone to find Luc." Evelyn whimpered at the news. "What voice?" I pressed.

Evelyn hid beneath the blanket. "Just tell me. I won't have to force it."

Could it be Levi? Was he somehow in her head?

"It started yesterday. It woke me. Sometimes she shouts. Sometimes she whispers."

'When she woke us,' Nyx muttered. 'Was her Lycan linking us?'

'She can't have a Lycan spirit without Alpha genes.'

"You said 'she'," Zachary spoke. "Who is she?"

Evelyn shrank against the wall, blanket pulled tight. Only her legs were visible. "She calls herself Dakota. Says she's my Lycan."

"Impossible."

"I'm not lying." Her voice was barely audible.

"You need Alpha genetics for a speaking Lycan. I wouldn't be able to force you to answer me otherwise."
###Chapter 0443

"An Alpha?" Her eyebrows drew together in confusion.
'This is impossible.' Nyx's voice echoed in my mind. 'We are the last female Alpha. There cannot be another.'

"Who are your parents?" I demanded.

"My father was Thomas Reed. I never knew my mother's name." Evelyn's voice trembled slightly. "My father told me she came from a powerful family but wasn't ready for motherhood. He convinced her to carry me to term and promised to raise me alone."

"Levi's surname is Bennett." Zachary muttered under his breath.

"No, that's his middle name. Levi Bennett Reed." Evelyn frowned deeply. "What's happening to me?"

"Just breathe." Zachary instructed firmly. "Keep your mind clear. Don't let her push through."

"What happened to your father?" I asked as she took several deep breaths.

"Heart attack. Even Lycans can't survive that. I was twelve. Levi took care of me." She snorted and shook her head. "But he didn't really, did he?"

"Can Dakota tell you if you have Alpha genes?" I pressed further.

"I'm not sure."

"You have to ask her." Zachary told her. "Just like when you told her to stop shifting."

"Am I an Alpha?" She spoke openly to the room.

Several minutes passed before her eyebrows shot up.

"No." Evelyn finally answered.

'She took too long to answer just to say no.' Nyx growled.

"What else did she say?" I asked curiously.

"I'm not... I'm not an Alpha but I do carry the genes." She shook her head, her grey eyes widening. "How is that possible? You're the Alpha. We're not siblings.'

'No we are not.' Nyx growled fiercely.

My pulse thudded heavily as blood rushed between my ears. If she carried Alpha genes, she had the potential to eliminate me and take my place. Just like Julian would challenge Alexander.

Was this what Levi meant? It could be a bloodbath because she had the power to wipe out everyone including me.

Evelyn stared back at me through the cell bars. Her eyes were wide with fear. Perhaps she thought I would kill her now that she posed a threat.

Zachary strode toward me. "Let's get some fresh air." He turned back to Evelyn. "I'll find you clean clothes."

"You're leaving." She whispered.

"Temporarily. My advice? Get to know your Lycan."

"What's happening?" I murmured as the guard closed and locked the dungeon door behind us.

"I think we need to consult Theodore."

"Why Theodore?"

"He's been working on your family tree."

"You think she's related to me, don't you?"

"Alexander once said you don't get multiple true Alpha Lycans. There's a bloodline." He pointed at me. "So while she might not be a sibling, perhaps she's a distant cousin. The problem is, many things were kept from you. You didn't know who you really were until recently."

"Do you think Levi knows?" I asked as we walked toward the house.

"He certainly knew she was powerful. Though he might not know how powerful."

Inside the house, Theodore, Alexander and Luc were arguing about the Witch Hunter business. I couldn't follow much of their argument due to excessive swearing.

"SHE CARRIES ALPHA BLOOD!" I screamed.

The three men stopped shouting and turned to stare at me and Zachary.

"She has a Lycan called Dakota." I muttered. "There's a good chance we're related." I couldn't believe those words left my mouth.

"I would have detected it." Luc scowled.

"Clearly something's wrong with you! You've missed so much regarding Evelyn!" I snapped back as he glared at me.

"She's not wrong." Zachary confirmed. "Your Hunter skills seem to be slipping. You should have killed Levi when you had the chance."

"My skills are not slipping!" Luc snarled through gritted teeth.

"Are you certain about that?" Zachary challenged.

"You want to challenge me now, Rogue?!" Luc spat venomously.
###Chapter 0444
Zachary

Luc's hands fly to his jeans, instinctively reaching for a weapon that isn't there. He freezes for a split second before letting out a low growl of frustration.

He was actually following Alexander's rules. If I wasn't bracing for his attack, I might have praised his restraint.

"I don't give a damn about your personal issues." Alexander snarls. He shoves between us, his attention locked on Athena. "Explain."

"She hears a voice. Not Cooper's. A female voice. She has a Lycan spirit, Alexander. Just like I have Nyx."

"That's impossible. Your bloodline ended with you. We saw the family records."

"Actually..." Theodore interrupts. "The records are incomplete."

"What do you mean incomplete?" Alexander demands. "There's more?"

"I believe so. I hit a research wall."

"Are you saying I have another sibling?" Athena stares at him in disbelief. "Nyx is absolutely certain Evelyn isn't related to me."

"No, definitely not. Only Seraphina." Theodore confirms. "Your mother had no other children. But certain birth records I obtained suggest your grandparents had another daughter after your mother was born."

"She would still carry the Alpha gene." I mutter. The name leaves a bitter taste in my mouth. I hadn't thought about her in weeks. She was fading into a distant memory. "The grandparents would have passed it down through their descendants."

"You think the bastard knew?" Luc asks with a deep frown.

"Evelyn isn't sure. Her father told her that her mother wasn't ready for children. But she carried the pregnancy to term and handed the baby over to her father. He raised her until his death."

"Did Cooper kill him?" Alexander asks.

"Surprisingly, no. Heart attack. Cooper took over her care when she was about twelve."

"Before her first shift?" Athena murmurs. "That seems convenient, doesn't it?"

"It does." Alexander confirms.

I watch Luc. He's pacing with narrowed eyes and deep forehead creases. He looks absolutely furious. Probably because Athena caught him being wrong. How did he miss so much when he claims to see souls?

"But Cooper must know about her abilities, right?" Athena asks. "His tone. His anger at Theodore for telling us to keep her contained."

Everyone nods in agreement.

"What if he projects into the prison and frees her?" Athena frowns and turns to Theodore. "You said he needs strength to wield a blade while projecting. Could he materialize in the dungeons and unlock her cell? Is that how his power works?"

Silence fills the room.

"Someone say something!" Athena snaps.

"I'll watch her." Luc offers.

"Go. But don't you dare harm her." Alexander warns.

"Is that wise?" I ask as Luc storms out.

"He's probably trying to understand how he missed the signs." Alexander takes Athena's hand. "We need to determine if Evelyn is connected to my mate, and how."

"She doesn't know. I don't know." Athena mutters. "Nyx says we're not sisters. Theodore confirmed my mother had no other children."

"I think we need to return to where this began." Alexander tells her.

Fear flashes in her blue eyes. She pulls her hand from his. "Silver Creek?" she whispers.

Alexander nods. "We might find answers there."

"We haven't been back since..." Her voice trails off. I watch her process the suggestion. I haven't seen this much fear in her since she faced going Rogue. Her usual confidence vanishes completely.

I knew how Alexander found her. I knew what Brianna did to her in that house. But I deliberately avoided learning the details.

Alexander cups Athena's face. "Technically, that land belongs to you now."

Athena's eyes drop to the floor. "No one lives there anymore." She whispers to herself. I watch her take a steadying breath. "Okay. But the boys aren't coming."

"Fine. Zachary, Theodore. You're both coming. Pack your things. We leave in one hour."

"One hour? Not tomorrow morning?" Theodore asks.

"It's a few hours' drive. We should get started."

Alexander disappears into his office to make arrangements. Theodore heads for the door. Athena remains frozen in place.

"Are you okay?"

"I haven't... I haven't been back since they tried to kill me." She crosses her arms over her chest and sighs. "Did Victoria ever take you there?"

"No. I wasn't that privileged. But Alexander is right. The place is empty now."
###Chapter 0445

"I understand, it's just..."

"Painful memories?"

She nods slowly. "If Alexander hadn't come to that house, my life would be completely different now. Or I might not even be alive. I would never have awakened my Lycan nature. I likely would have died without ever knowing my true identity. And it's not just about Dominic, Victoria, or even Marcus and the others. That's where I witnessed my parents' murder. The place where I was framed for a crime I didn't commit."

Her blue eyes lock intensely with mine. "How can a single word transport you back so completely?"

"That's how our minds work. But you survived, Athena. You became something they never got to witness. You have hundreds of Lycans here who would follow you into battle without hesitation. They wouldn't need orders—they'd do it willingly."

"Thank you, Zachary." She offers a faint smile.

"You don't need to fear the past, Athena. Everyone from that time is gone. You emerged victorious. This journey is solely about finding answers."

She nods determinedly. "Then I should go pack and ensure the boys are prepared for Brianna."

"Not Sophia and Sebastian?"

"No. They haven't experienced Evrin's shifting yet. I'm not certain they're ready for that."

Alexander drives while Theodore occupies the passenger seat, explaining how and why Luc believes he's a Witch Hunter. I roll my eyes because Luc has been increasingly mistaken lately, and I wouldn't trust anything he says.

"That doesn't add up." Alexander murmurs.

I glance at Athena while listening. She's asleep, using her arm as a makeshift pillow behind her head.

"She's anxious." Alexander observes quietly. "Sleep provides her some relief."

"She mentioned it was the memories." I respond.

"You knew Victoria's nature. If it were up to me, I would have displayed her head on a spike for the life she forced my mate to endure."

"Do you think this will help her find closure?" Theodore asks.

"We'll discover that soon enough."

At the fuel station, we switch drivers so I can take over. When Alexander gets in the back, he pulls a drowsy Athena toward him. She curls against him, resting her head on his lap while his hand protectively covers her stomach. I wonder if either of them knows yet.

Following Alexander's directions, we turn onto a narrow road. The trees and bushes have become so overgrown that we must abandon the car and continue on foot.

The packhouse is significantly smaller than the one at Obsidian Howl. Covered in thick ivy, the entrance is nearly invisible.

"Where are the other houses?" Theodore asks.

"Around back. The layout here is reversed. The main house isn't protected by the others." Alexander explains.

I tear the ivy from the door and push it open. The musty scents of dust, death, and decay fill the air. Theodore gags upon entering, and I suppress a laugh. "Are you certain you're a Wolf?" I tease. "It was unexpected." He mutters in response.

"No one has been here for years. How could it be unexpected?"

Athena remains frozen on the porch. Her eyes widen as she stares at the front of the house. Alexander moves back to her, silently offering his hand. She sighs but accepts it, following him inside.

"Shall we split up?" I suggest, and Alexander agrees.

Upstairs, despite the smell and dust, everything appears immaculate. I search the bedrooms one by one, finding nothing significant.

At the hallway's end lies a tiny bedroom, too small to swing a cat. I recognize it as Athena's room the moment I open the door. Her scent still lingers, but only a small bed and an old rotting dresser remain. No photos, toys, or artwork.

"She arrived with just a carrier bag of clothes," Theodore remarks from behind me. "When I first met her, she was terrified. She probably believed she was escaping one hell only to enter another."

"Back when I was Human, I eliminated Humans like Dominic and Victoria. Those who harmed children and tore them from their parents. Sometimes even the parents deserved punishment. If I had known..."

"That was Victoria's nature. Even Brianna admitted she didn't see it, despite spending considerable time here. We never knew of Silver Creek's existence until their leader requested Alexander's help. It was surprising that a pack lived so close yet remained off our radar. That was Dominic's fatal error. That's when everything collapsed for him."

"Yet Athena was the one who suffered."
###Chapter 0446
Athena

"Alexander was right. They're all gone. We ended them. They can't harm you now." Nyx's voice whispers through my mind as we trail Zachary through the hollow house.

We halt before the office door. My heart pounds violently against my ribs. Alexander's fingers tighten around mine, guiding me forward. "Not every memory here is dark. This is where I found you."

My gaze sweeps the room, landing on the dark stain marring the carpet. Marcus had fallen there. Typical Victoria—never cleaning up messes herself. That task always fell to me.

"Why did you lie?" My voice comes out hushed.

"Lie?"

"You told them I locked you in here. It wasn't true."

"I suspected they were hurting you. Dominic confirmed it when he struck you. Then again when they tried dragging you to the basement."

"It feels like lifetimes ago, yet..." I'd spent countless hours in this office, scrubbing every surface with a toothbrush while Victoria loomed over me, shouting orders or criticizing missed spots. So many times I'd fantasized about shoving that toothbrush through her eye.

Well, you did much worse than that.' Nyx murmurs inwardly.

A faint smile touches my lips. Alexander presses a kiss to my cheek.

"You've grown stronger since those days." He releases my hand, rummaging through the desk drawers. I drift toward the bookcase. Dozens of heavy volumes line the shelves—books I'd always yearned to read but was never permitted.

I pull out the nearest one. Fingertips trace the gold embossed letters. One single word: 'HARRISON'

I glance toward Alexander. He's now occupied with a cabinet, extracting stacks of paperwork.

Dust plumes around me as I sink into a chair. Coughing, I wave the particles away. Alexander asks if I'm alright. I nod, cracking open the book.

Page after page of elegant script in an unfamiliar language. What is this? I ask Nyx.

'Looks like Latin.' She responds.

'Latin?'

'I can't be sure! I've only existed with you a few years!'

Flipping further, I discover a family tree. Similar to the one Theodore created for me, but this one spans multiple pages with more names. Beside my mother's name reads 'Amelia Harrison' with birth and death dates. Branching from her is another line labeled 'Female, unknown.' Could that be Evelyn? That would make her my cousin.

"I found something." I murmur to Alexander.

"Good. Dominic and Victoria were terrible at record-keeping." He approaches, taking the offered book.

He sighs. "This makes sense. If Evelyn never knew her mother, the family wouldn't have recorded her existence."

"But someone must have known. Maybe Amelia claimed the baby didn't survive?" I shrug.

"Anything's possible. Unfortunately, this confirms Evelyn's claim. You're related."

"And she's a threat." I frown. "She carries Alpha genes. She could kill me and take my place."

"I doubt that."

"Why?"

"You're the last female Alpha. She can't simply replace you. Besides, if you died, your twins are next in line."

"Then what do we do about Evelyn? We can't keep her imprisoned forever. Levi might still come for her."

"Perhaps not. Maybe we can persuade her to help us."

"How?"

"By revealing her origins." He hands back the closed book. "Start with this."

My eyes lift to the shelves. Other identical volumes stand beside it. Pulling them out, I find the same gold lettering, but the pages are blank—waiting to be filled.

"Any luck?" Zachary asks as he and Theodore enter the office.

"We've found something. Not much, but we've identified Evelyn." Alexander informs them. "Athena's cousin. You were right, Theodore. Her mother did have a sister."

"Is she alive?" Zachary questions.

I shake my head. "According to this, she died fifteen years ago. I never met her—at least, I don't remember. I don't recall my mother mentioning her either. My clearest memory is watching my parents die."

"Search again." Alexander commands. "Ensure we missed nothing. Hidden rooms. Trap doors. Anything."

Theodore and Zachary nod, dispersing in opposite directions.
###Chapter 0447

"Do you ever wonder if they'd feel ashamed?" I ask Alexander.

"Your ancestors?"

"Not just my parents. Generations back. Seeing what became of our bloodline. This book shows there were once so many Harrisons. Now it's just me. And I suppose Evelyn too."

"And our twins."

"No."

"No?" He raises an eyebrow.

I shake my head. "We haven't discussed it, but they're Blacks. Not Harrisons. They may be Lycans but they're just as much yours as mine. The Harrison name doesn't carry the weight it once did."

His lips find mine in a fierce, possessive kiss. He pulls back with a smile. "Whatever you want."

We walk through the house until we reach the basement door. I try to focus on the memory of Alexander making me part of the contract. Back then I panicked, but it became my escape route.

"I can't go down there." I groan.

"You're strong enough."

"It's different now. This isn't about what they did to me."

Nyx remains silent too.

"Brianna?" Alexander asks softly.

"Brianna and I have moved past it. She's home watching our boys. I can't let what she did resurface in my mind again. I forgave her. If I go down there where my blood probably still stains the walls because I wasn't allowed to clean it... I don't want to relive that memory. That's not who she is anymore."

"Then I'll go alone."

He opens the door. The rancid smell of decay hits us like a physical blow. It's a hundred times worse than when we first opened the front door. Alexander had opened windows earlier, airing out the main level. But this... My stomach clenches violently. The milkshake I had earlier threatens to come back up.

My legs carry me through the house automatically. I barely make it outside before emptying my stomach.

"Morning sickness hitting already?"

I look up to see Zachary offering a water bottle.

"Alexander opened the basement. We found the source of the smell."

He glances past me into the house before returning his attention to me as I take the bottle.

"Right."

"I thought you and Theodore were doing a perimeter sweep." I mutter.

"We were. I needed a drink when you came charging out here."

I swish water in my mouth and spit it out, trying to clear the vomit taste. It only makes my stomach clench again.

"Wait." I look up at him sharply. "You asked if morning sickness was hitting already."

"I did."

"You didn't ask why I was sick."

"I didn't."

"Do you know something?" I point my finger accusingly.

"I recall only one other time you drank milkshakes obsessively. The same drink you demanded five minutes into our journey because you were suddenly hungry."

"Are you saying I'm pregnant?"

"It's early, but yes. There's a very subtle change in your scent."

'Nyx?' I mentally reach out.

'I didn't want to freak you out.' she whispers before humming to avoid further conversation.

"Plus, whenever you and Alexander stand together, he always has his hand on your stomach." Zachary grins.

"He does not."

He simply keeps smiling.

"Does he know?" I ask.

"He hasn't said anything to me."

"This is not good. I'll have three under two. What if these are twins too? That's four under two. What if they can shift? The diapers alone..."

"You have time to prepare." His smile widens.

"I'm glad you find this amusing."

"What's amusing?" Alexander asks as he joins us outside. He carries several Harrison books from the office.

"I just... Did you find anything?"

"The smell was from a badly decayed body. Probably Marcus. It was dumped at the bottom of the stairs. Nothing else down there. Some boxes of junk. A mattress. But I thought these might be useful." He taps the books. "We can add our own family to them. However many children we have."

"You knew?" I demand.

"Of course I knew." He presses his lips to mine through our bond. "You should have started your period over a week ago."

"Okay, now that's out in the open." Zachary winks at me. "How come Luc couldn't tell you're pregnant?"
###Chapter 0448
Seraphina

"You want me to walk Liam to school?"

"Don't speak with food in your mouth." Zoe scolds me. "But yes."

"The school is literally down the street. You could watch him from the window."

"I could, but the entrance is around the corner."

"I'm not permitted to leave the house without supervision."

"Hannah has agreed to watch you from a distance. Just walk him there, ensure he enters the building, and return immediately. I would do it myself but Braelyn was up most of the night. I need to get her to sleep."

I glance at my baby sister, whimpering softly as she clings to Zoe. Last night was one of the few times I actually wished I could leave this house.

"Fine." I agree, mainly so I can figure out what's going on with the little terror.

"Thank you."

Liam glares at me as he slings his backpack over his shoulder. Even without my Lycan senses, I can see he despises this idea.

"I'm not a baby." He snarls.

"Then maybe tell Zoe that, because she asked me to walk you."

"Only because my stupid sister kept everyone awake."

"HEY!" I snap, and he actually flinches. "Braelyn is an infant. She can't tell anyone what's wrong or what she needs. Maybe you'll understand someday that everyone has bad days, regardless of age."

"Whatever."

We step outside and he immediately kicks over one of Zoe's potted plants, grinding it into the dirt.

"You claim you're not a baby, but you're certainly acting like one."

"Fuck off!" He glares, and even I'm stunned. He turns eight tomorrow, not eighteen... "Are you serious right now?" I cross my arms, and he mimics me.

"I'm not scared of you. Maybe you should be scared of me. Now that you don't have your Lycan."

I grab his shirt collar and yank him back toward the house. He swings at me, tries to kick, but I'm smart enough to keep him at arm's length.

I shove the front door open. Caleb stares at us with wide eyes.

"Where's Zoe?"

"Her room." His blue eyes dart to Liam, then past us. "Caleb is going to be furious." I glance over my shoulder to see Caleb storming toward us, his face dark, hands clenched into fists. Caleb vanishes while Liam struggles against my grip.

"Care to explain what's happening?" Caleb demands.

"She hit me!" Liam wrenches himself free—or maybe I let go from sheer shock. I wasn't sure.

Caleb's eyes narrow to slits as he stares at me. "Basement."

"You don't have to..."

"Basement." He repeats, his voice low and dangerous. I nod and turn away, just hearing him order Liam to go to his room.

"But dad..."

"I said now."

I don't hear anything else as I slip through the door leading down to my room.

I sit on my bed, eyes fixed on the door at the top of the stairs. Waiting for Caleb's inevitable arrival. Liam was going to be the reason everything blows up for me. Unless I can prove otherwise.

My leg bounces uncontrollably, like it has a mind of its own. It jitters faster than my heartbeat as a bead of sweat trickles down my spine.

A knock sounds at the door.

"Come in." I whisper.

Caleb appears, the floorboards groaning under his weight. He trudges down the stairs slowly, releasing a heavy sigh when he reaches the bottom.

"What happened Seraphina?"

I tell him everything. Repeating Liam's words verbatim. No way was I letting a seven-year-old be the reason I get killed.

"I have to ask."

"I didn't hit him. Like I said, I grabbed his collar and brought him back inside. Ask Hannah."

I'd seen her watching us, though I hadn't mentioned it to Liam.

"Hannah?"

"Like I said, Zoe asked me to walk him. I reminded her I couldn't leave unsupervised. She said Hannah would watch me, and I saw her."

He sits beside me on the bed. "Sadly, I believe you."

"You do?"

"I'm as surprised as you are. But I believe you because you didn't see me watching you."

"It was a test?" I scoff.

"You like Hannah. I needed to ensure she wouldn't cover for you. I saw what he did with my own eyes. I heard every word he said to you."

"Then why didn't you step in?"

"I wanted to see how you'd handle it. If you'd hit him, this would be a very different conversation."

"I'm trying not to get killed." I mutter. "But if you don't do something, that kid is going to end up killing someone."

"Speaking from experience?"

I don't answer, but we both know I am.

"What are you going to do?" I ask quietly.

"I need to get to the root of this. I can't fix anything without knowing what's causing it."

I nod in agreement. Though Liam's attitude suggests this has been festering for a long time.

I spend the rest of the day in the basement, only slipping out for the bathroom or food. I figured staying out of Liam's way might help a little.

After everyone's gone to bed, I head to the kitchen for water. I sit at the counter, flipping through one of Zoe's many books.

"Why are you awake?" Liam's voice makes me jump. I was still adjusting to the lack of enhanced hearing being worse than losing the ability to scent someone.

"Liam, you should be asleep." I whisper.

"I asked you a question."

I gesture to my glass. "I was thirsty."

He walks around the counter and stares at me. "Are you here to hurt us?"

"No. Why would you ask that?"

"You left before. You left Zoe, me and Noah."

"That was a long time ago, and it was a mistake." I couldn't see his hands, and it made me nervous. "Sometimes we make mistakes. Sometimes they're so bad they ruin our lives."

"Why?"

"I lost my Lycan because of my choices."

"Because you were stupid. That's what he said. You were stupid and needed punishment. Everyone is stupid."

"Who said that?"

He just keeps staring. Right now, more than anything, I wish I could mind-link Zoe or Caleb.

"What's in your hand?"

He smiles and lifts his empty hands. "I'm going to bed." He turns and runs off.

My heart hammers in my chest. "Zoe?" I mutter, sprinting for the stairs just as Liam slams his bedroom door. I burst into her room to find her fast asleep with Braelyn beside her. Noah is tucked in his bed too. Caleb. Where is Caleb? I find him asleep in Braelyn's room, probably seeking some peace. I close my eyes and exhale. At least he hadn't hurt them. But who was he talking about?
###Chapter 0449
Zachary

We've searched every inch of the pack territory.
I don't think there's anything left to discover.
I relay this to Alexander as we head back to the vehicle.
Whatever evidence existed here, Dominic or Victoria must have destroyed it.
Probably to prevent Athena from learning the truth about her origins.
"I was hoping for more." Alexander admits, though he knows I'm right.
His crimson gaze shifts to Theodore, who's leaning over the car hood.
"What's he looking at?"
"A map he discovered. He's trying to locate any hidden structures those bastards might have used."

Alexander's eyes move to Athena, curled asleep in the passenger seat.
The vomiting and pregnancy revelation have completely drained her.
"I'm curious," I say. "If you knew she was pregnant, why keep it from her?"
"She wasn't ready to hear it. She made that clear not long ago. Though she's handling it better than I anticipated." He smiles faintly.
"You'd have an entire army if she allowed it."
"Nothing wrong with that. You'll understand someday."
I remain silent. My first mate had been unexpected. Finding another seemed improbable.

"Anything?" Alexander asks Theodore.
"Nothing." Theodore frowns, folding the map. "This feels like a wasted trip."
"Not entirely." Alexander counters. "We identified Evelyn. And Athena learned something new about herself."
I raise an eyebrow. Why wasn't he telling Theodore about the pregnancy?
'Too early.' Alexander links me, as if reading my thoughts.

He moves Athena to the back seat so she can lie down comfortably.
He slides in beside her, his protective hand immediately resting on her stomach.
Theodore takes the driver's seat.
"Are we telling Evelyn?" Theodore finally asks.
"Yes." Alexander confirms.
"Is that wise? I get she's family, but that doesn't make it right."
"It's only fair. She's started opening up. Maybe this will encourage more cooperation."
"What if that's exactly what Levi wants? Maybe he needed confirmation and we're handing it to him."
"I doubt it." Alexander says. "He already suspected something. That's why he monitors her. Why he threatened us with her. But from what we know, he's never encountered her Lycan. He wouldn't have if he kept drugging her."
"He claimed it was an accident. That he drugged her for protection but miscalculated the dose."
"Do you believe that?"
"No."

I notice Theodore's grip tightening on the steering wheel.
"What really happened when Levi held you captive? You've never discussed it."
He presses his lips together, eyes fixed on the road. "It's nothing."
"Nothing?"
"You felt a connection to him, didn't you?" Alexander keeps his voice low to avoid waking Athena, but his tone demands answers.
"Yes, but it's more than that. He was desperate for me to admit I was his mate. His moods shifted violently when denied. I think he's always gotten his way, and when challenged, he revealed his true nature. Angry. Aggressive. He tried to mark me."

Silence fills the car, broken only by the engine.
"Did he succeed?"
"No. I lied and gave a false name." His hands slam against the wheel. "Luc is wrong. He has to be. A Witch Hunter mating a Lycan... It's impossible."
"Luc's knowledge is unreliable lately. He's missing things." I glance back at the sleeping Athena. "Missing obvious things. He messed up by not killing Levi and now contradicts himself. Something's changed. He's weakening."
"You think he's mistaken?"
"Yes. Luc is a Rogue Hunter who happens to be mated to a Lycan."
"That's different."
"Is it?" I ask. "Hannah may not have her Lycan abilities now, but what if they return? Like yours did. She could still turn Rogue while remaining mated to a Hunter."
"So what does that make me? His mate and potential killer? I can't be bound to someone like him. He's unhinged. A psychopath."
"Not necessarily his killer. Remember that." Alexander murmurs.
"But it explains why you're so agitated about this." I shrug.
Theodore slams on the brakes abruptly.
"Dammit, Theodore!" Alexander snaps from the back as we lurch forward.
"Sorry, but I need to make this clear. I love my family. I love Obsidian Howl. I'll do whatever it takes to protect it. I won't accept him."
"Then why not just reject him?" Athena whispers from the back, sitting up. "Like Julian tried with Sophia."

Silence falls as Athena adjusts herself.
Theodore frowns deeply. "Sophia still refused. She wouldn't accept the rejection, so what good would it have done? And I already made my point. I stabbed him."
"You stabbed his projection because he stabbed you first. If it came down to it, could you actually kill him?" I couldn't bring myself to kill Isabella. Athena had to do it eventually, something I deeply regret.
"Theodore, it's okay." Athena tells him. "I understand what it's like to be mated to someone you don't want. It's confusing. Frustrating. So many conflicting emotions."

It takes me a moment to realize she's not referring to Alexander, but her first mate.
Someone I never met.
If I had, I would have torn him apart.
###Chapter 0450
Brianna

I collapsed onto the sofa.

All three children were napping simultaneously.

It felt like a miracle.

Exhaustion washed over me.

Maybe I could rest too.

I closed my eyes.

A strange noise came from upstairs.

Not a cry.

More like a gurgled groan.

Almost a growl.

Only the boys and I were home.

Sebastian had left to handle an emergency.

I crept upstairs silently.

Checked my bedroom first.

Then moved to Luca's room where the twins slept.

Luca and Logan were deep in sleep.

But in Evrin's travel cot sat a tiny Lycan.

Bright blue eyes stared back at me.

Athena had warned me.

Even with warning, it shocked me.

I'd never seen such a small Lycan.

"Your mother did warn me," I whispered.

I leaned over to grab his torn vest and diaper.

"What do we do with you now?"

He stared up at me.

Slowly, his eyes closed.

He shuffled down onto the mattress.

He could shift but experienced newborn Lycan fatigue.

I slipped out quietly.

Left the door slightly ajar.

Headed back downstairs.

On autopilot, I made tea.

Took it outside to the front porch.

So much better than my old stone porch.

I took a sip.

Saw Caleb and Seraphina marching across the grounds.

They were heading straight toward me.

No question about it.

"Is the Beta around?" Caleb asked.

"Sebastian or Zachary?"

"Either."

I glanced at Seraphina.

Her eyes stayed down.

Hands buried in her hoodie pockets.

"Zachary's working with Alexander. Sebastian's handling a situation at the packhouse. Can I help?"

Caleb glanced at Seraphina.

"Can you watch her for me?"

"Not a good idea."

Mostly because I wanted her dead.

Also because I had three children inside.

Two weren't even mine.

"Won't take more than ten minutes," Caleb muttered.

"Just need to speak to someone with authority."

"This about her?" I gestured to Seraphina.

"Yes, but not what you think. She did the right thing this time."

Her brown eyes flickered up briefly.

Surprised by Caleb's acknowledgment.

"Ten minutes," I muttered.

Turned to Seraphina.

"You sit there." I pointed to a small chair.

"Don't move until Caleb returns. Understood?"

She nodded.

Shuffled to the chair.

Several minutes passed.

Curiosity got the better of me.

"What did you do?"

"Not supposed to say," she replied.

"You know the Beta is my mate."

She frowned.

"What would the Alphas do if they found a child causing trouble?"

"Liam?" I raised an eyebrow.

"Didn't say that."

"But that's who you mean. Obvious, especially with only three siblings around. And there's already been problems with him."

"Something happened last night."

"Anyone hurt?" I asked.

"No, but I feel someone was close to getting hurt."

"By a child?"

"He's different. Compared to Noah, he has this dark streak."

She looked around as if expecting him to appear.

"Trying to tell me he's already Rogue?"

"Don't know anymore. Impossible to tell at his age. I used to always sniff them out, read the warnings. But now... Last night I slept outside his room to ensure he didn't harm anyone. He got up while I was drinking water. Started ranting about everyone being stupid. Made a strange comment too. 'He told him I was stupid, that I needed punishment.'"

"Levi?"

"Don't know. How would he reach him? He's just a child. Either at school or home with his mother. He's seven. Technically eight. I was bratty at his age, but not like this. He's a devil child."
###Chapter 0451

That was a cruel thing to say about a child. Even if Charlotte had called him bad.

Her fingers scrape against the wooden chair. “Last night, I felt this overwhelming urge to protect the family. I checked on everyone. I camped right outside Liam’s door just in case. Caleb found me this morning. The kid is insane. He tried telling Caleb that I hit him—just to get me in trouble.”

“Did you?”

“No! I know my reputation is terrible, but no. Besides, Caleb saw everything.”

“You understand why I had to ask?”

She nods slowly. “You’re one of many who hate me. There was a time I wouldn’t have cared. But I’m learning to accept it now. I know it’ll always be this way. I made too many enemies.”

“You did. But right now, you aren’t the problem we need to deal with.”

She leaps up from the chair. “What… the hell… is that?”

I turn and see a small black Lycan cub creeping toward me. I laugh softly. “So someone else can escape too,” I murmur, scooping Evrin into my arms.

“Are you telling me that’s your kid?”

“No.”

“One of Athena’s?”

“Yes.”

“He can shift?”

“Is there something wrong with your eyesight? Obviously, he can shift!” I snap.

“But he’s a kid. A baby.”

“And you had your abilities stripped. There’s a lot of weird stuff happening.”

“Does anyone else know?” she presses.

“No. And it needs to stay that way.” I hold her gaze until she reluctantly agrees.

“Are they going to bind him?” She follows me into the house.

“Why would they do that?”

“It could be dangerous for him. Shifting at this age… it might be harming his little body.”

“That’s not something you need to worry about.” I glare, making it clear she should shut her mouth before I do it for her.

“And you should be asleep,” I mutter to Evrin. His blue eyes lock onto mine, and he shifts back into his human form.

“This is insane,” Seraphina whispers. “And amazing. Why are they keeping this a secret?”

“Are you stupid? Did you lose all common sense when Levi stripped you?”

Evrin giggles. Seraphina just stares until a knock sounds at the door.

Caleb steps inside, his expression tight with concern. “You let her in.”

“I didn’t have a choice. One of the twins woke up. Everything sorted?”

“Yes. Thank you. Alexander is on his way home. We’ll move forward with the next step then.”

What did that mean?

“Let’s go,” he tells Seraphina before thanking me again.

I keep Evrin occupied until he finally drifts back to sleep. Sebastian appears. His frown almost mirrors Caleb’s.

“You okay?” he asks quietly. “Heard you got roped into babysitting Seraphina.”

I nod. “And she knows about Evrin. He climbed out of his cot and found me outside talking to her.”

He shrugs. “It was going to come out eventually. If it comes from her, no one will believe it anyway. Did she tell you what happened last night?”

“Yes. It has to be Levi, right?”

He sits beside me on the sofa. “Seems likely. Might explain why he has such an issue with Charlotte.”

“Seraphina spoke like she thinks Liam is already Rogue. Is that something we should consider? He’s not thirteen, but then this one already has his Lycan. What are you planning to do with him?”

“Caleb wants to bind him.”

“How will that help? If he doesn’t even have his Lycan yet, it won’t make a difference. How he’s acting right now won’t change either. Can’t we get Luc to figure out what his issue is and stop it that way?”

He goes silent.

“What is it?”

“Luc left. He left, and Hannah went with him.”
###Chapter 0452
Luc

Hannah's hazel eyes lock with mine. "Are you certain? What about the rest of them? Athena and Alexander? We're leaving without even a word."

"They'll figure it out."

"But I don't."

"Then why are you here with me?"

She lets out a heavy sigh. "Maybe because I'm a fool. It's not like I can actually be of any help to you."

"We can turn back." I offer, "I can return you to the safety of the pack, but I have to understand what's happening to me."

Hannah glances back toward the pack territory. We were completely out of view now. The guard at the gate had likely already reported to Sebastian unless he ignored the note entirely.

"If I don't uncover the truth about my condition, I'm completely useless to them."

She frowns deeply.

"That's not what I meant and you know it." I scowl back. "They brought me here for a purpose and I'm failing to uphold my agreement with Alexander."

"I'm certain if you just explain..."

"I can't explain it, Hannah. I don't understand what's happening. Even now, standing here looking at you, your soul is becoming harder to see. My Hunter abilities are slowly draining away. Tomorrow I might wake up as just an ordinary Wolf."

"You truly believe there's something at your old house?"

"I don't know, but it's worth investigating."

She pouts slightly before nodding. "I'll come with you."

"Then let's move. I have a vehicle parked up the road."

As Hannah settles into the passenger seat, I notice her rubbing her neck again. "Still hurting?"

"It comes and goes." She shrugs as if it's become routine, but it troubles me. I've even checked her neck to ensure nothing was injected beneath her skin.

"Seraphina mentioned that after she lost her abilities, she noticed changes." Hannah tells me. Seraphina speaks more openly with her, just as I anticipated. They share common ground. "What kind of changes?"

"Like feeling aches and pains more intensely without the ability to heal. Sometimes even lying in an odd position causes discomfort now. I suppose we used to heal automatically, even minor things like sore muscles weren't an issue. My scar still itches terribly." She points to the thick scar running from her eye to her chin. Fortunately, she hadn't lost her sight.

"It's where he injected me... I think. Maybe it's more psychological than physical pain." She shrugs again.

"Why haven't you mentioned this before?"

"Because it frustrates you when you can't fix something. And this is one of those things."

I glance at her. She has her elbow propped on the door, staring out the window. I could fix it if she were willing to be bitten. But I don't bring it up. It always upsets her.

"This is your home?" She murmurs as I park beside it.

"Yes." I reply, scanning the street. Something feels wrong. It's midday and there's no one around. No dog walkers. No runners or cyclists. As much as Humans irritate me, their habits are predictable.

Hannah moves to exit the car. "Don't," I mutter, grabbing her arm.

"What is it?" she whispers back.

"I haven't been back here in a while, and it appears Rogues might have moved in. I'm fairly certain we're being watched."

"What do we do?"

"You do nothing." I reach into the backseat for my shotgun. "You stay here. Lock the doors after me. Don't open them until I return."

"What if...?"

"No what if's. You do exactly as I say. Understood?"

She nods as I quietly exit the car. I watch her press the locks down just as something slams into me, throwing me to the ground. My gun slides across the road away from me, and I see another Rogue charging toward me.

Blood from a recent kill covers its face. It drops to all fours, gaining speed as I reach for the gun in my belt. A loud bang rings in my ears, and I watch the Rogue collapse.

I turn to see a wide-eyed Hannah, poking one of my guns through the small window gap, both hands gripping it tightly.

The first Rogue attacks me from the side. Claws dig into my shoulder before hurling me through the air.

As I land on my stomach, the air is knocked from my lungs. Screams come from the direction of my car. Rolling over, I see the Rogue desperately trying to reach my mate as he forces the window down.
###Chapter 0453

Madison fires until the gun clicks empty. Every single shot somehow misses the bastard.

I crawl toward my shotgun. I aim. I blow his fucking head off.

Blood sprays across my car. It splatters Madison as the Rogue’s headless body slides down the vehicle.

She flings the door open. She runs to me. Her arms wrap tightly around my neck.

"Let's get inside."

I guide her through the back door. "Stay here. I need to get rid of the bodies. I can’t have more showing up. Not until I figure this out."

"Okay," she whispers.

I reload the gun. I hand it to her.

"Just in case," I mutter.

I find no one else while disposing of the Rogues. I sense no one watching. But that means nothing. Not if I’m losing my ability to sense them. I should have scented the one that tackled me. I should have seen it coming.

It doesn’t matter now. They’re both dead.

I light a match. I toss it onto the bodies. Flames engulf them. I walk away.

"Hannah?" I call out as I enter the kitchen.

Silence. Then a weak, scared voice. "Here!"

I push open the dining room door slowly. Levi has her. Her back is pressed to his chest. His arm locks around her. My kitchen knife is at her throat.

"You're not here," I growl.

He pushes the knife tip into her throat. A bead of blood appears. She squeals.

"You are still not here."

"You're a smart Hunter. But stupid."

"Maybe. But you're still not in this house. You're projecting. Making it seem real. You're strong enough to hold a weapon. Strong enough to feel solid. How did you get in?"

"Does it matter? I'll find all of you. Won't I, Hannah?" He drags her back. She squeezes her eyes shut. She fights tears.

"You put something in her?" I demand.

"No." He smiles.

"It's in you," Hannah cries. "It's in you."

"Me?"

"Every day, you grow weaker." He grins.

"You haven't touched me!" I snap.

"No, I haven't." He agrees. "Funny what a little spell can do. How easy it is to control someone. Right, Hannah?"

"I didn't know," she whispers.

"That's the beauty. They never do." Levi laughs. "Amazing abilities we Witches have!"

"You know many other Witches?" I mutter sarcastically.

His smile vanishes. He glares.

"Why track me? Why take my abilities? What do you get?"

"Pick you off, one by one. Levi and Evelyn get to have lots of fun." He sings.

"Evelyn? Evelyn is locked in a dungeon. Last I heard, she wanted nothing to do with you, you cunt!"

He shoves Hannah aside. He points the knife at me. "What did you say?"

"Which part? Calling you a cunt? Or telling you Evelyn wants nothing to do with you? Let's see. When I threatened to cut her finger off hours ago, she said she never wants to see you again. That you lied her whole life. That if she sees you again, she'll rip your throat out."

"LIES!"

"Nah. Why lie when the truth pisses you off more?"

"I could slice your throat open."

"Yes, you could. But your legs are fading. Anger makes you weak, not strong. You're barely holding on. So get the fuck out of my house. When I see you for real, I'll string you up. I'll let the crows feed on your decaying flesh. That's if the Witch Hunter doesn't get you first."

The knife clatters to the floor. He disappears.

I look at Hannah. She's curled under the side table. "You didn't know you did that to me, did you?"

She shakes her head. She refuses to meet my eyes. "He told me just before you came in."

"Injection? Or a drug?"

"I don't know. I don't know when, where, or how. I don't even know if he's telling the truth. Or if I've done it to others."

"I have a machine downstairs. It scans bodies. We'll find out soon."
###Chapter 0454
Athena

"Luc is gone? Is he returning?" I ask.

"What a fool." Nyx murmurs.

Damn Luc and his relentless drive.

Definitely not like the one who held me down and stabbed my leg. I'm sorry, Athena. He was asleep. I swear I wouldn't have agreed to watch her otherwise."

She looks up, shocked. "Okay? I thought you'd be furious."

I shrug. "Everyone will find out eventually. Logan will be next. Seraphina wasn't the ideal person to discover it first." I glance at Alexander. "But maybe it will scare her enough to stop being reckless."

Brianna presses a hand to her chest, exhaling deeply.

"Preferably, no. It's what Caleb wants, unless I can change his mind. I'm hoping Athena can talk some sense into him."

"Me?" I ask, surprised.

"He's just a kid, but he's a Lycan kid. That means he answers to you."

"You want me to intimidate him?" I wasn't comfortable with that.

"Only if necessary. Sometimes it works."

Brianna and Sebastian agree to watch the twins while we visit Caleb's.

Seraphina opens the door. Her gaze drops immediately when she sees me. "Do you need something?"

"No. Where's Caleb?" Alexander asks.

"In the kitchen. This way."

She leads us through the house. A small boy tugs my sleeve. "Hi." He beams at me with blue eyes brighter than my own. "My name is Noah."

"Hi." I smile back. He blushes and quickly runs off.

"I think someone has a little crush." Alexander links me.

'Don't be ridiculous.'

'I think I'll have to keep an eye on that one.' He jokes with a smile.

Caleb appears. Seraphina makes an excuse and disappears through a door down some steps.

"Sebastian told you everything?"

"You don't want to bind him?"

"Ultimately, you're his father. But from experience, binding is one of the worst things you can do. It might make him hate everything even more."
###Chapter 0455

"I considered that possibility." Caleb mutters under his breath. "But reasoning with him hasn't produced any results."

"You haven't tried having the Alpha intervene." Alexander gestures toward me.

"Alright." Caleb gives me a reluctant nod. "He's upstairs in his room after a difficult day. Should I call him down?"

"Not necessary." I respond quietly.

"Let her handle this situation. Don't interfere in any way." Alexander instructs Caleb firmly.

Caleb takes a deep, steadying breath. "Proceed."

I move to the base of the staircase. "LIAM SILVERWOOD!"

Liam appears at the top of the stairs. There's a brief flash of irritation at his delayed recognition of me. I watch as his brown eyes gradually soften. His lower lip begins to tremble slightly. "Alpha Athena," he whispers, lowering his gaze respectfully.

"We need to have a conversation." I sigh heavily. He was just a child. A child slightly older than I had been when accused of my parents' murder. Intimidating him wasn't my intention. I would find an alternative approach. "Let's take a walk outside."

He descends the stairs silently, casting a pleading look toward Caleb for assistance. Caleb remains silent, exactly as instructed.

Liam follows me out of the house without speaking. He shoves his hands deep into his pockets, scuffing his feet against the ground as we walk. Yet he maintains a quick pace, as if eager to distance himself from the house.

"Tell me something." I murmur softly.

"Like what?" He asks, confusion evident in his voice.

"Anything. School, friends, home life."

He rolls his eyes dismissively.

"Did you know I have methods of extracting information from people, even when they're unwilling to share?"

"That's a lie."

'He's one arrogant little brat.' Nyx snorts derisively.

"How do you think I managed to get you out of your bedroom?"

He merely shrugs his shoulders, and we continue walking. His desire to be anywhere else was painfully clear.

"Are you unhappy here?" I ask directly.

He looks up at me and shakes his head.

"Why not?"

Liam presses his lips together tightly and continues walking in silence.

"Are you communicating with someone outside the pack?" I change my tone to one that demands an answer.

"Yes." He squeaks out, looking confused about his own compliance.

"Who?"

"Levi." His voice pitches higher with anxiety.

"What does he tell you?"

"He wants to punish everyone." His tears begin falling faster. I hated making a child cry, but confirming Levi's involvement was crucial.

"Liam. He's a liar. Whatever he's telling you isn't true."

He shakes his head vehemently. "You're wrong. He said we could be free. He said I could help him because I'm a strong Lycan. He said you would ruin us. He said he would help me. I'm not scared. He chose me. Not stupid Charlotte or my brother or anyone else at school. He chose me. I just have to..."

"Have to what?" I press urgently.

His brown eyes lock with mine. He genuinely didn't want to reveal this. "I have to..." He lifts his wrist and points to what appears to be a watch, but instead of a clock face, it features a small button.

"Press this."

"What does it do?"

"I don't know."

"He told you to press it but you don't know its function?" I grab his wrist firmly. He tries to pull away while simultaneously pressing the button, sending panic through me. I had no idea what it would trigger.

"Let me go!" He bites my hand and slams his finger onto the button.

An explosion throws me off my feet. Liam takes off running as I look toward the pack house. Every window has blown out, half the roof is gone, and the side of the house crumbles inward. Flames engulf the structure, sending thick black smoke billowing into the sky.

Liam had destroyed my home. Liam was a fucking child who had blown up my home.

Screams and shouts echo around me as people scramble. But all I could do was sit and stare in disbelief.

'Fucking little bastard!' Nyx growls furiously.

###Chapter 0457
Alexander

What the hell was that?
Through Ryken's kitchen window, thick black smoke billows into the sky.
I shove past Calihan in my rush to the door.
Ryken catches the boy just as Seraphina appears, demanding to know about the noise.
I don't answer.
I'm already outside, sprinting toward the explosion.

The packhouse is demolished.
Half the structure has collapsed into rubble.
Our pack members scramble desperately to douse the flames.
The remaining roof section sways precariously as more bricks crash down.

Then I spot my mate.
She sits motionless on the grass, staring blankly at the ruins of our home.

She remains silent.

She offers no resistance, seemingly in shock.

Thank the moon the twins were with them and not inside.

How could a child destroy such a large building?

That Levi had promised him something.
