She swings her legs around and sits upright.
The darkness in her eyes recedes, returning to their usual soft blue.

I should have ordered him to stop... I don't even know if anyone was inside... I could have prevented this."

Guilt radiates from her.
Brianna sits beside her, wrapping an arm around Athena's shoulders. "He's just a child. None of us could have predicted this."

"At least you and the boys weren't inside." Brianna sighs.

"And no one else was in the house either." I assure Athena. "They were all elsewhere. Everything lost can be replaced and rebuilt. No one was harmed."

"The boys," Athena whispers, looking at Brianna. "Are they safe?"

"Asleep. They slept through the explosion." Sebastian offers a reassuring smile.

Athena nods. "Ryken keeps linking me, demanding where his son is. How do I tell him that Levi corrupted Liam? That Liam destroyed the packhouse?"

"I'll handle it. Tell him I'm returning." I press my lips to hers and wipe the tear from her cheek.

Passing the packhouse, I see the flames are nearly extinguished.
Nothing remains salvageable.
The entire structure will require demolition and reconstruction.
###Chapter 0458

Zachary stepped outside, a scarf masking the lower half of his face.
Soot and ash smudged his skin.
“I assumed you’d be with Charlotte.”
He tugged the scarf down, revealing a grim expression.
“Athena collected her. Her biological father walked away.”

Caleb sank onto a wooden chair at the table. His hands clenched into fists. One fist slammed down on the table, making Seraphina jump.

“You think Levi was waiting for him?”
Seraphina nodded. “Liam did Levi’s dirty work. Levi will reward him. A prize, something Liam wants. It’ll make Liam feel justified, even though he knew it was wrong.”
Her eyes lifted to meet mine. “Think about it. Contracts provide satisfaction, Alexander. You offer something in return. Protection. Alliance. Whatever suits your needs. It’s probably the same for Liam. A sort of contract, but it doesn’t truly benefit my brother. It benefits Levi.”
###Chapter 0459

Luc

"You have to remove it." I pass Hannah the surgical blade, but her trembling fingers can't hold it steady. I wrap my hand firmly around hers. "It's draining my strength. I don't know how much longer I can last. It needs to come out now."

"You must do this, Hannah. I can't reach it properly myself. Not without making a mess." I gently lift her chin until her frightened chestnut eyes meet mine. "The scanner shows the exact location. It will be quick. Clean."

"I can't... We should return. Let Theodore handle it." She begs, her voice shaking.

"There's no time for that. I need it gone before it takes everything from me. I have you to protect. My little girl is back in Obsidian Howl, probably asking where I've disappeared to again."

I watch her shut her eyes tightly. She takes several deep, steadying breaths. Her hand finally stops trembling. She gives a slow nod. "Alright."

I lie face down on the cold table. I feel the chill of the metal scalpel as she positions it between my shoulder blades.

She presses down. Warm blood instantly trickles down my spine. The cutting pain is minimal, but she keeps whispering apologies over and over.

Hannah uses another tool to probe deeper into the wound. She freezes when I grunt in discomfort. Finally, she extracts a tiny sphere from my flesh. It clinks metallically against the bowl she drops it into, though it looks nothing like metal. I'll bring it back to Obsidian Howl. Perhaps Theodore can identify it.

"Got it." She murmurs, searching for something to clean the blood from her hands.

Immediate relief washes over me. I look at Hannah and smile, realizing I can see her entire soul clearly again. How could something so small cause such immense problems?

"Now your turn." I state quietly.

"Me?"

"I need to check first. In the scanner."

"He stripped my abilities."

"You mentioned an injection. If it's the same substance that was in me, I can remove it. You could get your Lycan abilities back."

I scan her repeatedly. Nothing appears. Not a single anomaly. Why was something different used on me?

For a fleeting moment, Hannah looks frustrated we found nothing. It gives me a sliver of hope that deep down, she truly wants her powers back.

"I despise him." She mutters under her breath while gently cleaning the blood from my back.

"Understandable."

She moves around the table to face me, standing between my parted legs. "How can someone be so cruel? Why would he feel the need to do this to people he doesn't even know?"

"He believes he's a God."

"Pfft. It makes no sense."

"Often, it doesn't." I wipe a tiny drop of blood from her cheek. "Everyone has darkness within them. For some, it never surfaces. For others, it consumes them completely."

"You're referring to Rogues?"

"Exactly. The problem is, we're dealing with a man who is half Witch. If that part dominates, he can channel the darkness that would have otherwise turned him Rogue."

She lowers her head, frowning. A crease forms between her brows. "So how do we defeat him?"

"Athena and Theodore."

"Just Athena and Theodore?"

"I believe so. I told you Theodore is a Witch Hunter."

"Athena can't link him, can she?"

"She can when he's vulnerable. That will be the key."

"You have a plan, don't you?"

"I'm working on it. I'll speak with Athena tomorrow. Tonight, we stay here. We get a proper night's sleep." "Do you think he'll return?"

"If he does, it will only be a projection. He won't actually be here."

Hannah sleeps curled tightly against me. All evening, her eyes kept darting around the house, searching for him. She even slept in one of my t-shirts because she didn't want him seeing her naked.

Any time I hinted at pleasuring her, she refused. The idea of Levi projecting himself here made her feel nervous and exposed.

I don't sleep. Not even a wink. I know there are more Rogues out there than just the two that tried to kill me. I can smell them near my house. But is it worth leaving my already terrified mate alone?

I lie awake, listening to their movements. There are at least eight. Eight of them prowling beneath my bedroom window. Yet not a single one attempts to enter the house. They can smell we're inside. I expect one to try a door handle. Or climb the building and attempt a window. But they don't.
###Chapter 0460

They circled the house, taking turns.
I couldn't take it anymore.
Slipping from bed, I quietly grabbed the rifle stored in my wardrobe.
I crept toward the window.
I aimed at one but didn't fire right away.
They spoke to each other in low, rough voices.
They used some kind of code.
Then they just left.
They disappeared behind the empty house across from mine.
Strange behavior for Rogues.
They usually didn't care about locked doors or windows.
I watched until sunrise.
They never returned.

"What are you doing?" Athena asked with a yawn.
"Rogues were here last night." I wouldn't lie to her.
"You didn't wake me?"
"They didn't do anything. It seemed like they were searching for someone."
"That's not normal, is it?"
"No."
"Were they looking for you?" she asked.
"I'm not sure."

Her eyes scanned the room.
It was like she expected to see Levi here.
She shivered and quickly dressed. "Can we go back to Obsidian Howl now?"
"Sure."

Athena stayed quiet in the car.
Bringing her had been a mistake.
But without her, I never would have gotten that poison out of my back.
"I will keep you safe," I muttered, placing my hand on her thigh.
She pulled away.
"You can't promise that."
"I know I want to protect you. I know I can, now that I'm at full strength again."
"He tricked me into injecting you. How can you keep me safe from that? How do I know this isn't another one of Levi's illusions?"

I pulled the gun from my hip and handed it to her.
"If you think this is a dream, point it at me and pull the trigger."
She took it and slowly raised the gun.
I didn't slow the car. I didn't stop.
If she truly believed this was a dream, I was about to die.
I glanced away from the road to look at her.
She could barely hold the gun steady.
Tears filled her chestnut eyes. "I don't know what to do."
"Yes, you do."

Her breathing grew heavy as she kept the gun aimed at me.
A small gasp escaped her parted lips.
"He wouldn't know, would he? He wouldn't expect you to let me shoot you?"
I winked at her.
She dropped the gun into her lap.
"Besides, you'd have to take the safety off first." My fingers tapped the steering wheel. "He really got inside your head, didn't he?"

Out of the corner of my eye, I saw her nod.
"It's like nothing belongs to me anymore. He took my abilities. He manipulated me into hurting you. What else did he make me do? Did he force me to harm others? Did he touch me when I was with him? How long has he been watching us?"
I had no answers for her.
But I understood why she hesitated to go beyond kissing.
He had shattered pieces of her soul.
I wouldn't let any more cracks appear.

"He wouldn't have touched you. He prefers men, not women."
I watched her relax slightly.
Then she leaned forward. "Is that Seraphina's brother?" Athena asked.
I slowed the car.
A boy with blonde curls was running in our direction.
His feet pounded the pavement.
Sweat dripped from him as he frantically looked around.
He ignored the passing cars.

"Why would he be out here alone?" Athena asked.
I pulled the car over.
The moment I stepped out, he tried to speed up and run away.
It took me two seconds to grab him.
"Where do you think you're going?"
The little brat tried to kick me in the balls.
"Not happening. Get in the damn car."
"You can't tell me what to do. I hate you."
I glared at him, and he fell silent.
This kid definitely had a dark aura.
"Get in the car."
We were only a couple of miles from the pack.
He had made it pretty far.
But who was he running from?
###Chapter 0461

"You'll find a way." Brianna gives me a reassuring smile. "You've always managed to handle impossible situations." She gently rocks Luca in her arms as he makes soft cooing sounds. Motherhood had become her natural state, as if she was born for it. Still, I felt anxious about sharing my pregnancy news with her. How do you tell a woman who can never experience carrying her own child that you're pregnant again?

Staying here had given me time to calm my nerves and think clearly. I felt incredibly foolish now. For a moment, I understood why Liam had called everyone stupid.

"Nobody's perfect." Brianna murmurs softly. "Stop punishing yourself over this. If Alexander had any suspicions, he never would have let you leave with Liam. No one could have predicted a child would do something like that. You reacted like any rational person would. Even if you had demanded the watch immediately, he still could have activated it."

"It shouldn't have happened regardless."

"Sebastian said the house would have been targeted regardless."

I nod, watching my boys playing in the corner. Part of me wonders how they'll react to another sibling. Another part worries this pregnancy might make me overlook important details again. Last time, carrying twins had exhausted me so much I missed crucial signs.

"I'm certain they'll find evidence." She offers me an encouraging smile.

"Even if they do, what difference does it make? The house is gone. The only place I've ever truly considered home is destroyed." "Alexander will rebuild it."

I nod. Knowing Alexander, he's already planning the reconstruction.

"What will you do with Liam?" Brianna asks curiously, settling beside me.

"Honestly, I want to end him. But I know that's not right. Ultimately, he's just a manipulated child. Killing him for that would be unjust." I shake my head. "But he still deserves appropriate punishment for his actions."

"Levi manipulated him the same way Victoria manipulated me." She whispers.

I nod in agreement. "I know they'll find him. There are only so many places he can run, even with Levi's help."

"And Levi? That bastard seems prepared for everything."

I run my thumb over my fingertips, feeling my claws resting just beneath the surface. "If he wants to play games, then we'll play his game."

She raises an eyebrow at me.

"I need to work out the details before sharing." I kneel beside my boys, kissing their heads. "Could you watch them a bit longer? There's something I need to do."

"Of course. I'll prepare the spare room for you and Alexander."

Leaving their house, I hurry toward the dungeons, avoiding looking at the ruins of my home. The guard nods respectfully and mentions that Evelyn seems more agitated than usual.

"Agitated?"

"She's been pacing constantly. Muttering to herself." He shrugs and rolls his eyes. "Lycans."

'She's communicating with her Lycan.' Nyx comments.

'Perhaps, but he doesn't know that.'

The guard opens the door for me. Immediately, I hear Evelyn arguing with empty air. She stops when she sees me. "What was that noise?"

"The packhouse."

"Levi?" She asks quietly.

"It appears he was involved, yes."

A frown forms on her face, then slowly softens. "I'm sorry."

"Sorry for what?"

"Dakota wants me to tell you this is all my fault. That if I hadn't been foolish, we could have handled this differently."

Her words surprise me. "Why would she want me to know that?"

"She says we're supposed to be your Beta."

"What?" I scoff, trying to suppress the laughter threatening to escape. "You think you, of all people, are supposed to be my Beta?"

"Dakota believes so." she mutters, lowering her gaze. "I've been telling her she's wrong. But she's completely certain and won't change her mind. I told her you'd probably kill us."

Nyx snorts. 'I've never heard such nonsense.'

Evelyn runs her hands through her hair and collapses onto the floor. "I don't expect you to believe her or anything I say."
###Chapter 0462

I stood frozen, staring at her in disbelief. "We're cousins."

"Cousins?"

"That's our relation. Your mother was my mother's sister. That's why you carry Alpha genetics."

She crept closer, fingers wrapping around the bars as she studied me. "Did you know her?"

"No."

"Oh."

"She wasn't discussed much. My parents died when I was young, so perhaps I just don't remember. Her name was Amelia."

"Thank you... wait, you keep saying 'was'. She was your mother's sister. Her name was Amelia."

"She's dead."

Her hands dropped from the bars. "That figures. Do you know how?"

"No. The records only showed her birth and death dates."

A slight frown appeared. Her tongue glided along her bottom lip. "There's a reason you're telling me this, isn't there?"

"I want your help to kill your brother."

"What?" she squeaked.

"Should I repeat myself?" I muttered.

"No... I just don't understand. Why would you need my help? You're the Alpha."

"So he won't see it coming."

'Are you seriously trusting this bitch?' Nyx asked.

'No, but I want to see where her loyalties lie.'

Evelyn turned away, facing the back wall of her cell. She was likely speaking with Dakota. Her hands rose to her temples, rubbing them slowly. She turned back to me. "If I do this..."

"I might consider letting you live."

She mulled over my words. "Levi is clever. He's always been prepared. Or perhaps he manipulates everything to work in his favor. I don't know anymore. It seems I was blind to it all."

"You say he's prepared, but will he expect his own sister to betray him?"

Her grey eyes locked onto mine. "I don't know. He's always been in control. But that was before. Now I can't hear him."

"How long?"

"Since Dakota emerged." She paused. "She says she's blocking him."

"Good."

'At least she has some sense,' Nyx muttered.

"Can I ask you something?" Evelyn whispered. "Do you ever get used to the voice in your head? The random sarcastic remarks? Or their annoyed huffs when they dislike something?"

"Never. Wait until Dakota starts humming. It's enough to drive anyone insane. I'll return later."

"Everything alright?" the guard asked, slamming the door shut behind me.

"It will be."

"Such a shame about the packhouse," he muttered as I walked away.

"At least no one was hurt." I smiled at him, but he just stared. Grant usually guarded the gates, not the dungeons. "It's unusual to see you working here."

"I guess they thought I needed a change." He shrugged, but I caught flickers of annoyance. "I don't mind keeping an eye on the bitch down there." He tapped the dungeon door.

'He gives me a bad feeling,' Nyx muttered.

'This is the one who has issues with Lycans,' I replied.

"Do you ever go down there?" I asked Grant.

"Why would I?"

I shrugged. "Curiosity?"

"I'm not curious about those assholes." His eyes widened as he realized what he'd said. "I didn't mean you... just, they... she's wasting space and resources."

'Digging his own grave, isn't he?' Nyx smirked as he stumbled over his words.

"Are we?" I asked. "Are we occupying your home? Are we starving you? Are we killing you off?"

"That's not what I meant," he protested.

"Then what is your problem?" I demanded, stepping closer. "This isn't the first time you've expressed hatred for my kind."

His hand moved toward the blade at his belt, but I was faster. My claws pierced his chest as a loud bang nearly deafened me. A small hole appeared beside Grant's forehead, followed by a trickle of blood. As he stumbled back, my claws retracted, and he collapsed to the ground.

I turned to see Theodore, his hand firmly gripping Liam's wrist. "Can't let the prick kill a pregnant woman, can I?"
###Chapter 0463

Her blue eyes shifted between me and Alexander before settling back on me.

I nodded. "I can see your soul clearly again." Alexander attempted to kick me. He had developed that nasty habit, so I lifted him off his feet. He dangled in the air, body swaying as he struggled. "That's why I left. I needed to figure out what was happening to me. Now the problem is solved."

She turned back to the dead Wolf. "I could have killed him."

*You could have. But that blade came too close to your stomach for my comfort."

I dropped the brat into a chair. His gaze lowered immediately, eyes hardening as he asked for his mother.

"She isn't here right now. But she wants you to know she's disgusted by your behavior." Ryken told him, avoiding direct eye contact. "You blew up the packhouse. You destroyed the home of the pack that welcomed us. What were you thinking?"

"He wasn't." Athena muttered. I glanced over and saw her rubbing dried blood from her fingers.

"I'm sorry." Alexander whispered. He wasn't sorry at all. Not even a little bit.

"Are you, Alexander?" Caleb asked.

"Yes," Alexander whimpered.

"You can't stop lying, can you?" I sat on the kitchen counter. "When I look at you, I see no truth. Just a tangled web of lies. Where does it end? Where does it begin? It's impossible to tell."

Anger flashed in his brown eyes. His head was lowered, but I still saw it. "I suggest you start telling the truth."

"Asshole." he muttered under his breath. His arrogance for his age was astounding.

"ALEXANDER!" Ryken shouted.

Alexander crossed his arms and huffed, slumping in the chair.

"What did Levi want you to do?" I asked curiously.

He stared at me.

"Were you supposed to blow up the empty house? Or was that a mistake?"

He scrunched his face, still refusing to look at me.

"Answer the question." Athena snapped. She was ordering him to speak.

"He just said I'd know when the time was right."

"Was it the right time? Or did you panic because you got caught?" I pressed. My guess was panic. What was the point of setting off a bomb in an empty building?

"I..." His eyes moved to Athena. "I'm not supposed to say."

"Look around, you little shit." I snarled. "Do you think you're leaving here without talking?"

"To teach you a lesson." he blurted out. He shook his head, blonde ringlets bouncing. "He said to teach you a lesson. To show you that you don't have all the power." He started crying. Finally, fear set in. All it took was a small threat. I should have done this when he first upset my baby girl.

"Where were you going?" Athena asked him.

"He said he would wait for me." Alexander muttered between sniffles. "He wasn't there."
###Chapter 0464

"You were planning to run from your family?" Caleb demands, his voice tight. "Did you consider us at all? Did you care what your mother and I would feel?"

Liam shakes his head defiantly. Alexander moves toward a pale Athena. She looks ill, but I stay silent.

"Alexander, Athena," Caleb mutters, running a hand through his hair. "How do you want my son punished?"

"He came to my room." Liam whispers.

"He was inside my house?!" Caleb's voice rises sharply.

"Likely a projection." Alexander replies calmly. "Not physically present."

"Only there?" Athena asks. Liam nods.

"None." Liam pipes up. "He told me the others weren't good enough."

"Liam, that's what monsters like him say." Caleb tells his son.

"People like him make empty promises." Alexander states firmly. "He only wants you to do his dirty work. He doesn't care if you get punished."

"No. He said I was strong. That I was good. That I could do this. He said I'm his favorite."

"A few nights in the dungeon might give him perspective."

"She is an adult. He is not."

"Let me guess, your solution is to bind him. A punishment that won't truly impact him until he's older and gains his Lycan abilities? So we should punish him later for something he does now?"

Caleb stares at me, his brows furrowing in anger. "You can't put him in the dungeon. He's eight."

"Luc is right." Athena tells Caleb. "I know what binding feels like. Honestly, I would have preferred death. He'll spend a few days in the dungeon, and then we reassess." She meets Caleb's gaze. "No visitors."

He looks at his son, truly seeing him for the first time since we entered.

Alexander pulls a protesting Liam to his feet. With a hand on his shoulder, he guides him toward the door. Caleb says nothing more. He simply walks out as Liam calls for him.

I follow Alexander and Athena to the dungeons. The moment Evelyn sees me, she steps back until she hits the rear wall. Her eyes lock on me. Not with fear, but with anger. "Who is that?" She asks quietly.

"Levi got to him." Athena explains as Alexander locks Liam in a cell.

"He's a child." Evelyn mutters in disgust.

"Not his usual style?" I ask.

She steps forward, her fingers curling around the bars. She frowns and shakes her head. "He dislikes children."

Her blunt honesty surprises me, but I sense she's telling the truth.

"Is this what he does now? Ruins children?" She asks.

"He did it to you." Athena stops beside me, looking in at Evelyn. "And just like him, you couldn't see his actions were wrong."

"A part of me knew. And I... I let it happen. Maybe," she drops her voice to a whisper. "I can help. I can talk to him. Am I allowed to tell him who I am?"

She glances toward where Alexander is speaking with Liam.

"Within reason." Athena mutters.

"I understand."

I didn't. There was clearly a secret I wasn't privy to. I follow Athena up the steps. "Are you going to explain that? She's his sister, so what isn't she allowed to tell him?"

Athena turns and stares back at me. "What is it that you're not telling me?"
###Chapter 0465
Athena

"You vanished with Hannah, leaving only a note behind." My gaze remains fixed on him. "You return claiming to have solved your issues, yet you withhold the specifics. Are you truly healed, Luc? Or will you continue denying the truth like always?"

"Alright, I understand your anger!"

'Biggest understatement ever.' Nyx scoffs internally.

"I returned home. That's all. I went back hoping to find answers, but her brother," He gestures toward the dungeon door, "Materialized inside my house and pressed a fucking kitchen blade against Hannah's throat. He manipulated her into injecting something into me."

"Hannah injected you?"

"At some point, yes. She doesn't recall when. She doesn't even remember doing it." He retrieves a small black sphere from his pocket, holding it up to the light. "Like I said, it's been handled."

"What is that?"

"Something I haven't deciphered yet. It appears inert while I hold it. Yet when it struck the tray, it resonated like metal. Inside me, it was draining my energy. Making me progressively weaker."

"Has she been coerced into doing this to others? What about her? Is that why she lost her powers?"

He shakes his head. “I scanned her thoroughly, found nothing. Levi is meticulous.”

'There must be a flaw somewhere.' Nyx murmurs. 'Nobody's perfect. Everyone makes mistakes eventually.'

"Are you certain Hannah is clean?" I press.

He nods. "He terrifies her. Makes her anxious, nervous. She couldn't hold a conversation without constantly scanning the room. His effortless manipulation has deeply unsettled her."

His eyes sweep over me. "Now, are you going to reveal your plan?"

"I haven't fully figured it out yet."

"Right." Skepticism drips from his tone. "But it involves Evelyn, doesn't it?"

I remain silent.

"I'll take that as a clear refusal to elaborate further." I watch him stride away just as Alexander materializes beside me.

He doesn't speak, but his hand finds mine, pulling me gently toward the forest.

"What happened with Grant?" He asks once we're deep enough among the trees for privacy. "I know you had valid reasons. Where's the body?"

"Zachary handled it. I noticed blood on your fingers and asked him to identify the individual and clean up before anyone noticed."

"Grant made it abundantly clear he didn't want me here. Or any of the Lycans."

I glance down at my top. "His blade. Luc shot him."

"Okay." He settles on a fallen log, reaching for my hand. A slight frown creases his brow.

"Why bring me out here?"

"You needed a moment. A moment you wouldn't get surrounded by others."

"I'm fine...."

"I didn't say you weren't. Sometimes peace and quiet are necessary for clarity."

I sit beside him on the log, feeling tension leave my body. The past few days have been a relentless barrage of news. Before processing one event, another erupted. I haven't had time to process the new pregnancy either.

"I need him dead." The words escape quietly. "I can't continue living like this."

"We'll find a way." Alexander assures. "There's always a method to defeat someone."

"I want to attempt something." He waits for me to continue. "He's lost Evelyn. I see it when I look at her. She was slow to realize, but now she knows. She was disgusted Levi targeted Liam."

"You truly believe her?"

"Frustratingly, yes." I sigh, uncertain how he'll react. "I want Theodore to take Evelyn to him. I believe both hold the key to helping me kill him."
###Chapter 0466

He watches me closely. "What's your plan?"

"Tear him apart." I show him my claws.

'Levi Bennett won't survive the week.' Nyx whispers. 'Alexander didn't object to our plan.'

*****noveldrama

The twins slept between us in Brianna and Sebastian's guest room. Both were in human form, breathing softly. My brief absence had made my heart ache with longing. Just watching them filled me with overwhelming emotion.

"Once the house is rebuilt, we'll need a larger bed. Especially when we have more pups."

"Excuse me!" I whisper, careful not to disturb the boys. "One pup, not multiple!"

He smiles warmly. "One, two, even three. I don't care, as long as you and they are healthy." He leans over our sons to kiss my cheek. Why does he keep saying 'they'? I silently ask Nyx if she's hiding something.

'Too soon to tell.' she murmurs. 'Focus on the immediate threat.'

I woke multiple times to a small foot in my face or tiny fingers poking my nose. For such little boys, they moved constantly in their sleep.

Eventually I rose and settled into the rocking chair Brianna had provided. The twins wiggled onto Alexander's chest. While I adored watching them, my thoughts drifted to Levi Bennett's impending death. I refused to let him destroy more lives. I would never let him near my children.

Quietly I changed into jeans and a hoodie. Pulling on my boots, I slipped outside and headed to Theodore's place. Lights still glowed inside. Through the window I saw him at the table where he'd taught me to read for countless hours.

I tapped on the glass. His deep green eyes lifted to meet mine. "Athena?" He checked his watch. "Is something wrong?"

"Levi Bennett needs to die."

"If this is about the Witch Hunter theory again, I think Luc might have been onto something." He gestures me inside, closing the door quietly.

"We've all been doubtful about Luc lately, right?" He continues.

I nod. "But apparently it's resolved. It's complicated-"

"He told me everything."

"He told you?" I whisper in surprise. I'd had to pressure him for information.

"Yes. He showed me that little sphere. Told me about Hannah."

"Do you know what it was?"

"No. But even without Luc's explanation, I recognized the owner's scent. I don't know how, but when Luc handed it to me, I could smell him."

"Like a mate's scent?"

"Not exactly."

"I don't understand." I frown.

"Neither do I." He gestures to the open books surrounding him. "That's why I'm researching. Trying to find answers about what I truly am. Much of it makes sense even without reading."

"Like Luc, I'm different. I don't crave belonging. I'm not a true pack wolf, though I love this pack. I'll fulfill my duties, but now I understand why I never fit in, even before being accepted here. I was never meant to be a pack member. This might surprise you, but once Levi is dead, I'll be leaving to find my own path."
###Chapter 0467
Theodore

"Are you leaving?" Athena's voice was barely a whisper.

I gave a slow nod. "I have to discover the truth about myself. You, more than anyone, would understand that need."

"Does anyone else know?"

"I only made the decision recently."

Her gaze drifted past me to the stacks of books. "Where will you head?"

"Wherever the path leads." I offered her a reassuring smile. "This isn't goodbye, not yet. And when it is, it won't be permanent. Since my past came to light, I can't stop questioning everything. I've researched you, other Lycans, even Alexander, but never myself. Never felt the necessity."

"Until now?"

"Until now," I confirmed. "All I know comes from my original pack, and that information was scarce." I motioned toward a chair. "Please, sit."

"It won't be the same without you here. Who will serve as pack physician?"

"The nurses who've assisted me are fully qualified. They'll be here to help with the birth, whether it's one pup or more."

"You knew?"

"Didn't require genius deduction. You've been touching your stomach since you arrived. How far along are you?"

"It's still early," she murmured. "Why does everyone assume multiples?"

"Twins are common in the Black family lineage."

"Alexander isn't a twin," she countered.

I pressed my lips together. He hadn't told her. "Theodore?"

"Alexander was a twin during gestation."

"What?"

"My apologies, I truly believed you knew." I mentally chastised myself for the slip. "His twin was stillborn."

She stared at me, completely stunned.

"It's not something he discusses." I attempted damage control. Alexander might actually kill me for this. "I genuinely thought you were aware, Athena."

"No... no, I wasn't." Her gaze dropped to her abdomen. "I only came to ask for your help setting up Levi. Now I understand why Alexander keeps saying there's more than one."

I remained silent, deciding it was the safest response.

"Could I have some water?" she asked softly.

"Of course." I moved to the kitchen and returned to find Athena flipping through my current reading material.

"Athena. I'm certain he has reasons for not..."

"Will you help me with Levi?" She cut me off.

"You know I will, but I'm unsure how I can assist."

"I need you to take Evelyn to him."

"You want her released from the dungeons?"

"She has her Lycan now. Dakota won't allow betrayal. Her Lycan believes she's destined to be my Beta."

"Your Beta?" That was unusual. Betas were chosen, not inherited. Usually.

She nodded confirmation.

"So I take her to him, then what?"

"Make him vulnerable. Make him think all his dreams are coming true so I can infiltrate his mind."

"When?"

"No time like the present."

"It's the middle of the night."

"Exactly. I can't wait any longer."

We moved swiftly across the grounds, stopping at the dungeon entrance where Zachary waited.

"What are you doing here?" Athena whispered.

"Saw you heading toward Theodore's place. Figured you might need assistance, and this would be your destination." He offered a reassuring smile that said he was fully committed.

"Theodore is taking Evelyn to Levi," Athena informed him. "I need to be distant enough that he can't catch my scent, but ready for when his guard drops."

"No offense intended, but why would Theodore be the solution? After what happened when Levi projected here, he'll be expecting something."

"Yes, he will," I confirmed. "My time with him was brief but educational. He learns from his mistakes quickly. He won't fall for the same trick twice, but if Evelyn is with me, he might believe I've switched allegiances."

"And he still believes Theodore is his mate," Athena added. "He won't give up on him easily."

Zachary paused briefly before nodding. "Alright. Someone needs to ensure your safety." His dark eyes shifted to me. "Though I have a suggestion."

"What's that?"

"If he believes you're mated to him, lead him down that path but maintain distance. It will drive him insane."

Both Caleb and Evelyn were asleep in their cells. I felt sympathy for the boy but understood Alexander and Athena's reasoning. Had he been an adult, his actions would have earned him execution by fire or tearing.

Zachary quietly opened Evelyn's cell. He moved silently inside as she began stirring, quickly covering her mouth to prevent screams that would wake Caleb.
###Chapter 0468

Her grey eyes widened as he pulled her upright, releasing his grip. "Now?" she whispered breathlessly.

"Yes." Athena confirmed.

We kept Evelyn wedged securely between Zachary and myself as we ascended the steps into the night air. She offered no resistance, no challenge. But the moment her feet touched the grass, she inhaled deeply as if tasting freedom for the first time.

Zachary observed Evelyn intently while Athena explained what would happen next.

"What should I tell him?" Evelyn asked nervously.

"That's your decision." Athena replied.

"I don't understand."

"You sought help, even through misguided methods. Now prove your worth."

"You want me to kill him?"

"No." Zachary stated firmly. "Just make him believe we're unaware of your presence. That Theodore freed you."

"He always knows when I'm lying."

"Then find a way to conceal the truth." Athena instructed.

"Okay...okay. I can do this." Evelyn muttered to herself. Her grey eyes locked with mine. "You're the one he thinks is his mate."

"Yes."

"One more thing." Athena added. "Don't mention Liam."

"We'll accompany you to the gate." Zachary told me. "But you must proceed alone. If anything changes, link me immediately."

"You can mind-link with Wolves?" Evelyn whispered in astonishment.

"I can."

She tilted her head thoughtfully but remained silent.

Sebastian stood guard at the gate. He asked no questions, likely already informed through Zachary's link since gate duty wasn't his usual assignment.

Evelyn emitted a small gasp as we passed through the gates. After her prolonged confinement in our dungeons, she probably never expected to experience any form of freedom—though her current situation hardly qualified as free.

"How far?" she whispered once we separated from Athena and Zachary.

"He's hiding at Seraphina's house."

"Still there?"

"I suppose we'll find out."

She asked no further questions, which surprised me. Thrown into a plan with minimal details, she adapted remarkably well.

The house eventually came into view. "I ruined things with Seraphina, didn't I?" she whispered regretfully. "She was a good friend, but I couldn't reveal everything."

"It happens sometimes." I murmured, watching the house. A single light glowed as usual. After nightfall, we always remained in the main room—firstly so he could block the entrance, secondly to keep close surveillance. Was he watching us now?

The front door swung open, revealing a boot before his full form emerged. He moved deliberately slowly. "I know you're there." he called out. "I can smell you."

I stepped from the shadows, keeping Evelyn's hands secured behind her back. Zachary's suggested approach felt impossible when anger still burned through me. This bastard had stabbed me.

He took another step toward us, sniffing the air. Athena had been right—he wanted to confirm we were alone.

"I didn't think you'd return to me."

"They had me in—" Evelyn began.

"I wasn't speaking to you, Evelyn. We'll discuss your situation shortly." I felt her tense. He'd made promises he never intended to keep.

"I brought your sister." I stated flatly.

"Then bring her inside." He grinned at me.

I pushed Evelyn forward. She released a growl that I hoped was meant solely for him. "Is it really you or are you projecting?"

"It's me."

I forced a smile.

"I thought I'd upset you. But now I realize you were probably confused and disoriented. I shouldn't have drugged you, and I've been looking for ways to make amends." He told me.

"What about me?" Evelyn asked.

His tone shifted instantly, eyes narrowing. "I said I'd get to you."

"No Levi! You promised me! You said you'd come for me! I've been rotting in that disgusting dungeon and you never even tried to help me!"

I felt almost impressed, considering she'd told Athena she couldn't lie.

"Evelyn. You were never in danger."

"Threat of execution isn't danger?" She snapped back.

Levi slapped her hard across the face, knocking her to the ground. "I said we'll discuss it later."

Her grey eyes burned with fury as his handprint bloomed on her cheek, but she remained on the ground, possibly struggling to control her Lycan. I remembered how difficult those early days had been for Athena.

"You don't need to hit her." I said calmly. "She's been imprisoned. Given limited food. Had her head shaved."

He looked at me dismissively. "She was supposed to be strong, bloodthirsty. Now look at her—she's become completely useless."
###Chapter 0469

Hello, lovely readers.

I'm sending this quick note to let you know I've caught that nasty bug that's been going around.

There won't be an update today, the 11th.

My head is too foggy to focus on editing properly.

I want to avoid any mistakes.

Thank you, as always, for continuing to read.

Your gems, reviews, and comments mean the world to me.

For those asking about the book's ending, there is still so much story left.

Poor Zachary has yet to meet his second-chance mate and find his happy ending.

I'm hoping to feel much better tomorrow.

Please stay safe.
###Chapter 0470
Theodore

"Pathetic!" Evelyn scoffs from the floor. "I am not pathetic!"

"I believed this was your desire." I keep my voice steady. "I thought you wished for her return."

"I desired you more." Levi turns away and enters the cabin. I help Evelyn stand and we follow him inside.

"You had no intention of intervening, did you?" Evelyn demands. "You were content to abandon me there like some rabid animal!"

"You fulfilled your purpose. I'm pursuing superior options now." He settles on the sofa, completely unfazed by our presence.

"Explain yourself." I speak before Evelyn can unleash another tirade.

"All will be revealed in time."

"For once in your miserable existence, speak plainly!" I snap. "You know I detest your riddles and evasive language."

He glares at his sister. "She has become useless to me. So I replaced her with someone actually willing to do what's necessary."

"Who?"

He smiles at me, his sage green eyes gleaming with amusement.

"If you're implying it's me, you're mistaken. I won't tear apart a pack for you." I tell him firmly. "I refuse to destroy the greatest thing I've ever known."

"Relax, Theodore. You would never commit such an act. That's precisely why it isn't you."

"Then who?"

"He's already destroyed the packhouse." He speaks with a sinister smile. "Tell me, who was injured? Your precious Alpha? His sons? The female Alpha? I've been anticipating news ever since I saw the smoke."

"You were nearby when it happened?" I ask.

"One of many locations I've visited recently." He runs a hand through his blonde hair, brushing it back from his face.

If he had been nearby, even just projecting himself, why hadn't he met Alexander as promised?

"Why are you doing this?" Evelyn asks.

"Because dear sister, there are far too many people who believe they know better."

I snort derisively. It was the same manipulative rhetoric he had tried to force on me. The man was completely delusional.

"So who was killed or injured? Do tell." He waits with eager anticipation.

"No one."

"What do you mean?"

"The house was empty, Levi. Not a single soul was inside. All you accomplished was strengthening their unity as the pack rallied to extinguish the fire."

"He told me..."

"You mean a child deceived you?" I knew Athena preferred we didn't discuss Alexander, but Levi had already brought it up. "Damn little brat. Just when I thought I could reach another child."

"Another child?"

"Me." Evelyn whispers. "He's referring to me. After our brother died, I was the first." Her head snaps toward him, pure rage burning in her eyes. "You weakened me. You fed me lies that made me believe you were righteous."

"And you were foolish enough to believe every word!" He tells her coldly.

"What you've done is monstrous! None of us deserved this. None of us. Do you even comprehend that? You made me believe the Moon Goddess sent you for a purpose. You claimed all those people were being punished by her. That you were merely her messenger. Is that what you told the boy?"

He opens his mouth to retaliate. But Evelyn continues her furious rant.

"You're worse than evil. You deserve to lose everything. You stole people's abilities. You took mine, promising it was for my protection." She shakes her head in disgust. "You made me believe I was doing right. You shielded me from my true self. I lost my friend because of you. I lost everything because of you."

She lunges forward and grabs him, yanking him from the sofa. His eyes widen in shock at her sudden aggression. He wrestles against her, fighting for dominance as she pins him to the floor. Locking her hands on his jacket shoulders, she repeatedly smashes his head against the carpet while screaming accusations.

I notice how completely black her eyes have become. They resemble Athena's when her Lycan forces its way forward. But I don't intervene. I stand motionless and let it happen. Because Evelyn is right—this is the least he deserves.

"Get off me, you insane bitch!" Levi swings an arm wildly, hitting nothing but air.

A ferocious growl erupts from Evelyn as she begins to shift. Her increased weight easily holds him down as her clothing tears away, revealing her massive Lycan form. Still, I do nothing. Her attack intensifies, claws slicing into him. She bites into his flesh as he struggles, but none of the wounds are fatal. As if she's deliberately holding back.
###Chapter 0471

Levi Bennett muttered strange words under his breath in a foreign tongue. Nothing happened. With one final powerful strike, Evelyn Reed knocked him unconscious.

Her Lycan strength remained formidable despite the long imprisonment.

Blood splattered across the carpet around Levi's fallen form. Evelyn rose to her full height, nearly hitting the low ceiling. This wasn't the planned outcome. She wasn't supposed to attack him directly. But we could use this unexpected turn to our advantage. We could bring him back to Athena.

Slowly, Evelyn's eyes shifted back to their normal grey hue. "Seraphina probably left some clothes upstairs," I told her. She nodded quickly and hurried from the room. Her heavy footsteps echoed on the staircase.

I searched for the chains Levi had used to restrain me. Instead, I found a drawer filled with syringes. Each contained a thick yellow liquid. Without hesitation, I took one and injected the unconscious Levi in the neck.

His distinct scent vanished within seconds. My racing heart finally began to calm.

"Theodore?" Evelyn's voice was soft as she peered around the kitchen doorway.

"He's alive. You didn't kill him," I confirmed. "I administered a drug. He won't be able to fight us or Athena now."

She nodded slowly. "There's something else." She glanced behind her and moved forward cautiously. Another woman stood behind her. Long obsidian hair framed her face, falling nearly to her navel.

Her scent was barely detectable, as if struggling to break through. It was so faint it explained why I hadn't sensed her presence in the house. Rope burns marked her wrists and ankles. Her trainers were scuffed and dirty. She needed thorough cleaning.

"She was tied up upstairs," Evelyn explained. "This is the right thing to do, isn't it?"

"Absolutely. What's your name?" I asked gently.

"What's yours?" she countered.

"Theodore."

"Jasmine," she whispered. "Jasmine Reed."

"Interesting name," Evelyn commented with a slight smile.

I nodded, hoping her name didn't reflect her actual personality. It literally meant chaos, new moon. "Are you a Wolf?"

"I was." She kept her voice low, turning her face toward Levi. I still couldn't see her eyes clearly. "He took it from me. Now I don't know what I am."

She reached for a knife. Instinctively, I grabbed her wrist. "We're taking him back to the Alpha. You can come with us too," I offered. I felt certain Alexander would offer her sanctuary if she needed help.

"The Alpha?" she asked from behind her dark hair curtain. "Does he transform to look like her?" She pointed at Evelyn.

"One of them does," I told her. Sometimes I forgot that many people still didn't know about Lycans, even though they probably outnumbered us. They had lived hidden in plain sight for generations.

"I don't want to go."

"We have others like you. People who had their abilities taken. They're Lycans though, like her." I gestured toward Evelyn.

"Lycans." She tested the word on her tongue.

"Yes."

"Did he take their abilities too?" She nodded toward Levi. As she lifted her face, her hair fell aside, revealing startling golden eyes.

"Yes."

"But they haven't regained their abilities?"

"No."

"A faint scent?" She frowned slightly.

"They smell completely Human. Did he drug you?"

"No. He muttered something over me." Her brow creased in a small frown. "What will your Alpha do with him?" Her golden eyes held mine intently.

"Skin him alive," Evelyn blurted out. I glanced at her. Her eyes were wide, her lips curved into a smile. She seemed somehow freer. Perhaps hearing the truth from Levi had cleared her confusion.

"You won't do that. I heard him. He called you his sister," Jasmine murmured.

"I just helped you! Don't be a bitch!" Evelyn snapped back.

"I'm not trying to be." Her golden eyes flashed toward me. "Would I be safe there?"

"Safer than here."

She shook her head. "I think it's better if I stay on my own."

"Where's your pack?"

She grimaced. "I was running from them when he convinced me he was my mate."
###Chapter 0472
Theodore

"Why?" Evelyn asks Jasmine.

"It's a long story. I'd prefer not to discuss it."

Levi groans from the floor, drawing my attention. "There must be a reason. How did he locate you?"

"Can we not." She turns away sharply. "I understand your curiosity. I'd feel the same discovering someone tied up. But I don't need others involved in my problems. Just assure me he'll be handled, and I'll be on my way."

"If you're fleeing someone, they always find you eventually."

Her golden eyes lock onto mine. "Then perhaps I'll simply become a ghost."

I should let her leave. She made her desires clear. Yet she was right—I was curious. Why did Levi have her here?

He groaned again, his eyes fluttering open. The dawning horror on his face made me smile. A taste of his own medicine was merely the beginning.

"What did you do to me?" he demanded, struggling to sit up.

"I thought you'd appreciate the irony of being injected with your own concoction."

Evelyn laughed, and his gaze snapped to her. "You foolish bitch. Just wait. I'll make you pay for this."

Evelyn crouched before him. "I believed you every other time you threatened me. Not this time. This is your end, Levi."

He turned to Jasmine. "Jasmine, release me."

"Why would I do that? You held me here against my will. You made me believe a lie."

"That's his specialty," Evelyn added. She stood and faced Jasmine. "You're not the first to believe you're mated to him. It's how he lures people in. He preys on those he thinks need correcting."

"I gathered that from all the shouting," Jasmine muttered. "I just don't understand why you haven't killed him yet. You look like some kind of powerful mutant. Pretty sure you could destroy anything in your path."

"Theodore told you," Evelyn murmured. "The Alpha wants him."

"Come on, Evelyn. You're not really taking me to them, are you?" Levi shuffled against the wall, leaning back. His eyes darted around the room, searching for an exit, but he designed this place with only one way in or out.

"He never stops, does he?" Jasmine muttered.

"Because he craves control and knows he's lost it."

"Theodore," Levi whispered my name. "You won't do this to me. I mean too much to you."

"What is he talking about?" Jasmine demanded.

"He believes we are mates."

She raised an eyebrow at me. "Are you?"

"Not long ago, he held me prisoner here. He drugged me, attempted to mark me, yet kept me in chains."

She turned back to Levi. "A bit kinky? All I got were thick ropes."

Evelyn looked away, stifling a laugh.

"You don't seem bothered about being tied up," I frowned.

"I should be, shouldn't I? But he fed me, and I had a decent bed. The lack of scent meant my pack couldn't find me. Silver lining." She shrugged. "But it doesn't mean I'm okay with what he did to me. Or from the sounds of it, what he's done to others. That's just messed up."

She wandered to the kitchen, rummaging through the cupboards.

"Do we just leave?" Evelyn whispered. "What about her?"

"She doesn't want to come. I can't force her. She refuses help. And we have him to deal with." "Okay."

"You won't win," Levi smirked at us. "Do you think it ends with me?"

"Yes." I yanked him to his feet, and he tried to shove me. But that strength he had when he struck me was long gone.
###Chapter 0473
"We're leaving." I announce to Jasmine.

She peeks around the doorframe, a spoon between her lips. Stepping into the room, she holds a jar of jam in one hand, carefully scooping another portion.

"You're actually going through with it?" She licks the spoon clean. "I assumed you changed your mind since you took so long." She sets the jar down, smacking her lips.

"Wait, can someone tell me where I am? He took me in the middle of the night. I'm completely lost." *A few miles from Obsidian Howl."

*Alpha Julian renamed the pack?"

*Alpha Julian has been dead for ages. The new Alpha is Alpha Silas. He slaughtered the Alpha, took control, and moved his men in."

*He wasn't already part of the pack?"

He just smirks at me. I might ask Athena to remove his lips first. Permanently.

*No, you don't understand. All Wolves. Everywhere. He believes they should all bow to him."

I knew right then I couldn't keep it."
