I couldn't go to our doctor. It would be a sin. I probably would have been killed. So I slipped out when I could. I had a good head start until he found me."

"And that's why you stripped her abilities?" I snap at Levi.

"I have my reasons."

*You should warn your Alpha about Alpha Silas. If you live nearby, you'll become a target. I guarantee it." Jasmine tells us.

I keep my mouth shut. She doesn't need to know the number of Wolves and Lycans in our pack.

*Come with me." I offer again. "You can tell them yourself."

"Why? You know nothing about me!"

"We have someone who can tell if you're lying."

"I don't understand."

"If you're telling the truth, you have nothing to fear."
###Chapter 0474

Athena

“Why is there no news?” I ask Zachary. The sun would rise soon, yet we heard nothing. Neither Theodore nor Evelyn had linked us.

I glance back over my shoulder. We were about a mile from home. Alexander must still be asleep, or he would be in my head, questioning my location.

“A little longer,” Zachary mutters. “Unless you can get into his mind.”

“I tried,” I sigh. “It’s the same as always—nothing. I just… I need him dead. This urge to end him is overwhelming.”

There’s still time. Theodore knows what to do.

How can you be so sure everything will work?

I have a hunch. Maybe you should talk about something else.

I nod. “Did you know Alexander was a twin?”

“No, I didn’t.” He furrows his brow. “What happened?”

Stillborn. Theodore told me. I probably shouldn’t discuss it before speaking to Alexander, but Zachary was right—I needed a distraction. Nyx was no help at all.

“And you’re worried?” he asks.

Everyone keeps saying I’m automatically carrying more than one. What if it’s true and something goes wrong?

The boys are healthy, he tells me through a yawn.

“This doesn’t stop,” I say, pointing to my head.

“It’s good that you’re concerned. I’d worry if you weren’t.” He smiles at me. “You’ll find out soon. If you’re still worried, just have Theodore do more scans.”

Theodore is leaving.

Since when?

“He told me he’s leaving after we kill Levi. He wants to find his place. I don’t want him to go, but I understand,” I sigh.

“We all want to find our place in the world, Athena. It’s not the same for everyone.”

We stand in silence, hidden by the trees as the sun rises. “We should go after them,” I mutter.

“No, we don’t need to.” He points up the road. Theodore is pushing Levi forward. Levi stumbles, struggling to stay upright. Evelyn is talking to another female.

“Who is that?” I ask quietly.

“No idea. Definitely a Wolf, but her scent is faint.”

“She’s not from this pack,” I mutter.

“No, she isn’t,” he confirms, his dark eyes fixed on the road as they approach.

Three times, Theodore has to pull Levi up from the ground. Levi is clearly falling on purpose, looking for an escape.

Zachary steps slightly in front of me. It’s his instinct when he senses a threat.

“Who are you?” he demands, his eyes locking on the long-haired woman.

Her golden eyes widen. She wasn’t expecting such a blunt greeting. It’s how Theodore and Zachary differ.

“Her name is Jasmine,” Theodore answers for her. “Levi was holding her hostage. He took her abilities.”

Not all, since she still has a trace of scent, Zachary glares at her.

“He didn’t do it the same way as the others,” Theodore explains.

A spell, Jasmine adds.

“And you brought her here?” Zachary asks.

“We’re not inside Obsidian Howl yet,” Theodore replies. His deep green eyes settle on me. “Are you or Alexander aware that Crestwood City changed its name to Dawnmist?”

“No.”

“It was a forced change,” Jasmine adds. “It wasn’t our Alpha. The new guy takes over.”

“So you thought we would take her in?” I ask with a frown. I didn’t want any part of this.

Theodore doesn’t answer.

“It’s fine,” Jasmine tells us. “I understand.” Her gaze shifts to Theodore, who is holding Levi steady. “I told you this was a mistake. I’m better off alone. I can figure it out.”
###Chapter 0475

Theodore grins, and that arrogant smirk makes my blood boil. I step around Zachary, squaring up to the half-Witch. He stared down at me, our height difference painfully obvious. If his hands weren't restrained by Theodore, I'd be standing too close for comfort.

"What's so amusing, Levi?" I press a single claw tip against his abdomen, just below his navel. His smile vanishes instantly, replaced by a flash of agony in his eyes.

"I gave him the same injection he used on the others," Theodore informs me. "He can't project. He can't heal. He's completely powerless."

"Is that true?" I push the claw deeper. Levi clenches his jaw, breathing heavily through the pain. It must be excruciating, but he hides it well.

"Tell me, Levi. Why did you think you had the right to do this to so many people?"

His lips part slightly, just enough to mutter the word 'punishment'.

"Then what should your punishment be?" I retract the claw, and he hunches forward, cursing under his breath.

I hear Jasmine whispering to Evelyn. "She can control her shift?"

"Yes."

"Holy hell!"

Zachary snaps his head toward her but stays silent.

"I've already been punished," Levi mutters.

"For what?"

"Doing the Moon Goddess's job," he snarls.

I see Evelyn shake her head and roll her eyes.

I drive another claw into him, and he hisses in pain. "I can keep this up all day."

"Then fucking kill me, you whore."

Why do they always resort to that word?

Levi stumbles sideways as Zachary lands a right hook, cracking his jaw. My claw slices through his stomach effortlessly. He collapses to the ground as Theodore releases him.

Levi presses his hands into the dirt, forcing himself up. Blood soaks through his already stained shirt. "Remember, Athena, there's always someone worse."

"Who are you talking about?"

He grins at me again, blood staining his perfect white teeth.

My gaze shifts to the women behind him. Evelyn watches intently while Jasmine covers her mouth.

Levi spits a mouthful of blood at me, laughing when it hits my cheek. "I should have come for you, though you were never my target. The precious last female Alpha. You would've made an excellent trophy. Such pretty blue eyes. Pity you're female."

He presses against his wounds and drops to his knees. He continues hurling slurs at me. Theodore grabs Levi's head, his hands firm on either side, and twists until we hear the sickening crack of his neck.

Theodore releases him, and for a moment, Levi's body remains perfectly still. A gentle breeze pushes him, and he collapses the short distance to the ground.

Evelyn gasps as Theodore meets my eyes. "It was always meant to be me, Athena. I couldn't listen to him speak to you like that any longer."

I nod, too stunned to form words. I never expected Theodore to go through with it, but he proved his loyalty beyond doubt.

"Okay, I thought Alpha Julian was insane, but you people might have just outdone him," Jasmine splutters.

Evelyn steps forward and looks down at her brother. "You finally got what you deserved, Levi. I warned you years ago that you'd mess with the wrong person." Her grey eyes meet mine. "Thank you."

"So what now?" Jasmine asks. "We just stand here over..." She sniffs the air. "I can smell you." She turns to face Zachary, pointing a finger at him. "And I can definitely smell you."
###Chapter 0476
Zachary

Her floral scent is overwhelming.
Far more intense than Isabella's subtle vanilla ever was.
When I told Athena that Jasmine carried a distinct scent, I never clarified it was the mark of my destined mate.
Was I prepared for another mate when even speaking Isabella's name still felt like a blade twisting in my chest?

“Are you going to say something?” she demands, her golden eyes fixed on me as she hurriedly twists her long obsidian hair into a low bun.

I turn to Athena. “We need to bring the body back to the pack.”

“You’re just going to ignore me?” Jasmine scowls, her voice sharp.

“I’m not ignoring you,” I reply, frowning.

“Is there someone else?” she presses, her gaze unwavering.

“Yes, and she is dead!” I snap, the words tearing out of me.
She immediately drops her gaze.
“I’m sorry. I didn’t mean it like that. I… me and my big mouth.”

“I need time to process this. There’s too much happening right now.”

“His heart is beating,” Athena murmurs, cutting off whatever Jasmine was about to say next.
Her hand is pressed against his chest, and she takes a quick step back as his lungs suddenly expand with a ragged breath.

“I broke his neck,” Theodore states, his voice low and grim. “He has no abilities. He can’t possibly survive that.”

“What do we do?” Evelyn asks, her voice tense.

I move quickly, yanking the belt from my jeans.
While Levi is still disoriented, I bind his hands tightly behind his back, ensuring he can’t move them.

“Cover his eyes,” Athena mutters, pulling off her sweatshirt.
I rip a sleeve off and tie the fabric tightly around his head, blocking his vision.
Lifting his shirt, I frown. “His wounds have healed, too.”

“What?” Athena leans over my shoulder to look. “How is that possible?”

“Is it possible his own potions don’t work on him?” Jasmine suggests. “Or maybe they don’t work completely?”

“I don’t…” He begins to stir.
I glance at everyone and press a finger to my lips.
Levi didn’t need to know our plans or our destination.

“Theodore,” Levi calls out, his voice unnervingly calm. “I know you’re still here. I can smell your delicious scent. I know you’re frustrated, but I can forgive what you just did to me. All you have to do is let me see those beautiful deep green eyes of yours.”

Athena shakes her head at Theodore, a silent warning not to speak or move.
It was strange to see Theodore so enraged, but he stayed quiet.
He understood this was some kind of trap.

A slow smile spreads across Levi’s face. “Is the Alpha telling you to keep your distance? You know you don’t have to listen to her. She isn’t your Alpha.”

Theodore’s hands clench into tight fists.
Evelyn places a calming hand on his shoulder, shaking her head at him.

“Is someone going to say something?” Levi presses, a thread of irritation weaving through his falsely pleasant tone.

He starts to laugh when we all remain silent.
The sound is forced, and his irritation is clearly growing. “You can’t kill me, but you’ve figured that out now. I will continue to be your problem, and you will never be able to stop me.”

Athena creeps closer to him and leans down, her voice a venomous whisper near his ear. “There is a way to kill everyone, but I want your death to be as slow and as painful as possible. You staying alive means I get exactly what I want.”

“Have you learned nothing?” he seethes, his body tensing.

Athena gestures for me to haul him to his feet. “More than enough,” she tells him coldly. “You keep telling me there’s always someone worse. Well, I’m about to become your worst someone. You will wish you had stayed dead just now.”

“Bring it on,” he dares, a smirk in his voice.

Athena turns and strides decisively toward the pack.
Evelyn and Jasmine hurry past me.
While Evelyn seems focused on catching up to Athena, Jasmine’s golden eyes are filled with a mix of confusion and wonder as they linger on me.

Theodore grabs Levi’s left side, and I quickly take his right.
We haul him roughly to his feet.
“You are making a mistake. Theodore, I can offer you so much more,” Levi insists.

Theodore finally breaks his silence. “No, you can’t. If they don’t kill you, I will, and I will be a damn sight more thorough. You’re right, Levi. Those initials on your chest are for me. My name is Theodore Daudet, and I am a Witch Hunter.”

Levi tenses up, digging his heels into the ground to resist being dragged forward. “It’s a trick,” he scoffs, though doubt now colors his voice.

“No trick. You just didn’t do your research.”

“You’re lying. You know I don’t like it when you lie,” Levi growls. “I can smell your scent.”

“I’ve already killed you once. Why would I do that if we were mates?” Theodore challenges.
I was truly seeing a different side of him.
He was always the voice of reason, but push him too far, and a dangerous predator emerges.

“I know you can smell me,” Levi insists, a desperate edge to his voice now.

“You’re right, I can,” Theodore says, his voice cold and flat. “At first, I believed what you were saying was true. Until I spoke to another Hunter. What I was smelling is what tells me I’m supposed to kill you. It was tolerable at first, but the more time we spent together, the more it turned vile.”
###Chapter 0477

Levi's lips press into a thin, bloodless line. The blindfold hides his eyes, but I can feel the rage radiating from him.

We haul him forward. He begins shouting for Jasmine. She glances back at him once, then her gaze flicks to me before she quickens her pace to catch up with Athena.

"Jasmine, I saved you!" Levi yells.

The words make her freeze mid-step. She doesn't turn around this time.

"You stole her abilities," Theodore snarls at him.

"Two birds, one stone. She was running. She needed punishment. I punished her. They couldn't find her. I saved her. I save them all."

"You call that saving?" Theodore demands. "Stealing their power isn't salvation."

Levi stays silent. I look at Jasmine. She has shoved her hands deep into her pockets and dropped her head low as she follows the others. Is that agreement? Theodore said she was Levi's prisoner, but what if it began differently?

"Enough," I mutter to Theodore. We pick up the pace, lifting Levi clear off the ground. He desperately tries to engage us, switching between threats, questions, and pleas aimed mostly at Theodore. The realization that his words are useless is finally dawning on him.

The women vanish around the bend leading to Obsidian Howl's gates. When we arrive, the gates stand wide open. A massive gathering of shifted Wolves and Lycans waits inside. Athena and Alexander stand at the front, poised for the hunt.

"What is this?" Levi demands as we halt. Theodore and I set him down, his feet hitting the ground firmly. He struggles against our hold. Athena gives me a sharp nod.

I release his shoulders and unbuckle the belt binding his wrists. He frantically rips off the blindfold and goes completely still.

"You think this frightens me?" His eyes sweep over the waiting army. He starts muttering under his breath. My fist connects with his jaw for the second time.

"Bastard!" he snarls, clutching his face.

"It seems you enjoy games," Athena's voice is ice. "So let's play. You get five seconds." Alexander smiles coldly.

"For what?" Levi spits out.

"A head start. I start counting the moment you enter the forest. You can figure out the rest." Levi scoffs. "You can't find me if you can't scent me."

Luc moves silently behind him. A blade flashes, slicing a long line down Levi's back. Luc takes a piece of cloth and rubs it in the flowing blood.

"Son of a bitch," Levi growls.

"Thanks," Luc smirks, carrying the bloodied cloth to the crowd. It's passed around. Every creature inhales the metallic scent.

"Can't hide the scent of blood," Alexander mutters. "Don't bother trying to wash it off. It lingers."

Levi looks at Theodore. "He can't be serious."

"It was mine and Athena's idea," Theodore steps closer. "You should have stayed dead. This will be painful. This time, there is no survival."

"Whenever you're ready," Alexander tells him.

Levi scans the crowd, his eyes landing on his sister. "Evelyn. Don't let them do this."

She doesn't answer. She moves to stand beside Athena.

"Control is a funny thing," I mutter. "You have it until you don't. Take it for granted, and you lose it. You lose all of it."

He glares pure hatred at me.

"And from what happened with Jasmine, the moment Theodore snapped your neck, everyone you screwed over got their abilities back. If by some miracle someone here doesn't kill you, those prisoners of yours will come for you. I'll be happy to help them."

He spits in my direction and looks back at Athena.

"Run," she growls.

He turns toward the open gate. Caleb and a few others, including Seraphina, block his path. His only choice is the forest.

He starts backing toward the trees, his eyes locked on us. He pauses at the very edge.

"Go to hell!" He bolts into the dense woods as Alexander calls out, "Five."

Everyone crouches, ready to charge.

"Four."

Alexander begins stripping, preparing to shift.

"Three."

Jasmine stares at me, utterly confused by the events. I need to learn how she first encountered Levi.

"Two."

The Lycans and Wolves are growling. I turn to face the forest. There's no way I'm letting him escape.

"One."
###Chapter 0478
Alexander

The pack surges forward.
Standard procedure.
They hunt first.
I allow them the initial tracking before joining.
Athena’s blue eyes flick toward me.
She is vibrating with readiness.

‘Let them have their moment. His fate is sealed.’ I link her.

She gives a sharp nod.
Howls and snarls erupt from the forest depths.
Birds scatter into the sky, fleeing the coming violence.

I count silently to ten.
Blair rushes to Athena’s side. “Please, let me go after him!”
“You have your abilities restored. Can you shift without turning Rogue?” Athena questions.
Blair remains silent.
“Then I suggest you remain here,” Athena states firmly.

‘Our turn.’ I link Athena.

She runs beside me, then shifts.
Her clothes shred as her body expands.
It amazes me every single time.
Doing it while pregnant is even more remarkable.

She tears through the trees effortlessly.
Her movement is nearly silent.
She pauses occasionally, altering course repeatedly.
I allow her to lead.
She hasn’t hunted like this before, but her rage toward Levi is palpable.
I am eager to watch her unleash it.

‘He’s injured himself.’ Athena murmurs, halting at a bush smeared with fresh blood. ‘Trying to lead us somewhere.’
‘Trying to survive.’ I reply, nose to the ground. ‘It’s fresh. He’s close.’

Howls echo nearby.
We weave through the trees to find two Wolves standing over a dead female.
She’s shifted back to human form.
A sharpened branch protrudes from her chest.

‘She was one of mine.’ Athena growls.

‘There’s more.’ One Wolf mutters.
They nudge her onto her stomach.
The number two is scrawled on her back in Levi’s blood.

‘Two?’ Athena asks.

‘He’s killed another. Eliminating us one by one to seize control.’ I inform the Wolves and Athena. ‘He’s tallying his kills.’

‘Stay together.’ I add.
Splitting up is dangerous. Anyone alone becomes a potential victim.

Athena and I take a different path.
Soon, another link reports a dead Wolf found.
The number three is marked on this one.

Casualties were expected, but three this quickly is alarming.
His tally enrages me further.
There could be more.
We haven’t even located the first victim.

Deeper in the forest, his tracks diverge.
He attempts to confuse pursuers.
But the scent of his blood is potent here.
He must be close.

Athena watches, alarmed, as I shift back to human form.
I step into a small clearing.
“Levi!” I shout.
No answer, as expected.

“I know you’re near. I smell your blood.” I address the forest. “Your tricks are transparent. You are close.”

“Killing two pack members was bold, Levi. Your turn will come. The pack will collect payment for the lives you took. Perhaps we start with your feet. A few toes first. Then we move to your fingers. Removing them one by one.”

Movement catches my eye.
It’s just the Wolves and Lycans signaling their positions.
They’ve all deduced the same thing.

“Are you frightened, Levi? You cannot escape this.” I wonder if he realizes my border is lined with guards. He can run the length of this forest, but he will never leave.

‘You don’t need to go far.’ Zachary links me.
Levi drops from the trees, landing hard on his back with a groan.
He’s inches away.
Healing bruises mark his chest. This is him, not a projection.

I look up.
Zachary perches on a branch in Lycan form.
He gives me a casual wave.

Levi lies on the ground, then begins laughing. “You still don’t understand, do you?” he muses.

“What is there to understand?” I step on his ankle.
He tries to kick me with his other leg. “You murdered three pack members.”

“They intended to kill me. Your rules never forbade killing. You should be clearer, Alpha Alexander.”

I apply my full weight to his ankle.
He grimaces in pain.

“Perhaps you’re right. Perhaps I should have been clearer.” I mock, removing my foot.
I signal everyone forward.
Panic flashes in his eyes as he realizes escape is impossible.

“I was saving them!” he shouts as several Wolves seize his limbs and begin pulling.

‘Pull until the joints separate.’ I intend to savor every second of this.
###Chapter 0479

Cooper fought them with everything he had.

I heard the sickening pop of his knee joints giving way.

Then his hips followed with another crunch.

His scream echoed as his shoulders were violently dislocated.

The Wolves released him abruptly.

He collapsed onto the ground, moaning in agony.

After a few moments, his injuries began to heal themselves.

"Toes!" I commanded sharply.

Two Lycans immediately stepped forward, replacing the Wolves.

They sank their claws deep into his toes.

Several digits were ripped clean off.

He screamed again, bolting upright to clutch his ankles.

Blood gushed from the stumps on his feet.

Only a couple of toes remained on each foot.

"You had the chance to walk away, Cooper. The moment you discovered Blair was a half-sibling to the Alpha, you should have vanished. You should have gone home and never returned."

"You'll pay for this!" he yelled at me, his voice raw.

"Who exactly do you think will believe you? Look around. Do you honestly believe there's any life left for you after this? There's only one way this hunt ends."

He glared with pure hatred.

"Saving people, or whatever you call this, is worse than cruelty. You claim to do the Moon Goddess's work. Then tell me, why would she want this done to her own creations?"

I waited for a response.

None came.

"Just as I thought. You use it as an excuse. Everything you say is an excuse in some form. You hate lies, yet your entire existence is built on one. Do you even know your own truth?"

"Cunt!" he spat at me.

The others growled menacingly.

From the corner of my eye, I saw Brax arrive with an axe.

"Take off his foot," I instructed him.

"Happily." Brax stepped forward, taking my position.

He dropped a backpack onto the ground.

"Hold him!" he ordered a couple of others.

Two Lycans pinned Cooper down firmly.

Brax grinned at him. "This will hurt. I made sure the blade was blunt just for this occasion. This is for Madison."

He swung the axe down hard, just above Cooper's right ankle.

The axe barely cut through to the bone.

Cooper released a blood-curdling scream.

It took five brutal swings to completely remove the foot.

Brax bent down and picked up the severed foot.

He turned to face me and Neah with a smile.

Splatters of blood covered his face and body.

He may not have delivered the final blow, but he seemed satisfied.

Cooper passed out from the pain, shock, or blood loss.

I didn't care.

I would wait for him to wake up.

The torture would continue.

Brax casually pulled a pair of shorts from the backpack.

He handed them to me. "We don't all need to see what you're packing."

I rolled my eyes but took them.

Cooper began to stir.

Moving over to my mate, I smiled at her. "Your turn."

She stepped forward and grabbed him by the leg without the foot.

Dragging him across the ground, Neah yanked him up until he dangled upside down.

She inspected the wound carefully.

Very slowly, she slid a single claw beneath the surface of the skin.

Cooper's screams filled the forest.

It only energized everyone present.

Everyone here wanted a piece of him.

Neah's claw circled the entire leg, slicing deep as if using a knife.

She began to peel the flesh back from the muscle.

She rolled it down like a sleeve.

Pausing occasionally to slice off any attachments.

"STOP! PLEASE STOP!" he screamed out.

"I bet that's what they all said to you, wasn't it?" I asked as Neah continued.

"Just kill me," he begged.

"There's plenty of time for that. You've still got all your fingers."

He vomited as Neah reached the kneecap.

She stopped and dropped him.

His skin remained rolled up around his knee, muscle exposed.

He vomited again upon seeing his leg.

"You live by the motto that there's always someone worse. Well, you found us. You should be careful. You never truly know people."

Neah stood over him and ripped his tee open.

Her claws sliced down his chest.

With one swift movement, she ripped the skin back, exposing everything beneath.

Cooper couldn't speak even if he tried.

His eyes rolled back, and he passed out again.

'They can rip him apart now,' Neah linked me.

I waved everyone forward as Neah stepped back beside me.

Teeth and claws sank into his flesh as everyone fought for a piece.

Within seconds, his arms and legs were torn from his torso.

Cooper's eyes opened for a brief second.

He let out a gargled scream.

A very large Lycan ripped his head from his torso.

It took me a moment to realize it was Samara.

Pieces of flesh scattered the clearing.

Everyone and everything was drenched in his blood.

The group parted for Neah.

She moved to the remains of his torso.

She plunged her claws into his chest and pulled out the heart.

Holding it in her hand, she stared at it for a while.

Then she closed her fingers around it and squeezed until it exploded.
###Chapter 0480
Athena

Pure satisfaction coursed through me.

I rolled the remains of his heart in my palm. Crimson blood dripped slowly from my fingers. No one could survive that. Not even him.

My gaze shifted to Evelyn. She remained in Lycan form, seated on the ground beside the severed head. The first kill always overwhelms. Something primal takes over and just happens. For her, Dakota might have taken the lead.

Behind her, hiding behind a tree, was Seraphina. The moment she realized I saw her, she turned and fled through the forest. At least she headed back toward the pack grounds.

Zachary dropped from a tree, landing feet from me. He grabbed my wrist and turned it over. The crumpled heart fell to the ground.

'Go.' His voice echoed in my mind. 'I'll handle the remains.'

Nyx murmured agreement. There was nothing left for us here.

I turned to find Alexander waiting. His crimson eyes locked onto mine, and he smiled. He always enjoyed watching me unleash destruction.

"Something in there for Athena." Luc called out. He pointed to the backpack near Alexander. Alexander snatched it and pulled out a shirt for me.

As I shifted back, Alexander wrapped the soft fabric around me. He guided my arms through the sleeves. He slowly fastened the buttons from top to bottom. "We need to get you cleaned up." He murmured softly.

"Seraphina was here." My words came out barely a whisper. My mind buzzed with tension.

"I expect she wanted to watch." He kept his eyes on mine as he fastened the final button. "Wouldn't you, if someone nearly destroyed your life?"

He took my hand and led me through the forest. "The people he killed?" I muttered, glancing back. "We can't just leave them."

"They will be handled with respect." Alexander said, holding a branch aside for me. "They risked everything. Their sacrifice fueled the others' rage. They were eager to tear him apart for his crimes. They'd do it again without hesitation."

We reached the forest edge. I saw Seraphina talking to Hannah. Sitting meters away was the newcomer, Jasmine.

"Did Hannah regain her abilities? Seraphina did, and so did Jasmine."

Alexander nodded. "She can scent Luc again. Her healing and hearing improved. But like before, she still can't shift. That wasn't Cooper's doing. It's something else entirely." He stopped me from moving further. "Are you going to explain the new woman?"

I felt surprised she remained. She could have fled when we left. Probably stayed because of Zachary. "She's Zachary's mate."

His brows furrowed. "His mate?"

I nodded.

"Already? I didn't expect it so soon."

I shrugged. I didn't understand how it worked. I was still mated to Marcus when Alexander entered my life. That seemed impossible too.

"And Cooper kept her locked in that house." I muttered. There hadn't been time for full explanations. Once I realized snapping his neck failed, I linked Alexander to organize the hunt.

"Why?"

"I don't know all details, but Theodore said she was fine. Cooper was the priority."

We approached her, and she jumped to her feet. She bowed her head to Alexander and extended her hand. "I'm Jasmine. Thank you for allowing me here. Do you know where Zachary is?"

"He's handling cleanup. He'll return shortly."

Her eyes widened, and she dropped her hand. She stared at Alexander. "Oh shit!" She stepped back. "This is a trap for me, isn't it?"

"A trap?" Alexander mused. "If you hadn't noticed, we were busy hunting the bastard who held you captive."

Jasmine's eyes scanned me, taking in the blood from head to toe. "He's really dead?"

"Yes."

Her eyes returned to Alexander. "Have you told him I'm here?"

"Told who?" He asked.

She glanced around nervously. "I only came because Theodore said it was safe. He lied to me."

"About what?" I asked, confused.

"Is he coming?" She pressed, stepping back further.

"I don't know who you mean."

"The man I'm running from. Alpha Julian."

"Who?" Alexander demanded.

Jasmine's eyes widened. She stared without blinking. "Alpha Julian. Please don't. I had to do it. I can't be part of that! Don't make me go back. I'll do anything. Give me time. I can take care of myself. You don't need to tell him I'm here. I can leave."
###Chapter 0481

"Why would we tell him?" I ask.

Alexander's fingers tighten around my wrist. "We need to talk." He pulls me away urgently, not stopping until we reach Brianna and Sebastian's home.

"Sit down." He commands the moment we enter.

"Alexander, what's happening?"

"There's something I must tell you. I've been struggling with how to say this for a long time. Now it seems I have no choice."

"You're trying to tell me you had a twin."

"You kn... Theodore told you." His expression darkens.

I shrug and nod. "I don't understand why you kept this from me, especially when I was pregnant with the boys. It would have been helpful to know multiples run in the family. To prepare me for whatever might be growing here." I pat my stomach, suddenly aware of my hunger. I hadn't eaten in nearly twelve hours.

"It's more complicated than that. Did he tell you what happened to them?"

"Stillborn." The words catch in my throat. Every mother's worst nightmare.

He shakes his head slowly.

"They weren't?"

"No. That's the story I was told. But it wasn't the truth. This isn't new information either. The reason Jasmine is panicking is because Silas is my twin. Judging by her reaction, we must look identical."

"I'm dreaming, right?" I whisper to Nyx.

'No.' Nyx responds quietly. 'This is very real.'

My eyes lock with Alexander's. "Are you saying you have a twin brother out there that none of us knew about?" He lowers his head in confirmation.

I open my mouth to speak, but only air escapes. Should I be angry? Probably. But mostly I feel disbelief that he never told me.

Pushing up from the sofa, I move toward the kitchen. I needed food, no matter how many questions Nyx was throwing at me.

Alexander follows closely. "I'm sure you have questions."

I pause to stare at him before continuing my search for food. I had more than questions.

His crimson eyes track my movements as I prepare a sandwich. I take one bite before setting it down. "What the actual fuck?!"

"With everything happening, there never seemed a right time to tell you. What I know is that Silas was given to another family member at birth. They couldn't have children, and my father only wanted one heir. That changed when he met his mate, my stepmother. Then Isabella and Julian came along."

"He just gave him away? Just like that?"

"I don't think it was that simple, but neither of them are here to explain. Silas was raised overseas."

"You've never met him."

"No. And I never wanted to."

"If Jasmine hadn't reacted that way, would you have told me?"

"Yes."

"Because I kept mentioning I might be carrying more than one?"

He nods. "The first time could have been coincidence. But if you're having twins again, you deserved to know."

"You're absolutely right about that!" I exhale sharply.

Maybe I hadn't used all my anger on killing Levi. Or perhaps I simply couldn't stay angry with Alexander these days.

"I don't know why he's here or where he is. I'll have to speak with Jasmine." He mutters.

"No one else knows the truth about him?"

"I told Sebastian. That's all. Everyone else who was around when I was born was told the same story. That I was the only survivor. This could destroy my status, Athena."

I shake my head. "It won't. The Wolves trust you. Because of that trust, they accepted me and the other Lycans. Most of them did. You won't lose them over some family secret." I take my sandwich and sit at the small table, still stained with Levi's blood.

"I understand if you're angry." He says quietly.

"I'm not angry." I take another bite. "Confused, definitely. But not angry. Maybe I'm still riding the high from killing Levi." I smile faintly. "I have a half-sibling and a cousin I never knew existed. It's only fair you have family complications too."

He knocks the table over, sending my sandwich and plate flying across the room. His hands settle on my hips, lifting me from the chair as he presses his lips against mine. "Do you have any idea how much I love you?"
###Chapter 0482
Zachary

We collected every last piece.
We built a pyre from what remained of Levi, adding dry kindling to fuel the flames.
Evelyn placed his head atop the pile.
Luc eagerly threw a match onto it.

The fire took a moment to catch.
Then it erupted, engulfing everything in vibrant shades of orange.
The scent was overpowering, thick enough to taste.
A sickly sweet odor that churned the stomach.
No matter how many times you smell it, you never get accustomed to it.

The others stood with me, watching the flames.
Silently savoring the victory.
We had finally stopped this man before he could cause more destruction.

One by one, they departed.
But Evelyn stayed.
Her grey eyes remained fixed on the fire.
I wondered what thoughts occupied her mind.
This was her first kill, as far as I knew.
Yet he had been her brother.
She said he raised her.

"Evelyn?"

She turned her head toward me.
Confusion flickered in her eyes at hearing me speak in Lycan form.

"Are you alright?"

She nodded slowly.

"I doubt Athena will send you back to the dungeon." I offered.

She lowered herself to the ground, drawing her long legs to her chest.
She began shifting back to human form.
Her face contorted with pain, but she didn't scream like she had in the dungeon.

"It feels strange." she murmured after completing the shift.
"He was my brother. But I had to help. He caused so much pain and suffering."

"I almost killed my brother once." I kept my gaze on the flames, giving her privacy.

"You didn't go through with it?" I felt her eyes on me.

"I was going to. Seraphina got to him first."

"Gabriel was your brother?" Surprise colored her tone.

"She told you about him?"

"Bits and pieces. I clearly don't know everything." She sighed deeply.
"I feel like I should mourn Levi. But mostly, I feel guilty."

"For his death?"

"For his actions. Maybe if I had tried harder, I could have stopped him long ago.
If I had stood up to him... If I had sought help earlier..."

"Hindsight is always clear. You couldn't have known it would come to this."

"I know my father would be rolling in his grave." She paused.
"I thought I would feel pain too. He was family, and our bond has been severed."

"It depends on how close you were. Your bond wasn't a true family connection.
He controlled you, Evelyn, just like Athena said. He preyed on you."
I groaned softly. "It's ridiculous. Every species has bastards like him."

I sat beside her as the flames began to die.
Embers glowed in the ash among shattered bones.
Droplets of rain started falling, diluting the smell of burnt flesh.

Suddenly, she leaned her head against my shoulder without speaking, still hugging her legs.

"Ready to head back?" I asked.

"Why?" she responded quietly.
"You said Athena probably won't imprison me. There's nowhere else for me to go. Not anymore."

"You can stay in the house I'm using. Until we figure things out."

"What about Jasmine?"

"I haven't figured that out yet." I told her honestly.
"I'm not ready for another mate. Not yet."

"What was Isabella like?"

"Different. Gorgeous. Cared about others more than herself.
That's why she loved working at the hospital.
We argued over stupid things, but I always knew we were good together.
She had an insane love for ice cream.
Thought I didn't know about her secret stash of sweets in our bedroom."
I didn't know why I was telling Evelyn, but it felt easier talking to someone who didn't know Isabella.

"She was close to Athena, but something changed.
I'm still not clear on what. Until I am, I can't accept a new mate."

"You should tell Jasmine that. It's not fair to let her hope.
If I met my mate and he wasn't ready, I'd want to know.
I'd want someone who desires me and only me.
Someone who accepts me for who I am.
Not someone trying to figure out past mistakes."

"Wise words." I mused.

I felt her shrug. "I read a lot on my little farm.
Take it with a grain of salt—I've never been mated."

"We should go." I muttered.

"The question now is how I get out of the forest naked without anyone seeing me."
###Chapter 0483

She tries to charge past me, jealousy radiating off her.

Her hand slices across my cheek when she can't get through.

I push her back, and she falls hard on her ass. "I told you, I was helping her. What part of that don't you understand?" I stare at her, disbelief washing over me. Her attitude is disgusting. Is this my punishment for nearly killing my own mate?

"I told you. I was helping her. If you hadn't stormed in here with that attitude, I might be helping you too."

"Do you like her?" she demands.

"Right now, I like her a hell of a lot more than I like you."
###Chapter 0484
Zachary

"You can't speak to me that way!" Jasmine shrieks at me, her voice grating on my nerves. I was completely fed up with her theatrics. She hadn't allowed me a single moment to explain myself. It was obvious she only cared about her own feelings.

Her eyes widen in apparent shock at my direct question. "We're mates! You could try acting like it," she snaps back.

"I've already told you I need time to process everything. What part of that isn't clear?" My irritation bleeds into every word.

"I expected you to have enough respect to avoid other women!"

"Your best friend is a woman?" she scoffs.

"Absolutely." I hold her gaze without flinching. "And I'm curious how you'll react when you learn I have a child."

"No." I consider explaining further, but her temper is already flaring. She'd gone from zero to furious just smelling Evelyn on me.

She frowns and takes a step back, raising her hands defensively. "I can't... I can't handle this."

"That's what happens when you jump to conclusions. You know nothing about me, yet you've already decided how I should behave."

"I..." Her golden eyes dart around nervously.

"Daddy!" Charlotte comes sprinting across the lawn toward me, her backpack bouncing with each step. Sebastian waves to confirm I've seen them.

Charlotte launches herself into my arms, wrapping herself around me tightly. She'd been staying with Athena and Sebastian for several days, and seeing her again filled me with relief.

"Jasmine, this is Charlotte."

"Your daughter?" she stammers.

"Yes."

Charlotte holds up two fingers proudly. "Two dads!" she announces. Though she spends significantly more time with me than Luc.

Jasmine attempts a smile at Charlotte, but my daughter doesn't return it. Instead, she stares intently at Jasmine, and I know she's reading her energy.

"Why is she staring at me like that?" Jasmine demands.

The skin between Charlotte's eyebrows wrinkles in concern. "I want to go inside," she murmurs.

"There's someone inside."

"Okay." Charlotte smiles slightly. "She won't hurt me! Promise."

I set her down, surprised she's more wary of the Wolf before us than the Lycan inside. She gives Jasmine one final look before slipping past me.

"What was that about?" Jasmine asks.

"She's an excellent judge of character."

"She doesn't like me, does she? She barely spoke to me! You're going to trust a child's judgment?"

"Don't like when the tables are turned?" I challenge.

"That's not what I meant."

"Isn't it? You've done the same to me. The difference is, my daughter can see your soul. There's no hiding from that—that's why she didn't need to speak to you."

I turn toward the house, done with this conversation.

"You're just walking away?" Jasmine asks.

I glance over my shoulder. "Yes. Or would you prefer I reject you right now? Because that's becoming increasingly likely."

"I thought you wanted time to think?"

"I did. But you're making it impossible to consider any positive aspects of being mated to you."

"..." She avoids my gaze, her eyes settling on the ground at my feet.

She walks away as I enter the house. An ache forms in my chest. She was supposed to be mine, yet I can't imagine building a life with someone like her.

Walking through the kitchen to the lounge, I find Charlotte already on her stomach, doodling on paper. Evelyn sits on the sofa wearing one of my black tees knotted at her hip and a pair of my shorts. The drawstring is pulled so tight it hangs past the shorts' hem.

"I'm sorry," Evelyn murmurs as I take a seat. "I didn't mean to cause trouble. I can find another place to stay."

"This was entirely her doing. You have nothing to apologize for." She studies me with her grey eyes and nods. "Charlotte, what did you see when you looked at Jasmine?"
###Chapter 0485

She stopped drawing and slowly put her pencil down.

She got up from the floor and walked toward me, her eyebrows furrowed.

"The lady outside?" she asked casually.

"Yes. I noticed how you looked at her. I know you were reading her."

"She's unhappy. She used to be happy long ago, but something changed. It's not dark, but it's not light either." Lottie touched her chest gently. "She's hurting, but she doesn't want anyone to know."

"Why did you run inside?"

"Um, she um," Her gaze drifted toward Evelyn. "She is your mate, but she doesn't like that you have friends. Or me."

"Lottie..."

"She's going to take you away from me." Tears streamed down her face as she spoke.

I tried to reassure her that no one was taking me away, but she ran to her bedroom crying.

"No. Thank you, but it's me she's worried about."

"She's a Hunter. Biologically, she's Luc's daughter."

"Yes."

"She isn't exactly like Luc."

"Why does she call you Daddy if she's Luc's child?"

"It's a long story."

"Athena told me the same thing."

"But we don't all have the inner Lycan?"

"No, it's related to carrying Alpha genetics. Ultimately, you carry Harrison blood."

"Still a lot to understand," she murmured. "But tell me about Charlotte. I'd love to know more."

She listened carefully as I explained how Lottie came into my life. She didn't interrupt, and she smiled when I finished. "You helped her."

"I like to think so."

"Can I ask you a question?" she murmured.

"Sure."

"Do you think Gabriel knew she was there? Do you think he left her there on purpose for you to find? Did he slaughter those people because of what they did to her?"

"Yes. There's no way he didn't know she was there. Rogues have a stronger sense of smell, and Lottie saw him. Whether he chose to leave her there for me to find, or to use her as an opportunity to get further away, is a different question. One I'll never know the answer to." I looked up at the ceiling. "She's far stronger than most people realize."

"I agree, she is."

My eyes locked on hers. "What did she say to you when she was in here alone with you?"

Evelyn smiled. "She told me she could see I was a good person deep down. That I just need to get out of the trap that no longer exists."

"Anything else?"

She shrugged. "Only that she likes me." She pointed to the back of her hand where a blue unicorn sticker was placed. "She gave me a sticker. Told me that Athena would know I was a good person. But I know it'll take more than a sticker for Athena to believe that. I keep expecting her to knock down the door and take me back to the dungeon."

"It's not going to happen. I've already told her you're here with me, and I'm keeping an eye on you."

"You don't have to do that, Zachary. As much as I'm grateful not to be sitting on a concrete floor, you don't have to be nice to me." She settled back into the sofa, letting out a soft sigh as she enjoyed the comfort.

"You're right. I don't have to do anything. I'm choosing to let you stay here."

She looked at me with wide grey eyes. "Thank you," she whispered. "You should talk to Jasmine, though."

"I will if she's willing to listen. But she seems stuck on her way and her way only. Maybe she got away with that in whatever pack she came from, but that doesn't work with me."

"Crestwood City."

"Hmm?"

"Crestwood City is the pack she came from. An Alpha moved in and took over, killed the old Alpha."

"Who is it?"

"She's already mentioned him. Alpha Julian."
###Chapter 0486
Athena

With the baby?" I didn’t want bed rest again. Not this early.

Athena?" he whispered. I struggled to open my eyes. The lights were too bright. I shut them quickly. Athena, you’re okay."

Because even Wolves and Lycans suffer from it. Why do you think we’re always eating? Especially after shifting. Plus, with the baby, you need more nutrients.

Baby," I mumbled. Until confirmed otherwise, it was just one. And how am I supposed to eat if I keep throwing up?"

Babies, and Theodore suggested those milkshakes you like. If it gets food into you. For now, you have that." He pointed to the bag connected to my arm. Liquid dripped into my veins.

“She wouldn’t have gotten far. Everyone is watching her.”
###Chapter 0488
Luc

"Hey, you!"

A woman with jet-black hair sprinted toward me. I halted, releasing a heavy sigh. I was supposed to be having dinner with Hannah right now.

"Yes?" She was that stray who returned with the others. A walking bundle of lies.

"Can you help me?"

"Depends." I muttered.

"On what?" She raised an eyebrow.

"What do you want?"

"Can you help me get out of here?" She pleaded.

"Yes."

She stared at me blankly. "Will you help me get out of here?"

"No."

"Athena has questions. I believe Alexander does too."

"So I'm not allowed to leave?" She scoffed, narrowing her golden eyes. I remained silent. The answer was obvious.

"This place is insane." She muttered.

"Not as insane as you running from your problems." I smiled. She glared back.

"Have you spoken to Theodore or that bitch at my mate's house?"

"No."

"Then how did you know... Do you see things like that kid?"

"I assume you mean Charlotte. Charlotte is my daughter."

She stepped back, eyes locked on me. "Two Dads. You're the other Dad."

"That's what she prefers, yes. I take it you don't like him having someone call him Daddy? I somewhat agree, but my daughter is happy. She's with him now?"

"When I left, yes. That bitch was there too."

"Calling someone a bitch doesn't tell me who you mean." I muttered.

"Evelyn."

"Excuse me?"

She shook her head, lowering her gaze. Completely unaware of my rising anger.

"I went to talk with him and Evelyn was already there." Her face twisted. "Parading around in his clothes. I could smell her scent on him, but he denies it. He's supposed to be my mate. Mine!"

"First, if he slept with her after knowing you're his mate, you'd probably be dead. Second, the clothes could be because she was a prisoner with nothing else, and she did help kill her brother. Third, Zachary isn't like that."

"Like what?"

"Not someone who jumps into bed with everyone. And I can see you've already taken the time to get to know him." I said sarcastically.

I stretched. Her eyes caught the gun in my belt. "Why do you have that?"

"Just in case I need to put someone down. Or maybe," I moved swiftly, pulling it out and pressing it against her temple, "I use it as a warning to liars."

She froze. "What are you doing?" Her eyes shifted sideways, focusing on the gun. "Please don't kill me."

"Why are you running from your pack?"

"It's dangerous."

"Bullshit."

"I swear."

"What story did you tell Theodore?"

"The truth."

"You lie."

I watched the lump form in her throat. Everyone I've held a gun to did that except Hannah. She was ready to die.

"It's the truth." The woman spluttered.

"No, it's not. It's a story you cooked up. One you think will tug at heartstrings. You sucked Theodore in. I see it. You're full of lies, weaving your own web of shit. What did you tell him? Must have been good to make him pity you."

"I swear."

"You keep saying that, but you're not actually telling me what you said to him."

"Daddy?" I turned. Charlotte stood there, holding Evelyn's hand. Evelyn's grey eyes darted between me, Jasmine, and the gun.

"I can tell you what Jasmine told us." Evelyn said.

"Bitch, you better keep your mouth shut." Jasmine yelled.

I pushed the gun harder against her temple. "Now now, that's not your choice."

"I don't want anyone else to know."

"Then you shouldn't have told them. Or is it because if others know your lie, it's harder to cover up?" I smiled. "Charlotte, cover your ears. I don't want you to hear this. What did she say, Evelyn? Don't leave out any details."

I listened as Evelyn recounted how this Jasmine allegedly had an abortion because of an Alpha. How he found out and she'd been running from him until she met Levi. Evelyn told me other things. How Jasmine was tied up. How Jasmine said she didn't want to come, but that was before she told the lie. How she was from Crestwood city, but they had recently changed their name.
###Chapter 0489

###Chapter 0491

"Is that a threat?" Alexander raises an eyebrow at her.

"I only meant..."
