"Alpha Julian will know it's me. I'm the only one who has ever gotten this far. I'm certain they are still searching."

Zachary shakes his head and stands up. He looks at me and shakes his head again. "I can't do this anymore." He turns to Jasmine, "I, Zachary Gray, Beta of Obsidian Howl, reject you, Jasmine Reed of Dawnmist Pack as my mate." He spits the words out.

"No." She stands firm. If she was hurting, she didn't show it.

"Accept." Zachary demands. Being here felt incredibly uncomfortable. I glanced at Alexander and knew he felt exactly the same.

Tears well in her eyes as she clutches her chest. "I can't."

"Yes you can, say it!"

"I can't."

"Why?" Zachary snaps.

"Because you don't mean it. You're angry with me because I handled things poorly. Don't reject me over that. Give me another chance." She pleads.

I watch him pinch the bridge of his nose. "You don't even want to be here. You keep asking to leave, so accept the rejection and go."

"You're supposed to protect me." She frowns.

"And I'm also supposed to like my mate! Normally I'm willing to give people a chance, but you're impossible."

"I'm impossible? What does that even mean?" She asks with wide eyes.

I quietly watch Alexander typing on his phone. Neither Zachary nor Jasmine notice as he tries to force her to accept the rejection. Seconds pass and the phone beeps.

"Ryan is alive." Alexander confirms. "Crestwood city is still standing strong."

Jasmine's eyes widen like saucers. She had managed to stop Alexander from calling, but that didn't prevent him from sending a message.

Zachary rubs his temples. "Are you some kind of compulsive liar? Do you even know what the word 'truth' means?"

"Why would you keep lying?" I ask.

Her golden eyes shift to Zachary as if expecting him to rescue her, but he only looks more furious. He reminded me of a cartoon Isabella had shown me, where smoke comes out of their ears.

"Do you even know Alpha Julian?" Alexander asks.

She looks at the floor.

"Answer me!" Alexander's voice booms, making her jump.

"Levi told me about him." She whispers.

"Levi? Why would he tell you about him?"

She shrugs. "Alpha Julian is related to you, isn't he?" Jasmine asks. "Levi told me about the eyes. When I saw yours I knew you must be related somehow. It's such an unusual color. He told me many stories about a crimson-eyed man and his pack of animals."

"Did Levi know him?"

She shrugs again.

"And Crestwood city?" I press.

"I don't know, just a name Levi gave me."

"You've never met him?" Alexander asks, confused.

She slowly shakes her head.

"You said you were his prisoner? Evelyn found you tied up." Zachary mutters.

"He kept me safe." She smiles like a madwoman.

'He's dead and still fucking with us.' Nyx tells me what everyone else is likely thinking.

"Where are you really from?" I demand.

"A place called Silver Streams. It's far from here." Her eyes grow even wider. She had slipped up, and Zachary could now reject her.

"I, Zachary Gray, Beta of Obsidian Howl, reject you, Jasmine Reed of Silver Streams as my mate." He states it again, desperate to break their connection.

She felt it this time. I see it in her eyes. Pain, anger, confusion. She clutches her chest differently, as if her heart might leap out. She fights back tears and hunches forward.

"Say it." Zachary demands, and for a moment, I hear Marcus, demanding I accept his rejection.

"Are you going to kill me?" Jasmine begs.

"Accept my rejection!"

Her breathing is heavy as she stares back at him.

"You are a compulsive liar, Jasmine. Not a single word from your mouth can be trusted."

She lowers her eyes and whimpers. "I, Jasmine Reed, accept your rejection, Zachary Gray, Beta of Obsidian Howl." She falls forward from the chair, curling into a ball on the floor as she cries in agony. Zachary stares down at her before leaving the room.

'Should we kill her? Alexander asks through mindlink.

I shake my head. What she's feeling won't go away. Not for a long time. Let her leave.'
###Chapter 0492
Alexander

I raised an eyebrow at my mate. That was not the response I had anticipated. My eyes drifted to Jasmine, who remained curled up and sobbing. She reminded me of Isabella and her state after her rejection. The difference was, I felt sympathy for my sister. I felt absolutely nothing for this woman.

She had been here only a short time and already became a major annoyance.

I pressed my lips to Athena's forehead. I told her I would return shortly.

"Get up." I muttered to Jasmine.

She didn't move, continuing to whimper in pain. She had brought this upon herself. Zachary would never be happy with her.

"Get up!" I snapped, yanking her upright by her elbow.

"Where are you taking me?"

"There's no place for you here. You get to leave, just like you wanted." I stated.

"Really?"

I nodded and guided her through the hospital. We passed Theodore but he remained silent. He had tried his best, but it simply wasn't going to work out. Keeping her here posed too great a risk. She didn't even glance his way.

She shuffled along at an agonizingly slow pace. I had to repeatedly pull her forward.

"Wait, this isn't the way to the gates." she protested. "The gates are over there." She pointed in the opposite direction.

"We are not going to the gates." I directed her into the forest.

"Why?"

"Too many eyes. And Zachary doesn't want to see you." I murmured.

"Okay. You'll need to point me toward the road once we get there. I'm completely turned around."

I nodded. She was indeed already disoriented. "Levi spoke of Julian?" I asked, wondering if I could extract even a sliver of truth from her.

"Yes. At first I thought they were just fabricated stories. But after a while, I realized they had to be true."

"How?"

"Facts. Small details. They never changed."

"Why did you panic when you saw me?" I questioned.

"Because you match the description Levi painted in my mind. You might look like him, you might not. But from the stories, I know he has eyes exactly like yours. Strange and unusual for a Wolf."

"And you could be lying." I muttered as she maneuvered around a tree stump.

"It's hard sometimes."

"What is?"

"Everything." She frowned, ducking under a low-hanging branch.

"Are you just saying that to gain sympathy? Because that won't work on me."

"My mate just rejected me."

"I was there. I saw and heard everything. What does that have to do with everything being hard?"

She stopped abruptly. Her golden eyes locked onto mine. "Because people never see me for who I truly am."

"Understandable, when you lie to everyone."

She scowled at me. "And you've never lied?"

"I didn't say that, did I? Now keep walking."

"He could have had me. I could have been his perfect mate. But no, I'm not good enough."

"No. No, you couldn't have. You're too much of a liability."

"Excuse me?!"

"Zachary was right. It's impossible to distinguish your lies from the truth. You're all over the place. Unpredictable."

"I am not!"

"Then tell me, who are you running from?"

"I told you."

"You did. Then you admitted it was a lie. That you had never met Julian. So who in Silver Streams are you running from?"

"No one."

"Silver Streams isn't a local pack. They're far north. You traveled a long way before encountering Levi."

"Why do you want to know?"

"Just curious. Plus, I need to know who to alert about your death."

She ripped her arm free. "What?"

"I love my mate. Usually, I would agree with her decisions. But lately, things have become too problematic to let you live."

"You can just let me go. I won't say anything. I promise."

"That's the problem, Jasmine. You might be more believable if you had told the truth from the beginning."

"I mean it." She begged, her voice turning shrill. "I really won't say anything. I won't come back. It will be like this never happened."

She took a step backward, holding her hands up. "Athena said I could go. I heard her."

"Yes, she did say that. But did you not notice her surroundings? She was in a hospital, exhausted. Her thinking wasn't clear. Mine is."

With each step I took toward her, she retreated until her back hit a tree.

"Please!"

She froze as a gunshot echoed. Not even a second passed before I saw the small bullet hole in the center of her forehead. A thin trickle of blood ran down between her eyes. The light faded from them before her body slid down the tree trunk.
###Chapter 0493

"How long have you been tailing us?" I demand, his footsteps crunching loudly on the forest floor.

Luc emerges from the shadows behind me. "Long enough."

"I was going to end her."

"And if you had, it might have damaged things between you and Athena."

I whirl around to face him. "Athena understands far more than you ever will. I intended to kill Eris for her. For us. For our family. Letting her escape would have been a grave error."

"We all know that." He moves toward Eris, still slumped against a tree. Gently, he closes her eyelids with his fingers. "But Athena is pregnant. She will need you. This way, you don't have to lie to her. Besides, she already knows I will do whatever is necessary to keep her and the babies safe. That was our agreement, right?"

"I never planned to lie."

"Okay." He mutters, hoisting Eris over his shoulder. "Let me handle this. You go back."

I take my time returning to Athena. I didn't understand why Luc assumed I would lie to my mate. Lying was never my intention; it wasn't part of the understanding between Athena and me. I simply needed to eliminate Eris first. At least now, she was another problem permanently removed from our lives.

'Alexander, come to my place now!' Sebastian links me urgently.

'What's wrong?'

'It's... complicated to explain. Just hurry.'

Sebastian is outside with Luca and Logan when I arrive. "What's going on?"

"Evrin." He gestures toward the house just as a loud crash echoes from inside. "Brianna is trying to manage him."

"He shifted?" I ask as another crash follows, accompanied by Brianna yelling at Evrin to stop.

Sebastian gives a grim nod.

I step inside to a scene of utter chaos. The house looks like a tornado tore through it. Furniture is overturned. Shattered dishes litter the floor. Clothes and food are strewn everywhere.

I hear Brianna upstairs, speaking in a calm tone, trying to soothe my son. It's met with fierce growls and the sound of heavy footsteps pounding above.

Evrin charges down the stairs toward me, launching his Lycan form at my chest. His arms lock around my neck as he buries his nose against me. His breathing is ragged, his heart racing, but as I hold him tightly, I feel his body grow heavy. He slowly begins to shift back.

A exhausted Brianna comes down the stairs, staring at me in disbelief. "Was that really all it took?"

My gaze sweeps over the destroyed house. Evrin couldn't cause much damage in his human form, but as a Lycan, he was devastating.

"Mumma." He whispers tearfully.

"I believe we've discovered the root of this." I look down at my son. He was a perfect miniature of her. But unlike Logan, Evrin seemed to sense when something was wrong with his mother.

"Is Athena alright?" Brianna asks.

"She's resting. She will recover."

"Mumma." Evrin whispers again.

"Let's get you dressed so we can go find her." I smile at him and tell Brianna I will return later to help clean up.

Logan stands up outside, raising his arms, waiting to be picked up. In true sibling fashion, they begin pushing each other, but soon burst into laughter as I carry them like footballs, playfully swinging them through the air.

They giggle all the way to the hospital, eager to get down the moment they see Athena. The boys scramble onto her bed, both vying for her attention as she hugs them tightly. My heart swells with pride.

If anyone had asked me years ago about having children, I would have laughed in their face. Yet here they were. And soon, two would become four.

"Has she gone?" Athena asks once the boys settle.

"You don't need to worry about her anymore." I assure her.

She studies me for a moment. "Did you..."

"I was going to. But Luc got to her first."

Her eyes remain fixed on me as she runs her fingers through Logan's dark hair.

"I understand what you said earlier. But after everything that's happened..."

"She posed too great a risk." She nods slowly.

"We didn't know her true motives. We didn't know if Cooper was using her, if she was playing us. This way, she can never harm us again."

"Okay. What about Silas? Do we need to prepare for him?"

"Perhaps. Perhaps not. But he isn't my priority right now. His story might be fabricated. Cooper may have discovered a few things to use against us. If anything arises, I will handle it."

"I would prefer if nothing happened for a while."
###Chapter 0494
Zachary

*Rejecting Jasmine was the right choice." Brianna sighs, gently rocking Luca in her arms.

I scan her cluttered living space. *And I'm fairly certain she's dead now."

She stops moving. *Care to elaborate?"

*I was heading home to check on Lottie but changed course to come here instead. I witnessed Alexander take her into the woods. Luc followed shortly after. Only Alexander emerged."

*But Luc and Jasmine never did?"

*Exactly."

*Are you feeling guilty? That's not typical for you."

*I'm uncertain about my emotions. Everything I've struggled to suppress has resurfaced. When the hold on Jasmine shattered and I recognized her, all I could think about was Isabella and her fate."

*You know her situation wasn't normal."

*Is anything about us normal?" I raise an eyebrow at her.

*Poor wording," she mutters.

*What I mean is, I don't comprehend how Jasmine could have been my mate. She was a self-righteous, insane witch. And that's putting it mildly."

Brianna laughs at me. *Definitely not your type."

*And Lottie despised her."

*Charlotte has very clear preferences about people. Speaking of her, how is she handling the changes with Liam?"

*Better."

*And Liam? What becomes of him now?"

*With Levi gone, he'll probably be released. He likely won't have independent freedom for a while."

*Just like his sister."

I hadn't considered Seraphina much. She kept quiet and handled her business. *I'm going home."

*Sure you don't want to stay?"

*No, I need to clear my head."

I stand at my front door, listening to Lottie's delighted squeals. For a moment, it reminded me of how Isabella used to make her laugh. Every time I heard that sound before, Isabella was always right there with her.

Lottie appears at the window, her cheeks flushed with what looks like beads in her hair. *Are you coming inside, Daddy?"

*I'll be back shortly. Is that alright?"

*Okay, but hurry! Me and Evelyn have a surprise." I still couldn't believe how much Lottie adored Evelyn when everyone else here seemed to have issues with her.

I take the longer route to the small cemetery. I hadn't stepped foot here since the day we buried Isabella and her twin. I had no words then, and I'm not sure I have any now.

The cemetery remained impeccably maintained. Weeds and fallen leaves had been cleared away, with vibrant flowers lining each grave. I stand at the edge of hers, hands in my pockets, silently wishing she had never given up on life. That she had found a way to tell me she was done.

I still blamed myself. I watched her fade away, and the small efforts I made to prevent it weren't enough. I should have tried harder. I should have made her more of a priority. I should have fought for her more fiercely. *You couldn't have changed anything."

I look up to see Luc. Dirt smudges his face, a shovel resting on his shoulder.

*I thought I might find you here. I did the same when I realized Hannah was my mate. I returned to my first mate's grave."

He sets the shovel down, leaning it against the small gate before walking over to me.

*You wish things had been different. That you could have found a way to save her. Trust me, I understand. I saw it that night, and I felt the same about my wife."

*When my mate and children were taken from me, I went on a mission. I hunted and slaughtered every Rogue I could find while searching for Seraphina and Charlotte. I didn't stop because I didn't want to feel. You distanced yourself because any mention of her brings you right back to this feeling." He points at Isabella's grave.

*Is that why you don't spend time with your daughter?" I snap.
###Chapter 0495

“She’s the spitting image of her.” He speaks softly. “The eyes. The hair. Even those tiny dimples in her cheeks. I should be overjoyed that she resembles her mother so closely.”

“It’s a painful reminder of your loss.” I let out a quiet breath.

“I love her. She is mine. She will always be mine.”

We stand without speaking for several minutes. “Is Eris gone?”

“Yes.”

I nod slowly. “Isabella would have despised her. I still don’t understand why she was chosen as my mate.”

“The fates operate in mysterious patterns. But I have a theory.”

“Do enlighten me.” I mutter, rolling my eyes.

“You were once Human.”

“That’s it? That’s your entire theory?”

“Legend says each of us has an expiration date. A day when we can no longer heal from what life throws at us. Part of that destiny involves finding our mates. But for Wolves and Lycans, those bonds are decided long before we are born.”

“If that’s true, then why are Lycans being paired with Wolves?”

He shrugs lightly. “Like I said. It was predetermined. But your kind disrupted the natural order.”

“Lycans?”

“Bitten Lycans. Perhaps the fates didn’t anticipate that.”

“That makes no sense. If our mates were pre-chosen, they would have accounted for our existence. Otherwise, the bonds wouldn’t form.”

He tilts his head toward the sky. “Or perhaps they’re merely toying with us. Setting challenge after challenge in our path. A brutal game of survival. But in the end, death comes for everyone. That much is certain.”

I raise an eyebrow. “Did you eat something strange in the forest?”

He offers a faint smile. “No. But sometimes what we seek is right in front of us, Zachary.” He moves toward the gravestone and rests his hand on it, glancing back at me. “She was a stepping stone. Leading you to the one you’re truly meant to be with.”

“Are you talking about Eris or Isabella?”

“Perhaps both.” He picks up the shovel and walks away.

Sometimes I’m convinced he’s on something.

I lower myself onto the grass. Staring at her gravestone for a long time. Wondering what she would think of everything that’s happened.

Maybe Luc was right. Maybe she had an expiration date. Never meant to live this long. But I know a part of her will always remain with me.

It’s late when I return. Evelyn is sitting on the sofa. Her hands wrapped around a mug as she drinks deeply. I scan the room. Sheets are draped everywhere, held up by pegs and string.

“Sorry, we built a fort. Charlotte wanted to show you, but she fell asleep.”

“She’s asleep?”

She nods, setting her mug down. “She had a bath. A story. Now she’s sleeping in her bed.”

I glance toward the stairs, frowning. “She didn’t make a sound?” There are very few people she allows to tuck her in. “How long has she been out?”

She checks the clock. “About an hour. When you didn’t come back, I told her you might have been called away on pack business. That she was safe with me.” She pauses, her expression shifting. “Sorry, should I not have—”

“It’s just surprising. That’s all. Excuse me for a moment.”

I move quietly up the stairs. Peek into Lottie’s room. She’s sprawled on her stomach. Her light brown hair is braided. Soft snores fill the quiet air. It’s unusual to see her so relaxed in sleep. Not curled into a tight ball. The teddy bear she received after I rescued her lies on the floor instead of clutched tightly in her arms.

“Is everything alright?” Evelyn asks as I descend the stairs.

“Yes. It’s just been a long day. Lots to process.”

She offers a gentle smile. “Do you want to talk?”

“Not yet.”

“Okay. Do you mind if I get some sleep? Your kid is wonderful, but I’m exhausted. It’s been a while since I’ve been this active.” She gives a soft laugh.
###Chapter 0496

"Take the bed. I'll sleep on the couch."

"Thank you, Zachary." She rushed up the stairs while I settled onto the sofa.

Lottie talked nonstop during breakfast. Between spoonfuls of cereal, she tried to give Evelyn every possible detail about school. I couldn't get a single word in. Instead, I found myself watching Evelyn.

Her grey eyes shone brightly as she listened to every word from Lottie's mouth. I remained surprised that Lottie had slept through the night without any nightmares. Because I couldn't quite believe it, I hadn't slept at all. Well, that and the fact I couldn't get Isabella out of my head.

"Daddy?"

I blinked several times and smiled at Lottie.

"When will I shift?" she asked curiously. The question caught me off guard.

"When you're much older."

"But Evrin can." Lottie smiled at me. "And he can barely walk."

"Athena's twins?" Evelyn asked.

"Yes."

"One of them can shift?"

I nodded.

"Is that possible?"

"Athena could when she was young."

"Wow. Do you know if my mother could?" she asked with a frown.

"I don't know. I don't think there's much information about your mother. I believe it has more to do with who Athena is."

"The last female Alpha." Lottie announced proudly, looking at Evelyn. "Don't be sad about your mommy. I don't have one either, and I'm okay."

Evelyn looked away, running her hand through her short blonde hair. It was starting to grow out, though she still hated it. I liked it. It suited her.

"Go get ready." I told Lottie. She shoved another spoonful into her mouth and ran off toward the stairs.

"You want to find out about your mother?" I asked.

She frowned at me. "Yes and no. I understand that Athena and I are cousins and that our mothers were sisters. I know she gave me up to my dad. I know she wasn't ready to have me. But that doesn't stop me from being curious about her. What was she like? Do I carry any of her traits? Do I resemble her?" She sighed. "Then there's the part of me that wonders if it's better this way. I can't miss what I never had."

She passed me as she took the dishes to the sink. Holding out her hand, she waited for my mug. Her fingers brushed against mine as I handed it over. A sharp current shot up through my finger, and I almost dropped the mug.

Evelyn didn't react to the spark. Instead, she asked me if I hadn't gotten enough sleep while slowly taking the mug from me.

"My brain is on overdrive." I told her.

"I take it you didn't talk to Jasmine then." she muttered with her back to me.

"We talked, and I rejected her."

I saw her freeze, but she didn't turn around.

"I was at the hospital with Athena and Alexander. Athena wanted to talk with her, and everything that came out of her mouth was a lie."

"I lied." she whispered, and I heard the sadness in her tone.

"It was different. You were being forced to do something you didn't want to do. She just kept spewing more and more shit. Making demands. She couldn't even look Athena or Alexander in the eye while she was bullshitting them. And that Alpha Julian was just something Levi had told her."

"So it's not true? There's no Wolf trying to claim power?"

"No."

"Are you sure?" She turned around to face me, supporting herself on the counter. "They seem to come out of nowhere. And she did say she was running from him."

"I can't be sure about anything these days. But Alpha Ryan of Crestwood City is alive and well. It hasn't been taken over. Jasmine came from a place called Silver Streams."

She frowned at me. "I know that name."

"Silver Streams?"

"Dad told me that was where he met my mother."
###Chapter 0497
Evelyn

Zachary's intense gaze pinned me in place.
I fought the sudden urge to close the distance between us.
My skin tingled with the memory of his touch.
'Go on. Kiss him.' Dakota's voice echoed in my mind.

"I don't have any more information." I shook my head, trying to ignore Dakota's prodding.
Maybe I should have mentioned this earlier when they confirmed Athena was my cousin.
But it hadn't seemed relevant at the time.
"All I know is what I've already told you. She didn't want me. My father only told me where they met. He never spoke about her again, no matter how much I begged."

I sighed and looked away.
"Sometimes I wish I could talk to him just once more. To get even a little more information. Does that sound crazy?"
"You should have told us sooner."

"I didn't think it mattered." I rubbed my fingertips, remembering the strange sensation when our hands brushed.
That electric spark. The heat that traveled up my arm.
It had stolen my breath, but he hadn't reacted.
So I stayed silent.

'This is your opportunity.' Dakota whispered.
'He's still hung up on Isabella. And I'm not even sure what I felt. I can't smell him like the others.'

"Was that where your mother lived?" Zachary's question cut through my internal debate.
I shrugged, feeling butterflies in my stomach.
His gaze felt different now. Not judgmental. Not dismissive.
He actually saw me. The real me.

"Is that the Harrison family's original territory?" He pressed.
"I don't know. My father refused to say anything else."

"But Jasmine was a Wolf!" He muttered to himself.
"There are Wolves and Lycans here. Maybe they had both there too." I offered.

"That doesn't track. Jasmine didn't know about Lycans. Or if she did, she hid it well. Then again, she lied about so many other things."

"Why wouldn't those Lycans have come here?" I asked.
I knew Athena had summoned them. Seraphina had told me that much.

"It was never an order. She gave them a choice." He stepped back, and I realized how tense our closeness had made me.
"But that would mean they're aware of her."

"Wouldn't Theodore have known? You said he's a researcher."
"Depends how well the information was hidden. We'll drop Lottie at school, then you'll come with me to Sebastian's place to speak with Athena."

He moved close again.
I held my breath as his hand rested on my shoulder.
Another sharp spark shot through me.
"This could actually be helpful, Evelyn."

I felt the blush spreading across my chest.
It would reach my face any second if I didn't escape.
"I need to go wash up." I blurted out, rushing past him.

I ran upstairs and slipped into the bedroom.
Leaning against the closed door, I let out a shaky breath.
This crush was ridiculous. It made me feel like a teenager.
And he was completely off limits. We weren't even mated.
Plus, he still longed for his first mate.

'You're overthinking it.' Dakota murmured.
'Please don't encourage this.'

'I'm not doing anything. This is your natural reaction to him. I'm just along for the ride.'
'So helpful.' I whispered.

In the bathroom, I stared at my reflection.
My hair stuck out in every direction, not that there was much of it left.
I wet it down until it looked somewhat presentable.
I couldn't wait for it to grow back to its former length.

A knock sounded at the door.
"Evelyn? Daddy wants to know if you're ready. We need to leave." Charlotte called out.
"I'll be right there."

I splashed cold water on my face.
Taking a deep breath, I walked to the top of the staircase.

Zachary waited at the bottom.
He leaned against the wall with one foot propped up.
Charlotte raced back and forth, listing everything she needed for her session.

"Lottie, we do this every day. I promise you have everything."
"But..."
"If you need something, your teacher will let you borrow it. Or she can link me and I'll bring it."

He was so patient with her.
And she wasn't even biologically his.

'Our children will be beautiful.'
"Dakota!" I shouted, horrified by her words.

Zachary and Charlotte both looked up at me.
Their eyes wide with identical expressions of curiosity.
###Chapter 0498

"She's making fun of my hair." I lie, my cheeks burning with humiliation.

"Well, Evelyn." Zachary says, his gaze fixed on me. "I think it looks good on her."

My stomach fluttered nervously. Compliments were foreign to me.

He gives me a small smile. "Ready to go?"

I just nod, words failing me completely.

Charlotte holds my hand tightly as we walk toward the school. I feel the stares. I sense the judgment. Just days ago, I was locked in a dungeon for being untrustworthy. Now I'm walking with the Beta to pack school.

We stop near the entrance. I spot Seraphina with a young boy. Her brother, I assume. I watch him hug her before rushing inside. As she turns to leave, her eyes land on me. Instant fury flashes in her gaze. She hates me for lying. For betraying her trust.

I open my mouth to apologize. She walks right past me without a single glance.

"She'll come around." Charlotte tells me, releasing my hand. She throws her arms around me in a tight hug. She makes me promise to show Athena the sticker. Then she puts another one on my shirt.

"Do I get a hug?" Zachary asks as Charlotte starts to leave.

"You should hug Evelyn." She grins before darting through the school doors.

He doesn't reply. He just stares ahead silently. Clearing his throat, he asks if I'm ready to see Athena.

"As ready as I'll ever be." I made sure to eat a big breakfast. Just in case she sends me back to the dungeon.

Zachary stays quiet as we pass the destroyed packhouse. Workers are already inside clearing the rubble.

We stop at a house further down. Loud noises come from inside as Zachary knocks.

Alexander answers. His unusual crimson eyes sweep over me briefly before he invites us in.

Athena is on the sofa with her feet on an ottoman. One twin clings to her while the other pushes toy cars down a ramp, squealing with delight.

"How are you feeling?" Zachary asks her.

"Like I'm under constant surveillance." She murmurs, glancing at Alexander.

"Just ensuring you have everything you need." He replies softly.

She rolls her eyes and focuses on me. "How are you settling in?"

"Um, I've mostly been at Zachary's house. I took a walk with Charlotte, but that's it. I promise." I desperately wanted to avoid the dungeons. I hated being alone down there.

"No trouble." Zachary confirms. "Evelyn has been very helpful."

Something about how he said my name. It made me sound more interesting than I am.

"But you have information for us?" Alexander asks.

"I told Evelyn some things Jasmine said." Zachary explains. "Specifically the story about Jasmine coming from a pack called Silver Streams." He gestures toward me.

"Apparently that's where my Dad met my Mom." I blurt out.

"Your mother?" Alexander questions.

I nod. "And before you ask, that's all my father said. He never gave me more details. I knew more about Levi's mother than my own."

Alexander asks the same questions Zachary did.

He questions why Wolves and Lycans existed together. If Jasmine lied about her knowledge. They have almost the same conversation I had with Zachary. This time, Zachary tells him what I said.

I see Athena watching me. I keep quiet. It's easier not to speak. I notice how she shifts the twin clinging to her. He's fast asleep but looks so much like her. He must be the one who can shift.

"Silver Streams was never mentioned to you?" Alexander asks Athena.

"As far as I know, I always lived in Silver Creek. But then again, I don't remember much beyond what happened to me." She frowns, creases forming on her forehead. "Is that where the rest of my family is?"

"Not necessarily." I mutter.

Her eyes snap to mine.

"You're the Alpha. You became Alpha because your mother died. She would have been Alpha too, right? But the title usually passes after death or a ceremony, right?"

They all look at me.

"There might not be anyone there. But there could be others. Extended family." I shrug. Deep down, I wanted to go. I wanted to know about my mother. I wanted to know what she was like. Someone there must have known her.
###Chapter 0499
Athena

'She might be right.' Nyx whispers softly. 'Others could exist out there.'

'Even if they do, they never came looking for me? You know they would have sensed it when my binding shattered. They would have heard my call when I linked every mind. Not a single one reached out. None of the Lycans here have even mentioned Silver Streams.' Alexander watches me as I adjust Evrin in my arms, seeking a comfortable position. I don't recall feeling this way so early during my pregnancy with the twins.

I frown when I sense Alexander probing my thoughts, searching for clues behind my silence.

"Do you truly believe that's where your parents met?" I finally ask Evelyn.

She pulls her shoulders up toward her chin and drops her gaze. “I'm not sure. I just." She frowns deeply. "When Zachary told me the name, it felt familiar. Like a forgotten memory hiding in the back of my mind. I hadn't thought about her until Dakota appeared, and now it's like an itch I can't ignore."

After a brief pause, she looks up at us. "You understand, right? To learn about her and discover that part of my heritage."

"We know exactly what you mean." Zachary speaks gently to her, and I notice her giving him a small smile. Her cheeks slowly flush pink. Quickly, she turns back to me, trying to hide the deepening blush.

"Don't you wonder? If it's truly a place where our bloodline runs deep, don't we deserve to know?" Evelyn presses, pointing toward my twins. "Don't they deserve to understand every part of themselves?"

I can't hide my scowl. I already know where this is heading. She wants to go to Silver Streams. And in a strange way, she's asking for my permission.

"I need time to think." I mutter. "It's not as simple as packing up and heading to a pack I've never heard of. I have children to consider."

"She's also pregnant." Alexander adds firmly. "And supposed to be resting." He gives me a look that dares me to agree to this idea.

"Theodore." I murmur to Zachary. "Go ask him if he can find any information about Silver Streams beyond it being up north. Take Evelyn with you."

"No dungeon?" Evelyn asks quickly.

"Not for now." I confirm. She played a part in her brother's death. Allowing her some freedom is the least I can offer. She smiles gratefully. "I won't let you down."

Zachary grins at her too, and it's not just a friendly smile. He clearly likes her more than that, but she seems completely unaware.

They leave together, and Alexander sits beside me as Logan climbs onto his lap. "Did you see what I saw?"

I nod. "They'll figure it out. It's not our business."

"I don't think they're mates."

I shrug. "Sebastian wasn't mated to his wife."

"True." He tosses a giggling Logan into the air and catches him easily. "You really don't want to know more about your background, do you?"

I shake my head. "If my parents' attempt to get rid of me is any indication, the others—if they exist—are probably just as bad."

"It might not be all of them. I'm not defending your parents' actions. But perhaps they weren't prepared for you. Maybe they didn't know early shifting was possible." He frowns thoughtfully. "This whole situation makes me think about what Seraphina said initially. How she wanted what was hers. To take the pack as the eldest, even though it was never your father's. It sounds like your mother might have left everything behind to be with him. To start a new life, and others followed."

"You think they were a forbidden couple?"

"Possibly. Maybe your father was nobody important, and your grandparents disapproved."

"Does that happen? They were fated mates." I ask.

"It happens more often than you think."

"That would explain why Silver Creek was always hidden."
###Chapter 0500

He nodded while bouncing Logan on his knee. "That explains Dominic's desperation to strike a deal with me. Who were they preparing to battle?"

"You believe they intended to fight Silver Streams?"

"The urgency. His refusal to review the contract despite warnings. How readily he agreed to you accompanying me. It feels like we overlooked something crucial. Never before has an Alpha been so eager to sign a contract with me without examining my terms. Typically, I'm the one pushing for agreements, yet I always allow an opt-out clause if it suits my interests."

He made funny faces at Logan. "But Dominic was beyond desperate. Perhaps they weren't planning to attack, but rather to fortify their defenses. They clearly lacked the numbers for either scenario. They needed reinforcements urgently."

"What would they have been fighting over?"

His crimson eyes locked intensely with mine.

"Me?" I scoffed in disbelief.

"Your mother had passed. You had ascended to Alpha status. Though Dominic and Victoria moved quickly to bind you again. But you admitted it yourself - on your eighteenth birthday, you were temporarily unbound. If that state had persisted, Nyx might have appeared and they could have located you. They couldn't find you while you were bound."

"You genuinely think they were coming for me? That sounds completely insane."

"Considering everything we've learned, does it really?"

"They could have found me at any time since I've been here." I muttered.

"Perhaps they could have. Or perhaps circumstances changed. Maybe they realized your true potential and decided maintaining distance was wiser."

"That's utterly ridiculous."

"Is it? Reflect on how events unfolded. I'm not just referring to what happened to you. They were transforming Humans into Lycans long before attacking us, and long before I entered the picture. Zachary mentioned Victoria did it to create powerful weapons. Yes, they had plans for you, but they clearly had other schemes brewing, since I didn't know you until I saw you in Dominic's office."

"Even if we entertain this theory, why would they come for me?"

"To bring you back to your rightful home. To nurture you into the powerful female Alpha you're destined to become."

I shifted closer and placed Evrin on Alexander's lap before standing. I loosely retied my hair into a bun, ignoring the stray strands as I processed Alexander's words.

"That's too many hypotheticals!" I sighed heavily.

"Agreed. I'm merely exploring possible scenarios. Perhaps they knew your parents tried to abandon you. Maybe they were attempting to rescue you. Possibly they wanted to offer you a better life."

"Anything would have been better than the torment Dominic and the others put me through. Near starvation, constant dehydration, sometimes barely able to stand without the room spinning. All I ever wanted was acceptance for who I am."

"Like I said, these are just theories. We don't know what's true." He shrugged.

"But you think I should consider it?"

"I believe you should do whatever feels right for you. I'm not pushing you either way. This must be your decision alone."

"As I told Nyx, not one of them bothered to contact me when they easily could have. I won't chase after something that doesn't need chasing. Besides, I'm carrying another set of twins. Would you really let me travel north while pregnant, not knowing what we might face?"

"Valid point." He smiled.

"If Theodore can provide Zachary with substantial information worth investigating, I might consider it after the babies arrive." I patted my stomach. 'We could try searching through the links to find them.' Nyx suggested.

'No.' I responded firmly. I wanted this peace to continue. I needed to focus on my pack and my growing family. Especially with my constantly shifting son.
